room_title: Escape room "The Lost Antidote" by The Escape Little Rock in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "221B Baker Street" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Took my boyfriend for our anniversary and this was our first time doing an escape room. We chose the Sherlock Holmes theme. We were greeted by the manager, who was super cool. Overall our whole experience was so much fun. Definitely will be back and bringing along some friends and family!

room_title: Escape room "221B Baker Street" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Did the Sherlock room and it was amazing. Fun time trying to solve all the puzzles. Super tough room with fun twists throughout. This is my 3rd Escape the room and these puzzles were harder than the other 3. The staff was very friendly and patient with us. That's even with us coming at 10am in the morning.

room_title: Escape room "221B Baker Street" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Although we didn't solve the mystery of who had Sherlock and where he was, the four of us had a great time. We will definitely be back. It was so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "221B Baker Street" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Awesome bonding experience with my family. Had no idea what to expect but we worked well together and we beat it!

room_title: Escape room "221B Baker Street" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: My friends and I decided on a whim to do an escape room one night. When we called to book a room, the staff was very friendly & accommodating. The ambience & decor were great, and the puzzles were creative yet challenging. We did the 221B room and enjoyed the twist (solving a crime instead of actually escaping the room) I would highly recommend coming here!

room_title: Escape room "Bad Medicine" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: This was my first experience with an escape room. We attempted the Bad Medicine room. We only got about 60% through before the clock ran out. We had lots of fun trying to figure out all of the clues. This room is very challenging!

room_title: Escape room "Bad Medicine" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: Every time I come to Tucson, which is often, I do a room (or two!) at Ace of Escape, they are by far my favorite in Tucson. They have a wide variety of rooms, if you catch their Christmas room during the season, it's the best Christmas themed room out there. Very well thought out, not just another room with Christmas decorations. By far my favorite is Bad Medicine, super hard, but I love a challenge! They just opened a new two person room that I can't wait to check out - I've never done a room specifically made for two people. I have a feeling it's harder than it sounds.

room_title: Escape room "Bad Medicine" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: We had a lot of fun figuring out all of the puzzles and were ecstatic to have escaped the Bad Medicine room!! We can't wait to come back and escape again

room_title: Escape room "Bad Medicine" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: My friends and I decided to try the challenging "Bad Medicine" as our first time. We had so much fun and got so close that we booked "The Illusionist" right after going back to back. We managed to escape that room! We had a blast! Definitely will be back

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by TrapZone Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This is a challenging but enjoyable room. I took my son and a bunch of his friends for his 13th birthday, which happened to be on Friday the 13th. It was just the right amount of spooky and strange to go with the theme of the day. The clues are very challenging but extremely creative and with just a tad bit more time, we probably would have solved it. I'd highly recommend it if you're looking for a challenging, fun, group experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by TrapZone Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was the first escape room I've ever attempted but it was so fun! It is a little difficult to find but there is lots of parking. The asylum theme brought the whole room to life. (I got scared not going to lie). And the puzzles were challenging and very well thought out. I had a great experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by TrapZone Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had a great time at TrapZone. There were lots of good puzzles and they weren't repetitive. Most of the puzzles worked well for a group so everyone got involved. Overall a very well designed room.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by TrapZone Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: It was super challenging and fun. A great interactive set up! Better to go with 4-5 people than with a large group if you really want to escape.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by TrapZone Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Our whole dental team escaped the asylum with just minutes to spare! We had so much fun and enjoyed the group challenge. Lots of laughs, a few scares, and a lot of brain-busting clues to solve! Can't wait to come back again. Highly recommended for fun and for groups!

room_title: Escape room "Are We Dead? VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: This is awesome! Like nothing we have ever done or tried before!

room_title: Escape room "Are We Dead? VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Just played the new Are We Dead game at Virtual Room. It was great! I've played all 3 games at this company and its newest game has polished the interface and introduced a cheeky sense of humor and a cute game mechanic. Our game hosts were fantastic as well, providing appropriate hints to keep the pace of the game fun. We had a wonderful time, thanks!

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz: The Breakout" by Merlin Entertainments in San Francisco
review: My first escape room and it was an amazing time! Fun and challenging! it took us 59 minutes to escape Alcatraz! I recommend this escape room to all locals and travelers!

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz: The Breakout" by Merlin Entertainments in San Francisco
review: This was the best escape room I've done!  It's pretty challenging but solvable.  We learned at the end that there are a few ways to solve some of the puzzles which was really cool.  I did this escape room with a group of friends and we had a blast and really enjoyed our night.

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz: The Breakout" by Merlin Entertainments in San Francisco
review: Without giving too much away, this was a very fun escape room with a great theme, but my group left a little disappointed because the last puzzle was too difficult, and required us to get several hints. We had quickly figured out WHAT we had to do, but it was so difficult, I almost believed that it wasn't the right thing to do. I've done many escape rooms, and usually the difficult part is figuring out WHAT the puzzle is, not solving the puzzle. But in general, I really liked many of the puzzles, and especially the theme.

room_title: Escape room "Attic" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: Great way to celebrate,  any occasion!Can't wait for the next girls night out!Have a creepy fun time trying to escape from THE ATTIC!

room_title: Escape room "Attic" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: I had never done an escape room before this one, and I must say it was an excellent first experience. Two other friends and I tackled the Attic room and made it out alive just in the nick of time. One of my friends has done multiple escape rooms before so it was definitely a benefit to have someone on the team with their head in the game. The room was super creepy and dark (very on theme) and the clues were challenging but rewarding to solve. The room was extremely well decorated and believable, I felt like a part of the story and that our mission was real, but it was quite small. I think our group of three was the perfect size. We'd bump into each other sometimes with the limited space, but there were enough puzzles that all of us were working on something different at the same time. The staff were also super friendly and helpful, commending us for finishing such a challenging room. I highly recommend this place and I'm looking forward to going back to finish them all!

room_title: Escape room "Attic" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: Came here for a friend's birthday and did The Attic, so fun! We were a group of 4 and did not escape. I would recommend this for a group of friends looking to do somthing a little different. Will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: Had an absolute blast! We were soooo close to escaping "Asylum" but didn't quite make it. One of the most fun things I've ever done!! Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: My friends and I adventured through The Asylum! It was creepy, challenging, and probably one of the coolest team building exercises a person could go through. Samuel was very humorous and helpful on getting us started, his personality definitely kept us in better spirits on finishing the room! I will certainly be coming back to challenge another room soon!!

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: Was our first night to go last night. Didn't pass the Asylum escape room but had tons of fun trying. The guy at the front was absolutely funny and made our visit the best! Can't wait to try the others as well!

room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Deja Vu" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Dynamic Escape Rooms has come up with a great game idea. An escape room with varying degrees of challenges. You can chose medium, hard, or extreme depending on how experienced or brave you are! And apparently even if you chose one style one time, when you come back to do another style, you don't play it the same way, so it's almost like a completely different room. We chose the medium Deja Vu and it was just right for us. You don't have to be a Doctor Who fan to do this room. It just adds to the fun and the geekiness if you are. You don't even have to be a sci-fi fan to enjoy this room. The decor is great and It was a very fun experience. Our gamemasters were Ignacio and Adam. Ignacio knew exactly when to give nudges and hints, making him one of the best gamemasters we have ever had. (Thx, Ignacio!) Also, Adam is one of the best front lobby people. He is also available on the website for a chat if you have questions. (Thx, Adam!) If you want to play a private room, you don't need to "buy out" the rest of the spots. You only pay $30 extra to make it yours alone! The lobby and restrooms were clean and uncluttered. This room would appeal to all ages, sci-fi fans, Doctor Who fans, puzzle fans, game fans. In other words, if you like escape games, we recommend this business to anybody and everybody, travelers and locals alike!

room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Deja Vu" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This was my first ‘escape room’ experience and the team at Dynamic Escape Rooms have set the bar very high. Initially I wasn’t thrilled with the idea of being locked in a room and forced to escape, but was immediately comforted by the amazing staff that assured me that this wasn’t the typical escape room. I could leave and take a break as needed, the door wasn’t locked, and to think of it as an interactive experience instead. And it was just that. I was amazed at the complexity and range of the puzzles in the room and the imaginative story line that linked the entire experience together. I first played at the medium level of the Time Machine Game, my team and I barely completed it on time, but felt we could definitely complete the hard level now that we were familiar with the layout. We couldn’t have been more wrong. I was amazed at how much more complex and different the puzzles had become with a change in levels, needles to say we did not complete the level on time. I will definitely be back and will be recommending Dynamic Escape Rooms to all of my friends. Great Job Dynamic!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Deja Vu" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: WOW! What an amazing experience! I have been waiting for so long for a great escape room experience. I have been to escape rooms in Las Vegas, Palm Springs and Phoenix, none compared to Dynamic. The staff is professional, courteous and helpful. The room can be set at different levels, I can't wait to go back and try a harder level! I definitely recommend checking out Dynamic Escape Rooms to all looking for a fun and immersive challenge! Great job Dynamic Escape Rooms staff and creators can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Operator" by Panic Haus in Jonesboro
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Time Travel - Chapter 2 VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: This is an awesome game! Time flies in there, now I can better understand my son and his “game addiction”;) Will be back soon

room_title: Escape room "Time Travel - Chapter 2 VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: We had a really great time at the Virtual Room on Hollywood Blvd. We had so much fun we went back for the second challenge. The staff was amazing, the concept is great, and the 3 of us had a blast. Great for all ages!

room_title: Escape room "Time Travel - Chapter 2 VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Great visual effects, helpful staff. Fun experience had by all! Would highly recommend!!

room_title: Escape room "Dark Seas Hideout" by Secret Spot Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Trevor is the BEST! Made this escape room experience so enjoyable! Super fun activity!

room_title: Escape room "Dark Seas Hideout" by Secret Spot Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: This was a very fun room! It was very immersive and we loved how much detail went into the room. The puzzles were challenging, but very doable. Our host was awesome :) He made sure that the room was comfortable for us and gave perfect hints. We had a great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Dark Seas Hideout" by Secret Spot Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: So much fun!Don’t be scared! Great for beginners and even those with experience.The younger guy running it 2/15 did an incredible job!

room_title: Escape room "Art Heist" by Great Room Escape San Diego in San Diego
review: So much fun! We loved every second of it. Definitely recommended

room_title: Escape room "Art Heist" by Great Room Escape San Diego in San Diego
review: Although my team failed the challenge and did not solve the puzzle it was fun and I Would definitely do another one

room_title: Escape room "Art Heist" by Great Room Escape San Diego in San Diego
review: I've been to a few escape rooms and this place is one of my favorites! Can't wait to see what new rooms they come out with I

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Already played 3 games and loved every game so far! We played Museum Heist tonight and our game master Brady was awesome!! Thank you for making this a great birthday and we can't wait to come play Mystery Mansion!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: We took part in the Museum Heist game. 2 adults and 2 15 yr old boys. This was the most fun we've had in a while. You are locked in a room with clues that you have to figure out in an hour in order to escape the room and get the picture to prove you got out in time. The clues are some common sense, some general math and problem-solving. We visited 2 other game rooms with other companies and this one is by far the best. I am so glad they opened up in Montgomery. They are also located in a great side of town!!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: I went here with my family. We were a group of 8 ranging from ages 7 to 66 (grandchildren, children, and parents) and everyone had a great time. We did the museum heist room and we barely got out in time. This place is clean, the staff is friendly, and one hour goes by really fast. Everyone is our group was able to participate and were genuinely excited and happy when we left.

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: We played the museum heist on Saturday 5-21, had an absolute BLAST!!! We've been to other gaming places similar to Breakout Montgomery and I must say this one is the best by far!!! Thanks to the owners & staff for making it awesome.

room_title: Escape room "Startup Escape" by Startup Escape in San Francisco
review: Fyi to set expectations, my friends and I have done several dozen escape rooms. Not sure experts but not new to the scene either. We loved the puzzles. They were refreshing compared to some of the overused ones we've seen. They did an EXCELLENT job with the startup tech theme. Lots of jokes that techies are sure to love. But if you're not from the startup world, you'll still be able to enjoy the puzzles and story without feeling lost. Great for group sizes 5-8. The first few puzzles are a little linear to get everyone warmed up, but the following ones can be parallelized so everyone's working on something and not feeling bottlenecked. Definitely would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Startup Escape" by Startup Escape in San Francisco
review: Silicon Valley's Startup Escape room is a love letter to the Product Hunt generation

room_title: Escape room "Startup Escape" by Startup Escape in San Francisco
review: With such a market saturation of Escape Rooms, it was really refreshing to find one that cultivates such innovation. The concept of launching your startup and a set amount of money is such a nice change of pace from the generic murder or end of world scenarios that seem to dominate the landscape. Thought this balanced difficulty and entertainment extremely well, and look forward to seeing more from the creator down the road!

room_title: Escape room "Big Top Circus" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: My boyfriend and I are escape room enthusiasts and North Valley Escape Room continues to surpass our expectations with every new room they open! We have done all of their rooms, most recently doing their Big Top Circus. Their circus room is amazing! Seriously, I cannot say enough good things about this room. It is now in my top five favorite rooms (we've done 121 total so far to give you a comparison). It is very aesthetically-pleasing and the puzzles are very clever, well-themed and challenging. All of their other rooms are very well done, too. One thing that sets North Valley apart from some other local escape room places is their employees. They are personable, fun, helpful and have a genuine passion for escape rooms and talking to others that do as well. Their clue system is very fluent and doesn't lead you in the wrong direction and they are quick to deliver them when needed. We love North Valley and can't wait for their next room to open because they never disappoint. There is a lot of heart that goes into their rooms and it definitely shows. Keep up the great work and keep wowing us with whatever comes next.

room_title: Escape room "Big Top Circus" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We did ZZ's Big Top Circus but failed and probably needed a few more minutes. It was really thought out and well done and lots of riddles, puzzles and locks, but it was linear so we couldn't work on different puzzles/riddles individually. We had to ask for quite a few clues since some of them were a bit difficult. There were multiple rooms and it was fun seeing each themed room. I can't wait to try The Great Outdoors next time!

room_title: Escape room "Big Top Circus" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This place is absolutely top-notch when it comes to escape rooms. We've done and made it out of three of the rooms (Big Top Circus, The Great Outdoors, and Alcatraz). We even did two in one day because we couldn't get enough! I've been through a few other rooms, and NVER really knows how to serve up an immersive, detailed experience for all involved. We'll definitely be returning to try all of the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: The most creative way to spend an hour with family and friends! Its an absolute must do in Los Angeles!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Great place and great people.....very intense and intriguing game.U gonna love it just need to try it....great story play!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Fun, strategic and masterfully designed! This place offers both a mentally stimulating challenge as well as provides a fantastic group experience! Excellent team building game if you're looking for that!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: We had so much fun although the world was destroy lol. I love it definite coming back maybe with a bigger groups so I don't get frustrated hahaha they forgot to send my pictures !

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Incredibly addictive! Great family/friends activity! Pure puzzle solving and intuitiveness to solve the mission at hand. Tell everyone and anyone! Can you escape?

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Amazing Experience! Loved it. I went with 2 friends and we had a lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: RoomEscape is the industry standard of what escape rooms should aspire to be. Very clean cut puzzles with great implementations of technology. I have done all 4 of their rooms and each has a well thought out combination of puzzles to make their games interesting for a variety of group sizes. Their themes are excellent choices and provide a new experience with each room. Would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Gentleman's Den" by Escape Redding in Redding
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Expedition" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: We tried the game titled "The Lost Expedition" which was rated medium-hard as far as it's level of difficulty. Without giving anything away, we'll say that it's a lot different than what you're used to, and has a lot of parts to solving which will make your team think outside the box, communicate well, but this particular Escape Room had a particularly good "flow" as you progress through the room. We will say that the actual room used for the puzzle, are well thought out, Jason was a great host, and we all agree that this Escape Room is one of our Top 5 favorites we've ever tried. Not because we solved it, but because it was VERY fun to do! Have you ever done an Escape Room where it's a lock defeating puzzle and all you managed to do was open 15+ locks? Well, this Escape Room is far from that, and was really really interesting. Give Steal and Escape a try! We think you'll like their games A LOT! Steal and Escape's experiences cost $32/person, but we also think it was time very well spent in our humble opinion.

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Expedition" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: So I actually ran The Lost Expedition as my first escape room ever on December 19, and while I thought I had done a bunch of research ahead of time on how escape rooms work and what to expect, this room subverted my expectations and set up a tough standard for future rooms I would do.Everything in the room is user-activated (really heavy arduino use), and one of the mechanics of the room actually gives the players more agency in their experience. There are no traditional padlocks or number pads. There is a critical path for the players to follow, but non-linear encounters line that path. Certain players have roles defined in the context of the game that provide a natural kick to encourage participation and communication, and I feel like that's really clever and probably doesn't get enough credit.Jason is a great game master and clearly has the experience to know when and how to nudge versus hint, and crafted an experience for our group that felt appropriately challenging, but never frustrating. My first experience with an escape room just happened to be this one, and it was so great that I was motivated to visit a different facility on the same night. The only bummer here is that so much heart and soul has to go into the creation of each room that I don't want to come back too soon, because once I play Mysterious Stranger I'm going to have to wait until the next room is released.

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Expedition" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: My group and I completed The Lost Expedition and HIGHLY recommend this company and room! For my birthday my group and I decided to do an escape room crawl in San Diego and this was our first stop. Not only is this room very immersive, the staff is also extremely nice.We originally were supposed to have four people playing this room, but plans changed and could only do it with three. Instead of turning us away and saying that we couldn't do the room, the two gentlemen working just came in at one point to help us with the one puzzle that required four people. Without giving too much away, the room begins with everyone being assigned a role that will help you in completing the room. I really liked this idea because it ensures that everyone gets to be involved in the room, instead of just have a few players steamroll everyone else. The team elements that are required to escape really add to the experience in my opinion.The other major difference with this room is that it isn't your traditional 60 minute room. It's all dependent on the choices you make throughout the game how long it will last. Your time could end in 20 minutes, or it can end in two hours. We will definitely be back next time we're in San Diego to do their other room, and can't wait to see what this company has in store for the future!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard Escape" by Unity Escape Rooms in Redlands
review: My son celebrated his thirteenth birthday here with seven friends in the Wizard Room. They had a blast. The steam coming out of the dragon's nose on the door was awesome! The ladies that work there are good with tweens and teens. Would definitely come again.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Asylum" by All Saints Lunatic Asylum in Hesperia
review: We had an awesome time. The staff were extremely friendly. puzzles very well put together. We can't wait to go back. A must do in Apple Valley.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Asylum" by All Saints Lunatic Asylum in Hesperia
review: This one was awesome. If you're in for a scary escape room this is definitely the one to go to. Can't wait to go for the IT themed weekend!

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Secret" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Great set design! Host was funny and cool.

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Secret" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This is Inferno Escape Room's best set design! Really cool features that give it a steampunk feel. Show up in costume for even more fun!

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Secret" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Played inventors secret and loved the look of this room! The puzzles were awesome and well planned. I dont want to give away too much, but there are some fun and surprising effects and the ending was a highlight!

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Secret" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: A great room with unique puzzles! Love the theme and atmosphere. I have played all the rooms at inferno and they all are fun and challenging!

room_title: Escape room "Inventor's Secret" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Great new place. Friendly owners. The Inventor's Secret had some fun, unique puzzles. Looking forward to trying their other room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Alice's Dream" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: Just had a great time escaping the Alice in Wonderland room. By far the best escape room I've done so far. The owner was super nice and friendly. We trusted other reviews for this specific place and it was fun. The decor was excellent and all the features worked, nothing was broken or not working as it should. We were able to really get lost in the game and dice into it. Definitely recommend this place and the Alice room

room_title: Escape room "Alice's Dream" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: We booked our Escape Room experience this afternoon; we chose Alice's Dream. We had so much fun! I love the setup in each room - super cute! Totally Alice in Wonderland theme. We find the puzzles & riddles challenging. You don't have to know anything about Alice in Wonderland to solve the puzzles. Christina was super nice & friendly;she gave us clues to help us move along & not get stuck.  She said she does not penalize us if we ask for help; what matters is we have fun. We would come back here again & try out other escape rooms. And their restrooms are super clean which is important to me & what I always like in a business.

room_title: Escape room "Alice's Dream" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: I brought my family here for my parents' and little sister's first time doing an escape room and we all had an incredible time! I was always worried my parents might get frustrated or not really understand what's going on but Alice's Dream is really family friendly and great for all levels. Barry and his wife did such an amazing job into the production of the escape room - it really felt like we were in Alice's dream from Alice in Wonderland! I will say that nothing is actually frightening but I did scream multiple times when things would open up but that's just me being me LOL I would 100% recommend this place to everyone!

room_title: Escape room "Ancestors" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Ex Machina" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: I've played Ex Machina and their new game The Society. Both were fun! Game master Theo was friendly and explained rules and game story thoroughly. Game themselves had good design, non-standard puzzles and solid support throughout the game. Lobby has some board games so you won't get bored while waiting.Nice place! Will come back for more :)

room_title: Escape room "Ex Machina" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: This place is awesome! I played 2 of their 4 games, Ex Machina and their newest game the society. Both had super immersive set design, creative stories and cool techy puzzles. There aren't a lot of escape room options in the east bay, so I'm super glad this place opened!

room_title: Escape room "Ex Machina" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: Fantastic fun and more to come! We will return as soon as possible to do the other rooms.Room: Ex MachinaOverall: Wonderful, friendly, and open customer service, Intriguing premise and unique "in world" tech and appropriately "authentic" props for immersion. Not too linear but becomes more linear as you near the finale. Enjoyable, relatively non-complicated tech and puzzles. The puzzles are strong and logical but certainly not too easy. No tedious task "puzzles" that can waste time. Outcome: We didn't make it but came close by being in the home stretch of the last set of challengesTime: Visited during soft opening several weeks ago; owner was extremely open and honest with us about the additional challenges that this may entail but it did not take away from the wonderful experience in the least. Should only get even better and better.Team: 4 - 2 adults and 2 teens - we've done 6 escapes rooms previouslyDifficulty: This was a challenging room for us but not impossible; This would be very challenging to first timers.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: Did Antidote today and had a great time, we had Oscar as our host and he was very friendly. We also got to meet Josh who was our game master. He knew exactly when to send us a hint when we needed it. Would highly recommend. Will be back to do the other two rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: That was tons of fun! We did the "easy" Antidote room and barely made it out with 5 minutes but we had to ask for help a lot! Great game masters and fun experience! Will definately be back!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: This was my first escape room and it was awesome. We made it in and out in 21 minutes and only used the free clues. I'll admit it was a little challenging with all the clues spread out between the rooms but it was worth the brain power. I hope I can come back again and try the other ones.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: We had so much fun we went back for a second one. Augustus was an awesome host.

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: Had an awesome playing with my co-workers. First time trying an escape room and we will be back. Facility was easy to get to, made us use our brains and work together. Glad we picked one that doesn't rely on scary stuff to make it challenging. Thank you Escapology for a fun team building activity.

room_title: Escape room "Time Machine" by Not Another Escape Room in Pomona
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Curse of Davy Jones VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: Wow. Brought kids here for a 12year old birthday party. The staff was super helpful and friendly. The kids were suited up and enjoyed every second of the Curse of Davy Jones experience. Special bonus was we were given videos of the experience to watch back the fun later. Great addition to the mall - we will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Curse of Davy Jones VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: The gameplay was so much more realistic than I expected, and the game was a lot of fun! We did the Curse of Davy Jones, and highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Curse of Davy Jones VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: Awesome! Great for a group of friends. The Davy Jones Curse was really fun! Would definitely go back again!

room_title: Escape room "51" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Amber Sky 2088 VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: We had my 10 year old nephews birthday, booking two sessions of Amber Sky and it was a blast!  Adults and kids all had fun, including grandma and grandpa!  Its pretty much a sci fi first person shooter, with team play... Two players are equipped with power shields that can block attacks and also be thrown like a boomerang, and laser pistols. The other 4 players carry laser rifles that also have a flamethrower... Theme is alien invasion... If your teammate gets damaged too much they shut down and you have to tap their shoulder to heal them and they can rejoin the battle.  If alien eggs are allowed to spawn they may jump on you and start biting your chest and your teammate needs to shoot them to get them off, but you can kick the eggs to break them or hit them with the flame throwers... A fun team tactic: give the kids the shield to block, and adult stands behind them with a rifle to shoot overtop of the shield! :)

room_title: Escape room "Amber Sky 2088 VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: I played the Amber Sky today with my husband & the kids. We had an amazing time!!! The green screen room becomes so realistic once the game starts. And the staff is so friendly and helpful! I can't wait to go back. Plus they give you highlight videos!!

room_title: Escape room "Amber Sky 2088 VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: I brought my 9 year old and his friends for my son's birthday. He had a great time. We did Amber Sky and my son loved the experience. I would say this is bit pricy. I could have taken kids to Great America all day for the same price. This was a 30 minute long game so I hope they would lower the price to attract more people.

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: A friend of mine really wanted to try The Fortune Teller Room. I've done plenty of escapes rooms and immersive experiences over the last couple years, The Fortune Teller Room was definitely a breath of fresh air. I don't want to spoil too much, but the room was unique in terms of how puzzles and challenges are presented. Everyone had an opportunity to participate. The theme and story of room were spot on and immersive. No random items that feel out of place like directional locks or number locks. There room is challenging in a fun and clever way. If you have done escape rooms before, definitely check this one out with your escape group for a different type of escape room experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: "The Fortune Teller beckons you with a neon sign that reads free group readings.  Mistress Nova welcomed us from behind her velvet to get our tarot card reading.  The signs aren't good.  A mystery with dire consequences is a foot."What is in store is a fun, creepy, camp experience that was exceptionally executed in production with fun lighting, a playful background music, and delightful acting. The games were a lot of mini puzzles with a timed element like any good escape room but broken up with interaction with Mistress Nova to further the story.  The immersive aspect of the room was really amped up having to talk to our fortune teller.If you've been here before, you'll know that this is the same space that was used as the Disrupted Decades room but they've done a phenomenal job making the room its own experience that I couldn't tell at all what the room was before.Great job Level Games team!

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: Paid a wonderful visit to the new Fortune Teller room at Level Games. The fortune teller herself is more of a mediator than a medium. She will guide you through the narrative and provide some hints along the way.The room has great atmosphere. It is like an old penny arcade that has a variety of delightful challenges requiring problem and puzzle solving, dexterity, and creativity. Teamwork was encouraged and rewarded by our live Zoltar.We had a group of 3 and found that there was plenty for each person to do. They recommend 4 people for this max of 5 room. As the cards are dealt, the game design definitely benefits a group of 4.I can see great success for this room and continued success for Level Games in the future. The care and enthusiasm in the creation of this room is truly evident and incorporates all aspects that make an immersive/escape experience unforgettable.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge" by Brainy Actz in San Diego
review: Had so much fun today.  Did the Mystery at Lost Point Lodge room with family and friends.Ok so we were more like a bunch of bumbling fools but we did figure out some clues on our own.   Wow Bobby and Monica were fun, friendly and professional.  Will be coming back again to try different rooms.The Ceniceros and Merlin family.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge" by Brainy Actz in San Diego
review: My family and I escaped the Mystery at the Lost Point Lodge. When I first walked in, the room felt very authentic, the sounds, the props made me feel like I was in a lodge. The things we had to figure out and find was fun. It was a great experience overall and I hope to go back soon to escape some of their other puzzle rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge" by Brainy Actz in San Diego
review: We did the Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge room and rented it out just for our group. The room itself was decorated very nicely and we definitely felt instantly immersed in the story provided -- it has a maximum of six people so it's definitely the perfect size for a private room. The gentleman that greeted us and gave us the story, and took us into the room was great as well! We did have a hiccup with the game master with 8 minutes left on the clock. However, the company reached out to us the following day to apologize -- they were training new staff and things just got a little out of order for a moment. We've since returned and attempted The Secrets of the Master. Our faith was definitely restored in them due to their quick and understanding customer service, as well as our great second experience!Regardless of the hiccup, the Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge was actually our favorite room out of the two. If you're a group that's looking for a creepy room that isn't necessarily scary, it's perfect. The puzzles for both rooms are very well put together and as newbie players we didn't stand a chance to escape without clues!

room_title: Escape room "Magic Kingdom" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I highly recommend LA Maze Rooms for anyone who is looking for a good time with friends. This was my first room at this company and it did not disappoint! I went with a group of 6 and I felt like you can definitely do this room with a smaller group because it was a little tight for 6. This is a good room for beginners because the puzzles were not overly difficult. The production value of this room was phenomenal, as this is not your average keys and locks type of escape room. If you're looking for a beginner friendly escape room with high production value, then this is the room for you.

room_title: Escape room "Magic Kingdom" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had a super fun time doing the Magical Kingdom! Really cool puzzles and the room looked amazing. Thanks Jay for being a great game master!

room_title: Escape room "Magic Kingdom" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This escape room was very different from the others I've been to. The Magic Kingdom was very interesting and creatively decorated!

room_title: Escape room "Magic Kingdom" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: It was so much fun. Really well done!! I can't wait to do another of their rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Magic Kingdom" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Highly recommend Maze to anyone who enjoys a fun challenge! Team work is a must, so is common sense, logic and the ability to laugh at yourself! Looking forward to our next visit and the opening of the "crime scene" room!

room_title: Escape room "Castaway" by Padlocked Inc. in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: By far the best escape room venue in the valley. We did the Mad Hatter room and it was so gorgeously decorated. It was challenging and the puzzles were so creative. I can't wait to try out all their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Excellent staff- excellent service- excellent experience. Our group of ten did The Mad Hatter and we had a blast!  The rooms are super fun!! If you like escape rooms - you'll love Eludsions!

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: The four of us did the mad hatter and escaped in 45 min! It was definitely challenging but very fast paced and fun. Loved the decor. We loved it so much we did the runestones one right after. That one was fun too, but we preferred the mad hatter because it was more exciting.

room_title: Escape room "The Agency" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: Super fun! We did the agency room and it was so cool! It had three different rooms you could work your way towards after solving each step. We were one minute away from escaping it! I'm addicted for sure.

room_title: Escape room "The Agency" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: Loved the spy room about the secret agent. Fun and challenging and we worked as a team with another family that we didn't know. That made the experience all the more fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Agency" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: This place is loads of fun. Great team building opportunity and to work together with co-workers on solving clues. Definitely coming back.

room_title: Escape room "Operation Counterpart" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Really enjoyed this experience. The host Jeremy was helpful when we needed a nudge in the right direction. I would recommend this escape the room experience.

room_title: Escape room "Operation Counterpart" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Awesome! Had a lot of fun

room_title: Escape room "Operation Counterpart" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: It was an awesome day!!! Family and friends gathered here for our bachelor/bachelorette party!!! Lots of fun!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Painter's Collection" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: So, I did not escape this room :(. However, despite my failure I have to rate this 5/5 because it was phenomenal. This is the hardest room they have and by FAR the hardest room I've ever done. I truly felt that I lost this room fairly and squarely (and I don't say this often lol). Before starting this room, you have a choice of picking it in difficult mode and of course being with fellow avid players, they chose the HARDEST MODE. That was our first mistake. I probably wouldn't pick the hard mode unless you had at least 5 people all of whom have done 20-30+ rooms. This was a true v4 room with little to no keys/locks. Lots of puzzles to solve and definitely a lot of puzzles that I have NEVER SEEN and was WOW'd once clue master explained it to us. This room put lots of different skills to the test and made us quickly realize our weaknesses. I highly recommend this room!

room_title: Escape room "Deadwood Mansion VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: We tried the "Deadwood Mansion" with a party of 3 and had a really good time. Will be definitely going back a few more times with more friends,Staff were very friendly and amenable. Recommend trying the pirate adventure if you don't like horror.

room_title: Escape room "Deadwood Mansion VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: Omg this place and the people and the experience were amazing! Customer service is spot on, they are always ready to make your experience one of a kind. The explanations were detailed on to what to expect. We played deadwood mansion and thrilled with fun.Great recommend for team building activities,corporate event or plain ole fun

room_title: Escape room "Deadwood Mansion VR" by Sandbox VR in San Francisco
review: Did the Deadwood Mansion, super intensive! I'll try the curse of Davy Jones next time! Nice staff and services. Recommended!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: This was an awesome escape room!  Very well done, no red herrings, and an appropriate amount of encouragement from the Game Master (Dillion).  The puzzles were great and plentiful.  The room was very professional and functioned as designed.  There were no cheesy puzzles or tricks that were stupid, as sometimes happen.  Just a Grade-A experience.  And no, we didn't solve it by the time limit, but they let us continue, and we got out about 10 minutes later.  The first escape room we didn't complete, but probably still the most fun and most challenging.  Also, the room was well-lite, so you can see without straining.  I've been in escape rooms where you can't read the combination locks because it was so dark...very frustrating...but that didn't happen here. You will not be disappointed.  Highly recommended.  A word of caution...don't leave anything in your vehicle while you do the escape room.  Our van was broken into and we lost some stuff.  It was our fault, we had been told earlier in the week in San Francisco not to leave anything visible in your vehicle, or they will smash and grab...and it happened to us.  Live and learn.  Good luck!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: This was my first escape room experience. Holy awesomeness this was one of the most amazing, fun, and catching experiences I have had!!!! The Houdini Escape Room is cleverly thought out and a fantastic puzzling challenge. If you are ever in the San Francisco area, this is a great place to go to!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: The Houdini Room is amazing. We went with a group of friends before dinner (makes a great night!). Chris (the room's creator and operator) is incredibly smart and was kind enough to spend time with us explaining how the room worked, the history of the many innovators represented in the room, etc. This is both an interesting and educational time!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: This escape room was incredible, by far the best I've seen. There was so much detail in every aspect of the puzzles and scenery at large. I definitely hope to solve more of these well-made rooms by Palace Games, but the Houdini Escape will surely stay up for some time. I wait with bated breath!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: We visited the Houdini escape room as a team building exercise for work.This was really an remarkable experience. It was fun, challenging, required team work, and definitely tested our problem solving and collaboration skills.The META analytics provided at the end of the experience were a great conversation starter about what worked and what didn't.

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: I'm a big fan of San Francisco history (and turn-of-the-century history in general). Located in the old Exploratorium building at the Palace of Fine Arts, where currently housed is the wonderful Innovation Hangar exhibition of old Panama-Pacific International Expo historic items, you'll find the Palace Games' Great Houdini Escape Room. This is the same room that Houdini presented to his notable friends 100 years prior. With a team of friends, you'll use your wits and teamworking skills to solve your way out of the room. It's challenging and very, very fun. Not sure when the Houdini room ends, but from what they've told us, we can expect a spy-themed room coming in the future.Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: Houdini Escape was a great experience! Went with a group of 11, and we all enjoyed it thoroughly. Puzzles were fun and challenging, the entire room and atmosphere were all very nicely designed. 10/10 would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Houdini Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: The Houdini Escape Room is by far the best escape room I have done. The puzzles were all well thought out and much more creative than the standard combo-lock puzzles I've seen in the other rooms. The puzzles are challenging, but all of them made sense and there no crazy leaps that you had to make to solve it. The room itself is well put together with an underlying theme that pulls everything together and enhances the experience. The only downside of the Houdini Escape Room is that I fear that no other escape room will ever live up to this new standard.I definitely recommend the Houdini Escape Room as it is not only extremely fun and challenging, it is also the best escape room out there.

room_title: Escape room "Diner" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: Awesome escape rooms! We did both The Diner and Speakeasy - both incredible rooms, though my favorite was The Diner (and has now become my favorite room I've ever done). You can't go wrong with either room though. Creative puzzles to solve, lots of fun and unique twists - truly the most enjoyable escape room I've done as compared to several others around the nation. Owners/designers were fun to visit with afterwards. Definitely visit this place if you are ever in the San Diego area!

room_title: Escape room "Diner" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: Super fun! I've done a handful of escape rooms, and I don't want to be told answers. We got out with 6 minutes left and only needed one clue, and it wasn't an answer, just a gentle nudge in the right direction. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Diner" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: I've done over 60 escape rooms, and the Diner ranks very well. The puzzles are well designed, with appropriate clues provided. Our solving experience was very logical, and I love how appropriate the decor was! We had a lot of fun and look forward to returning for more!

room_title: Escape room "Diner" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: My girlfriends and I just got back from an escape room weekend in San Diego. We did the Diner room, and it was one of our favorites of the weekend! Production value was high, and we had so much fun escaping this room! I look forward to coming back and trying the Speakeasy room soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Roosevelt Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: This was my first escape room. I had an absolute blast. The puzzles were fun, varied, and some were quite tough! Our Game Master was super friendly, even letting us go back into the room afterwards to talk about the design a bit more, and catch up on puzzles we'd missed (since we divided & conquered our way through most). Loved the setting and theme -- and learned a bit about some historical figures along the way.

room_title: Escape room "The Roosevelt Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: My friends and I have done both the Houdini and Roosevelt rooms by Palace Games. They're incredible, challenging, and so much fun! The production quality is spectacular. The staff is amazing. Check them out!

room_title: Escape room "The Roosevelt Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: Wow! Every experience I have had with Palace Games so far has been exceptional! The staff is amazing, the stories behind the puzzles are fun, and most of all, the puzzles are challenging! I have been here twice, once for the Houdini Room and once for the Roosevelt Room. Both times were fun, but I preferred the Roosevelt Room slightly more than the Houdini Room. I might also add that we escaped both times! We didn't need any hints in the Roosevelt Room and we still managed to escape in 72 minutes. One thing that was exceptional about our run in the Roosevelt Room was our host, Alan. He was funny and very helpful. If you are into escape rooms, I would definitely check out Palace Games. Their rooms are elaborate and very fun! They are making a an Edison room, so stay tuned.

room_title: Escape room "The Roosevelt Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: We came here on New Year's Eve to submit ourselves to one last challenge for the year, and we sure got it! We skipped right to the Roosevelt Room and were impressed with the design, intricacy and overall production quality. It was cool that the story was also designed with the history of the Palace of Fine Arts in mind. Will be back to try out the Houdini Room!

room_title: Escape room "The Roosevelt Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: I had a great time. The attention to detail is awesome and the puzzles are very thoughtfully set up. Also got a little bit of a history lesson and got to know about all the wonderful people that this room pays tribute to.Also from what my friends tell me this is the best escape room they've been to.

room_title: Escape room "The Roosevelt Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: I have been to a few other escape rooms around the bay but this one stands a head above the rest. The detail and sophiscation of the room is ridiculous! I would highly recommend it to anyone, even if you don't fancy yourself a puzzle person (I'm not!) there is something for everyone.

room_title: Escape room "Samurai" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: After doing 50+ rooms, this is one of my all-time favorite rooms. Unique puzzles that fit the themes nicely. The cleanest design I have ever seen and was esthetically beautiful. A mix of modern and traditional elements. I highly recommend any of the Lock Down rooms. The staff was friendly and very accommodating with the booking process. I am usually not a fan of walkie-talkies for hints. However, the walkie-talkies used were simple, worked well, and hints were given quickly demonstrating that the game master was tracking our progress carefully. Lock Down delivers a solid A+ escape room experience which can be a rare find these days.

room_title: Escape room "Samurai" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Very fun! We did Chem lab and Samurai tonight (beat the Samurai record!). Clean location. Great employees. Great rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Samurai" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Did Theft and Samurai yesterday. It was defiantly on our top list of escape rooms. The rooms are fairly spacious so large groups can fit very comfortably. Staff was fun to talk too. Definitely coming back to try out Chem Lab.

room_title: Escape room "Samurai" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We have gone to many escape rooms and really enjoy a good challenge. The rooms here are fun, challenging, too notch. Great place for date night, team building or even the whole family( we brought our 14, 13 & 9 years old kids). I can't say enough about how nice the staff there is, friendly, helpful and very professional! We will be back for a third time soon!

room_title: Escape room "Samurai" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: There are a wealth of great room escape options in the East Valley and Lockdown rates among or at the top of the list.  Our team completed the Theft and Samurai rooms and were thoroughly impressed by each of them.  The puzzles are clever, engaging, and challenging.  Better yet, they truly feel as if they are organic and belong in their environments.  What sets Lockdown apart from other escape rooms is their commitment and attention to a particular aesthetic.  They have realized that challenge does not have to detract from the overall immersion of a room escape experience.  Their design principles are a welcome change from the many rooms where escaping the zombie apocalypse, a fallout shelter, or an alien research facility requires the unlocking of a half dozen bike locks.Lockdown is a challenging, affordable, and engaging option for a group room escape.  Their staff is friendly, enthusiastic, and welcoming.  We will surely be back to enjoy their other experiences.

room_title: Escape room "Samurai" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Today was our first visit to an escape room. We did Samurai and had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned Basement" by The Hour Room in San Diego
review: First escape room I've ever done and it was excellent! Plenty of different variety of clues and challenges. All of the puzzles and clues were rational and I never felt cheated when they were solved.I was afraid there would be random scary things popping out because I hate haunted mazes, but safe to say even if you hate scary movies you'll be fine here. Would recommend to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned Basement" by The Hour Room in San Diego
review: This was my fourth escape room, and it was super fun! Really well thought out puzzles. You have to work fast and work well together as a team to escape! Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned Basement" by The Hour Room in San Diego
review: Fantastic gameplay and the theme was solid! You felt immersed the moment you stepped in. Perfect amount of creepy without being scary. Great for all ages and abilities. Everyone in town should be checking this out!

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned Basement" by The Hour Room in San Diego
review: Awesome room! Super creepy with clever clues! I highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Abandoned Basement" by The Hour Room in San Diego
review: Some friends and I went to The Hour Room tonight to celebrate a birthday, and we all had so much fun! The story was really well thought out and really fun! My team got out with 13 minutes to spare. The space was really big, much bigger than other escape rooms I’ve done! I would definitely recommend The Hour Room!

room_title: Escape room "Return of Bootlegger Warehouse" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: I've done around 15 escape rooms and this one is my least favorite so far. Without giving anything away, there were about 100 keys in this room, if not more... The room didn't require much skill, most of the time we were just trying every key on every lock until we got the right one.... It was pretty annoying.

room_title: Escape room "Return of Bootlegger Warehouse" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: so much fun. We did both rooms available in one day and both were very different and challenging. Will definetly be back to try the new rooms when they come up!!

room_title: Escape room "Return of Bootlegger Warehouse" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: This was my first time doing one of these rooms so I don't have much to compare with, that being said I had a blast. It was challenging and forces you to work together with your team, so pick people you like and work well with. My team rocked, we only used two clues and made it out with 20 minutes to spare � we all had a great time and can't wait to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: Visited this place for a corporate event and loved it. I've been to several of these escape rooms and this was by far the cleanest one. The game was well organized and challenging. Everything about this location was top notch. Highly recommend. We did the bank heist theme and everyone loved it.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: This was an awesome experience with family and friends. We escaped! But we did ask for some hints! Nathan was our game master and he gave us good hints that pointed us in the right direction but still allowed us to think and solve the puzzles. We did the Bank Heist which is supposed to be the easiest of the three rooms by Limitless Escape Games. We have to come back and try the others!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: I had so much fun, and received a completely unexpected surprise! Ryan worked with my now-fiancé to set up one amazing proposal in the Diamond Heist room. Thank you for the wonderful memories!

room_title: Escape room "The Hurricane Room" by Escape House Waterville in Orange Beach
review: Enjoyed my time everyone was able to contribute. My 10-year-old son was hooked! I did wish there was more of a wind aspect to the hurricane room.

room_title: Escape room "The Hurricane Room" by Escape House Waterville in Orange Beach
review: We did the hurricane room while on vacation and had a blast. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to have fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Hurricane Room" by Escape House Waterville in Orange Beach
review: Did the Hurricane room and it was SO MUCH FUN! Super challenging!

room_title: Escape room "Red Alert" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: 60Out did it again!! Im truly amazed by what they can do!! We just played PUTIN Bunker and we had a great time! The room had an fun theme and it felt like we were in a real bunker. The puzzles were creative and not to hard to solve. This is a great room if you are a beginner in Escape rooms! Our game master Ryan was fantastic! He was super friendly, patient, and continued to theme with us the whole time we were in the room! I recommend 60Out to everyone! I can't wait to play more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Red Alert" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had an awesome time in the Red Alert room at this location. Initially we were supposed to play Da Vinci, but when we arrived the game masters warned us that it has about a 10% escape rate. Wish we would have known that before we booked! (The website just lists it as "hard" so we had no idea). We were nervous since we've done a couple dozen rooms but didn't feel like we were "experts" in any sense, so game master Jess suggested we play Red Alert instead and we were so glad she did. The room was a perfect mix of physical puzzles, lock and key, and technology, and we never felt stressed or stuck. Jess was awesome with giving the right amount of hint without just telling you how to solve the puzzle, and we escaped with a few minutes to spare. We also talked to her for a while afterwards and got some recommendations for more 60out rooms to play. Can't wait to try them out next time I'm in LA!!

room_title: Escape room "Red Alert" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This place was awesome!! We did the Putin bunker or "red alert". It was definitely not easy but we did make it out with a minute to spare. We asked for about 5-6 clues throughout our time because we were getting stumped at certain parts. We are definitely coming back...it was so fun to use our brains and teamwork. The employees were super nice too. Highly recommend!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Loved the Asylum great room and Chris was awesome!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Super fun time with family while in town for a wedding! Staff was very fun, nice, and helpful. Even though we didn’t quite make it through Asylum, we were told what needed to be solved in our last room...we were so close! Definitely recommend this experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Highly recommend the Asylum room! It was put together very well and challenging for a great escape room experience!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: Yesterday was my first time, and it was amazing! I didn't manage to escape the island, but got really close. Our game master was very helpful to us. I will definitely be going back! It was a great experience

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: me and my family did the island escape,even though we didnt make it (4 steps away though lol) we had a great time! we def plan on coming back to do the hostage! awesome game for the whole family!!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: We went to the Island Escape room. They had a really fun theme and room design and a lot of new and novel puzzles that were well engineered. The staff was friendly, engaging and on top of monitoring our progress. The communication was clear and easy to understand.Cons:Some of the puzzles were huge leaps of logic. One of the first ones took us about 15 minutes to figure out and we had to use one of our three clues. A few tweaks on it would have made it much more understandable. After we won, the room leader came in and told us that a lot of people get caught up on it. If that's the case, then it's probably the puzzle that needs fixing. I don't like the feeling of being stuck on the first puzzle! I wish they had given me a few more wins before a big stall.This experience puts this room at the middle of the pack of my escape room experiences, but I do hope they continue to refine the puzzles because the room could be great!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: Great adventure for the whole family!! We have a 9-year-old and 2 older teens. We did the island escape and they were all able to participate and all enjoyed it so much!!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: Went tonight with a group of 8 as a belated birthday celebration. We had so much fun with Island Escape that we turned right around and booked Operation Casino right after it! Our game masters were both amazing and I can't wait to try the other rooms!!!

room_title: Escape room "Tut’s Rut" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Amazing family run game! Our group had the best time and can't wait to return to play the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Tut’s Rut" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: I visited Tut's Rut with 5 of my friends. I've done a few other rooms, but nothing like this one. We put on our pith helmets and escaped the space ship into the tomb only to discover we had to keep going back into the space ship. All of the rooms work together, and you have to split your group into small teams and work on the puzzles, and just keep building on puzzles until the very end. We were overwhelmed by the whole atmosphere created by this room. It was incredible with Hollywood style special effects, but I don't want to give too much away. You feel like you're in a tomb!! After we escaped, we had to all hang around and check out the technology in this room. It's mind-blowing to see how this whole thing works together. My friend's birthday is coming up and I know where we'll be having his party!

room_title: Escape room "Tut’s Rut" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: It was a very good time. The room was very detailed and immersed you into the world. The father/daughter duo were very nice and helped a lot. It was tough but we did make it out within the hour and a half time period. Will be going back again.

room_title: Escape room "Clinic" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Private Detective Agency: Knight & Rook Investigations" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: My friends and I tried (and failed) Knight and Rook last weekend, it was difficult but fun. I have done escape rooms in other locations and this was a bit different. We were very close to making it out, on the last step, but ran out of time. Disappointing, but the room was definitely doable if we hadn't missed a couple of easy clues. The owner was very nice and took time after we were done to talk about where we went wrong, what recommendations we had for him, etc. Great customer service. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Private Detective Agency: Knight & Rook Investigations" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: Had a blast here! It's clean and the employees are very welcoming. I would definitely recommend getting a group together and making a night of it. The more people you have the more fun it is.

room_title: Escape room "Private Detective Agency: Knight & Rook Investigations" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: It blew my expectations out of the water... interactive.. challenging.. and so much fun!! I highly recommend these guys!! I went into it thinking it might be cheesy.. it wasn't At All! I can't wait to do it again!

room_title: Escape room "The Sword of Hattori Hanzo" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Myself and 4 other adults just did Wanted: Dead or Alive at the Del Amo site tonight and my husband and I with our 3 teens did The Sword of Hattori a month ago and had a blast. Tonight was my 5th escape room and I have to say the rooms at Back in Time have been my favorite, having so many details and clever surprises. I like that escape rooms are such a great bonding activity that allow us to think together through and talk about what happened after over dinner. My favorite room so far is The Sword of Hattori Hanzo. I'm looking forward to the next birthday or special event as an excuse to go to another room at Back in Time!

room_title: Escape room "The Sword of Hattori Hanzo" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had such an amazing time at Back in Time Escape Rooms.  First off, I didn't know there was an escape room in the South Bay!  So, in planning for a fun activity for our group, I was able to find this place so close to work.  We had an amazing time!  We did the room where we had to find the sword.  That room was challenging but fun!  Our group loved it.  We were sooooooo close, that we even got bonus time!  Sadly, we still didn't get out.  In any case, it really brought our team together, and we are looking to come back soon to experience Area 51 =)

room_title: Escape room "The Sword of Hattori Hanzo" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I had my daughter's Birthday Party there yesterday and the kids (more like teenagers) had an amazing time!  The games were fun, the party room was great and the staff was fantastic! For this age group, I would suggest the Witches of Salem, though they really enjoyed "the Sword of Hattori Hanzo" very much as well, they just needed a bit more time to complete it.  We will soon be back to try the "Inside Area 51".  Did I already mention the staff? :)  They were amazing, friendly, caring and on top of everything.  I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Lost in the Ozarks" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I have been to probably about a dozen escape rooms so I was really excited to finally have one in Thousand Oaks! We did the Study Room and it did not disappoint. We definitely needed to use my sister for quite a few puzzles but between all us, we only needed one clue and we escaped - I think that's a win! At the end of the room, the theme definitely came full circle so I appreciated the attention to the detail and I would highly recommend this to anyone.However, it doesn't beat my favorite room of all time which is the Great Houdini Escape Room which is actually in San Francisco, so if you're ever in SF you definitely need to go there!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've done several escape rooms now, and the two things that really make a good escape game for me are puzzles that connect to the theme, and a room that "feels" right. The Study definitely hit it out of the park. There were some easier puzzles and some harder ones, and it was a clear flow. The guy working there was super friendly and I liked that the room had a story. Can't wait for the new one!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: What a great and unexpected treat this was! We all thoroughly enjoyed the challenge and really pulled together to escape from the Study with only 37 seconds to spare. A great bonding exercise.

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: A really great escape room! The puzzles are intelligent and challenging. Alex is amazing - smart, chill, with a real knack for terrific customer service. I love the fact that they built escape games right here in Thousand Oaks. We did The Study and we got out with only 4 minutes to spare! To me, that's perfect - when you think you might not make it because the puzzles are so challenging but you are still able to if you hustle and focus. This is a great room and I would definitely recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Cuckoo's Nest" by Padlocked Inc. in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Such a fun experience! The decor was beautiful in the lobby area and featured really cool pieces of art from a local artist. The Budapest Express was difficult, but very interesting. I went with a group of friends and we had a blast solving the murder mystery together. I want to try all the rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Went here last night to do the Prison Break room with my 2 kids (under 12) and a couple of friends. The staff was very upbeat and helpful. the room was so fun and FULL of puzzles. I believe Sandy (Sandra? SORRY) was our Game master. She did a great job.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Did The prison escape this weekend.  It was rated as moderately difficult.   It was our first attempt at an escape room.  We should have started with "easy"!    With some hints from the Game Master we made it out.   Had a great time.   Next time we'll bring a few more people.  The more brains working on the challenge, the better.   My advice.....  EVERYTHING you see is part of a clue, so don't ignore anything.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Back again!!!  This time we did Prison Break. Such a fun room. Puzzles were fair and the gameplay extremely exhilarating. This is our fourth room here and we can't wait to do the 5th and get our red key. The rewards program is well worth it.

room_title: Escape room "The Sword In The Study" by GasLamp in Pomona
review: One of the most well-designed escape rooms I've visited, in terms of production quality and theme. Our team took on the debut room, The Sword and the Study. The puzzles were challenging and even better, interesting. A good mix of cognitive puzzles, critical thinking puzzles, and technical puzzles; it allowed for all team members to contribute their unique skills. A very, very good "teamwork" room. Highly recommended and I look forward to new future games!

room_title: Escape room "The Sword In The Study" by GasLamp in Pomona
review: We found this gem of a room randomly doing a search for escape rooms. Lots of fun and unique puzzles in a little space. Any room that has swords and wands a must do for us. We didn't expect much since we hadn't heard anything but we were pleasantly surprised. We found the Sword in the Study! Our Game Master was great also!

room_title: Escape room "Bazaar Battle" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Gallery" by Stockton Escape in Modesto
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Pharaoh's Curse" by The Hidden Passage in Los Angeles
review: We have a few escape rooms under our belt now and this Pharaoh room was really fun and clever. Well decorated, puzzles and locks took a minute to figure out, but we always like when the gamekeeper is fun too! Yea Ben! Good for a medium size team.

room_title: Escape room "The Pharaoh's Curse" by The Hidden Passage in Los Angeles
review: Really fun ! Rooms are hugeI love the pharaoh storyline, just make sure it's just your group that's going in with you obviously it's easier to work together but if you don't mind playing with strangers than it should be great

room_title: Escape room "The Pharaoh's Curse" by The Hidden Passage in Los Angeles
review: Wow! Just WOW! This was my 114th escape room, so I am not easily impressed. I've done half the rooms in LA, and this one really holds it's own. The set design and building were amazing. You go to an industrial area not expecting much, and then you walk through their doors and low and behold you are transported to Egypt. The game and puzzles were incredibly fun and my team had a blast escaping The Pharaoh's Curse. The attention to detail and immersive nature of this escape room were impressive. I'd recommend this game to any escape room expert or newb.

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Dragon Eggs Quest" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
