review: We have done Escape Rooms in the past, we tried the Dragon Egg Room and has an amazing time. The rooms are clean  and more high tech.  The people there are helpful and so nice. We will definitely be back to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Dragon Eggs Quest" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: We did two different rooms over two days. The newest room is The Dragon Eggs Quest. It was so much fun and fairly difficult which is what made it so fun! The next was the VR Space Station Tiberia. We liked them both so much! Escape Room 101 is clean and they are very customer friendly. Great area with restaurants and things to do before or after your escape room experience. Highly recommend them.

room_title: Escape room "The Dragon Eggs Quest" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: We did Chocolate Factory, The Dragon Eggs Quest, and Diplomat's Secret. All were fun with original puzzles. As GOT fans, we really liked Dragon Eggs Quest! Recommend doing all these games!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock’s Library" by ALL IN Adventures in Tuscaloosa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Morgue" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: We have done all 4 rooms! And all the rooms are awesome. From the suspenseful room of The Morgue to the very realistic rooms of The Garage, Aunt Debbie's Apartment, and The Classroom. They are all great, and whether you win or lose you are guaranteed a great time. The staff is very friendly and thank you to Big Mike for always being so welcoming! Definitely recommend this place for a date night or fun family night.

room_title: Escape room "The Morgue" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: Fun and exciting experience. Will definitely be going back.

room_title: Escape room "Cold Case" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: Escape Hot Springs offers challenging fun for the whole family. Great for team building. The Cold Case room was full of tricks, we loved it. I highly recommend Escape Hot Springs for groups, work teams and families! Great! Great! Great! Plus the staff is amazing too!

room_title: Escape room "Cold Case" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: No one in our group had been to an Escape Room before so the Cold Case room was exceptionally challenging. Thanks to our hostess, we were able to find our way through all the clues, locks and mind benders to finally solve the case and escape the room with 7 seconds left! This is something everyone should try... so much fun! Teamwork and communication required. Take your friends to Escape Hot Springs to have a very unique and interesting time!

room_title: Escape room "Cold Case" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: Great fun for a family with kids old and young! The Cold Case room is definitely a challenge, be prepared to work as a team on perfectly thought out puzzles! The staff were fun and having a great time as well!

room_title: Escape room "Cold Case" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: We did the Cold Case Room. Very challenging. Lots of fun. I look forward to going back and trying the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Cold Case" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: My family and I were here on Spring break and my 11-year-old son wanted to do the cold case file. It turned out to be an experience we won't be forgetting. I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a new and exciting experience.

room_title: Escape room "Cold Case" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: Great group activity! The crew are very friendly, the atmosphere is clean, and its challenging but FUN FUN FUN!!! We did the cold case room. My youngest is 9 and she really enjoyed it. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Best escape room yet! Alcatraz will not disappoint!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This has been my favorite room so far. The puzzles were great, and the experience was amazing. Although we didn't escape, we still had a wonderful time. Everything was just so well done.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We came, we saw and we were amazed! Each of these rooms are a must do. We waited patiently for Escape from Alcatraz and it amazed us with its absolute spot on decor right down to the color of the walls. The flow of the puzzles were great. Room is challenging but we managed to escape with time to spare. If you're in north Phoenix, just head 15 minutes further north as this was awesome! Highly recommended! We have done 42 escape rooms in AZ and this room takes the cake so far! Great Job Team North Valley Escape Room!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: The staff were so friendly and helpful with all of the questions we asked. Our group did the Escape from Alcatraz. The rooms are very elaborate and the puzzles were well done. We were so close to getting out but time ended just as we were on the very last puzzle. Our group was made up of mostly first timers to escape rooms. I highly recommend for any skill level. We will definitely be back to try their two other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Escape from Alcatraz was a blast! The room was so much more elaborate and complicated than I ever imagined. Our family (two parents, three kids(17, 17, 15), and two grand parents) had so much fun working together to solve the puzzle and find our way out! We loved all the little surprises along the way too. I must commend your staff of puzzle makers and builders for really creating an immersive experience filled with intrigue and danger, it was perfect!The kids are already asking when we can go back!

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: So much fun! Make sure to have a team when you go. We only had two people in our room and it made things much more difficult. Such a fun activity!

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: We had a fantastic time! Can’t wait to try to beat the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Prohibition room was so much fun! We went with a group of ten for a bridal shower & had a blast.

room_title: Escape room "C.S.I. - Mob Hit" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: This place was an absolute blast!! Went to try out Asylum and ended up doing Wonderland as well because it was so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: Sugar and I had so much fun in the Alice in Wonderland room! We will be back soon!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: We did the Alice in Wonderland room. It was great! So much fun!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Best price point for a ninety minute game anywhere!  $29 bucks!? Comeon, I pay that much and more for shorter sixty minute games.Overall I give it five stars across the board, quality of puzzles, difficulty level, theming, quality of the props and decorations.  And the briefing they give is spot on, the lore of their backstory is so cool, mostly because it has a lot to do with actual history.  Of course I love time travel to start with, but Escapeopolis actually pulls it off and makes it seem authentic.

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: GO. TO. THIS. PLACE!  Hardest puzzles our group have ever been challenged with, yet excitingly delicious at the same time.  Great theming, great mom and pop owners, and absolutely the best customer service we have ever received  at any of the 100 or so games we have played.  We played both of their games - wildly different from one another - yet incredibly well imagineered.  GREAT!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Wow!!! This is a hidden, and soon to be a not so hidden treasure in NWA!!  My husband and I and another couple tried out Escapeopolis and Basinga! we found our new favorite escape room game!!First, the puzzles are phenomenal, all very crafty and unique - especially compared to other escape rooms that seem to depend on way too many padlocks.  My hubby loved it!!!  You really gotta think, you know, use the old brain pan to figure these puzzles out.And the look and feel of this place is awesome!  From the moment we walked in, we felt like we were thrown back in time to some military laboratory where top secret stuff went on.  The look and feel continued from the front door into the game and all the way out the door!!  Very nice.We played their newest escape room, the insurgent attack, where we were sent on a mission as security agents to 1969 to... oops no spoilers here folks - lol!We didn't win initially, but we played again later in the day when they had another time for us to book and killed it.Don't forget to book early for this one, they were pretty busy when we went.  We loved it and are for sure going back to play their other games.  You don't want to miss this one!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: My boyfriend and I played this game a couple of weeks ago with my sister and her husband. It was their first game ever, and I’m afraid we completely spoiled them! This game was by far the best game we ever played! The level of immersion from the time we walked in to the time we escaped the room was the best we’d ever seen! Plus, the way the puzzles were set up made sense, like we were in a real place and not a game! The owners were super nice and made sure we had a great time too!We’ll definitely be back and you should come too!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Best room ever!Not only were the puzzles and the story so much better than the other escapes in NWA, but the price was so much better than everyone else too!Escapeopolis Project, please make some rooms soon so we can come back and play again!!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: So, when I tried to find the insurgent attack game here, I couldn’t. So here’s my review for that room as well.The insurgent attack was nothing like the 1959 game, but boy, was it cool! The story is kicked up a notch and the special effects are super cool too! The game is also 90 minutes, unlike the 60 minute 1959 room. The puzzle were harder than the 1959 room, but they’re still solveable, thanks to the extra 30 minutes. My friends and I didn’t escape, but we’ll definitely be back next weekend to beat this game too! We found our newest favorite escape room today!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: We played the 1959 room and it was like nothing my friends or I had ever played! The story of the game was not only in the game, but also through the rest of the building as well!Once we were in the game, we had to change our normal strategy since there was only one padlock in the entire room! Crazy, I know!We escaped with just seconds left on the clock, but, boy, was it ever so exciting!Definitely give this room a try! My friends and I had such a good time, that we immediately booked the newest room, the insurgent attack, for after lunch!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Unfortunately this was the absolute worst escape room I have ever done. Which is unfortunate because the couple that run it obviously put a lot of time into it. My wife and I have done 20+ escape rooms in several different states across the country and this one was BY FAR THE MOST EXPENSIVE and BY FAR THE WORST! We brought 2 friends that had never done an escape room and I am so sorry that was their first experience. We paid $140 to do their newest room having something to do with time travel. Sadly after having spent over 2 and a half hours there total I still can't even properly explain the room. He talked FOREVER before we even were allowed in. Even though I had asked repeatedly to go to the bathroom. Then serval of there props didn't work. The flashlight we needed to get into the second room wouldn't turn on. The intro video was excessively long. They entire thing was WAY TO COMPLICATED! The clues he gives you aren't even real clues and they were off center so we couldn't even see all of it on the screen. I was so upset with how ridiculous everything was that we told him we were done even before our time ran out. We just wanted to go home. He offered to let us come back for free to do this room again since so much of equipment didnt work correctly but he should have offered us half our money back. I will NEVER go back and I will be sure that none of my friends go either. If you want a fantastic escape room experience go to Bolt NWA! The only reason we tried escapeopolis is because we had done all the other escape rooms in NWA.

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Fantastic place, staff and extremely creative. We had a blast traveling to 1959. We will be back and recommend for sure.

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: I've never been to an escape room experience before, but I really enjoyed it. The back story was really interesting and the room was very detailed. I went with a group of 10 which is probably too many (a little chaotic), but 3 to 5 I think would be perfect. Really nice people too! Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: I didn't know what to expect at all before entering Escapeopolis, and wow it was spectacular! You can see the hard work that the owners put into making you feel like you're in 1959! I would highly recommend going because you're not going to get this kind of experience anywhere else!

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: What impressed me the most was the attention to detail at Escapeopolis. Not only did the rooms have very creative and intricate puzzles, but even the lobby matched the aesthetic of the adventure at hand. Additionally, the rules, instead of being blandly stated, were presented in the context of the backstory. These smaller, more subtle details really helped create an enjoyable experience.

room_title: Escape room "1959 - Jack's Place" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: This escape room was unlike any other escape room I have ever done. At a normal escape room you are greeted at the door and led to the room where you solve various puzzles to escape. Escapeopolis is much different than a normal escape room. From the moment you are greeted at the door you feel like you are already immersed in an elaborate storyline. You are led to a room full of intricate details and thought provoking challenges, which truly test your puzzle solving capabilities. I encourage anyone who wants an enjoyable mental challenge to visit escapeopolis!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We played the Island Escape game for my daughter's 14th birthday and it was so much fun! Our game master was the best. We had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Played Island Escape today with a group of coworkers. Escaped just in time! Everyone had a great time. 2 other groups of coworkers enjoyed their rooms as well. Only 3 of 20 of us had done a breakout before. Several of the first-timers said they'd like to play again. Staff was friendly and helped make the game more enjoyable. Special thanks to Will, who helped us with the Island.

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We did the Island Escape room. It was so much fun! Our group consisted of my husband and I (we're the parents) and all three of our daughters and their husbands. Everyone had a blast and we all contributed to our successful escape. I would recommend Breakout Birmingham to everyone who wants to experience something truly unique and fun!

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We went with our four boys, ages 13-21, to celebrate a birthday. We did the Island Eacape and had a great adventure. It's hard to find something we all enjoy but this hit the mark! Our Game Master had perfect timing with her comments. We broke out with 9 minutes to spare. Hope to return for another adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: My husband and I brought our 9 and 6-year-old yesterday. It was our first visit, and we will definitely be back! Island Escape was perfect for them. They loved all the details in the room and unlocking all the locks. Thanks for a great Sunday with the family.

room_title: Escape room "303 Coulrophobia Ln." by Escape the Place in Orange County
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: So much fun!!!! Perfect for small or large groups of friends and family! We broke out of the museum heist and it really lets you feel like you are trying to save the art museum !!!highly recommend!!!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We had a blast! My wife and I went for our anniversary and we couldn’t have had a better experience. Our game master Will couldn’t have been any better. We will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Visited Breakout Birmingham tonight as a team building exercise with cohorts from a non-profit. We split into two groups and tackled two different rooms. My group was able to escape the Museum Heist room.The game master was very friendly and clearly explained how the game works. We were allowed three clues if you get stuck but we only used two. I was impressed with the design of the room and the variety of puzzles to solve.Our group had a blast and thrilled we were able break out. Definitely a must-do for friends or team building groups.

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Did the Museum Heist today. Crew full of Breakout rookies. Had a blast! Will definitely be back to try the other rooms! Thanks Breakout Birmingham.Oh yeah, we broke out! 44:52!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Museum Heist was well designed with a proper game flow without being too linear. That's "roomer" speak for, it was totes rad. Definitely, one of the better rooms we've done and we've done a few. The staff was great and very welcoming. Our game master (Caitlin) was awesome. Quite impressed with this place. I plan on visiting Birmingham again simply to try more rooms. This gets the Patrick and Amber seal of approval.

room_title: Escape room "The Kitchen Nightmare" by Unity Escape Rooms in Pomona
review: This room was super fun and well-done. The hosts were great, and it was a well put- together and unique room. Would definitely go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Museum" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: None

room_title: Escape room "CSI: Modesto" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: So fun! I went with my stores management team and we tried the CSI room. It's a hard room, but full of surprises!

room_title: Escape room "CSI: Modesto" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: Tons of fun!!!  We had adults and teenagers...each age group had its own unique strengths to help solve the clues!  Fun for all ages. Absolutely recommend this for anyone who loves a challenge!!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "CSI: Modesto" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: Awesome! We had a group of 11 girls in the CSI room (the hardest room) and had a blast. Interesting, challenging and super fun. We did not escape but we're close!

room_title: Escape room "Ark of the Covenant" by Cinema Escape Rooms in Orange County
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Toys and Tragedy" by Clues and Gumshoes in San Francisco
review: So close, we almost made it within the hour!My friends and I did the "Toys and Tragedy" room. We loved our host, William! It seems like he's super passionate about telling stories. I love creepy story rooms like this because it gives a good thrill. Since all of us have different ways of thinking, we were able to help each other by being creative and finding different solutions. It was a great experience overall and definitely evoked our emotions, creativity, and curiosity!

room_title: Escape room "Toys and Tragedy" by Clues and Gumshoes in San Francisco
review: This place was really fun. Me and my friends came and did the Toys and Tragedy room. This room was tricky enough to get the mind working and we were be able to still have fun doing all the tasks. This place does not aim to profit off of the customers and will actually let you finish the room even after the time limit because they want you to experience the fun of completing the room. Brian, the owner, is such a nice guy and easy to talk to. Would definitely   go again!!

room_title: Escape room "Toys and Tragedy" by Clues and Gumshoes in San Francisco
review: I came here with a group of friends to give this place a try and we had a blast!  There were 4 rooms with different themes but we chose the "Toys and Tragedy" one. You are given 1 hour to solve all the puzzles and unlock of the keys to escape the room.  The room was sufficiently challenging but solvable especially if you utilize the 3 hints wisely!Brian is a really nice person who showed us around.  He seem to enjoy what he does and he really supports his local community!I highly recommend this place for those who are in the Berkeley area who want to hang out or do a fun activity with their friends/family!

room_title: Escape room "Yin & Yang" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Seriously loved the experience and yes...the staff was amazing!!! Didn't think such a good time could exist so close to home!!!

room_title: Escape room "Yin & Yang" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: This was our first time ever trying an escape room. We had a great time. We definitely will be coming back again.

room_title: Escape room "Yin & Yang" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Took my husband here for his birthday, we were joined by my moms. We enjoyed it so much that we went back the same day to try another room. Really fun and great way to work as a team. The owner was friendly and I would recommend this place for any occasion or just something to do. Even if you’re not really a puzzle person this is still a lot of fun. We will be back to play again soon. 😊

room_title: Escape room "Pillow Palace" by Open Door Escape Games in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Best group activity I've done......ever? Best bang for your buck - everyone in the group agreed

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This place is awesome! Came with a few friends and we had a blast. Totally worth the money for the experience you're getting

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Definitely a place to go! Must have experience! Great way to spend quality and memorable times with your friends! Love this place! Can't wait to come back ~

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the Jungle Game maze. It was difficult and so much fun. Our game hostess was really friendly. Awesome experience.

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loved every minute of it! Don't think twice book it! We played the Jungle Room. Great experience using problem solving skills, math, logic, and reasoning. We can't wait to go back again.

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Just my wife and I played but we escaped the Jungle Room and loved it! We own an escape room in another state and would definitely recommend Maze Room.

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had so much fun! Great staff, the room was more fun than we even expected. We're already planning to go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Jungle Game" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was a great escape room! We have played a lot of them and the Jungle room was very impressive. It was hard to see and hear in there but otherwise it was great! If you haven't played an escape room do yourself a favor and go and if you have played other escape rooms, this one will not disappoint.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: So, Antidote was my first escape room, not just in Escapology, but EVER. I have almost never had so much fun! We had to do the next two rooms right then and there, and spent the rest of the afternoon having a blast.The staff was courteous, the scenarios and equipment-use creative, and our Game Master seemed to be having as much fun as we were.I can't say enough great things about our experience at Escapology!!!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: The employees were so nice and interactive while we waited. Offering us water multiple times. The Budapest room was hard but so much fun! Would definitely recommend! Can't wait to come back and do another.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: As an escape room player, I have played well over 100 games. During my trip to San Diego, this was one of my favorite escape rooms. The attention to detail and immersion was outstanding. More importantly, the staff here delivers some of the best customer service in the industry. The games are great and the puzzles are clearly tied to the theme. If you are a beginner, novice, or expert, this is the place to go for your escape room adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: We had an incredibly fun time. First time that we'd tried something like this and I surprised my bf for his bday by taking him to do the Budapest Express. The game master was helpful and we can't wait to go back and try the other storylines.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: We had a great time and the staff is 100% amazing!!! We did the train scene and it was a blast!!! What a great way to spend my brothers birthday! We love you Javi!!! Let's do this again!!! I wish they had a kid's themed room though!!! That would be so much fun with Dominic!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: First time playing and we had a blast!! Started out with Antidote and game master Augustus was extremely helpful to my group of rookies. We loved his sense of humor and his desire to see us succeed. We enjoyed him and the game so much that we immediately signed up to do Budapest Express. Having just completed Antidote we knew exactly what was necessary to tackle Budapest and we executed our plan flawlessly. We finished that escape with 9 minutes to spare. The "who done it" feel of Budapest was very exciting. I would recommend this to all of my friends and family.

room_title: Escape room "Alien Zoo" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: Great rooms...challenging and creative. Host are in character...adds to the enjoyment.

room_title: Escape room "Alien Zoo" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: The kids are always excited when we do one of their escape rooms. The latest alien zoo was are favorite. We have even brought the grandparents along with another visit. Staff is fun and always in character. We have one last room to try and then we can say we have done them all. But have not successfully completed one. We can only hope one day we can manage our own way out.

room_title: Escape room "Alien Zoo" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: So impressed! We've done other escape rooms and the Alien Zoo at EscapeOut was SUCH a welcome surprise! The staff was outstanding - excellent characters, costumes, and interaction (I was a little creeped out, in a good way!), and the puzzles were so challenging, yet the entire experience was appropriate for kids as well. Can't wait to support this place again!

room_title: Escape room "The Menagerie" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: This review is about two weeks overdue. I can't thank the folks at Level Games enough for helping me pull off a fun 300th escape room surprise for my best friend. They were amazing and very accommodating. I had a plan set in motion to help my friend celebrate his 300th Escape Room and they helped me store the cake and balloons in their party room until after we exited the room. They even decorated the room by writing Happy 300th on their wall. For the room itself, we did The Menagerie. When I tell you that we had a blast, it doesn't even begin to describe it. The room was so well designed and there were lots of things to do for the 8 people in the room. I usually don't like larger groups in general for a room but this was a special occasion and it did NOT disappoint for one minute. We were thoroughly entertained throughout its entirety. I can't wait to see what else Level Games has in store because this room was great! Thank you again for the amazing hospitality!

room_title: Escape room "The Menagerie" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: Played "The Menagerie" when it FIRST opened expecting a clunky "beta" but were pleasantly surprised at how complete and solid it was. Out the gate, this game was amazing. You can tell these people put their heart and souls into these games because of the attention to detail. My girlfriend is such a scaredy-cat and screamed multiple times at inanimate stationary object, which made it that much more exciting. We also played the Doggy Dog and Disrupted Decades rooms in the past and left with big smiles. All REALLY well done and super fun. Will be back if they release new stuff.

room_title: Escape room "The Menagerie" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: Escaped from the new Menagerie Room at Level Games. It is a great experience developed by the creative minds and hands of the designers and owners of Arcane and Escape Chronicles.  All the puzzles and set pieces demonstrate the skilled craftsmanship of Arcane's wooden and mechanical wonders coupled with the originality and innovative puzzle flow that is a hallmark of Escape Chronicles.  This room was more of a cabinet of curiosities than a menagerie, with beautiful and intricate showcases that are interesting to look at and challenging to fully comprehend. There are some thrilling and unsettling moments provided by good production, sound and light effects, and most importantly a sense of timing and pacing that a certain evil genius would be proud of.  This room is a must-do!

room_title: Escape room "Infection" by Unity Escape Rooms in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "DEA" by Suite 201 Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had a really good experience here tonight with my family of 5 and my brother included.  My children tagged along ages, 8,9, and 15 and it was very family friendly in the DEA room.  They were easily contacted via phone and easily booked the room online.

room_title: Escape room "DEA" by Suite 201 Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: SUCH A GREAT TIME! We had such a fun time doing this escape room. It was a Saturday when we went and we did the DEA room and loved every minute. This escape room has you so immersed, you feel like a real agent haha! You actually feel at one point that you're it's real life. The owner is so personable, professional and so cool. He answers all your questions and explains everything very thoroughly. Definitely will be coming back to do some of the other rooms. We found this place on Groupon and it was absolutely worth it.Thank you for a great Saturday night!

room_title: Escape room "DEA" by Suite 201 Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This has to be one of the greatest escape rooms I've done so far! I have done over 20 rooms and this one ranges on my top 10! very fun room, gets you thinking and also has a ton of puzzles I've never seen or done before. well done.

room_title: Escape room "Burned Out" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This is a seriously fun game for corporate groups. Big enough to fit a larger crowed, with plenty of puzzles for everyone to solve. The humor in the room is a great touch.

room_title: Escape room "Burned Out" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: *I am an internationally experienced Escape Room enthusiast with hundreds of rooms under my belt*Good staff, good location, original themes. Most, if not all, puzzles are unique in their origin and execution. For first timers or enthusiasts looking for a fun, silly theme, play LIT. For those looking for a small-group challenge, play Inventor's Secret. Larger groups will want to play Burned Out. I particularly enjoyed the mini-escape room that they offered in their lobby. This was only the second instance of that idea that I've found in Arizona and I wish more locations offered it as an intro and lobby time-killer.

room_title: Escape room "Burned Out" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: I love this place! I came here twice with my parents and friends to play Lit and Burned Out. Everyone in my group really loved it, even my parents who were unsure what it was or if they'd enjoy it. The puzzles make sense, unlike a lot of other rooms I've played. And the themes of the rooms are more unique than anything I've seen and super entertaining and funny! I'm definitely coming back to play Inventors Secret soon. Also shout out to the staff for being the best :)

room_title: Escape room "Burned Out" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Just played Burned Out and it was a very fun, challenging room! Love the theme and the puzzles are original with a touch of humor throughout. I also appreciated the variety of puzzle styles! This room was a good size and can fit a larger group which was nice.

room_title: Escape room "Sulley’s Sinking Ship" by Escape Zone Oxford in Oxford (AL)
review: My 13 year old daughter went and left smiling. She had fun and was challenged. Good team building exercise.

room_title: Escape room "The Abyss" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Abyss is so much fun! It's very tech related and the puzzles aren't like the other puzzles in other rooms. You have to really think what you would have to do in that situation. Also, the simulations are really cool. You feel that you are truly going under water, because the capsule moves slightly to give you that feel. If you are very claustrophobic I'd advise against this room, as the space is kind of small. Not extremely small, spacious enough for 2 people to move around, but not a lot. Very fun maze room. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Abyss" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Girlfriend I did 'The Abyss' room. The maze was perfect for us being new to escape rooms. It got our brains spinning quite a bit but looking back at it, it wasn't as difficult as it should have been for us. It was good for beginners. Definitely a fun time and left us wanting to come back to try the other rooms out

room_title: Escape room "The Abyss" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I attempted this room with my boyfriend recently when we found out that this opened because we had been wanting to do a room with just us 2 to see how much better we have gotten at escape rooms. This room was immersive, but that's every maze room escape room. It was pretty linear, considering how the room was only designed for 2 people to play. The only issue I had with this room was that there were a few technical issues with the room, such as things opening when they shouldn't, and other parts not working properly. I imagine they probably fixed it now, but those were some issues we had when we were playing this room. We still managed to escape with a few minutes to spare, although I imagine we would have escaped much quicker if we didn't have all those technical difficulties that threw us off.

room_title: Escape room "Party in Vegas" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Challenging puzzles and immersive experience! Did the Vegas room and it was lots of fun! I would definitely want to try the insane asylum next.

room_title: Escape room "Party in Vegas" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Our family went to the Las Vegas escape room and we had such a good time. We managed to get out in 50 minutes. Well worth it. The event coordinator was welcoming and funny. Coming back for the asylum room next time we are in town.

room_title: Escape room "Party in Vegas" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Had such a great time. This was my 3rd time going to an escape room in general and this was my favorite so far. We did the Hangover room and had a great time! I can't wait to go back and try the asylum next time.

room_title: Escape room "Party in Vegas" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: If you are a beginner in escape room world, I will definitely suggest to start with this room. It is fun and an easier room to escape, even here we had to ask for a couple clues, thankfully we got out on time. Next time we will go back to try the Asylum room. Good location and pretty assistance working at the front desk.

room_title: Escape room "Party in Vegas" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Came for my 9th and 10th escape room! My friend and I tried both the Asylum and Party in Vegas rooms. They are still pretty new so the tech worked very well. It's not so much of search and find like some other rooms. This is strictly puzzles and solving riddles. Party in Vegas was so much FUN!!! It was a nice pace of change compared to other serious rooms. The decor was great and highly immersive. But I would say it's one of the easier escape rooms. We only had three people and escaped in 53 mins.

room_title: Escape room "CSI: Conway" by Escape Mystery Rooms in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Firewall" by Breach Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Went with my husband for a mini date night. We did the Firewall Escape Room, just us two and it was perfect.This escape room is definitely family friendly and was not scary as some other Escape rooms out there & definitely a good challenge.Needless to say, I recommend it and will be coming back with some of our friends to do the other room!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Autopsy" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: Our family had a blast! We did the Zombie Autopsy. It was perfect - not too creepy. Our teenagers liked it. The two young girls working that night were awesome and very helpful. We'll be back for the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Autopsy" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: I took my two 12-year-old grandchildren in the Zombie Autopsy Room. We almost escaped! It was awesome! We will do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Autopsy" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: I can't say enough about this awesome place! First of all, they were actually closed on the day we wanted to do it but the owner opened it up just for us! It was my son's 18th birthday and we wanted to do something different- this was definitely the right choice! We had a blast! There were 6 of us, and we did the Zombie Room - it was really tough, but we did it! In 51 minutes! KUDOS to Gulf Coast Escape Room for a very cool experience that we will never forget!!

room_title: Escape room "Nightmare Hotel" by Fort Smith Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Zen Room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: In terms of aesthetics, this is probably my favorite room ever! I just love how white everything is. I went with a group of 4 and this room was extremely fun, perfect for beginners. We escaped without asking for a single hint. Highly production value, great for beginners, would highly recommend for anyone who wants something on the easier side.

room_title: Escape room "Zen Room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did the Zen room on Friday night with 3 friends and we really enjoyed it. We didn't think that this room was super difficult but for beginners, it would be a good start. The whole production of the room was really cool, and the room was non-linear so one thing necessarily didn't lead to another. We came late at night so parking wasn't an issue. The workers here are super nice and helpful. I'd come back to try their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Zen Room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This room brought peace and serenity and also frustration and urgency! It was a different kind of room and using all elements were fun and tactical. I loved every aspect of it from the moment I walked in to the moment we escaped. We did this room the day before my birthday and BOY this was a great gift to play. Come with a peaceful mind set.. don't struggle to think too hard..everything you need to know to solve a puzzle is in the room.

room_title: Escape room "Zen Room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My husband and I escaped the new Zen Room in 47 minutes and we were very impressed! This room is definitely surreal and dreamlike in nature. I would say it's more of an adventure game than solving puzzles and opening locks. I love how the room tells a complete story from beginning to end, which adds a sense of accomplishment.

room_title: Escape room "Zen Room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We entered the Zen room with great anticipation of getting out before the hour expired. It took a bunch of teamwork, trial and error and goofiness.In 36:49 we exited with a solid nod to Rose who helped us only three times.Go here and do your best!

room_title: Escape room "Zen Room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Was great fun! We went with a group and we all enjoyed it and participated in figuring out the clues. Will come back again!

room_title: Escape room "Sanatorium" by Escape Anchorage in Anchorage
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the 7th Stone" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Had the pleasure of doing The Legend Of The 7th Stone and it was amazing!  Really one of the best escape rooms I have had the pleasure of experiencing.  Everything was top notch from the immersive theme to the helpful and energetic staff.  We made it out with a little more than 14 minutes to spare.  I honestly cannot wait to come back and try Great Outdoors!  Thanks for an amazing time!

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the 7th Stone" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This is a great place to go for all ages! I've done 2 of their rooms with my 8 year old son and both were challenging but FUN! We did The Principal's Office and The Legend of the 7th Stone. If you have kids hen you have to book the whole room but the flat rate to book it as a private room is reasonable. The staff has always been kind and friendly. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the 7th Stone" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Ohhhhyaaaasss

room_title: Escape room "V.I.P.E.R's Nest" by Break Through Sac in Sacramento
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: By far the best escape rooms we’ve ever done. The production value is unreal. We did the psych ward and the fun house, both well worth the money.

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: THE BEST! After doing the Psych Ward yesterday I can totally see why they have 5 Stars. We did a family event that my brother had gotten us for a Xmas present and we had a total blast. The "orderly" that helps you totally stays in part through out the whole game and gently assists you when you get stuck which allows you to move along. So many different puzzles and clues and it keeps you on your toes. We are looking forward to going back and doing the Hex Room next. We totally enjoyed ourselves. It's also great for team building and we are thinking of coming here for a company event.

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: This place is great!!! There are 2 escape rooms and a new game called the Psych Ward. Our family has done the hex room escape game twice, and last night took a crack at the Psych ward which creates 2 teams, 1 of the sane and 1 of the insane, and puts them together to collect points and try to win against the other teams. The customer service is hands down great, and everyone sticks to the character so well. The games are some of the most tricky and integrated I've played yet. The atmosphere is just fun!! Honestly if you want to have fun this is place to go.

room_title: Escape room "Space Sector" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: My friends and I did the space sector room last weekend, we had an amazing experience! The room had some pretty interactive puzzles and the props were perfect. Can't wait to try Crematory next!

room_title: Escape room "Space Sector" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: Very fun. Fantastic way to celebrate my son's birthday as a family. We solved Space Sector in 45 minutes. Whoop whoop!

room_title: Escape room "Space Sector" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: We had so much fun today escaping our room! Our family did the Space Sector and it was very challenging. We have done other escape rooms at different locations and this was our favorite! We can't wait to try another room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Space Sector" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: I’ve been here twice and have enjoyed both times! I did The Crematory first and Space Sector second. Space Sector was easier, in my opinion, and I was with only 4 other people in my group. We passed it with just seconds left which was really exciting! The rooms were super fun and would recommend Space Sector if it’s your very first time doing an escape room and don’t really know what to expect. What I love most about this place is how nice and friendly the owners are. They’re super chill and will make you want to go back! Definitely go here if you’re looking for something exciting to do.

room_title: Escape room "The Millionaire's Loft" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
review: We had such a great time doing the millionaires loft here!  We have done escape rooms in multiple cities around the US and this was one of the best!  The staff made us feel so welcome and made sure we had a great time!  The room was very unique and challenging and we were able to finish it with only a minute to spare. We used a couple hints and they were well thought out giving just enough to point us in the right direction but not just giving away free information. I recommend this place to anyone that enjoys an hour of great family friendly fun!  We will definitely be back to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Millionaire's Loft" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
review: Had a great experience at the Escape House Mesa! Did the Millionaire's Lounge and escaped with 8 minutes left! The staff was AWESOME!! I highly recommend escaping or trying to escape from their rooms!! We had a blast and are looking forward to escaping their other rooms soon!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Millionaire's Loft" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
review: We had a great anniversary at Escape House Mesa. One of the owners, Adam, was our gamemaster, and he showed us a super time. (Thanks, Adam!) We did "The Millionaire's Loft" and had a blast! Adam gave us just the right amount of help when needed. We escaped with 38 seconds left. We had such fun, we signed up for "The Detective's Office" immediately afterward. We can't wait to do "Flood the City". I would say that this business is a "must-do" escape room experience for newbies and experienced pros alike. If you like puzzles, you will like Escape House Mesa.

room_title: Escape room "The Warden's Ruse" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We had a great time! Staff is awesome! One of the better escape rooms I've been to for sure. Our group has been twice and will be back again!

room_title: Escape room "The Warden's Ruse" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Very well thought out rooms. Challenging but very fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Warden's Ruse" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This place was awesome. Even though we failed miserably the staff walked us through the steps as if we would have succeeded.. which was much more fun than going home feeling defeated!! The room we did "the Warden's Ruse" had a lot more high tech features than the escape rooms I've done in the past. 10/10 would recommend to others!!

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Throne" by Escape Eureka in Eureka
review: Had an amazing time doing the The Quest for the Throne escape room. The room was pretty challenging; our group of 6 didn't quite make it in one hour. It was super fun and I'd love to go back and try their other room options!

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Throne" by Escape Eureka in Eureka
review: Amazing! The owner(s) are so incredibly nice and helpful! We did Quest for the Throne and it was so much fun! We are doing DaVinci’s Office next week!

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Throne" by Escape Eureka in Eureka
review: Highly recommend! It was so much fun. My friends and I tried the Throne room, all the puzzles were very well thought out and some of them definitely took some time to think through. We will definitely be back to try the other room and hope that more rooms will open up in the future.

room_title: Escape room "The Villian's Lair" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Very unique! It was lots of fun and definitely challenged our minds. Can't wait for other rooms to be done!

room_title: Escape room "The Villian's Lair" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Very pleased with the experience I had at The Exit Game. It's definitely innovative, fun, and going to be the latest trend for game centers. I definitely recommend visiting The Exit Game, make sure you book in advance!!

room_title: Escape room "The Villian's Lair" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: I played mission 2 with friends and it was just the right mix of challenge for us to finish it with only a couple of mins left on the clock!

room_title: Escape room "The Villian's Lair" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Amazing venue to explore and challenge your brain with friends. Definitely exceeded my expectations with their puzzles! Who knew something like this existed in the SGV. Something I would highly recommend trying. Not to mention the owner is amazing and great to work with.

room_title: Escape room "The Villian's Lair" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Their Villain's Lair room was amazing! Technology like I haven't seen in most other rooms. Really unique and fun puzzles. Really great quality, time, effort, thought and love went into making these rooms. Total immersion and true teamwork required! I am looking forward to checking out their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Villian's Lair" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Very well constructed puzzles and challenges, lots of varieties, and allow different people with different skills to solve. Definitely worth trying all the challenges because they are all different! Mechanical, physical, logical, mathematical, deceptional, sequential, tag-team-working ones, all the classic room-escape genre puzzles are there! The best part is they listen to the people's responses and improves on their puzzles. Love this team of builders and designers!

room_title: Escape room "The Villian's Lair" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Their Villain's Lair room was amazing! Technology like I haven't seen in most other rooms. Really unique and fun puzzles. Really great quality, time, effort, thought and love went into making these rooms. Total immersion and true teamwork required! I am looking forward to checking out their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Informant" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: Fun room! We did the Informant room which had a fun spy theme. I enjoyed the atmosphere and the way they tied hints and emergency stuff into the story of the room so it kept the story alive. Very fun place, and one of my favorite staff interactions! The owner was very friendly and talked to us about games and other escape rooms. I can’t wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Informant" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: We had a great time with our group of 4! The challenge was intense, from start to finish. Definitely recommend this experience to others!

room_title: Escape room "The Informant" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: Had a amazing time! The kids loved Edwin and staff, we will be telling everyone to go there! Thank you so much for making Natasha's 16th birthday a hit! They didn't stop talking about all night and then woke up talking about it.See you in may

room_title: Escape room "Voices" by Twisted Exit in Lancaster (CA)
review: We had a great time in the Voices room. It's nice having fun places like this in the AV. I recommend the experience and will go back to try other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Voices" by Twisted Exit in Lancaster (CA)
review: Did the Voices room and it was a blast! Will definitely be going back again!

room_title: Escape room "The Mayfield Manor" by Unlocked Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Coolest thing ever! We had so much fun with all of our family of 11 doing the Mansion room! All we can say is communication is key!

room_title: Escape room "The Mayfield Manor" by Unlocked Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We escaped! This was my first experience and we had a larger group so we did the Mayfield Manor room (up to 14 people). Great puzzles and amazing owners who explained everything and were incredibly patient. I highly recommend this place and will definitely be back!! Thanks you guys!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Mayfield Manor" by Unlocked Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Unlocked Escape Rooms is so much fun!! Me and my awesome team passed with like 30 seconds to spare! Haha highly recommended!! Such a great team building activity!

room_title: Escape room "The Mad Rapper" by Scenario Escape Room in Orange County
review: I've played close to 100 escape rooms and Scenario Escape Room is a MUST GO. I'm all about this room- The Mad Rapper...the graffiti artwork, the music, the games, the hip hop themed room - all of it made this room hella FUN. I felt the games were different from other rooms we played which made it really unique. Not to give away too much, but there's this one room where you play a game that reminds me of one of those carni games. Loved it!!  My son who's 11 enjoyed the room and he was super helpful. If you're in SoCal, you gotta go to Scenario Escape Room and play The Mad Rapper.

room_title: Escape room "The Theft" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Would recommend if you have kids or novice players. Avoid if you have escape room connoisseurs. 5/5 for room design - it sets the mood for a break in. 1/5 puzzle difficulty - most of the puzzles were ultra easy to figure out. I could be that I'm a little more experienced and should have opted for a more challenging room. (We were out in less than 20 minutes, so understandably, I didn't feel like we received our money's worth).

room_title: Escape room "The Theft" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Nice backstory and immersive room. A mix of modern and unique traditional puzzles that fit the theme nicely. Good room for newbies. I highly recommend any of the Lock Down rooms. The staff was friendly and very accommodating with the booking process. The game master was tracking our progress carefully and gave hints promptly.

room_title: Escape room "The Theft" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Escaped the Theft room with my family on 5-14-17 (with 3 seconds to spare). We had an absolute blast! The escape room was challenging (which is the point) and so well created. The staff was fantastic. It was a thoroughly enjoyable time. We will definitely be back to conquer another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Theft" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Five of us members of the same family had a ball figuring out how to get out of The Theft with little time to spare! Thinking seriously about doing it again in another room. Definitely recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "The Theft" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Had a great time, almost broke a record in the theft room, great service, and all around fantastic experience! I've already convinced my closest friends to try it out!

room_title: Escape room "The Theft" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We had a great time doing the Thief room but got stuck a few times. We did end up figuring it out in the end and beating the time but only with a lot of help. Overall it was a great experience but the North Valley Escape Room in Anthem is so far the best we've been too.

room_title: Escape room "The Theft" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Did the Theft room and we loved it!! Can't wait to try the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: Really fun with a group of people. You are locked in a room and have to use the clues and riddles given to you in order to escape. I enjoyed it and you will too.

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: My daughter and I had a great time at this place.  We had so much fun solving the riddles that we went back and did another room.  We really enjoyed working with the other people to figure out the riddles and unlock the clues.  It was really fun and interesting.

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We went to the new location (and newly renamed) Puzzle Effect and found the same Top Notch customer service as the original location. The manager, Marian, who was also our gamemaster, was super nice and welcoming. We did the Pipe Works, which turned out to be a good, solid escape room. This room could be divided into 2 teams racing against each other, or as we did it, one team. This was a fun room, run by a fun staff. Marian was a great gamemaster, and she knew exactly when we needed nudges and help. (Thx, Marian!) We highly recommend this location to beginners and experienced gamers alike.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Cannot wait to be open!!! Yeeee

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Super game! Top hosts. Highly recommend it to everyone visiting LA. Fun fun fun

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: I loved it. Can't wait to go back my team and I had a fantastic time.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: This game brought out all my competitive side!!! I had so much fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: These rooms are the most fun you'll ever have, they can't make them fast enough!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Our second visit, we played both of the new rooms, and enjoyed them both immensely! Very tough, especially the zombie room, but also really clever and well thought out. I love these rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Such a great experience, we've been twice (bunker and zombie) and can't wait to go again! The rooms have great production quality, a wide variety of clues, and are interactive so the whole group can participate and enjoy. The theming is great and the staff is friendly and helpful. The zombie room was harder than the bunker, so I'd suggest starting with the bunker or asking the staff which room to book if you haven't played before. They're very helpful and will help you find a room that's a good fit for your group.

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Black Knight" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Having done all of EscapeX's other rooms we were very excited to try out their new room, The Curse of the Black Knight.As with all their other rooms, they did not disappoint with the amount of detail and storytelling that is intricately and meticulously built into the rooms.  We were able to escape but the puzzles were definitely challenging and keep you on your toes.The tech in this room was fantastic and seamless, anytime something would be completed or unlocked the transitions were seamless and very well designed.Our game master, Anthony, did a fantastic job setting the stage and environment for the room.  That is the one thing I've always truly enjoyed about EscapeX is the effort they put not only in their rooms but the stories and introductions.Fantastic job as always, we can't wait for your next new room in the future!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Black Knight" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This place is amazing! I tried the Mafia Heist room months ago, and had a blast. However, today I had the pleasure to help beta test the new Curse of the Black Knight room, and it exceeded every expectation I had. The attention to detail not only with the puzzles but also the immersion and decor was outstanding, and my friends and I felt a real sense of accomplishment after finishing each puzzle. Watch your step, keep your eyes open, and prepare for an adventure, because the rooms here pack a serious punch!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Black Knight" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've done all the rooms from this company including the games at their previous location, and I've gotta say, they have really improved over the years.  Their newest game, the Cursed Knight is a perfect example of something new and innovative while still being approachable by newer player.  Definitely check this escape room out.

room_title: Escape room "Arcade" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: Definitely one of the best and most memorable escape rooms in the SD area. A mix of really good set design and fun, interesting puzzles made it an unforgettable experience.

room_title: Escape room "Arcade" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: This was a really fun escape room once we were there. The puzzles were great and creative and it was good for a big group. May not be ideal for someone with mobility challenges. Very fun time all the kids loved it. The booking was complicated as no one could really answer questions. I booked for a teen party. Things weren't transmitted from the booking to the facility. A little frustrating but the puzzles were great.

room_title: Escape room "Arcade" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: Came to this place after searching which had the highest ratings around town and I'm so glad I came to this place! I came here with 5 of my friends for some fun, and boy did we find it. The building is quietly tucked away in Sorrento Valley and pretty easy to get to. Upon arrival, we were very happily greeted by Zoe and her partner in crime. They gave us the full disclosure and all of the info we needed to fully enter the room we were going to escape from. We had an hour like most folks and that was just enough time for the 6 of us to find our way through the various puzzles (with several hints from the awesome duo up front). Highly recommend the arcade room while they still have it!

room_title: Escape room "Arcade" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: Arcade is a very tricky room but loads of fun.

room_title: Escape room "Cold War Bunker" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: We saved the world! Lol great time in the cold war bunker ... Amazing staff! Luca was awesome! We can't wait to rob the bank! What an adrenaline rush!

room_title: Escape room "Cold War Bunker" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Loved This! Great series of puzzles and good use of the space to tie the whole room together. Really enjoyed the Bunker and will return for the Bank Vault. Really enjoyed having Noah for the hints. He was able to provide just enough of a push in the right direction. Can't wait for the next visit! Also, extremely easy to get to and find.

room_title: Escape room "Cold War Bunker" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Very rarely do I leave reviews for places, but my experience here last weekend absolutely justifies one. I had a chance to try to escape the Cold War Bunker, and quite simply it was one of the most fun things I have ever done. The staff are incredibly friendly, the rooms are built and themed like mini soundstages, and the puzzles are genuinely difficult, but not impossible. It all adds to an awesome hour of puzzle solving and team building. I paid $33 to spend an hour frustrated and failing, and I can't wait to go back for more. If you derive any sort of joy from problem solving and working a riddle over and over until you finally solve it, you NEED to check this place out.RoomEscape LA, I will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Cold War Bunker" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: My group did both rooms, and BOTH are so perfect. The exact level of difficulty and ingenuity that you want in an escape room.We liked the bunker more -- escaped with ten minutes to go. It was impeccably decorated and had a good mix of logic and physical challenges. The bank was also so fun -- the flashlights were a good touch, and this room had a great multi-section layout. Escaped with ZERO seconds left on the clock!! Challenging but not undoable!

room_title: Escape room "Cold War Bunker" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: I've never tried anything like this. I'm not the least bit into video games but this was one of the coolest experience I've had in recent weeks. Just go with an open mind and be ready to think. My team did the cold war bunker. Allegedly, that's the easier of the two rooms, but we certainly found it challenging! One hour went by way too fast! The cool thing about doing this, is that for one hour you are completely immersed in what's going on around you. No phone or outside distraction competing for your attention. I thought of nothing but the task at hand the entire time we were locked in there and it was a very nice change of pace. The crew there is fabulous! Jo is so sweet and gave a nice little pep talk before you enter the bunker. Listen to what she says - she gives a few helpful hints that you're likely to forget once the action starts. I had a slight problem signing up online but she was more than helpful and took care of everything right away. Looking forward to going back and trying the bank vault!

room_title: Escape room "Cold War Bunker" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: I've watched a lot of James Bond movies, and I've always asked myself "I wonder if I can do what he does" - Now I know I can.I got together with a group of friends and did the Bunker. It was one of the best exhibitions of teamwork I had ever seen. We each had different positions, 1 person was a scribe, another would organize clues and process them, another would focus on the puzzles, one person was the leader making executive decisions, another person was constantly scouting the room for things others missed or things that changed in the room etc. We all had a lot of fun, and each person contributed something that helped us get to the next level, it wasn't just 1 person solving everything. Believe me when I say, every single position matters. Irene was a great host. (I think that was her name). She had a great sense of humor, and even joked with us when we we're doing something wrong. As the last 10 minutes hit the clock things got intense with the last puzzle. Finally we solved it, and saved the world! You're welcome.

room_title: Escape room "Flood The City" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
review: We played the room "flood the city" - it was very difficult! However we had the best time! It was a clean room, an intriguing and it kept us engaged the entire time. Brian helped us out with three clues and was great in setting the stage for the story! We'll definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Flood The City" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
review: This was our first experience with an escape room and we had the most amazing time!  We decided to go as a family for my daughter's 16th birthday and we let her choose the room. She chose Flood the City because she said it sounded the most "interesting."  After booking the room, we realized it was also the most difficult, but we decided we were up for the challenge.  The staff here was also great!  Since we were newbies, he spent some time letting us know how it works and then went on to tell us the back story of our game. We were to discover the clues to unlock our door and to save the city from being flooded.  We were allowed 3 hints during our hour game, which we did use.  There were five of us and the game was definitely difficult but we escaped with only minutes to spare.  So much fun and we can't wait to return and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Flood The City" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
review: Thank you Ryan for making our experience a great one. This was our family's 2nd time at Escape House Mesa, we did Flood the City and had a great time. Thanks again!

room_title: Escape room "Cartman's Escape Room" by Escape the Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Devin our games master was great... had a blast doing the South Park room that we stayed to do clock tower too... can’t wait to go back an do the other 2 rooms... great job escape the room la...

room_title: Escape room "Cartman's Escape Room" by Escape the Room LA in Los Angeles
review: My wife and I experienced the South Park and Jurassic-themed rooms, both of which had incredible production value. While we agreed that Cartman's room had the more interesting puzzles, both games were top notch. Staff was friendly, hints were helpful and plentiful, and we will likely return to experiences their two other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Prison" by Escape Folsom in Sacramento
review: My group and I had a blast doing the prison escape. Puzzles were challenging but not impossibly difficult. Next time we'll eat and drink there too!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Prison" by Escape Folsom in Sacramento
review: We came to do the prison escape room and it was so much fun! Arrived early enough to enjoy some drinks and then dived into our game!The manager Philip was also great and super accommodating. Would definitely return to try and solve another room!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Prison" by Escape Folsom in Sacramento
review: We were not able to escape the prison but had such a blast. The service was great and the food was good. This place rocks!

room_title: Escape room "Foster's Fortune" by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: We did the beautiful Foster's Fortune room today. We found out some highly interesting information about Arkansas leading up to the room and then began the "most challenging" room in the Mansion. There was a LOT to do in the room, and that's about all I can say without giving away too much information. At the end, we didn't quite finish in time but we were allowed to go slightly over the allotted 60 minutes and complete it. I recommend definitely giving this place a try if you want a fun way to work your brain for an hour!

room_title: Escape room "Foster's Fortune" by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: I went with a group to celebrate a birthday and it was so fun! We did the Foster Fortune room and it had tons of challenging riddles and clues that eventually led us to find hidden and "illegal" coins as well as the key to escape! A moderator watched on camera and gently nudged us in the right direction when we were struggling with the riddle or locks. My team finished in 1 hour and 2 minutes, the best time yet!

room_title: Escape room "Foster's Fortune" by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: We did the Foster's Fortune room. You don't have to be a genius to have fun at this! Definitely a group exercise. Great staff very friendly! would absolutely do again!

room_title: Escape room "Foster's Fortune" by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: Foster's fortune was really hard and the theme was intriguing and the setting was immersive. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Dracula" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I loved *other* 60Out rooms, but didn't enjoy this one even though we escaped. This was my 36th room I've escaped, and a lot of the puzzles didn't seem super logical. So when you find two components of a puzzle, it's not clear that they go together, let alone how to use them. We were a bit disappointed that the game masters gave us hints that we didn't ask for, but they were just trying to make sure we maintain a good pace in order to escape the room.

room_title: Escape room "Dracula" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We played the Dracula room and Chris was an amazing escape room runner! Very attentive and fun! I highly recommend booking here. Chris will show you a really fun time!

room_title: Escape room "Dracula" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had an amazing time getting to preview Dracula’s room before it opened. It was the first experience for everyone in our group and WE LOVED IT! The staff is also super great.

room_title: Escape room "Dracula" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The Dracula room was great. It's  definitely on the hard side as the room has great puzzles that involve every aspect of the room. Gamemaster Valerie was very helpful. She gave us hints when we needed it. Overall we had a great time.

room_title: Escape room "Dracula" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: One of my favorite 60OUT locations! We've done Grandma's Masterplan, Dracula, and Alice in Wonderland! All rooms are fantastic and the puzzles make you think in a different and new way. Of course, the sets are always amazing and it is a big part of the appeal. Love it when I get fully immersed in the theme!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret at Whitmore Estate" by Breaking Point Escape Rooms in Pomona
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Witch's Cauldron" by Quest Tavern Escape Room in Pomona
review: The witch theme escape room was fun. The game host did a great job with setting the mood of the theme. Their were a good mixture of different types of puzzles. Can't wait to try the next escape room when it comes out.

room_title: Escape room "The Witch's Cauldron" by Quest Tavern Escape Room in Pomona
review: We did the witch's cauldron. We had 6. I feel that was an appropriate team size for the room. It was fun. We escaped. We have done many escapes and we needed some hints. Don't be afraid to ask for hints. Jordan was our host. He was friendly and told a great story. Thanks for an awesome time!

room_title: Escape room "Chronostopia" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: So much mechanical and magnetic work, best escape room I've done yet! Did chronostopia and didn't escape but definitely want to come back and try inception lol

room_title: Escape room "Chronostopia" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We had a great time. This was our first escape room experience and It was a really fun. We did Chronostopia room. It was very well decorated will decent amount of technology we will definitely come back and look forward to the next time!!!

room_title: Escape room "Chronostopia" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Hi I came here on weekend and did Chronostopia room. It was amazing and rewarding. We enjoyed it. Recommend wearing comfortable clothes. No cell phones or anything it all stays in a locker. Very fun though definitely recommend on a hot day!

room_title: Escape room "The Royal Suite" by Escape This in Hesperia
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: I have done 21 one escape rooms with my fiance! We love them; we came here and played The Theater room, which was fun, and a little challenging. We recently came back to do OutBreak, which we knew was the hardest room, but this room is specifically meant as a money grab room, which I have played a few rooms like this, elsewhere; before! What I mean by that is the room is designed so you don't make it out, and they take your $100 bucks that is costed you to book it! There is a difference between challenging and just making it so hard that you spend the whole time on one set of puzzles starting at screens which hurt your eyes! I thought the concept of the room was awesome but the way the room was laid out, game wise was not good at all! This room in my opinion needs to be reworked; I will not becoming back here again, and I will not be doing another escape room in general, for a long time as this room left me with a very bad, and annoyed feeling, of being taken advantage of money wise! I can no longer recommend this place to anyone that I know or that asks me!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: There were 7 of us and we needed everyone! Wasn't easy at all but with the clues we made it thru! Will definitely be going back to try the other rooms. It is kinda pricey so it would be for another special occasion. The people working there were GREAT!!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: Staff was so beyond sweet & welcoming. Went for part of my fiancé's 21st birthday. We did the Outbreak room. It was honestly pretty challenging! Staff said that's their hardest room. We didn't finish the whole room in time but we only had two steps left before we could've won so I think we did pretty well!! Overall we had a great time & we are excited to do the other two rooms soon!! We found a 50% off coupon online so definitely look for coupons or sign up for emails for them to send you coupons every now & then!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: We did a team build event here and it was so much fun. Most of the group had never done one before and we managed to save the world from a virus in the Outbreak room and escaped in about 55 minutes. This is new to the Chandler Mall (right by BJ's Brewery and where Cold Stone Creamery used to be). Super clean and really nice inside. Our host was super nice too. The staff was very friendly. I'm definitely going back with a group of friends.

room_title: Escape room "Jigsaw" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
