review: Employees are nice although room felt like it was more of a matter of finding numbers not puzzle solving and teamwork

room_title: Escape room "Jigsaw" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: The room was great they really challenged you in this jigsaw escape. 4 rooms, the first room ,my group, found the most difficult because we over thought it;however, the other 3 rooms were great you must work together

room_title: Escape room "Jigsaw" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: My friends and I decided to try the Jigsaw themed escape room here, after work today. It was fun and challenging. It definitely requires everyone working together to get through all the clues. There were four rooms connected, and some were more challenging than others. Although we didn't make it out (just needed like 3 more minutes),  we all had a blast . I'd definitely recommend this, especially if you want to try something different.

room_title: Escape room "Jigsaw" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: Best escape game I've played in the Bakersfield area. This is a fun multi-room live escape game. It is well decorated. There is more "stuff" than you need to solve the puzzles, but it adds to the feel of the room. There is both searching and puzzles. It's a bit like a home haunt and an escape room had a baby. I recommend playing if you are in the Bakersfield area. The owners seem quite nice and passionate about the escape game industry.

room_title: Escape room "Jigsaw" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: The staff is always very polite, and there are always just enough nudges in the right direction to feasibly escape in the nick of time. That being said, these are still some of the most challenging (and well decorated) rooms in town.

room_title: Escape room "Mad Lab" by Extreme Escape Redding in Redding
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Camelot" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: We went as a big group and had a blast doing the Camelot room! Samuel was helpful and very friendly! It’s a fun time for big groups. I recommend everybody to go and try it out.

room_title: Escape room "Camelot" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: We did the Camelot room. It was fun and very cleverly done. We ran out of time butt it was our first time. We didn’t realize that some steps had multiple steps. We were trying not to use hints. We finally used one... we got to the last step. I will say that it would have been better to say...10 steps, and spend less than 6 minutes per step. That budgeting would have helped...then, if we got stuck after 4 minutes, then use a hint. So, we want to go back and try that logic next time.

room_title: Escape room "Camelot" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: We tried the Camelot Room on a recent Friday evening (along with my youngest son’s college roommate). We called and reserved the room in advance.The 2 staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. After paying and signing waivers, we were shown a short video explaining the “Do’s & Dont’s” and how to use the iPad.They have lockers where you store your cell phones (& other items if you choose), as they do not allow phones in the rooms.This escape room does not use interactive game masters that we were used to. Instead, your hints are delivered by scanning QR codes around the room with the iPad. When you use the hints, it deducts from your time. There is also a bell in the room that you can ring at any time to have a game master come in and help if needed.We found the Camelot room to be challenging, but not to the point that it was frustrating. It wasn’t easy, but it also wasn’t so hard that it was unsolvable. The theme, layout, and props were all thought out very well.Without using any hints, we did escape with a couple of minutes to spare. Although I must admit, had it not been for our kids, my wife and I probably would’ve struggled a little more to make it out in time.After you escape, they take a group photo, which they post to their Facebook page.Overall, we had a great experience and will definitely try one of the other rooms next time!The only negative thing I can say (and it’s not that big of a deal) is that their sign and parking area were not very well lit and we actually passed the place when we first drove by.

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: Had a great time as we worked to escape the Classroom. Definitely recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: What a great experience we had doing the Classroom at Locked In! It was challenging, unique and tons of fun! We had a blast and got out with 2 minutes to spare! The staff members were friendly and welcoming! Highly recommended for a night out!

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: We went this past Saturday to celebrate my birthday that was on Monday. We did the classroom (the one with the least success rate) and to my surprise, we made it out with 5:25 left! We had an awesome time and can't wait to try the other rooms! So glad we went and tried it!

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: Had a great time as we worked to escape 'the Classroom.' Definitely recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Detention Bay" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Masquerade Manor" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was my first experience with escape rooms, and I couldn't have asked for a better introduction! I brought a group here yesterday for my birthday party and we ALL had a blast! The staff was wonderful, funny and incredibly sweet. We are definitely coming back for the Sherlock room!

room_title: Escape room "Masquerade Manor" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We decided to stop in on our honeymoon and check out Exodus. On the drive over we were nervous and not sure what to expect. When we arrived we signed our waiver and we're lurched up in our room. With teamwork and focusing on each others strengths we were able to escape with just 5 mins to spare. We had an incredible time and are definitely coming back to visit and try the other rooms! Thank you for making our honeymoon unique and unforgettable!

room_title: Escape room "Masquerade Manor" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: So much fun!!! Don't wait! Even if you don't solve it you'll have a great trying!

room_title: Escape room "Masquerade Manor" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This is a fun venue and it was a perfect birthday event for my husband. The staff is great. Can't wait to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Masquerade Manor" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The puzzles were challenging and the atmosphere was fine but the decor was a bit bland for the story. The price was good though.

room_title: Escape room "Masquerade Manor" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Took a party of ten to the Masquerade! So hard and soooo much fun! Everyone said they would love to go back and try their other rooms...totally great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Captain’s Quarters" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: My husband and I took four 13-year-olds for a birthday activity and we had so much fun in the pirate themed room! It was challenging and it was great seeing the kids put their heads together. This was our first time doing anything like this and we are looking forward to trying another one soon! Thanks for making our day special!

room_title: Escape room "Captain’s Quarters" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: We had fun! We escaped the pirates in 58 minutes and 30 seconds. Yay for us! Rooms were small however challenging.

room_title: Escape room "Captain’s Quarters" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: This was so fun! The staff of as helpful and friendly! We did the Pirate room and escaped. An hour well spent! It's not easy so go with your smartest friends. You need to be creative and clever.

room_title: Escape room "Captain’s Quarters" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: I will definitely be back to play the other rooms! Such a great night! The staff was fabulous and the room was challenging!

room_title: Escape room "Captain’s Quarters" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: This place was great! The staff was awesome, the room was difficult but oodles of fun, and it made the perfect date night for my boyfriend and I! We will definitely be returning next time we're in the area to try our luck again!

room_title: Escape room "The Murder Mystery" by Pacifica Escape Zone in San Francisco
review: Super fun! My husband and I have probably done 25+ escape rooms both in the Bay and in other states and countries. (You would think we're really good at them, but no we just enjoy them .) We did the Mystery Room and didn't escape in time (got out in just over an hour). The host was really attentive (he wasn't in the room, but I guess from the monitors he could tell when we were struggling) and asked if we wanted clues at just the right times. He was super nice and friendly too and is why I give this place five stars instead of the four I would probably give just for the room itself.Storyline and theme was just okay, but it was still an overall good time. Would recommend this for a fun little date, the room is doable by two people.

room_title: Escape room "The Murder Mystery" by Pacifica Escape Zone in San Francisco
review: I did the murder room with a group of my friends.  We worked out butts off to figure out the puzzles and beat the room with 1 minute and 30 seconds left before the hour expired.  The room as challenging but totally doable.  Keep yourself organized and have fun!  Great way to build team spirit and have a fun group date.  Best tip is to embrace the experience, lose yourself in the game and you'll have a great time.The PEZ crew was very helpful and the rooms were very well done.5/5 would recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Murder Mystery" by Pacifica Escape Zone in San Francisco
review: A fun way to spend time with a small group of friends or colleagues, solving a murder! Get a diverse group of buddies and each can work on a different clue or puzzle - we solved the "crime" and escaped with only a few moments to spare. If you're looking for a team building exercise - look no further.

room_title: Escape room "The Expedition" by Fort Smith Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: We had some much fun and an awesome experience! We did the expedition room and it was a tough but totally fun experience!

room_title: Escape room "John Smith's Speakeasy" by Escape Room 13 in Eureka Springs
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: This was my first Breakout experience. We booked The Kidnapping. Lot's of fun and I'm looking forward to returning.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Had a great time escaping the kidnapping room for a friend's birthday party. Will definitely be back to do the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: So much fun! By far one of the best ways to have a good time in the area. The staff was so sweet and the place is really clean. We did the kidnapping with 2 adults and 2 kids (a teen and tween). They had a blast and I can't wait to go back for the other rooms. This would be a great place to take a group for a birthday celebration too!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: It was so much fun. We did the kid napping and Katie (thank god we had her) was so patient with us. But we escaped on our first time doing it. Thank you so much for a memorable experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Best escape room I've ever done. We did the Kidnapping room and we loved all the variety of clues and puzzles. Best escape room by far and I've done 10+ different rooms in different cities.

room_title: Escape room "Escape From Alcatraz" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: This place is amazing! All the puzzles/challenges really fit the Alcatraz theme and the environment is very realistic. A group of 4 (old friends in mid 30s) did this at the weekend. We played the Escape from Alcatraz Escape and LOVED every minute. So much that we booked the Antique game right after and already planning to try the 3rd. Highly recommended and great fun...

room_title: Escape room "Escape From Alcatraz" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Great planning put into the Alcatraz room! I liked that there wasn't a ton of confusing and excess props used for staging because it's hard to find importance in each clue when only 4/25 matter! Also really liked the electronic aspect of it and the puzzle of thing popping open! Will definitely be back for more adventures with our groupon!

room_title: Escape room "Escape From Alcatraz" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Just Did the Escape from Alcatraz! We had a blast! I highly recommend doing it! The staff are super friendly and they make the adventure fun. This was a very unique and memorable experience and I am so glad a friend told me about Escape SF!

room_title: Escape room "Escape From Alcatraz" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: This was one of the best family excursions that we've had. We broke up into two groups and did Escape Alcatraz and the Antique Room. You really need to follow the clues and work together to get to the second phase. The staff was extremely friendly and readily available to give hints when stuck. What was nice was the offering of a cold drink since San Francisco was actually hot. We loved it and plan on going again . They are in the process of adding another room so we're ready!

room_title: Escape room "Escape From Alcatraz" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Came here with my dad, boyfriend and brother after trying an escape room in San Diego. We were unsuccessful at that place so we were determined to try and escape to one in SF. We tried the Alcatraz room and finished with 18 min left on the clock. Not going to spoil this with hints but all I can tell you is everyone needs to work together and also separately so you have adequate time to complete this. Its part physical and the rest mental. Most of the clues are right in front of you so don't sweat it and overthink too much. Think and act like a prisoner ;)

room_title: Escape room "Escape From Alcatraz" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: It was my first time playing the escape games so I didn't really know what to expect! I assume it was a Monk/ Sherlock Homes kinda game. The staff  were very nice & give very clear instructions. We did the Alcatraz one. We managed to escape with 3 mins & 26 seconds left to spare. It was challenging but fun at the same time. Literally THINK outside the BOX!! I highly recommend this game! I can't wait to play more of these escape games in the future. BIG TIP; make sure your teammates are smart. Seriously. The place kinda hard to find because it's not hella obvious where the location is at, but it's across the street from the 1 bus stop next to the sushi restaurant on the corner of Kerney & Sacramento Street.

room_title: Escape room "Escape From Alcatraz" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Something new and exciting to do with friends! We escaped from Alcatraz with our group of 5 and could not have had a better experience. The rules were clear and the game was well-designed and thought-provoking! We came out SOOO excited and talked about it for days! It will animate you! Give it a try!Close to a ton of restaurants and bars to re-hash your escape techniques over cocktails. We can't wait to come back and do the Antique Room!

room_title: Escape room "Night Bandit Treasure" by Fairhope Escape Rooms in Mobile
review: We visited the Fairhope Escape room with a family group of people with ages between 9 and 78 years. Everybody had a great time playing the Night Bandit Pirate treasure hunt. We will be back next time we are in the area!

room_title: Escape room "FBI Academy" by Great Escape Mystery Rooms in Fort Smith
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Bunker" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: I loved it, it was 5 of us, it was supposed to only be me and my boyfriend at first, but I'm glad we went with Friends Because had it of just been me and him I doubt that we would have even be able to make it as far as we did. We had a blast and although my group wasn't able to make it out in time, we still wanna try the other room on our next trip.

room_title: Escape room "Bunker" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Went tonight and loved it. I did The Bunker, going back to try Asylum. Great idea. It kept me thinking from the time I started. I'd definitely recommend going with 3 or 4 people. I went with one other person and we ran out of time, but we still had a great time. It's a must try. Also, it was a laid back environment. The person working there was really cool.

room_title: Escape room "Bunker" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: First time here it was a awesome experience. Can't wait to try a different room.

room_title: Escape room "Bunker" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Great group experience for working as a team, flexing your mental muscle, and staying on your feet hunting for new clues! Our group beat The Bunker with only 3 seconds left and no hints, definitely love the pressure to make it out and looking forward to trying the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Bunker" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: It was our first time and we got hooked! It's a very exciting experience. This validated how well me and my best friends work together. Teamwork is a big deal! It really gets your mind going and once you figure things out, it's such a great feeling. Be able to get out before time runs out and you'll feel like you're on top of the world! Definitely a must do!

room_title: Escape room "Bunker" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: This was truly a fun and unique experience. I purchased 4 tickets through Groupon for the Bunker Room. I made a reservation through their website and shortly after I received an email confirmation. We really had no idea what to expect. As you may already know, you get locked in a themed room for an hour and you have to try and escape by overcoming a number of different physical and mental challenges. It's an experience like no other. My entire group had a really great time and we are looking forward to experiencing the Insane Asylum.  They like to have 6 people per session so if your party is less then 6 you may get paired up with people you don't know. They also don't serve food or alcohol so get your drink on before you come.

room_title: Escape room "Bunker" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Experienced "The Bunker" with my cousins and sister and we had a BLAST!  It really challenges your logic skills and forces you to exercise teamwork - LOVED IT!Parking can get pretty challenging.  Luckily, we reserved a later time slot so parking wasn't bad, but, I would suggest arriving early, to lock up a parking spot.Susie was a great hostess!  My team (Team Adobo) and I only needed ONE hint to escape and Susie was on the other end of the walkie-talkie ready to help us without giving away too much.  Made the experience more satisfying for us to be able to get through it mostly on our own...

room_title: Escape room "Lola in Space" by Reason in San Francisco
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Raven's Eye" by Alaska Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: Great job on the story and clues Seriously.. choose this place.  The multiple rooms made this an even better experience.  The staff was extremely helpful and supportive.

room_title: Escape room "Raven's Eye" by Alaska Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: I went with my family and a couple of friends, so there were 8 of us.  We all had a great time.  The whole thing was a ton of fun.  The multiple rooms, the different types of puzzles, the theme/story - was all incredible.  Most of us had never done an escape room before, so it was an excellent first experience.  Immediately upon completing the game everyone was ready to book another game.  We will definitely be back when the new room opens!

room_title: Escape room "Raven's Eye" by Alaska Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: I went to the escape room with 5 other friends to celebrate school getting out and we had a blast going through the Raven’s Eye! Graham was really nice and accommodating and made the whole experience super relaxing for us first-timers. I’d definitely recommend to anyone with an hour to kill who’s looking for a good time :)

room_title: Escape room "Raven's Eye" by Alaska Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: This was my first escape room experience and it was exciting. Went with my coworkers for a night out and had a blast solving puzzles together. The story line worked well with each room we unlocked. The owner/creator helped to make this a rewarding experience and we were able to save the girl! Definitely recommend to anyone who is curious, great for parties/events!

room_title: Escape room "Raven's Eye" by Alaska Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: Had such a great time at the Alaska Escape Rooms with my coworkers. Definitely recommend this experience to all.

room_title: Escape room "Raven's Eye" by Alaska Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: This was super fun and challenging. A great way to spend a night out with your friends!

room_title: Escape room "Raven's Eye" by Alaska Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: This was a great time! The puzzles were challenging and it was a lot of fun! This was our first escape room experience and now we’re hooked!

room_title: Escape room "Raven's Eye" by Alaska Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: We had such a fun time! We're so glad that Graeme and his family decided to create this amazing adventure. If you like games and you're in Anchorage, be sure to take the time to go over and play.

room_title: Escape room "Raven's Eye" by Alaska Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: We went to the Alaska Escape Rooms as a team building excercise for work. We had so much fun, and really enjoyed the experience. Graeme, the owner, game master, etc, was super helpful and really contributed to a successful afternoon. I would definitely recommend this for anyone looking to test their wits and have fun doing it.

room_title: Escape room "The Apartment" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: I absolutely enjoyed doing The Apartment! We got out in 57 minutes.

room_title: Escape room "The Apartment" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: The Apartment was amazing! We didn't make it out but had a great time solving puzzles and looking for clues. The staff was amazing and friendly. Would recommend d as a must try to anyone and everyone! Had a blast.

room_title: Escape room "The Apartment" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: We had a great time in the Apartment! This was our 4th escape room and it was the most difficult one we’ve done. It's a fun night out where you actually have to think and figure out clues as a team! The crew there were awesome, very welcoming and gave us a tour after of how it all works. Check it out!

room_title: Escape room "The Apartment" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: Took my son and two of his friends to the escape room for his birthday in September. They chose 'The Apartment'. Even though they didn't escape, they had a lot of fun. I can highly recommend this, it is well thought out and challenging.

room_title: Escape room "The Apartment" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: My wife took me here for my birthday and we had an absolute blast. Even though we didn't manage to escape the apartment, but for our first time in an escape room, we almost made it out with no clues. Will be going again.

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: Me and my husband did this for the first time together! We decided to do it for a date night as something fun and different from the regular dinner and movie! We were not disappointed! We had such a blast! We did Jail Break and cannot wait to bring family and friends to enjoy and try the other rooms

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: One word: Amazing. I thought I would be able to escape the Jail room quickly, since I love crime novels and tv shows. Wow, what a great challenge!Working with your partners and unraveling clues definitely makes time fly! It's great for all ages, however the crawl spaces were a bit hard to climb into. The clues weren't too frustrating and we had a great laugh afterwards!

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: It was awsome!! We made it out with 10 seconds left. The jail break was so realistic and hard but so so fun!! Can't wait to do another one

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: Our group has done many escape rooms at a couple of places around the valley and this was BY FAR MY FAVORITE one. It kept everyone so busy and no one was standing around without a task. We also loved Diego. Definitely worth it. So much fun! We will definitely be coming back to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: It was so fun and amazing! My group and I had an amazing time! We did the jailbreak room and it lives up to its reputation of difficulty. We solved it but it took some teamwork! I recommend it to everyone, it was so fun! Can't wait to be back and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Grove" by Brain Busters Escape Rooms in Daleville
review: Wonderful staff. You can tell that everyone really loves their jobs. Super friendly and very professional. Great price for such a well done room. Will highly recommend anyone here. Team building days are amazing. The owners are wonderful people. Very helpful. I would give 10 stars if i could. I have played other places but for this price you cant beat them.. I would choose them over anyone else in the wiregrass area. I will be back.

room_title: Escape room "The Grove" by Brain Busters Escape Rooms in Daleville
review: We where Driving by And seen the SIgn Glad we Stopped. The Staff was Nice and the Place is inside  A Magic Shop too!  The Price was Cheaper than Expected for the Room. We Failed to get out in 60min but the owner let us Play out the Game and 8 mins later We left the Room. It was Fun and all the Props and  Games Looked Build by the Owner but all Was FUn to Solve.it is upstairs that's the ONLY bad  Part about this Place. We will be Back to Play the Other Rooms for sure

room_title: Escape room "The Trap" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Awesome place! Very clean. Awesome staff. Would've liked more jump scares but other then that great place we'll definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "The Trap" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: When we entered Baffled Escape Room we were greeted by friendly staff who encouraged us to check out the array of costume hats that we could wear during our escape room experience. So awesome if you really want to get into character. We had the honor of having Daniel as our clue master during "The Trap". He was super helpful and made our experience awesome! We will be back to try out the other rooms soon.

room_title: Escape room "The Trap" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Came here for my Birthday with family and did 'The Trap' room. Had an amazing time and we were able to escape with 18 minutes to spare. Vince was super helpful and we definitely be back to try the other rooms

room_title: Escape room "The Trap" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: It was my first escape room challenge, but some friends joined in with previous experience. We had a blast... We needed some helpful hints to get through. Several different thought processes were needed to make the escape and enough to ensure everyone was able to play a part in our group success. We were able to make it with 10 minutes to spare. That's 50 minutes of searching, thinking and playing through scenarios. The teen that wanted nothing to do with it ended up having a blast. We are ready for the next challenge! Thank you Vince!

room_title: Escape room "The Trap" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: My friends and I had a fantastic time playing the Trap room. At first, the room doesn't look like there is enough going on to keep us busy for a whole hour. But as you start playing, you find out that the clues are complicated but fantastic and just the right amount of challenging.  We had a fantastic time and the staff was great.  I would definitely do it again.

room_title: Escape room "The Raft VR" by Two Bit Circus in Los Angeles
review: Amazing concept!

room_title: Escape room "The Raft VR" by Two Bit Circus in Los Angeles
review: Can't wait to experience! So excited

room_title: Escape room "MudButts Cafe" by Solve Who, LLC in San Diego
review: Last minute dare night choice and it was amazing!!!  We had an absolute blast!!!! You are given a starter story, taken through the crime scene, see the interrogation of suspects, comb through evidence, and try to figure out who dun it!!!  So much fun and things to keep you guessing!!! Can't wait to try the other room and see what else they come up with.........planning on expanding with two more areas!!!!  The guy running the "investigation" was really friendly and fun!!!!  Great job!!!!

room_title: Escape room "MudButts Cafe" by Solve Who, LLC in San Diego
review: This place is so freaking unique. The amount of work the owners have put into putting everything together is so visible. The creativity, effort, and hard work shows. The owners are also USN Veterans and I love supporting veteran entrepreneurs. The small business vibe is real and the passion is evident.As for the actual interaction. The crime scene is witty. I don't know anything about murder mystery but I do know that playing detective was super fun. The humor they add throughout the whole experience is a cherry on top. Take a date, a group of friends, or just do a meetup at Solve Who one of these days. You won't regret it! :) It's one of those activities that's really fun to do if you want to have an ice breaker too. It gets everyone working together and thinking collectively.

room_title: Escape room "MudButts Cafe" by Solve Who, LLC in San Diego
review: FUN FUN FUN!!!   Just go, you will not be disappointed.You don't have to be super puzzle solver guy/gal, anyone can join in.  Don't get me wrong, they can be challenging; the more effort you put it the more fun you'll have. You can play in groups or just one or two, personally I think the sweet spot is four people because there is a time limit.  My wife and I played and got though it just fine and it was fun from start to finish. The host (sorry forgot his name) is awesome, personable, professional and really created a unique and fun time.  The amount of detail and comedy is well thought out and everywhere you look.

room_title: Escape room "The Room of the Great Mysto" by Escape House Waterville in Orange Beach
review: My brother, 9-year-old niece and I went last Sunday to the Mysto Room. It was so much fun. We expected it to be a little over my niece's head, but she really enjoyed it and helped. That being said, we barely escaped... so it wasn't too easy either.

room_title: Escape room "The Room of the Great Mysto" by Escape House Waterville in Orange Beach
review: When I went in, I had experience with one other escape room, while my roomies had no experience. We went into Great Mysto, and while we got stuck and tried to power through, our Game Master gave us hints to move in the right direction. We escaped with a little over 2 minutes left, but it was enjoyable the entire way. We will be hitting the hurricane room....as soon as we get a bit more practice under our belt.

room_title: Escape room "The Room of the Great Mysto" by Escape House Waterville in Orange Beach
review: My family and I went to this escape house last night and absolutely loved it! We did the Mysto room and had an awesome time (mostly because we ended up escaping). Also, Cassidy did an amazing job and even stayed after to talk with us and answer all of our questions for an extra hour. She was so nice and made the experience even better than it already was. Would definitely recommend this escape house!

room_title: Escape room "Indiana and the Buried Key" by Unlock Escape Rooms in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works: For Three and the Solemn Few" by Puzzle Effect San Luis Obispo in Grover Beach
review: We had a family outing last weekend and decided to reserve a room (Pipe Works) at Puzzle Effect’s. This place did not disappoint! The staff was super friendly and helpful throughout the whole process; challenging yet obtainable. Highly recommend this place for groups looking to build teamwork or families looking to bond.

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works: For Three and the Solemn Few" by Puzzle Effect San Luis Obispo in Grover Beach
review: Had a great experience! We had 8 people in our group and we chose the Pipe Works escape room. The staff was friendly and the rooms were engaging.We’ll be back soon to try Curse of the Emerald Seas!

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works: For Three and the Solemn Few" by Puzzle Effect San Luis Obispo in Grover Beach
review: Our family split into 2 teams and competed against each other in the Pipe Works escape room. Had a blast and will definitely be back for a rematch!

room_title: Escape room "Speakeasy" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: It was the first time for me and my five friends, so we didn't really know what to expect but we were excited to try! We truly had a great time! First few minutes it was intimidating, then it became fun and exciting. Highly recommended! We escaped the Speakeasy with a little over a minute to spare and we'll be back to escape the Diner!

room_title: Escape room "Speakeasy" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: Well put together and well thought through. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Speakeasy" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: Great experience! We did Speakeasy and it was engaging, challenging and fun. Authentic items and interesting puzzles kept our entire team occupied every single minute. Definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Return of the Pharaohs" by Paragon Escape Games in Phoenix
review: I've been to several escape rooms now, & this is by far the BEST!  The atmosphere is amazing- it doesn't look "decorated" as much as it feels like you get transported into the experience!  Everyone in our group was constantly needed, to help/search/solve the entire time- and the 12 & 14 year old in our group figured out things that the adults couldn't!  This escape room was a BLAST, you don't want to miss it!

room_title: Escape room "Return of the Pharaohs" by Paragon Escape Games in Phoenix
review: You have not been to an escape room until you’ve tried Return of the Pharaohs! The room is incredible. I felt like I was in an Egyptian tomb. The puzzles all went along with the theme and the attention to detail will blow you away. I can’t wait till their other rooms are finished.

room_title: Escape room "Teddy’s Lab" by Escape Room 104 in Pine Bluff
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: Fun room! We escaped with money to spare. Having a live actor in the room added a fun twist - he was dressed in period costume, friendly, and we gave him money for clues. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: Best escape room I've been to, great experience, great actor a lot of fun and overall a great experience 10/10

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: This is absolutely unbelievable! This is one of the most sophisticated yet fun and exciting games the proprietors Joy and Jeremy are unbelievably great at what they do. This is an experience that we would recommend for anyone and everyone. We run a level five organization, and we've never seen anything like this. This is a must do for any company or any group.!

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: This was our first time doing an escape room, and we loved it. Took three children and they were highly involved. The puzzles were challenging, but doable. We didn't escape with the money, but we really enjoyed ourselves. I would recommend this room.

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: This is the most amazing room we have done, everything thing about it is so amazing, the fact that you actually have to go old school for this room is what gives it the 5 stars, If I could give a million I would, thank you so much for the fun experience and staying in character the whole time. Definitely will be back for future rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: This was a solid escape room. It is a small space, but it was efficiently used. The host stays in the room with you, but it wasn't awkward at all, and he stays in character the whole time which cracked our group up several times. There is a creative hint system where you can get a hint by bribing your host with stacks of cash you find in the room, but that will lower your winnings. Very fun night!

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: Great overall experience! Very unique environment you can't find anywhere else! The game master, who is your assistant, has awesome character and diction. The puzzles are so great and unique in its meaning. The game master explained the game afterwards and even makes it more interesting! Definitely recommend to anyone. Kid friendly and gives a great early 1900's vibe.

room_title: Escape room "Mob Accountant" by Felix Games in Los Angeles
review: The best escape room I've ever been to. I'm not sure what you're supposed to say about these kinds of things without giving much away, but if you choose to spend your time in this escape room you'll find it well worth it.Rather your average run-of-the-mill employee, those who work in this fine establishment role play the game perfectly and you will sincerely feel like you are in a high-stress, real-life situation rather than just a game.The puzzles were incredibly unique and nothing I had seen before, despite having done several escape games. If you're expecting to play an escape room game with a bunch of locks that ask for word or number combinations, be warned. Your brain will be stretched to the max in this game.

room_title: Escape room "The Mission" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Cannibal’s Den" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: We did the cannibal room and it was scary and so much fun! Our group worked together to find clues and help each other "escape" from the cannibal room. Everything looked so realistic and detailed. You'll have adrenaline pumping through you the entire time. There was a lot of effort out into production which ultimately helps it all seem realistic.

room_title: Escape room "Cannibal’s Den" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Cannibal room was a very fun and very immersive experience. The puzzles were challenging without being frustrating. I plan on returning for their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Cannibal’s Den" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Amazing escape room! We did the cannibal den and it was great! Ben did a great job at making us feel scared when we entered the escape room! Very great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Rowdy's Gold Claim" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: My friend and I did this as a birthday gift for her. It was our first time to do anything like this. We had a blast at Breakout Birmingham. We did the Museum Heist room. It was challenging and fun. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We had an awesome time at Breakout in Homewood. We were greeted with friendly service and everything was explained to us in depth. We all really enjoyed ourselves. Great family fun-filled outing.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Definitely fun times. We did the Mystery Mansion room and I had a blast. It was very good mental exercise, challenging. You definitely have to pay attention to detail here, but I feel like after doing one room I might be more prepared for the others. Worth checking out with a good group of friends.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: This was my first escape room. The Mystery Mansion was great!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Had a total blast! Our game master, Emma, was so cool and patient! We're already planning on going back and trying the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Would definitely come back and do it again! Great time had by all. Very good team building experience strengthening communication skills within the group as well.

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Super fun! Made you use your noggin and tested your ability to read between the lines, but wasn't so impossible that you didn't keep figuring things out til you were able to escape. Would definitely go back!

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My friend and I booked a room on a Wednesday afternoon! It was one of the best experiences that we have had in a while! It was so much fun, we can't wait to come back!!

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had a blast at this location!! Definitely challenges you and it was really cool working with strangers toward a common goal. The staff was helpful and nice. Would definitely recommend and will be making another visit!!

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Katie and I had a great time in the Amazing Escape Room...great times and lots of pics with friends... lots of laughs and tears...I would definitely do it again. You guys have to try it out at least once...we are going back

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This place is awesome!!! I was there yesterday, January 31st, and the place was really cool. Had a great time with my family and guess what? Hines Ward, Steelers Great, was there with his family. Double treat for me because I love Escape Rooms and am a lifelong Steelers fan! Never know who might be in your room with you when you go through.

room_title: Escape room "Roaring 20's" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: First time here on a date and we chose the Roaring 20's room with no idea what was to come. We had THE most amazing time! We made it to the last puzzle, but didn't get out in time. Now we are hooked and ended up staying to do the Desert Storm room. Very challenging but we made it out of this one with minutes to spare! So exciting and brain exercising, perfect place for a second or third date.

room_title: Escape room "Tomb of the Pharaoh" by Unity Escape Rooms in Pomona
review: My friend and I came to do Person of Interest but afterwards we asked if we could do the next two rooms and they were very accommodating. It was lots of fun because we got to meet the owner's parents and son who served as our Game Masters before the owner returned as our Game Master for the other two. As a person who grew up in a family business it was awesome to see dynamics like that still happen. The Tomb of the Pharaoh was our favorite of the three so if you can only do one while you're here, do that one! Can't wait to try their new room opening up soon. Thanks UNITY for the amazing customer service and for a fun night.

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Phoenix
review: Best Birthday party place I’ve found for my sons 9th birthday! I only had to worry about having a good time. Everyone had a blast! Thank you so much for working so hard to have us enjoy his day!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Phoenix
review: My family and I had a great time. The staff was very understanding and awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Phoenix
review: I took my daughter and three friends here for one of their escape rooms last night, and they had a great time. The Detention room was challenging, fun, and a great theme for kids (based on their words, since I didn't go in). Garret and Jesse were just amazing. I waited in the lobby while the girls were in the room, and between customers, the guys kept me company and then let the girls continue the room passed their time limit since no other customers were waiting. They were great with my group and from what I overheard, great with every other group. Super friendly and funny. They treat their customers like friends, which is perfect in that type of environment. Genuinely awesome guys, and even though I don't live in the area, I'll be returning just because of them.

room_title: Escape room "Captain's Quarters" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We did the "Captain's Quarters" and had an absolutely fantastic time. I took my son and his 5 of his 13-year-old friends. We did need to use all our clues and finished with 10 mins to spare. Kids had a great time and said, "best party ever". The staff were very friendly and professional. Thank you, Espace room Mesa.

room_title: Escape room "Captain's Quarters" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: The facility was clean and organized. We did the Captain's quarters. Staff was great. Puzzles were challenging. We scathed by without having to walk the plank. We had a great time.

room_title: Escape room "Captain's Quarters" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: So much fun!! Can't wait to go back!!! Escape Room Mesa had so many experiences to choose from. We ended up walking the plank in the Captains Quarters but had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Captain's Quarters" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Went for the first time today with three family members and this place is awesome! The staff are friendly, the puzzles were interesting and the ambiance very fun! We were able to have the Captian's Quarters room all to ourselves and we finished a minute ahead of the hour. After we were finished, the staff let us use props from the room to take pictures, and gave us souvenir rubber bracelets. Plus, when the staff heard it was my sister's birthday, he gave her a Happy Birthday rubber bracelet!

room_title: Escape room "The Dynaline Incident" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: We had so much fun solving Dynaline that we plan to come back when the sequell is ready (hint, hint) The puzzles were top notch and we were impressed with the hidden rooms, logic puzzles and the technical aspects were very well done.

room_title: Escape room "The Dynaline Incident" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: I did the Dynaline Incident and it was my first escape room. The room was very well put together with a lot of creative puzzles. We escaped with just a few minutes to spare and all had a blast! Look forward to doing another room at Quandary!

room_title: Escape room "The Dynaline Incident" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Had the opportunity to play the Dynaline Incident room. The room is awesome, it immediately makes you start thinking. Time starts and after each puzzle is solved, you will be excited for the next part of the game. I won't provide any more details other than you'll be pleasantly surprised throughout the entire game, and will definitely be challenged and must work as a team! Enjoy. Great room Quandary

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Of The Red Dragon" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Red Dragon- We booked this one in the next time slot right after we got out of The Office. This room is intense. It's not like any of the others they have. I had so much fun in this room. Was stuck on one of the first puzzles in the beginning but just remember everything that you need to solve the riddles is in the room with you, no matter how unimportant you may think it is. This room is also a higher tech room which utilizes more than just the typical lock and key. For sure one of my favorite escape rooms! We escaped with 3 minutes left!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Of The Red Dragon" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I've only experienced one other escape room, and this location definitely takes the cake! We were able to complete the Red Dragon room. Jeremy was an amazing host and made it an enjoyable experience.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Of The Red Dragon" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: A really fun experience! The two of us tried to solve the Mystery of the Red Dragon. We lost but got close. The design was top notch. I would strongly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Of The Red Dragon" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This is such a fun and interesting concept, and it allowed myself and my group to use our minds in other ways than we do in day-to-day life. We made it out of the "Mystery of the Red Dragon" room with just 1:15 to spare! It was an exciting experience and I will definitely be back to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Of The Red Dragon" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I went to this Escape room, and did the Red Dragon themed room. What a blast! We have booked another room, but I was unable to attend do to my dog being ill. Steve, not only was extremely apologetic to what was going on, but he honored my Groupon and set me up for another day! I have to say, that this is the best customer service I've ever received at ANY escape room! The rooms are fun, the challenges are there and the owner is a rockstar! Thank you Steve, for being so helpful. Customer service at its best, we will see you soon!

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Yes. It’s pricey. Yes. I’d pay double to do it again and again and AGAIN!!! It is beyond completely worth the price because of the thrill alone! You will NOT regret it! You’ll want to do them all!!

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Staff were excellent and professional, you could tell they cared about your experience. Facility and props were high quality. Would definitely go again.

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We went here with family as it was their first time doing anything of this sort and we loved it !! Every one at Breakout was very friendly and informative before our game started , i would defiantly recommend going to see them .

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: I just returned to Breakout again to try out their new room "Runaway Train". As always the staff is super friendly. The game master was non-intrusive but attentive and helpful when needed. Breakout's rooms are always fun and they seem happy to keep things as serious or light as an individual group wants. Runaway Train is a physically small room so 6 or 7 people is plenty. The decor is well suited for the room, and there are some cool puzzles to be had. This room is a little bit math heavy. Breakout remains the best escape experience in Birmingham!

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Our group did the Runaway Train escape room and it was by far the most exciting escape experience I have ever had. The room had a lot of super unique puzzles and challenges that I haven't seen before in any other room. Our game master Christian was extremely helpful and made the game go very smoothly the whole time! I would one hundred and ten percent recommend checking this out.

room_title: Escape room "Dash For The Cash!" by Escape Room Adventures in Henagar
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Quarantined Casino" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Toymaker" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: I have done both of the rooms by Escape Games Riverside. They are well thought out and extremely fun. I've done over 20 escape rooms and these are by far some of the better ones I've done. The pirate room is extremely challenging but the puzzles are fair and well thought out. The toy maker room is so much fun and is more hands on and tactile.

room_title: Escape room "The Toymaker" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: We did a lot of escape rooms, and this is one of the better ones - we did the Toy Maker room, and it had a lot of original/unique puzzles, which made it a really fun experience. The owners and game master were extremely nice as well!

room_title: Escape room "The Toymaker" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: This place is fantastic. We went to do the pirate room and ended coming back for the toy room. Both were great. Staff was fantastic and might be our favorite escape room we have done. Great experience overall.

room_title: Escape room "The Toymaker" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: We came in to do the pirate themed room and loved it so much we stayed and did the Toyshop too. Both rooms were amazing. Our group had a lot of fun, and our gamemaster was awesome. Creative puzzles! Can't wait until they open their next room!

room_title: Escape room "The Toymaker" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: I loved it! I took my son for his 16th birthday today. There were six of us. We did the toy room. I highly recommend this place. The owner was very nice. I will definitely go back.

room_title: Escape room "One Way Ticket" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the train escape room called One Way Ticket. It was really a ton of fun. It was the first room for all of us and we're planning on coming back to do the other room very soon.

room_title: Escape room "One Way Ticket" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Our gamemaster was amazing! She ran our room 'One Way Ticket' with subtlety and grace. The room itself is beautifully decorated and SO MUCH FUN! Really looking forward to trying out the other room at this location!

room_title: Escape room "One Way Ticket" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So much fun!Great entertainment. Wait us for the FBI room for sure! Thanks

room_title: Escape room "One Way Ticket" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had so much fun! Great staff, the room was more fun than we even expected. We're already planning to go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Last Supper" by Quest Tavern Escape Room in Pomona
review: Our family has been to about 80 escape rooms around the world.  The Last Supper was amazing.  The actor was great.  The clues were interesting (but not ridiculously impossible).  The clues were well designed and sequential, making it an excellent experience.

room_title: Escape room "Last Supper" by Quest Tavern Escape Room in Pomona
review: They have my new favorite game! It's been about 6 months since I last played a room. But I've done about 40 now in total. Both games were wonderful. Some seriously genius puzzles that fit the theme and made sense to be there, especially in the witch game. Their other game, The Last Supper, was the amazing! I'd consider it a a thriller/horror game. But the unexpected and best part to me was that I have never laughed so much while playing an escape room. Or maybe in the last few months of my life lol. They set up moments to make us laugh, or for us to make ourselves laugh. The actor was great, the story flowed perfectly. As well as continuously throughout, constantly developing to immerse us further and further. Timing of the puzzles allowed us to finish with only a few minutes to spare. My biggest wish is I want to get amnesia so I can just forget it and play it over and over haha. Thanks for the great evening!

room_title: Escape room "Last Supper" by Quest Tavern Escape Room in Pomona
review: I'm a huge enthusiast with escape rooms and let me say that quest tavern escape room didn't disappoint. Last supper was a phenomenal experience as it gave you the adventurous feeling in addition to that hint of fright and jump scares. They have a lot of different selections and I highly recommend for everyone that reads this to try it out.

room_title: Escape room "Last Supper" by Quest Tavern Escape Room in Pomona
review: The Last Supper is one of my favorites of all escape rooms I've done. I thought the puzzles were great and I loved the interactive nature of it. There were definitely a few jumps and scares. If I could I would go back and do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Last Supper" by Quest Tavern Escape Room in Pomona
review: Hands down the best escape room out there! We did the witch's cauldron a few weeks ago and loved it! We were told another scary room was opening soon so we decided to come back and give it a try! The last supper was the BEST room I've done so far. The actors are amazing and there is the right amount of scare to keep you on the edge of your seat (you'll know what I mean) but not soo much where you can't solve the puzzles. Definitely recommend 100%!!!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Manor" by The Prism Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did this room with 4 people (our other team did it with just 2). The theme is Mystery Manor. Half of our team was running late, and they were nice enough to delayed the game for us. The staff was really nice to us. The room is 3 stars, a-ok, but their customer service brought it up another star. The room wasn't really immersive, but it was definitely decorated nicely. I wish it was bigger and more puzzles though. They didn't have any tech puzzles, and more traditional lock and puzzles. I would like to see them change the room to have more hidden tech, but still keep the same theme.Looking forward to do their Virus Zero room next.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Manor" by The Prism Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The puzzles were very thought out. Some were a bit challenging, but overall had a blast with the whole family!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Manor" by The Prism Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The Mystery Manor was such a fun challenge for me and my friends! We escaped, but just barely! Our gamemaster, Tiffany, was very nice and helpful. We will definitely be back for their next room!

room_title: Escape room "Houdini’s Hideout" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did the Houdini Room (the smallest and most challenging room) and escaped with 1 minute left! It's a fairly low tech room (mostly just spin locks, and keys). The hint system was through walkie talkie and the GM was very attentive and helpful when we were stuck on some of the puzzles. There are no red herrings in this room, which is very useful so that you don't get stuck on something that isn't part of the game. Only negative thing is that there is no countdown in the room so you either have to ask, or just remember the time you started and time yourself on the clock. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We ended up parking outside in the metered parking. I believe it was $1.50 for 1 hour. We will be back for the other 2 rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Houdini’s Hideout" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did Houdini's Hideaway and it was a BLAST! Very challenging but not totally frustrating - kept having successes along the way. Very clever!  We'll be coming back next time we are in the area, for sure! Thanks, Jon!

room_title: Escape room "Houdini’s Hideout" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Just did their Houdini room and LOVED it! Even though it's their smallest room, it was super challenging. We are escape room veterans by now and we had to use all of our 3 hints, but we did escape with about 7 minutes to spare. I love that nothing in these rooms feels like a huge leap. Even when you get stuck and get a clue, you immediately go "Oh! How did I not get that?!" It's also great that in a small room, they have multiple things you can be solving or working on at once so that everyone is always occupied. And this time we got magic tricks AND we got to play with a dog in the lobby. Seriously, the staff here is the best. Definitely recommend! Can't wait to go back and do Bonnie and Clyde!

room_title: Escape room "Houdini’s Hideout" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My family and I decided to check this place out. This was our first time trying an escape room and this one just recently opened up fairly close by. The staff was amazing, very fun and informative. We tried out the Houdini room and beat it with seconds to spare. Overall it was a great experience and I'll definitely be going back to tackle the rest of the rooms they have available!

room_title: Escape room "The Temple" by Unity Escape Rooms in Redlands
review: Unity Escape Rooms was an amazing experience. My group did the Temple and it was unique, challenging, fun, and most importantly, made us uphold a sense of "unity." You have to work together to successfully conquer the rooms challenges. We are so excited to try the "Cabin in the Woods" and "Wizard" rooms. The owners are very creative and obviously at the top of their game. I have done other escape rooms and this one is definitely exceptional. Well played UER!

room_title: Escape room "The Toy Box" by ZScape Games in Livermore
review: None

room_title: Escape room "DaVinci's Secret" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We did the DaVinci room and it was a great experience. We thought the room could have been a little better decorated to give more of a moody feel to it. The clues were great and we liked that there were a few red herrings, it fit with the theme. We found the holy grail with 1:51 left on the clock.

room_title: Escape room "DaVinci's Secret" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: My daughter and her friends did The Da Vinci room for her 15th birthday. This room was great for teenagers who had never tried an escape room before. The staff at Baffled were extremely friendly and helpful. Our group was very pleased and we are happy we chose Baffled for her birthday!

room_title: Escape room "DaVinci's Secret" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This is our first time doing an escape room so we have nothing to compare it to, but our group of 5 had a blast in the DeVinci room. They have a very simple waiting area and small-ish room but it was great for the 5 of us and the puzzles/riddles were fun to solve. We got out of the room with 30 secs to spare. We'll definitely be back again!

room_title: Escape room "DaVinci's Secret" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: THE BEST WEEKEND EVER!!!! Did the Da Vinci room with my daughter (9) and her best friend and family to celebrate 1st Quarter report cards. It was extremely fun and worth every second!!! Age ranges in our group were 6-40 and it everyone was able to participate and contribute to opening the room. We will be back!!! Love our experience, the staff is awesome and friendly!!!!

room_title: Escape room "DaVinci's Secret" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: A very nice experience for an escape room. Vince was amazing, super friendly and helpful the entire way. We completed the DaVinci room and it is highly recommended. Puzzles are tricky. The 8-year-old in our group lost interest about 40 mins in, but the adults were engaged the entire time. Highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of Madame Lumina" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: Heck of a good time. This place has me hooked. You best believe I'll be heading up to all of these locations and attempting to further our win streak! Madam luminas was such a good time!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of Madame Lumina" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: I went with a group of 6 and did the fortune teller room. It was the most fun I've had in a while. I will definitely back to try other rooms in the future!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of Madame Lumina" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: We had a wonderful time! The curse of Madame Lamina was challenging! We will be going back!!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of Madame Lumina" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: We did this last night as a family and we had an amazing time. Our game keeper was great, kept the game going, let us know when we were totally off on a wrong direction. We had a teen and a child with us, and I they had an awesome time too (make sure to check the policy on bringing kids under 15). Everyone was able to be involved and it was a fun time. And luckily we escaped the Madame Lumina Room!! Would definitely love to do this again!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of Madame Lumina" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: It was our first escape room experience and as a group, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! We played with a group of six, which seemed about right for the Madame Lumina room-- any more, it may have been a bit too chaotic for me anyway. But with six players, there seemed to be enough to do to keep us busy and keep the excitement building in the room. The game maker/runner did a good job at keeping us moving along and not letting us get stuck in futile searches. Overall great time!

room_title: Escape room "Undercooked" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Had a great time.  We were a party of 5 and did the Uncooked game.  Person who checked us in explained everything clearly and answered all our questions.  At the end of game she went over how we did and explained some of the puzzles where were stuck on - eye opener!  lol  Everyone enjoyed themselves and would definitely go back and do it again.  Uncooked game was different from other escape room game types which was a nice surprise and change.  Instead of trying to beat the clock to get out of a room, you're fighting the clock to try to make as many recipes/dishes as possible - nice twist.  Good for all ages.

room_title: Escape room "Arctic Asylum" by Escape Room Ak in Fairbanks
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Queen Pin" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: The new room "Queen Pin" is very challenging but very fun. My 10-year-old was able to be a part of the team and helped out quite a bit. I really enjoyed the interaction with the staff and thought that the room was very well thought through. Great Job, Huntsville Escape Rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Queen Pin" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: We did the Queen Pin as our first room with Huntsville Escape Rooms, and it was fantastic! I've done 5 escape rooms now, and this one easily topped the list as my favorite. It was challenging and had some unexpected twists. We'll definitely be back to do the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Queen Pin" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Excellent staff. They were very friendly and made my birthday party feel very welcomed. Queen Pin rules and yes we escaped! Thank you Jamie and R for your wonderful hospitality and superior customer service. BEST BIRTHDAY EVER!

room_title: Escape room "The Queen Pin" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Queen pin was challenging, exciting, and unique. As self-proclaimed professionals, we highly recommend Huntsville Escape rooms! It was a fun atmosphere and the staff was great.

room_title: Escape room "The Queen Pin" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Queen Pin lived up to our expectations! Fun room with a variety of challenges to make you think. Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Sector 13" by Trapped! Escape Room Upland in Pomona
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Theatre" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: For 8 out of 10 people in my group, this was our first-ever Escape Room, and boy did we love it. We entered The Theatre (and escaped!), and it was such a blast, we wanted to do a second escape room immediately after completing the first. Definitely will be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Theatre" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Love this place! I've done The Theatre (which we escaped) and The Cavern (which we didn't). They were both so detailed and fun and accommodated our group of 10.

room_title: Escape room "The Theatre" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: This was a blast.My favorite part was our "guide". He was helpful without leading. Know that these puzzles are difficult but engaging and doable. So much fun. We'll be back.

room_title: Escape room "The Theatre" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: First time doing an Escape Room ever, and our group of 12 had the best time! We did the "Theatre" game and finished in 38 minutes, which we were told is really excellent. Communication is so important, so I'd recommend getting a group of people you know to fill that particular room -- trying to communicate well with strangers would've been much more challenging. We are looking forward to doing another one soon. Also, our "stage manager" (the room's host) helped make the experience fun. She had her poker face on during the game, but during our recap afterwards was personable, energetic, and had been so observant about the details of how we solved the riddles. RECOMMEND!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Revenge" by Exodus Escape Adventures in Sacramento
review: We were super impressed with Exodus Escape Adventures! It was our first escape room experience, and it was great family fun. The Pirate’s Revenge room was the perfect balance of challenge (we didn’t make it out in time) and fun (we still had so much fun). The lighting, the set, the props were all perfect fits to set the right atmosphere for a midnight adventure. Hope to come again soon!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Revenge" by Exodus Escape Adventures in Sacramento
review: This is our second time at this establishment and after doing over 50 rooms pirates revenge is one of our favorites. Not only was the set spectacular and immersive, the puzzles were challenging and our game master (forgot his name sorry!)was amazing. We will def be back for their new room in January!!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Revenge" by Exodus Escape Adventures in Sacramento
review: I've played well over 150 escape rooms and their Pirate themed room here is epic!!! You can't miss this amazing Pirate adventure. The set design here is phenomenal. You'll be experiencing an adventure in ways that other local escape rooms just don't offer. I brought my friend who had never played an escape room before, and he caught the bug and we can't wait until they open their new room so we can go back and check out what other amazing things they can create. Our game master was really fun and the backstory was very well themed too. A good time was had by all.

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage" by Train Escape in Birmingham
review: We've done many escape games and this is one of our favorites! We successfully completed Operation Sabotage. It was fun, surprising and challenging! It was clean and our host was very nice and helpful. One time, a key was shaken out of a lockbox and he reminded us 'you have to unlock the box to get the key,' so he was clearly watching what we were doing. (We weren't trying to cheat. Haha.) It was a great time and we will return to try another game!

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage" by Train Escape in Birmingham
review: Our group was there for a friends bachelor weekend and he wanted a unique escape room. Train Escape has their rooms in train cars and was great for what we were looking for. We had a group of 9 total. The couple at Train Escape managed to have us split into two groups and use both rooms. After talking with them, they told us about a third room they were opening that we would definitely try to come back for.

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage" by Train Escape in Birmingham
review: We had so much fun last night! We brought our kids and our niece and we came so close to breaking out of the Sabotage room. The owners were very friendly and made us feel right at home. Derrick even took extra time at the end to show our 4-year-old around the actual train. We are definitely coming back to do the other room!

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage" by Train Escape in Birmingham
review: My group of 4 absolutely loved Sabotage! It was somewhat linear while also leaving a lot of room for exploration of codes. The theme was awesome being smashed into a train car with everyone. It gave a real sense of urgency without having to do much to affect us mentally. There were enough red herrings to keep us going down a rabbit hole or two without overwhelming us with useless items and meaningless clues. It's so hard to gush about the room without giving away hints, but I'd say you'd be hard pressed to find something to dislike about Sabotage! Go try it!

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage" by Train Escape in Birmingham
review: Sabotage is an excellent room fun, challenging puzzles. The theming was well done and the story was fun, with a logical flow, and some very cool twists. The idea of an escape room in a train is original, and provides a great atmosphere, as the train element is thoroughly executed throughout the game. I recommend for beginners and enthusiasts alike, and I can't wait to go back to play the other room!

room_title: Escape room "The Virus" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: The production value in this spot was amazing! Definitely a challenging room, but having the actor in the space was great to keep us on point, without giving hints away. The VR experience was the first I had tried as well, and it really helped to add to the whole room.

room_title: Escape room "The Virus" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: Absolutely the coolest room I've ever done. LOVE THE OCULUS RIFT INTRO. Completely immersive. Felt like I was really a scientist out to save the world.....and my own life.We need more rooms as awesome as this one! Looking forward to the next one!

room_title: Escape room "The Virus" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: I've done a few escape room experiences, and this is BY FAR the best!  Well thought-out, clever puzzles, and great effects!  Not really a beginner's escape room... I recommend you try a few others around town and save the best (this one) for a very special occasion.  We did not make it out...but totally loved the whole experience from the moment we arrived until we left.  We had 6 of us. I wouldn't do it with less because there are so many tasks to complete.

room_title: Escape room "The Virus" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: WOW SERIOUSLY ONE OF THE BEST ROOMS, EVER! I can't wait for their upcoming submarine room. I would recommend booking max capacity since you'll be needing all the help. Our experience from beginning to end was fantastic. The production value, entertainment, puzzles, technology, and experience were all top-notch. It really doesn't get better than this. I cannot recommend The Virus enough.

room_title: Escape room "The Virus" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: From start to finish, this was an amazing experience.Once your group is together, you're no longer customers, you're "doctors," brought together to save the world from virus that's destroying the planet. The whole experience reinforces that-- the VR presentation does a wonderful job of making you feel like you're entering a secret government lab, deep in the bowels of the earth. The room itself was expertly decorated, and while you recognized that this wasn't *really* a multi-million dollar lab, it also didn't feel like something that was thrown together in a weekend to cash in on the escape room craze...

room_title: Escape room "The Virus" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: One freaking puzzle away! What an amazing time we had! It was soooo challenging and the puzzles were very thought out! Go do it!

room_title: Escape room "The Virus" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: Holy crap!!! I just experienced the most awesome, challenging, amazing escape room!!!! Congratulations to the creators, bob and Larry for creating such a fun experience!!! I cannot recommend it enough!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Escape Redding in Redding
review: Just did the prison break escape and it exceeded my exceptions by far! This was my first escape room and it was extremely fun. The workers were great and I look forward to doing the others soon!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Escape Redding in Redding
review: Wow. What a great place. I haven't had that much fun in a long time. I recommend the jail room, it is extreme! The staff is so nice and they explain everything in detail. I felt like I really was in prison. Very cool. I’d give 10 stars if I could.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Escape Redding in Redding
review: What a fabulous experience In Redding. None of our party had ever been to an escape room and we weren't sure what to expect, but the director put our minds at ease and gave us some fun hints for success. Our room was "Prison Break". The layout was so creative and accurate to how a jail might look. The director was in communication with hints which helped us through times we felt frozen. We actually got out with seconds to spare. Great price for a great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Island Escape" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Return of the Magician" by UNLOCKED: Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I've done quite a few escape rooms in the past (around 15), but UNLOCKED still manages to impress me with unique puzzles I haven't seen before. Some mechanics/tech of the rooms were pretty awesome, too. The rest of my group were first timers but they all thoroughly had a super fun time figuring out the puzzles. 60 minutes went by so quickly!

room_title: Escape room "The Return of the Magician" by UNLOCKED: Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The puzzles were varied in type and difficulty. Nothing felt unfair. You can tell a lot of thought went into the room. The staff is super friendly and the room is good for all ages. I would recommend it to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "The Return of the Magician" by UNLOCKED: Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I've done quite a few escape rooms throughout so cal and this room did a great job of being both immersive in storytelling and impressive in its variety of puzzles and pacing - even during beta! Great job unlocked team!

room_title: Escape room "The Gallery" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: Can't wait to go again! What a great adventure!

room_title: Escape room "The Gallery" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
