review: The experience was fantastic. I was engaged the entire time. This is a great team building exercise for employees. I could also see this being a great idea for a first date. I will definitely be going back.

room_title: Escape room "The Gallery" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: So fun!!! Can't wait to do this again. We didn't even argue..... Much!!! Loved it!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Gallery" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: We had two teams of 6 go head to head in the Study rooms. My team didn't even win and at the end, I wanted to keep going because I was having so much fun. The rooms are mentally stimulating and this place is a great team-building activity for coworkers, friends and couples. I will definitely be coming back to attempt the Gallery! Bravo guys

room_title: Escape room "The Gallery" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: Service is wonderful ,I will be backThe sea breeze drives like a dream highly recommend pierson rentals

room_title: Escape room "The Gallery" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: RV was clean and easy to drive.  The owners were very nice and helpful. Highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "The Gallery" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: Bret and Ashley at Pierson Rentals are professional and always quick to help with questions. It was our family's first experience with an RV, and although I was personally pretty nervous to drive one, Bret made it easy with his clear instructions. I felt like a pro by the end of our trip! The Suncruiser gets lots of second looks on the highway, as she is a beauty. Bret has updated the Suncruiser to be modern with a ton of cool amenities. It's perfect for a family of 4-6 or two couples

room_title: Escape room "Mad Mind VR" by ZScape Games in Livermore
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Guardian of the Scroll - Chapter 1" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We loved this place so much we did 2 challenges in 1 day. Literally finished one and we were so pumped we paid for another same day. Not so hard that it is impossible to escape, but challenging enough to make you brain work. We are actually planning on going again in a week for my bachelorette party! A must try if you want to do an escape room. There isn't enough words to explain how awesome this place is! It has never disappointed us!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: My family and I had such a good time! We did "The Kidnapping". We didn't break out but we sure had a lot of fun trying. Would definitely recommend to anyone. Great family fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: We attempted "kidnapping" with two adults and three children (ages 5-11). It was exciting and challenging, and we had a fun time! The staff was friendly and helpful. We definitely plan to return to try the other experiences.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: Our group did the kidnapping one and we had the best time working together to solve the puzzles and managed to breakout with 5 minutes left. I would definitely recommend for anyone to try this and the crew was great.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: What a great time we had with our two adult sons in the "Kidnapped" breakout room! The puzzles were challenging, and we were two numbers away from escaping within the hour:). It was a fun experience, and we'll try another when we're together again.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: Had a great time!! Took my sister and nephew who were visiting. We did the kidnapped room. Broke out with a 1:33 left. Wasn't until we got out that our game master told us that we did it in the dark without turning the light on. That made it much more exciting that we escaped!! Will be coming back!! Thanks again.

room_title: Escape room "Wise Guys" by Planet Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I have a lots of fun. HUNTER the guy that guide me and my friend was very helpful and nice!! I truly recommend it. Thank you!!! I will come back for the next level!! I am from Las Vegas!! 🤗

room_title: Escape room "Wise Guys" by Planet Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We had a mind-blowing experience. Allen our host did a superb job getting us ready for our 60-minute adventure. The clues were challenging and not obvious. We got a preview of escape rooms being constructed. Heartily recommend the escape room for a unique outing.

room_title: Escape room "Wise Guys" by Planet Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Fun staff, good times with friends. We did the mafia one and it was pretty intense. WE WERE SO CLOSE! Compared to the competition, one of the better escape rooms out there.

room_title: Escape room "Wise Guys" by Planet Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This is by far the best escape room around. Just when you believe you've got it - think again! The best part? Completely a private experience. Went here for a date night and left with all smiles. Thank you so much!

room_title: Escape room "Wise Guys" by Planet Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I’ve done a lot of escape rooms and this one is at the top of the list. It was very creative and super fun. Loved the way the room was set up and had some creative surprises! Highly recommend two thumbs up!

room_title: Escape room "Classified" by Train Escape in Birmingham
review: We had a great time! Unfortunately, we did not break out, but we will definitely come back so we can redeem ourselves!

room_title: Escape room "Classified" by Train Escape in Birmingham
review: We had an awesome time at the Train Escape. The owners were friendly and helpful. This was our first experience in an escape room and although we didn't make it out, it was a lot of fun.

room_title: Escape room "Classified" by Train Escape in Birmingham
review: So far best date night of 2017!This was our first time attempting an escape room challenge. We honestly had no idea what to expect. We booked the "Classified Room" which I thought was great for first timers although we didn't escape :(

room_title: Escape room "Government Secrets" by Xscape Pods in Los Angeles
review: So excited to have a new entertainment option in Chino Hills!  The owners were friendly and fun to chat with, the decor impressive and authentic, and the game was difficult but SO MUCH fun!  We managed to beat the Government Secrets room with just over a minute to spare.  This was my first escape room experience and it was a fantastic one!  I can't wait to go back when the other rooms are completed.  If you like escape rooms, I highly recommend trying this one!

room_title: Escape room "Government Secrets" by Xscape Pods in Los Angeles
review: My 3rd local Escape Room experience and I have to say this was really cool! They did an awesome job with the decor and the room itself was well thought out and kept us interested! We were greeted by the owner and creator of the rooms! He was nice and welcoming. Overall the whole experience was great. Of the three rooms to choose from we did "Government Secrets" skill level was moderate lots of communication between participants is key! I would come back to this location to do the other two rooms and anymore in the future.

room_title: Escape room "Government Secrets" by Xscape Pods in Los Angeles
review: Had a great time with only 9 minutes left! We got it. Very exciting. Tried the Government Secrets. The Egyptian room looks pretty cool too.

room_title: Escape room "The Doll Room" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: We completed the doll room today. So much fun!! It was just creepy enough, and the whole family had a great time.

room_title: Escape room "The Doll Room" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: Just did the doll room and loved it - staff was great and everything was well organized.

room_title: Escape room "The Doll Room" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: We just finished the doll room. Had a great time! The girls working there did a good job explaining everything. Would definitely recommend for a different change of pace from the beach.

room_title: Escape room "The Doll Room" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: We were in town celebrating for a Bachelorette Trip. It was so fun! We did the "Doll Room". A great challenge that puts you in the investigator role for a short while. The staff was also very friendly and helpful.

room_title: Escape room "The Doll Room" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: We loved escaping from the Doll room!! We all had to work together and we solved it !! We want to come back and escape from the Voodoo room when it's finished!!! Thank you to our great guide. She was fabulous!!!

room_title: Escape room "Abducted" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Up in Smoke" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Nice staff Fun puzzles. Great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Up in Smoke" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Great fun! wonderful staff!

room_title: Escape room "Up in Smoke" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: We had a awesome time! The staff was amazing and the puzzle was challenging but tons of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Gallery (Quest to the Forbidden Temple)" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Central Bank" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: Super fun. First time doing escape room. Saw many great reviews and it didn't disappoint. Did the bank robber one. Super difficult but so much fun. We were so close too! Highly recommend for any group of folks that just want to have fun, team build, or for bday celebrations like in my case.

room_title: Escape room "Central Bank" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: The Bank Heist room was cool. They gave us some cool things to make us feel like we were robbing a bank which added to the overall experience.As far as design, the sound effects were nice, but the decorations could have been a little more immersive. Puzzles had a good flow to them. We got stuck on a few of them and one of the puzzles was missing a key but the game master caught the error right away and fixed it. Customer service was great. We escaped with a few minutes to go.

room_title: Escape room "Central Bank" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: Amazing night of fun! This was our first experience with an escape room and it lived up to the hype. We had the Central Bank room which was extremely challenging. Although we didn't escape the room ( 25% success per Fox in a Box) we made it into the vault and are now even more determined to go back and finish the job. Highly recommend for a fun night out!!

room_title: Escape room "The Captain" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: We had such a great time in the Captains room. Can't wait to try another room soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Captain" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: We had so much fun playing "The Captain"! It was very challenging, but it felt awesome when we finished with only 1:57 left on the clock. This is a great place for some family fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Captain" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: Had a great time with the kids trying to solve The Jewel Thief and The Captain. These games are well designed and so entertaining! The Captain is very challenging!! Definitely need your thinking cap with this one! Highly recommend Beat 60!!

room_title: Escape room "The Captain" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: We had so much fun trying to beat "The Captain"!! We will definitely be back to try another challenge!

room_title: Escape room "Video Game Land" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: My group did the video game room and it was so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Video Game Land" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: My group, which included a seven-year-old, just completed Video Game Land and had an absolute blast! This room was well-designed, with lots of fun surprises and challenges. The theme and story flowed well and they didn’t try to over-complicate things. Richard, our game moderator did a wonderful job and was helpful and funny. This room is one of the only in town I would say is truly appropriate for all ages. I will highly recommend this place to everyone!

room_title: Escape room "The Signal" by Hall Of Shadows Escape Games in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by The Sleuth Box in Phoenix
review: Wow! A Hidden Gem of an Escape Room! My husband and I have done over 20 escape rooms, and we must say that this is our new favorite room. Megan did a great job as our cluemaster. We were lucky enough to do this room on our own which we prefer. (Too many cooks...and all that). This room had all sorts of unique puzzles and lots of good old-fashioned locks. And lots and lots of books, of course. This franchise allows you to take as long as you need to finish the game, which is always appreciated. We can't wait for their new room to open! If you like escape rooms, put this room at the top of your "must-do" list. You won't be disappointed.

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by The Sleuth Box in Phoenix
review: I've never had the opportunity to play an Escape Game before, but I'm glad my first experience was at the Sleuth Box!I don't want to give too much away, but every little detail was on point. From the look and feel of the room to the clues themselves, everything was done with attention to the finest detail.My co-workers and I who worked to solve the puzzle talked about our experience well after we were done and we are definitely eager to go back when the next room is available. Hey, we may even want to come back to solve the first puzzle since it was so much fun!A+ experience and would highly recommend to others!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by The Sleuth Box in Phoenix
review: This was my first experience at an escape room, and I have to say, The Sleuth Box set the bar high!! It was such a fun experience, and so different from anything I've done before. The room was incredibly detailed, and the mystery was intriguing and challenging. I'd recommend this for a date night, or with a group of friends or family. I can't wait to go back when they open their second room.

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by The Sleuth Box in Phoenix
review: What a great time we had! The men in our group, of course did not want to go, and of course we made them! After we were done they started talking about attending another in our home town, that is how much fun we had. We all worked together and were able to get out. We were surprised how we all came together and worked so well! This establishment is recommended to everyone. This was our first experience and now we can't wait for the second.

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by The Sleuth Box in Phoenix
review: My experience here over the weekend was phenomenal and my family is still raving about this a few days later.  And this wasn't my first escape room, and I *thought* the other one was pretty good...The room was so richly appointed and well decorated, to the point that it becomes an immersion experience.  And the puzzles were challenging and engaging, but not so ridiculous that no sane person could ever conceivably ever reach that end conclusion on their own accord.  Plus, there are a couple of bonus action items in the game that made our group exclaim in delight and surprise!  This was an extremely well thought out room and a completely delightful way to spend an hour.  I will return and I can't wait until they open another room!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by The Sleuth Box in Phoenix
review: My family took me here for my birthday this past year, and we had a blast escaping the Sleuth Box!  There's only one room right now, but it was so intricate and fun that I know the Cabin In The Woods (the room they're currently developing) is going to be a huge hit.  The Sleuth Box and Escape Zone AZ are probably my favorite two escape businesses I've visited so far, in regards to the atmosphere, the details of the puzzles, and how they're incorporated into the room.  I felt like I was Sherlock Holmes!

room_title: Escape room "Awakened" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The room was good, but would probably be best for first timers. People who are experienced with escape rooms may find it too easy. The props and atmosphere were great and scary, but there wasn't much of a narrative as you went through. Some of the puzzles were innovative and had some cool technology involved, but the final puzzle was a bit simple and made the ending a little anticlimactic. It took us a moment to realize that we were done! I enjoyed that the room was really big, with a lot of smaller rooms that you progressed to. Overall it was a good rioo

room_title: Escape room "Awakened" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The staff was awesome and very patient! The escape room (no spoilers) was fun and clever. Definitely requires critical thinking. Spooky theme and lots of fun!

room_title: Escape room "Awakened" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Went with my adult kids and we had so much fun! We did the Awakened room -  it was scary, fun and intense. Such a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Awakened" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Came with a full group of family. Glenn was in charge of leading our group. He was very fun and made us comfortable when we were all nervous. The escape room was not challenging here and there. I loved how it was different rooms and ways to get around. I lost my voice from screaming so much but that's me being a wuss.

room_title: Escape room "Awakened" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This place easily deserves 5 stars! The Awakened room is definitely a challenge with a very interesting backstory to it and it makes for great fun with friends. The customer service was excellent. We were happily greeted by our host Aneca who gave us some really good hints and made our experience that much more enjoyable. Definitely coming back here again!

room_title: Escape room "Awakened" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: It was my first time ever going to an escape room and I'm so glad my first experience was here! Super creepy/eerie theme. It was extremely interactive and witty. Pleasantly surprised that I had enough courage to do it all. Dylan and Glen were super awesome and helpful throughout the entire hour. I would definitely come here again!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Jungle Safari" by Brainy Actz in San Diego
review: My kids had a blast at birthday party At brainyactz. Great host, safe and interesting for kids and adults. Loved the  jungle room.

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Jungle Safari" by Brainy Actz in San Diego
review: For my second escape room experience, I brought three 13 and 14 year old boys that I babysit. The four of us took on the jungle room and we all had a blast solving the clues. We did escape but the boys also took full advantage of the use of the walkie talkie and asking for hints whenever they got stuck for more than a couple of minutes. The hints were helpful, though, and we were able to quickly move on to the next task with a little nudge. I thought that the dim lighting in the jungle room provided an extra challenge as it made things a little more hidden and harder to see. There was a good mixture of easy to more difficult steps to solving the puzzles and I love how these rooms force you to communicate and work as a team. I'd definitely love to come back and try other rooms in the future.

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Jungle Safari" by Brainy Actz in San Diego
review: Omg so much fun! The gal that was assisting was awesome! This was my first time here and didn't know what to expect. She left us in the room with one clue. From there you look for the clue that she gives you and then you find another clue with one of the clues that you just found. We were in The Jungle Room and we had to find the gold skull. We did it under the our time but there were a few glitches that held us up due to someone putting a lock on backwards so there was no way we could ever get the lock opened to get another clue to move on to the next phase. She came in and helped us and figured out what was wrong and then gave us a free clue. You're allowed three Clues if you get stuck within the hour to help you move on. It was fun all of us got along and we did a lot of laughing. Looking forward to going back again.

room_title: Escape room "The Missing Professor" by ClueMasters Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: My daughter picked this activity for part of her birthday party and the girls had a blast! Ben was a wonderful host and was very helpful when they needed some clues. We will definitely be back. Thanks for a wonderful experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Missing Professor" by ClueMasters Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: Had a ton of fun! Very innovative and clever. You can tell that a lot of effort, thought and passion was put into it. It's a great addition to Fort Smith and I would recommend it to anyone looking for something fun to do in this area. Can't wait to solve the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My son and I were in the Alice in Wonderland room and had a fabulous time. The owners designed and built the room which was really cool :-).

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: We had never been to an escape room before but decided to try this on vacation. It was so much fun! The owner was so helpful, informative and friendly. We did the Wonderland room. We had to solve puzzles and clues to find Alice's necklace. We would definitely do this again.

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: Just finished WonderLand with family of 6, kids aged 7, 11, 15 and 16 and we all had a blast. The room was perfectly suited for us as beginners and although we had some help along the way, managed to solve the room with time to spare. Kids can't stop talking about it. Highly recommend for families seeking some quality time and memories!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: We are here on spring break with our family, girls ages 10 and 8. We have never been to an Escape room before so we decided to give it a try. We did the Alice in Wonderland room! We had a blast and great family fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by MasterMind Escape the Room Game in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Z-Cape Z-51" by Escape Room Napa in Rohnert Park
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Inheritance" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: My husband and I came here on a double date night and it was way more fun than your regular dinner and a movie. We did the Inheritance room and although we didn't escape in time we put a decent amount of clues together and can't wait to try another one! Also the staff was so funny and helpful.

room_title: Escape room "The Inheritance" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: I played The Inheritance and Jail Break. This company shines in immersion and storytelling. (I am also a huge fan of their hint systems.) Overall, the puzzles in both games were incredibly creative. I enjoyed the use of both physical and mental tasks. The space and decor were impressive, as well. Escape Zone AZ has created a clever, fun, immersive experience that is fun for all ages. I highly recommend booking your escape room experience with them.

room_title: Escape room "The Inheritance" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: It was a lot of fun and a great family bonding experience. Lots of communication and teamwork, escaped with 4 minutes to spare! Very elaborate set up and deco, super realistic feel. Can't wait to try the other rooms next time.

room_title: Escape room "The Inheritance" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: This was an early Father's Day gift for my husband! Hubby, kids and I loved it! So much FUN! We did the Inheritance room. Very, very clever and high quality engineering. We almost made it out!!!! Thoroughly enjoyed this experience. We will return to play the Jailbreak room. This is fun activity for families, a group of friends or work colleagues.

room_title: Escape room "The Inheritance" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: One of the most inventive and ingenious ways to spend an hour. The inheritance escape room really makes you think and work together. It's exhilarating figuring out puzzle pieces and getting closer to the end. I highly recommend trying this out. Can't wait to go back.

room_title: Escape room "King Arthur’s Legacy" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Alexander and Danny were great! We did the King Arthur room and it was so much fun. Support local businesses and have fun doing it

room_title: Escape room "King Arthur’s Legacy" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Their new King Arthur room is amazing!

room_title: Escape room "King Arthur’s Legacy" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Amazing puzzles and lots of surprises. We did the King Arthur room. The decorations were great and the puzzle were pretty cool. Some of them were a bit confusing and we needed some hints. But we enjoyed every second of it.

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: Just did this room tonight with my girlfriend. We opted to do the 'hard mode' version which is 5 additional puzzles. It's a really cool room as the whole thing is a bunch of linear puzzles where each set of 5 has their own start. We ended up finishing with 30 something minutes left and the guy was generous enough to reset the remaining 2 rows of puzzles (normally done with large groups) so that we could do the rest of them. I really enjoyed this room as it was full of all sorts of different puzzles from logic, to word, and everything in between. They really make use of every possible type of puzzle as no two are alike. Definitely one of the more enjoyable Gen-1 rooms I have done.

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: I have done about 10 escape rooms so far and this one has to be by far, the best one yet. Yes, it did lack a storyline, but made it up with the amazing puzzles! My group had 5 people and we were able to solve 5 rows with about 2 minutes to spare! Lots a fun and one of the funniest escape rooms out there. We would of loved if this place had a second room because we would of definitely came back. Hopefully they open a second one and we will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: This is a very well done escape room game with a couple of cool aha! moments. It's perfect for a large group that works well when broken into in smaller groups. Its multi-path style allows for small groups to play together in a public game and still work mostly with their own players within the larger team. It's a weak on story, but very puzzle heavy.

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: Different from the other escape rooms I've done, but in a good way! Great puzzles and set up really well for team building if that is what you're after!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: There were plenty of puzzles to keep a large group of people entertained. It was not easy but not extremely hard. We truly enjoyed ourselves even though we failed! We will be going back and trying again!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: A lot of thought and planning went into this great game. We had a group ranging from 8 - 72 years old. It was great for the whole family. I would go back and try again. Also recommend it to anyone.

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Laboratory" by Dystopian Entertainment LLC in Los Angeles
review: Puzzles, puzzles, puzzles! Each puzzle is custom made and there are some cool dexterity, mind, and searching puzzles. There is a high density of puzzles and it's super fun to solve each one.

room_title: Escape room "Ground Zero" by The Prism Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was my first ever escape room and honestly, it really got me into them. Before I always doubted spending money on doing an escape room because I believed it would be a waste, however this was actually a lot of fun! My group of three did the virus room and you are provided with as many hints as you'd like. The room was amazing in its technology and all the puzzles to solve were very creative. Overall, I'd recommend to go to this escape room and the workers here were very friendly and funny!

room_title: Escape room "Ground Zero" by The Prism Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did Ground Zero and it was awesome! Our group of 4 was entirely novice to escape rooms but we got close to finishing. I couldn't believe how clever some of the puzzles were -- like the stuff out of a movie script plot-twist. Apparently the owners are just a couple of people with day jobs that do this for fun on the side, and their passion really shines through.

room_title: Escape room "Ground Zero" by The Prism Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This place is awesome!!! My Sister booked the Ground Zero room for today. We had 6 family members and we needed every single one of us to complete this room in the 75 minutes we were given. Before we entered the room we were told Ground Zero only had a 20% success rate. That scared us. 3 of us have never done an escape room. The rooms were decorated great. So many combination locks to open. So many things to figure out just to get to the second room. There is a 3rd small room attached to the second room. While in the 2nd/3rd rooms we only had around 18 minutes left. We started to really worry. We were all sweating to figure out that last combination to get the door open. We made it with 1:46 to spare. When that lock clicked open we all let out a huge celebratory scream. I would highly recommend The Prism Escape Rooms. I would recommend having the maximum 6 people if you choose the Ground Zero room. We all had a fun time!!

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Captain Judy is so amazing and funny. She is there to help you out when needed when you give her the correct call to request the help. The Titanic room has about 3 rooms you need to break through to end the game. It's so much fun, just remember to talk out loud with your team, this is not a figure out yourself type of game, or you cover that area and I cover that area. It's really a group effort.

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the Titanic Room with a group of 3 on Sunday. Our little group was pretty new to the escape room scene and we were pretty excited to check it out. The building doesn't look like much from the outside but it's super cute on the inside. Captain Judy explained the scenario and told us how to get hints if we needed them (we needed them!). I don't want to give anything away but all of the rooms were decorated great and we had a fun time figuring out the various puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: What a lot of fun in one hour! My wife and I were first-timers. Our friends had done an escape room before with 60out at a different location. Ivan oriented us with the do's and don'ts of the rooms and then we were off on the Titanic (yes, I had a sinking sensation going in). This is not an activity for someone with claustrophobia. Figuring out the clues is very challenging, and we did need to get an assist from "Captain Ivan" more than once. But we did escape at 59.5 minutes. And we agreed that we would return for another room in the near future!

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: LOVE LOVE LOVE these. The rooms are set up sooo well and the puzzles are challenging. Not a lot of locks to unlock, I have nothing against opening a lot of locks, I actually like it but these rooms are so incredibly creative that they are amazing. Also, when they give you hints they are very vague and get you thinking so they don't just give away the answers which I appreciate. They also don't put any other players you don't know in the room with you which is a requirement for us.We've done the Titanic and Zen Room at the Marina Del Ray location and Senator Payne at the West LA location. Judy was our Game Master at the Marina location for both rooms. She was amazing! She was so fun and you could tell she really loves her job. We will be back in a couple weeks to do Outbreak Judy!

room_title: Escape room "Titanic" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We came to 60out Escape Rooms for the Titanic puzzle. The lobby area is cozy, spacious, and even houses a couple of small games. This was our second escape room experience, and the design of the rooms was top-notch! The difficulty was noticeably harder than our first room, but some puzzles were exceptionally clever! Our game master, Judy, did a great job providing useful hints without directly giving the answer away. Thanks for being so patient with us!

room_title: Escape room "The King’s Keep" by Next-Gen Escape in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The staff here is fun,and have a good sense of humor! I'm still buzzing from the rush of our successful teamwork! Sherlock Room, perfect for the educated,artistic Team #thebookcellar! Looking for something New to do with your friends and family? Exodus Escape Room is Waiting for you! Thanks Chad,artistic Trevor, our host,for an Awesome Adventure!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had a blast good timeseven if we were in the dark and handcuffed

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My group did the Sherlock room and it was a lot of fun! We had nine people which was a little bit of a crowd. The only problem that we had was that the finally lock was difficult to open and keep us from getting out in the hour. They did give us more time though because they knew that we had the code. My family is really excited to do this again though!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had such a fantastic fun time! The staff was extremely friendly and courteous ! Great event to do with a good group of friends! We did the Sherlock room, and were able to escape! In "record" time perhaps! We had 25 mins and 44 seconds to spare! Whoot ! Will definitely come back to try the Trap Room next ! Смайлик «grin» dundunn dunnnnn!!!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was my first experience with escape rooms, and I couldn't have asked for a better introduction! I brought a group here yesterday for my birthday party and we ALL had a blast! The staff was wonderful, funny and incredibly sweet. We are definitely coming back for the Sherlock room!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: What an amazing experience!! Loved everything about it! The staff was amazing and the experience was like no other! I highly recommend doing this. I had a huge party of 18 people and they accommodated us. Split us up between the Sherlock room and Escape room. Made it a competition! So much fun! You HAVE to experience this! Going back for more! Thank you!!

room_title: Escape room "The Agency" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We were a group of five and we did the Agency. We ended up escaping in 35 minutes and that was the fastest time for this week so we were pretty stoked. There were various puzzles and we each seemed to excel in different places. I will definitely be back to try the Hideout soon. On a side note, the Agency is not a scary room so if you get spooked easily this room is perfect for you. It is mysterious but not scary.

room_title: Escape room "The Agency" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've now experienced both rooms. They are awesome. Absolutely, enjoyed myself each time. I'm now addicted! The staff is super friendly and helpful. I highly recommend Arcane to everyone!

room_title: Escape room "The Agency" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I loved how the puzzles are mentally challenging and fun at the same time. You get the clues and it's not a give away. You still have to figure out what they really mean which makes it more exciting. Will definitely come back here once the new room is available! Great job Arcane!

room_title: Escape room "The Whispering Halls" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: I have done multiple escape rooms in the past, but "Whispering Halls" is far and away the best one I've encountered to date. The ambience, detail, and engrossing puzzles definitely kept our group on our feet the entire time. 5 Stars! A masterful job well done. Will definitely be back for more!

room_title: Escape room "The Whispering Halls" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: There was 12+ of us, and we got packed into this super super tiny room for Whispering Halls. Then, a secret door opens, and I was blown away. There were secret passageways, other doors, it was huge, and we beat it with two minutes to spare and I couldn't believe how complex it was. I am already planning a trip back with friends, and let me tell you, after that experience, everyone involved couldn't stop talking about it, and I guarantee we will talk about it later as well. I personally called two friends and told them my whole experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Whispering Halls" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: I am a veteran with escape rooms and this one "whispering halls" surprised even me. The puzzles were new and different and the interaction between the puzzles and the space were terrific. The puzzles themselves were not too hard (ensuring that complex math or problem solving would not be the reason that you cannot escape) but we're connected throughout the room. Take it from an experienced escapee ... visit this place!

room_title: Escape room "The Whispering Halls" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: This was my first experience with escape rooms. I went with a group of friends that never done one either. We tried Whispering Halls and it was Fantastic! We were definitely engrossed in all the puzzles and surprises. We did not escape on time but was on the last puzzle when we ran out of time. Nevertheless we loved the experience. The staff was awesome. The clues, puzzles, decorations, ambiance, etc was great. We couldn't stop talking about how much fun it was and when we want to go back and try the other experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Whispering Halls" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: We had a great time. I have never tried something like this before and now I am addicted! Awesome!

room_title: Escape room "LIT" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Loved all the puzzles, very unique room!

room_title: Escape room "LIT" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This is Inferno's best room for enthusiasts and newbies alike. Bring your friends, there are a lot of puzzles to solve! A room full of humor and fun... this one would be particularly great for birthday parties, bachelorette parties, etc.

room_title: Escape room "LIT" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: My family has done many escape rooms across the Southeast so we decided to try one in Phoenix...and this was one of our favorites! We did LIT and loved it. The room was linear and the clues made sense. It definitely wasn't easy- but not undoable. Great design and fun to play.

room_title: Escape room "LIT" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Lit was a great room! Our group had a fun time playing and laughed quite a bit. Still a challenging room! Love the storyline and added challenge to break INto the room. I would recommend highly recommend this room.

room_title: Escape room "LIT" by Inferno Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Lit is a must play! If you are looking for a fun, but challenging room- this is the one to play. Love the sense of humor throughout the game and the very unique puzzles. Best room!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard Hysteria" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: This is definitely a “ must see” if you love escape rooms! It definitely felt like you were in the Wizarding world of Harry Potter and Ian, our game master, was awesome! As chaotic as it can get at times he was on point with the clues and even cheering us on at times. Will definitely be going back to escape the zombie apocalypse.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard Hysteria" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: Seriously, THE BEST! Heard a lot about escape rooms and this was the first one we actually did. If others are anything like this, I'm all in. We did the Horcrux Hysteria (Harry Potter theme) and it was awesome! Took 5 moderately intelligent adults almost the entire hour to work our way out. So challenging but a ton of fun. The guys that work there are really nice very accommodating, and the location is great. Great with friends tonight and will bring my teams back for work activities. Excited to come back!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard Hysteria" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: This has been one of the best date nights we've had! Horcrux Hysteria was incredibly well done. The room was very immersive and creative. Highly recommended for a group date night!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter Two: Norcross Art Gallery" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: What an excellent experience. It was our first time. The Art Gallery set up was amazing and well thought out. Think Davinci Code. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter Two: Norcross Art Gallery" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: First time doing a escape room and it was pretty awesome! The story line was pretty good, it was challenging and fun at the same time! Totally worth it can't wait for the next chapter!!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter Two: Norcross Art Gallery" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Amazing! I've done about 15 rooms in LA and this one makes one of the best, original puzzles very well thought out. What I like most is the level of imersion in this game you really do fell like part of the story. You seriously need to try it out regardless if you're and experienced or beginner. Can't wait to try the other chapters !!! MUST TRY

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Tower" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: What an incredible experience! The guys running this escape room are so friendly and fun! You can really tell they put a lot of thought into making the escape room fun and memorable. Thanks Alex for a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Tower" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My 13-year-old son and I did a new Wizard's room, and we loved it! It's not the hardest room but it's not the easiest either. We are experienced at doing escape rooms and we were able to complete the room in record time with a few hints. I think this is a perfect room for kids. I look forward to their next one.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Tower" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was my first escape room ever, and I loved it so much! My best friends and I were able to escape the Wizard's Tower room with some hints from the friendly staff. Woohoo! Great work on this room! I really felt like I was in another world. We will definitely be coming back and will be spreading the word! Thank you for an amazing time!

room_title: Escape room "Bear Valley Search and Rescue" by Big Bear Escape Room in Big Bear City
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Babysitter" by Reed Between The Lines in Rohnert Park
review: My first escape room visit. Was so much fun! Looking forward to doing it again!

room_title: Escape room "The Babysitter" by Reed Between The Lines in Rohnert Park
review: So much fun! Such a blast with friends and family.

room_title: Escape room "The Bank Robbery" by Trapped In Decatur in Huntsville
review: So much fun, now I want to do them all! We broke out the bank. My family of four worked together without killing each other. Staff was friendly and helpful when we got stuck too long.

room_title: Escape room "Illusion de Magician" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: We did the magic room and it was amazing! Ed was our host and he was awesome! Ask for hints if you need them... they won't tell you outright but give you enough to steer you the right way. We will be back to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Illusion de Magician" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: We did the I'illusion de Magicien room today and had an amazing time. It's only one room but the set up and story were really well put together. We had an amazing time and were able to solve the puzzle. I can't wait to go back and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Illusion de Magician" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: We did a team-building event yesterday in the Magician room and had an absolute blast!! The puzzles were challenging but fun, and your excitement just grows each time you figure out a clue! Very well-done, we definitely want to return!!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Great experience! We did the Prison Break room, we did not make it out but we had a great time. Staff were super friendly, helpful, and funny! We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We tried heist and prison break. Both rooms were well thought out and very high quality. The staff was friendly and encouraging. We will definitely be back to try the remaining rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We love riddle escape room! The owners are the nicest. The rooms are high tech and challenging. The prison break room is great.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Great imagination has put this challenging room as one of the best in Arizona! Prison Break has puzzles and games never seen in an escape room before. Real jail bars, toilets and good decor make this room worth it. You and your friends will need to focus and work together to escape before time runs out. High difficulty but Tons of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Lair of the Puzzlemaster" by Trapped! Escape Room Upland in Pomona
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Island Paradise" by Vector Escape Games in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Beyond the Wardrobe" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: My boyfriend and I love doing escape rooms for a date night activity. We recently chose Beyond the Wardrobe and were blown away!! The creativity that it takes to come up with the ideas for some of the clues is outstanding!!! This was our 3rd room and we Escaped with 9 min remaining!

room_title: Escape room "Bio-Hazard Bunker" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Vampire's Rise" by Minervium in Sacramento
review: So fun, really well thought out, and an affordable and local option for an evening out in Davis!

room_title: Escape room "Vampire's Rise" by Minervium in Sacramento
review: This is a well thought out and executed room, a perfect combination of puzzles and tech made the experience flow really well. Our game master was awesome and made the experience that much better.

room_title: Escape room "Vampire's Rise" by Minervium in Sacramento
review: The best escape room I’ve been to by far. The game master we had was really nice and helpful as well! I’d recommend coming to this escape over any other any day.

room_title: Escape room "The Professor's Study" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: One of the best experiences my family and I have had!We did the professor's study and it was AWESOME! The puzzles and clues were so well thought out! We were two clues away from finishing and loved every minute of it The staff is so friendly and clearly clever to put on such a great experience.We will all be back for my brother's birthday and cannot wait.Definitely recommend this!

room_title: Escape room "The Professor's Study" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: We absolutely loved this! Definitely coming back for the other two rooms as well! Very friendly and helpful staff as well!

room_title: Escape room "The Professor's Study" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: We had a great time at Bolt. If you are looking for something to do with family or friends I would highly recommend Bolt.

room_title: Escape room "The Professor's Study" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: Had a blast at Bolt. My friends and I escaped the Professor's Study with just 3 minutes left. The staff is great, and the experience is amazing. Can't wait to go back and do the Hacker room!

room_title: Escape room "The Professor's Study" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: We had a great time. The staff is very friendly and the room was challenging! I recommend anyone who likes puzzles and has an hour to spend go try this out!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: The Sherlock Holmes room was awesome. All of the clues were so intricate and well thought out. Would definitely go again!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: We went with a group of 5 and 4 of us have never done this before. We did the Sherlock Holmes room and had a blast! Lindsey was a great host. Definitely will be back to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: Went here for my 40th! Girls against boys, super fun! Loved the Sherlock room!

room_title: Escape room "The Executioner" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Fun House" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: My friends and I haven't had this much fun in a long time.

room_title: Escape room "The Fun House" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Had the most amazing time!There is no slacking and letting your friends lead in this game. Everyone must do their own part of the puzzle before you can come together as a group.Room is detailed and immersive. Characterization is unique and adds a fun element.Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "The Fun House" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: LOVED this escape room!!When I first received the invite to come along, I thought okay, what is going to set this one apart from the rest? I've been to my share of escape rooms, some were great, others needed to mature a little more, but after you've done so many, you want to find a uniqueness about the next one.I read the concept of everyone starting off separated into different rooms, that really caught my eye. The idea of everyone being a different character based on a quirky personality test was also nice. I had my eye set on being the detective (which I was able to be ). I watched as my friends became elected into the other positions - the jock, the rebel, the nerd, the virgin and the prom queen.To conquer this escape room, you really need the right dynamic. Everyone has their own puzzles to conquer, but at the same time, one may have something for someone in another room. I don't want to spoil much, but I will speak from being the detective. If you find yourself in this spot, I hope you don't get overwhelmed easy. You are the glue that bonds everyone and it is your responsibility to make sure everyone is okay and gets what they need.I highly recommend this room and will be speaking nothing but good things about it to anyone interested. What a great team at Crossroads, I can't wait to see what rooms you all come up with next.

room_title: Escape room "The Fun House" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Sets a new standard for an immersive, tense escape room through fantastic lighting, sound, and set design. You can tell the owners took a lot of care into making a professional movie-grade experience. From the moment the briefing starts to our send off at the end, everything was customer centric. Warm and welcoming at the beginning. Chilling and dangerous during the game. Loved this room and company.

room_title: Escape room "The Fun House" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: So amazing! My friends and I couldn't stop talking about it after we left. We were SO CLOSE to escaping and now all we want to do is go back and try it again!It's beautifully designed and with the dramatic lighting and eerie sounds, it seriously felt like we were in a horror movie.It was everyone's first experience in an escape room and we were all nervous about what we were getting into, but the owners we so kind and helpful that they were more than willing to make sure we were all going to have a fun time!I just recommend to book in advance because those time slots fill up fast!

room_title: Escape room "The Voodoo Cabin" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: I would not suggest this room, there was 6 in our group all related but one got sick and wasn’t able to come.   We ask for a refund and was told they couldn’t do that because they had no control over what was done over the internet.   Just a few of us had ever been before and we got no where solving the clues.   We had to ask for help in every step and then ask how it was solved and we weren’t even 1/16th through it before our hour was up.   Told them that half of us just sat on the floor and we were so disappoint.   Then they told us it was difficult that they created it and they even had trouble solving it.   Maybe they should tell you this when you are checking in.  I could of found a much better way to spend my $170.  The ones who never had done this before will probably never go to another one.   I want, what a waste.

room_title: Escape room "The Voodoo Cabin" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: Need to get with the program a lot of stuff to do in Destin Fl to not even act like you care if customers walk in your place of business, stood and waited 3 minutes to be greeted by one of three girls sitting behind the desk 2 witch had headphones in and all on the phones so me and my party of seven went and spent our money where we had better customer service

room_title: Escape room "The Voodoo Cabin" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: We had so much fun finding all the clues in the voodoo cabin. We will be coming back to do the other rooms very soon.

room_title: Escape room "The Forgotten Pharaoh" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: So much fun! We did the Pharaoh's challenge, I can't remember the exact name, but it was a lot of fun and very challenging. My family and friends, all nine of us, made it out of the room in 53 minutes while using for clues. I feel like we are closer as a group then we were before. It was a great team building exercise.

room_title: Escape room "The Forgotten Pharaoh" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: Best escape room we've been to. It's slightly more expensive than Los Angeles, but you get a very high quality experience. We finished the Pharaoh game with 30 seconds to spare with 6 people and it was the perfect amount of difficulty. I would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Forgotten Pharaoh" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: Our family came in for Thanksgiving, I booked The Forgotten Pharaoh escape game. What a blast we all had, very challenging and lots of fun. We came out realizing the importance of working together.Charlie and his team are absolutely wonderful. We will be back and have already mentioned to our friends that they need to check it out.Thank you all for a great experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Forgotten Pharaoh" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: This was our first time ever in an Escape Game and I guarantee we will be back here! We did Pharaoh's Tomb and had a blast. Charlie and Cullen were so helpful and made our experience a great one! The Christmas Room is about to open and looks AWESOME! I highly recommend this to all - from beginners like us to pros!

room_title: Escape room "The Forgotten Pharaoh" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: AMAZING!! I was new to escape rooms before I found this place, and now I'm hooked. The owners (Charlie and Mia) are very friendly, the location is perfect and the entire experience is very well organized. The best part is that the puzzles were quite tough but fun! Specifically, the Forgotten Pharaoh -- which was my first room ever -- was a BLAST! Overall Escape Games at the River delivered an experience that has me wanting more!!

room_title: Escape room "Neutrino 42" by Boss-Play Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Skull and Scepter" by Break Through Sac in Sacramento
review: First Time at an Escape Room and we had a wonderful time. We did the Skull And Scepter room on expert mode. Very challenging but so much fun. We will be back for sure.

room_title: Escape room "Skull and Scepter" by Break Through Sac in Sacramento
review: There was four of us that did the Skull and Scepter room and had a great time! Larry was an awesome Game Master!! He made sure our hints where not to obvious but helpful and really made it a great experience since two of us have never done an Escape Room before. We had one Vet, a second timer and two newbies and we escaped with 2mins left out of an hour and had a blast the whole time. We WILL be back for more!

room_title: Escape room "Skull and Scepter" by Break Through Sac in Sacramento
review: I did the Skull and Scepter Escape Room and it was a lot of fun. Larry was our Game master and he was awsome. Way more attentive than most Game masters. Also he never directly gave us an answer to a clue, he just guided us to our conclusion. All in all I'd rate this one more than 5 stars and I will definitely be back for Vipers Nest.

room_title: Escape room "Rob The Bookie" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Very fun experience. Our guides were also entertaining and helpful. We did the mad tea party room and the bookie room. Both were equally challenging and I would love to try new rooms in the future!

room_title: Escape room "Rob The Bookie" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: This was our first time doing an escape room and it was awesome. The girl working was very helpful and friendly. We did the Rob The Bookie Room and got out with almost 9 minutes left. We will definitely be back to do it again. Thanks for a great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Rob The Bookie" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: This was the most fun I've had in a long time. The puzzles were very engaging. Can't wait to go back.

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Senator Payne" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Addicted!Jerred and Tommy are great hosts!Mystery of Senator Payne is my personal favorite at this location, though I also highly recommend Casino Heist as well!This is a great location for an escape room. We finished the Casino heist and had to come back the next week and take on the Senator Payne room.Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Senator Payne" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Always the best!! Had so much fun doing the Mystery of Senator Payne  not as easy as you think but we were able to escape!!! TOMMY our game master is super awesome!! Super cool!! Thanks so much man you made our escaping more exciting!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Senator Payne" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Amazing! My friends and I tried this out as our first escape room and we had a blast.Service was great! Even though I had booked for 6 people, one person didn't show up but it wasn't a problem. Angelique was a funny, friendly, and overall fantastic game master. She helped make the experience as good as it was.The actual escape room itself (we tried "The Mystery of Senator Payne") was so so so much fun. We worked as a team and really got into the game. Finished with only 8 minutes to spare!We'll definitely be back to try out "Casino Heist"!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Senator Payne" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Mak was an amazing game host! She did a great job at engaging with us during our experience and was very helpful whenever we needed a clue or hint.My group tried the Senator Payne room and it was such a great experience. Very fun and a decent challenge as well! Highly recommend that room! My group did 7 people, but I highly suggest trying to keep the group at 5 people or less. Anything more it gets kinda messy and there's too many people trying to figure out the clues, which causes delay.Can't wait to go back and try another room! Great thing to do with a group of friends.

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Senator Payne" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Such a fun Escape room!! One of the best ones I've ever done. I did the Senator Payne one and the set was really perfect and detailed. All the puzzles were very different, some were more complicated and some were deceptively simple, but it kept the pace and suspense building and building and building.

room_title: Escape room "Thwarted" by Exit Strategies in Redding
review: We almost made it out in Thwarted Escape room, so much fun. I got to see how smart my family really was. If you want an hour of extreme fun than get to Oasis Fun Center and try one of their escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Thwarted" by Exit Strategies in Redding
review: We did the Thwarted escape room here at Oasis Fun Center. We had a family team of four. We solved it, but barely. It was very well done! Not an easy solve. Lots of challenges and a few cool surprises. I highly recommend it. We have done rooms in Boise and Reno. This was my favorite!

room_title: Escape room "The Lair" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: So my friend, her father, and I decided that we wanted to go on a fun escape room on a Friday night right? The service and general idea of the room was supposed to be "not scary" and we supposedly played a kids version. Late into the game, we got stuck. We asked for a clue and the guide gave us false information and then said "my bad" at the end when we couldn't escape. If that wasn't enough, my friend was horrified even though it wasn't supposed to be scary at all. There were mangled dolls draped across the ceiling and eerie sound played in the background. You had to undress a Barbie to find one of the clues, which I personally find extremely disturbing. It was said that we played the kids version, however, many elements of it seemed more mature. We were really bummed at the end since we weren't offered a refund for the mistake that was made. They acted like the issue wasn't a big deal, but the "customer is always right". Please note before exposing this to your kids.

room_title: Escape room "The Lair" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: Just recently I get lucky because I stumbled upon this place by accident when I was reading an article “15 Best Places to Meet Singles in Los Angeles” – https://www.flirt.com/ and this place was among those 15. Out of sheer curiosity, I decided to make a visit and I was hooked right away. Since then it's my favourite escape room in Los Angeles, where we always have a lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Lair" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: This game is really fun and unique. I've done many escape games and this one had creative and unique puzzles I hadn't seen in the 30+ previous games I've played. It feels like a game, but there is still the pressure to beat the clock. I love the set up prior to entering the game. The staff is great and so is the experience. Definitely check this out if you want to have a fun time.

room_title: Escape room "The Lair" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: Great experience with this escape rooms. No doubt one of the op escape rooms. So many clever puzzles integrating incredibly well with the technology. The hosts were incredibly warm and friendly. Any fan of escape rooms must visit this room.

room_title: Escape room "The Lair" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: We did another escape room two hours before...and needed more. Our group of 4 showed up with no expectations and were pleasantly surprised. The puzzles are very well put together and required a thinking. Our group likes to power through things when we get stuck, but the hosts know when is the right time to offer advice! They are opening up two other rooms in the same location...I will be going asap once they are available!

room_title: Escape room "The Lair" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: Recently a group of friends and I gave Escapedom escape rooms in Westwood a try. We didn't know exactly what to expect but ended up thoroughly enjoying it. I'd recommend it to groups of friends/colleagues who want to do something fun for a solid hour with no distractions except the mysteries you're trying to solve. The hosts were fun and entertaining and even spent time with us after to get our feedback.

room_title: Escape room "Captive Chamber" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: Super fun! Our host was amazing! We did the Captive Chamber and it wasn't super creepy. We will definitely go back to check out their next location.

room_title: Escape room "Captive Chamber" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: This was only my second attempt at an escape room, and I loved it! We escaped from the Chamber and it's definitely a great beginners intro to escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Captive Chamber" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: I had such a good time!!! So much fun!! The team did such a good job!! Can't wait to do it again

room_title: Escape room "Creature of the Year" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Went last night for my nephew's birthday, and we had a blast! Loved the theme and creative puzzles. We will definitely be back to try the new room when it's ready. Thanks!

room_title: Escape room "Creature of the Year" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: I had a blast doing to Creature of the Year escape room with my family for my birthday. The room is a lot of fun and has some really cool surprises. The room had just the right level of difficulty. I will definitely be returning!

room_title: Escape room "Creature of the Year" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This was one of the better escape rooms we've done. They asked us how difficult we liked it, and customized the room to fit our group of 9 people (mostly kids). We asked for a difficult room, and we definitely got one! We were able to escape with only 5 minutes to spare, which is far more enjoyable than escaping too early. The ambiance was great, and there was a good mix of puzzle types. We will be back when the Shawshank room opens!

room_title: Escape room "Creature of the Year" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Cluemaster was a FABULOUS escape room! Michael was so thorough explaining the locks, how to get "hints" and story behind the room. Although this was my first experience in an escape room, I was with others who had done several. We all agreed that this was the best escape room ever! I plan to return and would highly recommend Cluemaster Escape Rooms to anyone looking for a great, entertaining way to spend an evening.. Thanks Michael!

room_title: Escape room "Creature of the Year" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Went as a family for my husband's birthday and had a great time! It was the first escape room any of us had done, and I will admit some of us were a little skeptical about it going in. But we all got really into it and had a blast! We're looking forward to going back when the next room opens. Thanks for a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Black Beard's Brig" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: Had my son's birthday party here and they were very accommodating to everyone in the group. They completed the pirate room and had a great time.We can't wait to go back with friends.

room_title: Escape room "Black Beard's Brig" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: My first escape room was the Pirate room and it absolutely got me hooked. Even as a new player, I was able to contribute and we successfully escaped the room. When I had gained more experience, we came back for the cabin room and it was a blast. The decor and immersive story really enhance the experience overall and it is my favorite room so far.

room_title: Escape room "Black Beard's Brig" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: My co-workers and I had a great time at Auburn Escape Zones! The rooms were challenging, yet still fun for both beginners and puzzle experts. This is a great way to spend an hour or two with a group in Auburn. The staff was very friendly and I can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Black Beard's Brig" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: This was such a fun surprise for my husband's 30th birthday! We enjoyed the pirate room, and it was perfect for people with a variety of puzzle experience! Will definitely be coming back!!!

room_title: Escape room "Black Beard's Brig" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: Went with a work group for a team building event. Our group of 8 escaped the Blackbeard room! It seems like the ideal number of people is 5-6 - 8 was a bit chaotic and crowded, but we all had a great time and everyone contributed to the escape. The staff was terrific, very friendly and encouraging. I will definitely go back! Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Jumanji" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did this room with a group of 6 adults, cleared all three portions of this in 45 minutes.  Very immersive with good detail.  The puzzles are all excellently thematic and genuinely fun to solve.  My only issue with this room is when you are assigned character roles there is no way to reference what your "specialties" are.  If we had a prop of some kind that we could have referenced would have made things quite a bit smoother... maybe that's the point?

room_title: Escape room "Jumanji" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Rooms are fun, challenging and very immersive. Fun for the family!

room_title: Escape room "Jumanji" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Best escape room HANDS DOWN!! The puzzles were very creative--you won't find locks and combinations here! The game masters really know what they're doing, and it shows because they have a total of 16 rooms! Because my experience here was so amazing, I'm definitely going to try the rest of their rooms! Rose was an amazing host and game master, and she was very kind and helpful. PS their ice cream is delicious!

room_title: Escape room "Jumanji" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My kids (ages 9,11 and 21) and I have done three 60Out escape rooms: Jumanji, Alice in Wonderland, and Fire & Ice. Jumanji is one of our two favorite escape rooms in LA, and Fire & Ice is our third favorite. These are high-quality escape rooms with strong production design and story. They are high-tech escape rooms with lots of magnetic-opens and pretty much no combination or key locks. If you like escape rooms that require you to find combination and keys to open locks, these are not your rooms. But if you like "OH! THAT'S COOL!" moments in your escape rooms, 60Out rooms are for you. All of the rooms we did were impressive and amazing, but HANDS DOWN, the Jumanji room will blow your mind with its production value, set design, script, and puzzles. Unlike linear puzzle rooms, several different puzzles can be done simultaneously in this room, which makes it fun for groups. We look forward to doing more 60Out rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Monkey Business" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: My family and I came to play on a Monday afternoon and had a blast. I recommend it to anybody.

room_title: Escape room "Monkey Business" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: Great family night for our young teens! Keeps everyone engaged!

room_title: Escape room "Monkey Business" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: My 10 year old son and his friends did the Monkey Business room and had a blast!! They had so much fun that after they finished they wanted to do another one!!

room_title: Escape room "Clue Me In!" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Honest to goodness this was so fun! We did the Clue one as a family and it was perfect! Just tough enough to make us think, but we were still able to solve it! (We are a detective type family though). I would seriously recommend this place to anyone!!! It's perfect for all occasions. Thank you so much NWA Escape Rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Clue Me In!" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Lots of fun, and just challenging enough to make you work for it! But not so hard that it's frustrating. Staff was great. We did the Clue room and loved it. The room was made for 8 people, but just 4 in our group were getting in each others way, so I'm glad it was just us. Would have been a little claustrophobic with 8! Will definitely be going back.

room_title: Escape room "Clue Me In!" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: The person who helped us set up was awesome! He picked the characters for us and from what we heard from our other group members, pinned all of our personalities down! We had a great time and will definitely be back for more adventures!

room_title: Escape room "Clue Me In!" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Fun!!!!! Put your thinking caps on and challenge your detective skills. Great time for everyone. We are coming back. Great staff and they make sure you have a great time. Great for family time or any group. We completed our challenge and escaped. If you are looking for a great unique party or time give them a call.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak!" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Fun time! We did the Outbreak Room with our kids 7, 11, 13, 15. It was a little difficult for us, but we had a great time! We will be back someday! The staff was nice and the room was really cool!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak!" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We just celebrated our son's 11th birthday with a group of his friends in the "Outbreak" room! They had fun, and it was very tricky. We got some helpful clues but did not make it out in time! The building is nicely decorated and very cool on a hot summer day! Staff was great too. We would go back and recommend to others.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak!" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: A great night out! Well done. Can't wait to try another one.

room_title: Escape room "Try-Wizard Tournament" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Did the Wizarding Room - very well thought, although you should bring someone who loves traditional newspaper puzzles. Will definitely go back with more friends.

room_title: Escape room "Try-Wizard Tournament" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Super fun! Awesome staff! We did the Wizard escape & made it out with 5 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Try-Wizard Tournament" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Square Room Escapes is a decent escape room (nothing crazy elaborate set wise) but they have some fun puzzles.  We did the "wizard" room a couple years back and it was quite enjoyable.  We managed to escape with a few seconds to spare.  Nice time, very professional, and I was happy that it was a private room.

room_title: Escape room "Wizards and Spells" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Escape rooms are fun teambuilding or date activity, and EscapeGameSD does a fantastic job engaging the participants and the rooms are very fun, especially the wizards challenge. Headmaster Paolo did an amazing job creating the room.

room_title: Escape room "Wizards and Spells" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: My friend and I did the Wizard room for our birthdays (our first escape room ever). We were both thoroughly impressed and captivated by the fun and intrigue that was had. Will definitely be back for more!

room_title: Escape room "Wizards and Spells" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Brought my son and his friends for his 15th birthday party today to the wizards & spells room. They loved it and had a great time. They really had to work together to get through the puzzles and they did it with 11 minutes to spare! Fun props and very Harry Potter like. Highly recommend for all ages.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets in Suburbia" by Breach Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Located in an anonymous industrial park off Lambert Street near Lake Forest Drive, The Scene Escape Rooms is a little hard to find but definitely worth the effort. If you’ve never experienced an escape room, the way it works is that your group (in our case, a family of five) is locked in a room and is given 60 minutes to find the way out by solving different puzzles and finding related clues that eventually lead to the key that will open the door to freedom and victory.The reception area is attractive, and the staff is friendly and helpful. We tackled the “Secrets in Suburbia” room, a murder mystery set in a suburban neighborhood circa 1962. The room was well-designed and nicely themed, and the puzzles were detailed and logical. NOTE that there is some math involved in one puzzle, so it may be helpful to bring a calculator – fortunately, my son is an engineer and easily handled the math problems.This was my fourth experience with an escape room, and “Secrets in Suburbia” was probably the room I’ve enjoyed the most so far. I would certainly recommend The Scene!

room_title: Escape room "Secrets in Suburbia" by Breach Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We had a blast! Very challenging and super fun. The room was amazing and the staff were very friendly. Such a great idea. We will definitely do this again. I definitely recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets in Suburbia" by Breach Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My family and I went to The Scene Escape room today for my husbands birthday and we all had such a blast. I was a little worried how we would handle trying to solve the puzzles together but we all did great. The staff is awesome as well. They were very kind and friendly which made our time there even better. If you haven't tried an Escape room before, you have to try The Scene Escape Rooms. I cannot wait for their next room to open.

room_title: Escape room "The Shack" by Escape Enterprise in Daleville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Edison Puzzle Labs" by Edison Puzzle Labs LLC in Los Angeles
review: Super fun! It was set up in my living room and I did it with three of my young adult friends. It was challenging and I enjoyed the theme of it.
