Not creepy at all, and you felt like you were a part of the time period of Edison. It was cool to see how even though it only happened in one room, there were some awesome surprises along the way. I would definitely recommend this to do for a party or even a staff team-building event day!

room_title: Escape room "Lab Rat" by Hatch Escapes in Los Angeles
review: Lab Rat was a very unique and entertaining escape room. The story and room were very well done. The room is challenging but flows well with one of the most unique layouts I've seen. The staff was great and friendly. We did the room with 8, and I think 6 would have been more ideal but all of us had an equal amount of fun. And that's not to say the room can't be done with a wide range of group sizes. I'm looking forward to the next Hatch Escapes room that's designed.

room_title: Escape room "Lab Rat" by Hatch Escapes in Los Angeles
review: This is not an escape room. This is the Disneyland-of-puzzle-adventures for adults. We have done dozens of escape rooms -- including some really great ones-- and by far, Lab Rats is beyond the best, and creates a whole new category of escape rooms. This is a totally different experience, and it will spoil all other escape room experiences for you. To call it "immersive" is a gross understatement. There are endless surprises and loads of fun gags. We can't wait for your next room, Hatch Escapes!

room_title: Escape room "Lab Rat" by Hatch Escapes in Los Angeles
review: Between my husband and I, we have tried more than 10 escape rooms and Lab Rat was by far the best experience we've had. It is a totally immersive game, the props and puzzles were clever and intuitive. It had our whole group yelling and back and forth - amazing concept and production! Can't wait for their next room!

room_title: Escape room "Orient Express" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Back for the second time around and this time we did the Orient Express room! We escaped this room with 15 minutes left to spare. Although most of the puzzle are just basic locks and keys, this room uses some more higher tech puzzles than the Houdini room. With that being said I thought that the difficulty level was about same between both. There are lots of puzzles that keep you moving and thinking the entire time and there is never a dull moment. We did have to use our hints and the GM did a great job of pointing us in the right direction yet not blatantly giving us the answer, which I appreciate. 	I am also happy to report that the rooms now have countdowns them! Also the staff is still as amazing and friendly as they were last time. They do a great job explaining the rooms backstory, the rules, and ways to get help if you need it. This time we even got to see some magic tricks while we were waiting for our room. 	If you are looking for an escape room to do that is well themed and well priced, I highly recommend Theme Quest! Can’t wait to go back for the Bonnie and Clyde room!

room_title: Escape room "Orient Express" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My friends and I decided to do the Orient Express room last minute and I am so glad we did. We had just finished a room somewhere else that didn't quite fulfill our puzzle solving needs and found Theme Quest by chance. The room was full of fun, creative and interactive puzzles. I am very excited to try their other rooms. The hosts were friendly and Joseph, the magician, was awesome.

room_title: Escape room "Orient Express" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Took my office here for a team building, holiday event. Did the Murder on Orient Express room. Super fun! People were super nice. While we waited we were entertained with magic tricks. Overall it was a great experience and the staff was great!

room_title: Escape room "Orient Express" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've done a good 30+ escape rooms and this one is a great example of one where good puzzles mean the rooms don't have to have a million bells and whistles and unreliable technology. We did the Orient Express room and we were definitely impressed by how much they managed to fit into this small room. We had just come off a room at a different company that was very spacious and had many rooms and lots of fancy technology, but we felt like solving the puzzles required too much guesswork and not enough logic. After that, this room was a total breath of fresh air. The staff was also super helpful and friendly. Magic tricks in the lobby was a fun bonus too! Definitely will be going back to try their other rooms. They also said they are expanding, which is great, because this place definitely has a lot of potential.

room_title: Escape room "Aunt Debbie's Apartment" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: Absolutely loved it!!!Well done!Already booked my next adventure!10 out of 10

room_title: Escape room "Aunt Debbie's Apartment" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: first of all ive done alot of escape room i did two here very!!! good room your going to love ! very nice and clean rooms . good location has parking . the tall dude is very nice a must try open late on a week day i promise your going to love it :)

room_title: Escape room "Aunt Debbie's Apartment" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: We just did debbies apartment escape room it was great .we had so much fun really creative ideas .we were a group of 5   had so much they have a couple more room definitely going back to do another room all the locks were working good

room_title: Escape room "FBI Interview" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Amazing! My husband and I had been talking about going to an escape room for a while now. We were on vacation and decided to try it out. We did the FBI Interview and had soooooo much fun. So much, that we immediately did The Heist right after we were done. Puzzles are challenging but not impossible. There is also hints given if you are ever completely stuck. Would definitely recommend. Staff is very personable.

room_title: Escape room "FBI Interview" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Definitely a 5-star experience. FBI interview was the bomb. We will be back definitely!!!

room_title: Escape room "FBI Interview" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Went here for a team building activity with 6 co-workers and it was great! We did the FBI room and it was fun and challenging. They also have earlier times (before 5) so it was perfect for leaving work a little early. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "FBI Interview" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: The FBI room is my favorite, but each room is fantastic! We have done close to 40 rooms now and nobody can match the room quality and friendly service that the guys at Riddle provide. We happily paid full price even when other rooms had discounts because the experience they provide is so much better! I can't wait for their 4th room to open!

room_title: Escape room "FBI Interview" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Did the FBI room with a team of friends from Arizona Camp Sunrise. Not only did we genuinely enjoy every second of the challenge, but we also found the owner, Tolga, to be an incredibly kind and generous guy. He helped us come up with some ideas so we can bring these types of puzzles back to our campers this summer.When you find something that is both highly entertaining and that is run by amazing people, you don't hesitate. You book your group ASAP!

room_title: Escape room "Atlantis" by Top Tier Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: We played the Atlantis room and really enjoyed it! Our group had 2 enthusiasts and 2 first-timers, and the room kept us all engaged and properly challenged as we progressed. The design of the room is super cool and fun, and the puzzles are clever and unique. I would recommend this room for enthusiasts and newcomers alike. Can't wait to play the next room here!

room_title: Escape room "Atlantis" by Top Tier Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: Really enjoyed the first room up here. Atlantis is unique, provides challenge and ample enjoyment to go with it. Our group of 4 enthusiasts were impressed with what is cooking up here at this newly opened venue. Nothing better to see than quality rooms joining the community with humble and customer-first owners.  Keep up the good work looking forward to the bright future of Top Tier Escaperoom!

room_title: Escape room "Atlantis" by Top Tier Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: Top Tier was so much fun! I highly recommend Atlantis! It was very creative and well done! Our family really enjoyed it! It was just hard enough to make us all dig deep and exercise our minds! It was fun to see everyone using their strengths to find clues! Great fun!!

room_title: Escape room "A Winter Fall" by Bakersfield Escape Room in Bakersfield
review: Something new and exciting, that keeps you thinking and wanting more time. Funnest place I've been to in awhile... Check this place out. More rooms coming soon

room_title: Escape room "A Winter Fall" by Bakersfield Escape Room in Bakersfield
review: What a great addition to Bakersfield! So much fun. Stop what ever you are doing and go play these rooms right now. Go!

room_title: Escape room "A Winter Fall" by Bakersfield Escape Room in Bakersfield
review: It was a lot of fun, it's just hard enough to keep you from winning too quickly but if you get too stuck they help you out. It's really cool the way it's planned. I will definitely be going again very soon. Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "A Winter Fall" by Bakersfield Escape Room in Bakersfield
review: What a great experience we had! Winters fall was a challenge worth taking. All of us enjoyed the thrill of escaping. We can't wait to take on another challenge.

room_title: Escape room "A Winter Fall" by Bakersfield Escape Room in Bakersfield
review: This was a fun experience! We worked together as a team and had to use our brains and be creative! Definitely something new and fun to try!

room_title: Escape room "A Winter Fall" by Bakersfield Escape Room in Bakersfield
review: What a great addition to Bakersfield! So much fun. Stop what ever you are doing and go play these rooms right now. Go!

room_title: Escape room "A Winter Fall" by Bakersfield Escape Room in Bakersfield
review: Absolutely excellent. Whether with your family, friends, or co-workers this place is a BLAST!!! Professional and courteous staff. Highly recommend everyone try it!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Brown's Manor" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: Went here with friends and played Dr. Brown's Manor. We were kind of intimidated by the low success rate. It was super challenging but very fun. I don't want to give too much away but the puzzles were well thought out and well designed. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Brown's Manor" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: Chose the most challenging room, Dr. Brown's Manor for our first ever escape room. It was challenging!! We went as a group of 7 and was given an hour. I need to know the end - what happened to Dr Brown! I'm down to try again soon!!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Brown's Manor" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: A lot of fun, super nice staff! Would definitely go again to try out The Vault.

room_title: Escape room "King Tut's Treasure" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: Sooooo fun!! Definitely start with King Tut's room if it's your first time. When they say easy it just means least difficult. Great for friends or work.

room_title: Escape room "King Tut's Treasure" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: Took the Escape Modesto challenge with some friends a couple of weeks ago. We did the King Tut room. Not to give much away but it was fun and very very challenging. We felt a little silly asking for help but fortunately the voice on the other end got us through the tough parts without giving anything away. Highly recommend if you have a mixed group of fun brainiacs, however you don't need to be a genius to contribute but being clever definitely helps. Can't wait to try the next rooms!

room_title: Escape room "King Tut's Treasure" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: My wife and I went to Escape Modesto for the first time on Saturday. It was our first attempt at an escape room so we tried King Tuts Tomb. We had so much fun. Katie was so professional and did a great job explaining the rules and how best to work together. Even though we were playing with several groups of strangers we worked well with each other and most importantly had a blast. Definitely will be back to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "King Tut's Treasure" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: We had a great time and a great experience! The staff is very friendly and professional. This is a Must if you live in the Central Valley. We are diffinly comming back.

room_title: Escape room "King Tut's Treasure" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: We had a blast doing this. We did king tut and we made it out with a minute to spare! Next up is the prison room. We will be going back. If you haven't done this you need to!

room_title: Escape room "Secret Mission" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The Secret Mission and Lunar Mission are really great intricate puzzles. The story and way you get through the rooms is refreshingly different. They do a few things other escape rooms don't to make you feel completely immersed.

room_title: Escape room "Secret Mission" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Spy - Barely just a fortnight old, the production for this is the best in my opinion, edging out the castle by a bit. Stepping through the door, you really do get a feel as if you're in a 70s-80s apartment with puzzles cleverly lining throughout the room. The puzzles also blend together well, along with neat uses of several everyday items. Digging the vibe of this room.

room_title: Escape room "Secret Mission" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My friends and I signed up for the Hotel Escape and were pretty disappointed with the experience, but were told afterward it was the easiest and dullest one to choose.  So we signed up for a later experience where you have to discover the identity of a Russian Spy.  That experience was AWESOME! The rooms were decked out in 60s mid century modern and everything about the clues and room made you feel like you were really into the story.  Even the guy who set us up intro'd it well.  Will definitely be going back to do some of their other more challenging ones!

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter's Tea Party" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: This was my first escape room. There were 10 of us in total, which made it a little too crowded. We made it out with 14 minutes to spare, so I'd suggest fewer people. It was definitely a good first room, and I enjoyed all the puzzles!

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter's Tea Party" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: I took my two daughters and granddaughter to the Mad Hatter room yesterday and we had a blast! Highly recommend! It was a challenge but we escaped!!

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter's Tea Party" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Took my daughter and some of her friends today for her 13th birthday. We escaped with 23 seconds to spare. Everyone had a blast and our Control Master Tony K. was awesome. Would definitely recommend them and am looking forward to trying out another room (we did the Mad Hatter room).

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter's Tea Party" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: I went yesterday for a team building activity with some of my co workers. We did the mad hatters tea room and it was sooooooo much fun. I would recommend everyone come and experience the escape room!!!!The owner and her husband were sooooooo sweet. I look forward to going back really soon.

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter's Tea Party" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We did the Mad Hatter's Tea Party w/ a group of 6th grade girls for my daughter's birthday. The room monitor did an excellent job of not helping too much and gave clues when we needed them that still kept it challenging for the girls.....not too easy, but not too hard! Great experience for them!

room_title: Escape room "Mad Hatter's Tea Party" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Nice, clean location. Great, friendly staff. Mad Hatter's Tea Room was an excellent challenge. We had a group of 8 and managed to get out with some time remaining. I've been to other escape rooms and this is my favorite so far. They pay attention to detail, not just in the room but the overall company. I will most certainly return and try out their other rooms. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Baker Street Mystery" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: This place was awesome! I am an avid escape room attendee and I thought this place was so well put together. The puzzles were challenging and the room was great! (We did the Baker Street one). I was just here to visit, but when I come back I will definitely be coming back!! Also, the staff was so helpful and nice!

room_title: Escape room "Baker Street Mystery" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: The Baker Street Mystery room was the 23rd room for my husband and me, and it did not disappoint! It was definitely a challenging room but not impossible. The owner/game host was really nice, he even stopped the clock when he had to come in and assist with a lock that wouldn't open even though we had the right combination. It was a fun little stop on our vacation, we will come back to try their other rooms the next time we come out to Palm Springs.

room_title: Escape room "Baker Street Mystery" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: This place is awesome! It was so much fun! You guys should try the Baker Street challenge, it's a challenge!

room_title: Escape room "Baker Street Mystery" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: This was so much fun! Came for a bachelorette party of four girls, and all newbies to the escape room phenom. We were nervous because we didn't know what to expect, especially when the guy told us we picked the hardest room (Baker Street Mystery). But it was a BLAST! And it was challenging without being impossible, really had to use your brain but it was exciting and fun! Would love to come back to try the other rooms! A definite must do! :)

room_title: Escape room "Baker Street Mystery" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: What a great time! Even tho we didn't "win" by the time limit, it was so much fun. I will definitely be trying the other rooms. Baker Boys was the one I did.....very hard!

room_title: Escape room "The Ghost of Mentryville" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had a double date here last week and we had a great time! 5 stars from start to finish.  We got a little lost (note 405B is NOT next to 405A). We called and the front desk girl ran out and flagged us down.  My husband and I had done escape rooms before, but our friends had not. The girl who checked us in was very clear with her instructions and answered all questions.  She definitely made them feel more comfortable with the game.  I know it can be intimidating for people who don't know what to expect! We did the Mentryville escape room.  It was SO much fun, and I was really proud of our completion. First of all, thank goodness 4 people are the max. I have been to an escape room around the same size where they stuffed 8 people in and I honestly thought I would pass out. The puzzles were ingenious! And I have to say the ghost (Tony/Samuel) was excellent.  We would highly recommend this escape room and we look forward to doing another one sometime soon.

room_title: Escape room "The Ghost of Mentryville" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We loved the Ghost of Mentryville. It was part escape room and part interactive theater. Our "live" host helped guide us through the adventure. In some rooms, the live actor either jump scares you or gives you hints. The actor in this room really is part of the room and sets the eerie, but not scary mood.  The puzzles and tasks in this room are clever and some of the best integrated I have seen and experienced in any room. The set pieces and narration transport you to places well beyond the confines of the room itself and your imagination fleshes out even more details.  There is no strict time limit for this room and the guidance is generous. There is an urgency to complete this room because of the need to resolve situations and close the loop. Good things come in small escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Ghost of Mentryville" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Wow! Just finished The Ghost of Mentryville & it was incredible! Ghost story telling at its best, brilliant use of a prop! Clever, creepy and very original. Enjoyed the immersive element & not feeling the urgency to rush through it, but still enjoyed the excitement of progressing through the story. We loved everything about this experience!

room_title: Escape room "Blood on the Bayou" by Fort Smith Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: We tried the Espionage room. It was a great experience for our first escape room try. The kids enjoyed helping with the clues. We all worked together and used our 3 hint helps to escape.

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: We had a great time !!!! Escaped "Espionage" with approx 20 seconds left. A lot more challenging than we anticipated. We will definitely go back soon to attempt Lost Cabin. Highly recommend these guys at Escape Room ... Great overall experience

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: We had an awesome time! We did the Espionage room. I highly recommend it to anyone who likes to solve puzzles. We can't wait to do another one!

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: We loved the escape room! We did the espionage room, and it was a lot of fun! It keeps you thinking and putting together clues you find the entire time! Can't wait to try out their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: Had a great time at the Escape Room!! We escaped the Espionage Room with 19 seconds left. This is a great place for family & friends. Staff was friendly & helpful throughout the experience. Looking forward to returning to try out the Cabin Room.

room_title: Escape room "Jailbreak" by Flagstaff Escape Space in Flagstaff
review: The staff was incredibly accommodating with our development budget, as well as time availability and the rooms were a great experience for many of our staff members- especially those who have never done escape rooms before.Thanks so much for having us!

room_title: Escape room "Jailbreak" by Flagstaff Escape Space in Flagstaff
review: This place is awesome!!! Great quality rooms! They were so detailed and they were very challenging. We signed up for the jail break room which was crazy hard but soooo much fun I would totally recommend even if you can't make it out. We didn't and had so much fun we decided to do another room. We did the saloon room also which was awesome!!! You get unlimited hints but they make you wait at least ten min to try and work together. Great for team building. Our team, karly and Brooke, were outstanding and so helpful! They walked us through the rooms when we didn't get it and answered all questions we had. This was my first experience and it was a great one thanks t this place and these ladies!

room_title: Escape room "The Manor" by The Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Our group of 5 did The Manor a few weeks ago. It is a good mix of tech and traditional code/key locks. There are some reveals and elements that are reminiscent of the Haunted Mansion and The Munsters(for Boomers like me). Costumes(optional) are provided and add some comic relief and role playing aspects to this room. There are a few clues that are a little confusing, even after a hint. All in all, the three room here are definitely worth doing and are distinctively different experiences.

room_title: Escape room "SUBmerged" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My family and I did the "SUBmerged" escape room and it was so much fun! Although we faced some challenges along the way, we were able to complete the escape room with some help. I will definitely be back! Alexandra really made it so much more enjoyable. She was attentive and enthusiastic, you can tell she really enjoys her job.

room_title: Escape room "SUBmerged" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I love this place. We've done all 3 of their rooms and SUBmerged is for sure my favorite! Plenty to do and there's a nice mix of technology and hands on locks. The theme is well thought out and present throughout. Looks great and was fun to play!

room_title: Escape room "SUBmerged" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Went here with a group of my friends for my birthday. We all had never done an escape room before, but we ended up picking the hardest room: SUBmerged. It was really difficult.... but we had a blast! Alex was great and made the whole experience even better. Will be coming back!!

room_title: Escape room "Th3 C0d3" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: The bank heist room was nice because it involved more props and physical activity than just writing down numbers and opening locks. The decorations were also great. Way too small for 12 people though, and a bit hot inside the room.

room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: Meets the excellent standard of a great escape room. We did the Western Bank Heist with a group of 8. Apparently their hardest room! We had a good flow going, but for anyone you needs it you can get hints - of course their eyes and ears are on you the entire hour. Really cool system - one of the mirrors actually doubled as a TV for typed hints. With a little boost on the most embarrassing ones to miss, we were able to get out with less than five minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: We had our own group of 12 and chose the Bank Heist room. It was a blast!!! We all had so much fun that we can't wait to book another adventure here. I highly recommend it for something fun and different to do.

room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: So fun, we did the Western Bank Heist room and it was a blast. Excited to try the other rooms too. For sure recommend this as a fun date night with friends or other couples!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Huntsville in Huntsville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: Best escape room in Tucson!After we finished the Zombie room, we immediately reserved the Bank room. The difficulty was just right and it did not require too much math to solve. We had so much fun there and we will definitely come back !

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: My pals and I had a great time at FITB. We went twice in out weeklong trip, completing both rooms. Personally we thought the bank was more fun, but the Zombie room was great too. The two owners are extremely nice, and created a creative atmosphere that we were all mesmerized by. Props to you Mr. Fox.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: Such a fun experience to do with friends!!! We had an amazing time and got to the diamonds with about 3 minutes to go! Highly recommending and looking forward to going back!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: My boyfriend and I came out for a date night and it was so much fun! The owners are a lovely couple that are passionate about what they have created. Would highly recommend this for a date night or fun night out with friends!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Robbery" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: What fantastic game rooms they have! We really enjoyed doing both rooms this weekend. What we especially like about them is that they were 100% different and had a great variation of puzzles and clues. These were out 20th and 21st escape rooms and we will recommend it to everyone we know!

room_title: Escape room "Chocolate Factory" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: My husband and I recently did Escape Room 101's newest room-The Chocolate Factory. This was our first game since doing 3 lackluster rooms in Socal. We were not disappointed. Lots of puzzles and games to stimulate the "little grey cells". Our gamemaster was Sean who, as always, was a great clue giver. He made our visit fun and worthwhile. (Thx, Sean!) The room was family friendly, bright, colorful and fun. After the experience, we signed up to do the VR escape room for my husband's birthday next month. We can't wait! We highly recommend this business as "must-do" to locals and travelers alike.

room_title: Escape room "When Worlds Collide" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: I have now completed all the rooms they have at 3rd Day (for now!!) and I have to say that I love the new rooms. The asymmetrical racing room When Worlds Collide is such a fun competition. Be sure to get enough people to split into two groups because the racing component is incredibly enticing. But make sure to double book so the teams can switch rooms and do it again! I seriously loved both "worlds" so much that I would have been disappointed had we not done both in one day. Cool theming. Clever puzzles. Fun competition. The owner and all the staff are incredibly kind and welcoming.

room_title: Escape room "When Worlds Collide" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: 4.5 starsWe had a smaller group this time (4) compared to to our usual escape group but that wasn't going to stop us! The fates of two realms hung in the balance! We also happened to have two 13 year olds with us and one of them had no experience in escape rooms so we wanted a place that would be a good introduction. I was intrigued by the asymmetrical set up of the When Worlds Collide room. So much that it overcame my worries that it would be too much for an inexperienced player and such a small group. Without giving anything away, this particular game is set up so that two groups can play against each other! One in the "Fantasy realm" and one in "Reality". Its essentially the same story, and the groups don't really interact with each other except for the fact that only one realm can be triumphant. Other escape rooms I've played with two separate groups I'd consider a parallel setup because both groups play two copies of the same room, and whichever group finishes first wins. Here, whoever finishes first wins but the two rooms are completely different so if you are so inclined, you can come back and play the other side so try to avoid spoilers after your post game sharing! All this makes When World's collide a great option for a large group. Up to twelve people can play (6 in each realm). Or even as small a group as ours with some experienced players (2 in each realm). Or take your normal group and play each side on different occasions, that's an option as well! Thanks to our game master Chris for explaining and giving us our clues. We had a great time! The only thing that we noticed is that the temp could get a bit hot in the rooms so dress appropriately! I found that we were concentrating on our mission so intently that it wasn't all that of an inconvenience but I'm sure some would like to know.

room_title: Escape room "When Worlds Collide" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: I was in a group of 6 who did the When Worlds Collide room. We split into two groups of 3 and competed against each other - one group in fantasy and one in reality. We had so much fun that we went back the next night to compete again, with the teams switching rooms. I did the reality room the first night, which I thought was a bit more challenging than the fantasy room. We were on the last puzzle when the time ran out. The group in the fantasy room still had several puzzles left to get through. The 2nd night I did the reality room and we made it out with 12 minutes to spare. We had such a great time in both rooms, and the girls who worked there were fantastic. I don't want to say too much and give anything away, but if you have a large group I highly recommend checking out When Worlds Collide!

room_title: Escape room "The Curiosity Shop" by Wizards & Wires Studios in Redlands
review: This is an incredible escape room. A bit creepy with great ambiance. A room full of antiques and mysterious artifacts. Some have meanings and others are for show. No hints or clues here. Just a great hour of enjoyment and surprises!

room_title: Escape room "The Curiosity Shop" by Wizards & Wires Studios in Redlands
review: Just got done with this escape room. It was an awesome experience and highly recommend it. None of us have been before and had a blast. This was our first time and we are excited to do more!

room_title: Escape room "The Curiosity Shop" by Wizards & Wires Studios in Redlands
review: Soooo amazing!!! We had the best time and cant wait to come back! Well worth the money and not far!! Totally creeped us out and was just hard enough to make it amazing!!!! THANK YOU!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Curiosity Shop" by Wizards & Wires Studios in Redlands
review: This place is PHENOMENAL! Our group of 4 had a blast! It was our first time doing an escape room, and we are now hooked. Very interactive and a lot of clues to look for. We finished with just under 8 minutes to spare. Staff was awesome and friendly. Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "The Row" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: We had a great time you would not believe where the clues were the staff was great very nice and helpful and  Iris was my new found friend she was great a played along

room_title: Escape room "The Row" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: Such a fun-filled time with my friends! The staff was so friendly and attentive! I had the best time and can’t wait to come back again!

room_title: Escape room "The Row" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: Really clever puzzles and wonderful staff!

room_title: Escape room "The Row" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: High quality rooms provide the top of the line escape room experience!!! The staff are super friendly and professional!!! Definitely put this on your to do list if you're looking for a unique and thrilling experience!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Al Capone" by The Experience Escape Rooms in Centerton
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Science Fair: Spells & Potions" by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge" by Brainy Actz in Los Angeles
review: This is only the second escape room ive done but it I've definitely got the bug now. A friend and I did the Mystery Lodge room. It was certainly a challenge with just two of us, but our guide, Adam, did a great job of laying out the scenario and giving us hints that were juuust enough to keep us going without feeling like we were having our hands held. He definitely helped draw us into the experience with his intro.I was very surprised by the quality of the room as well. Wherever I expected something go be a bit 'low budget', I was pleasantly wrong. There is a lot of thought and effort to making a lot of these secret hatches cool and surprising. Just when I thought something was only another decoration, a puzzle would pop it open.The whole place was clean and professional too. A definite thumbs up, and ill be back for sure with more people to try one of the larger rooms.Thanks again Adam!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge" by Brainy Actz in Los Angeles
review: Had so much fun today.  Did the Mystery at Lost Point Lodge room with family and friends.Ok so we were more like a bunch of bumbling fools but we did figure out some clues on our own.   Wow Bobby and Monica were fun, friendly and professional.  Will be coming back again to try different rooms.The Ceniceros and Merlin family.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery at the Lost Pointe Lodge" by Brainy Actz in Los Angeles
review: My family and I escaped the Mystery at the Lost Point Lodge. When I first walked in, the room felt very authentic, the sounds, the props made me feel like I was in a lodge. The things we had to figure out and find was fun. It was a great experience overall and I hope to go back soon to escape some of their other puzzle rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: The Breakout Games franchise in Gulf Shores met the same expectations of quality and fun as the St. Louis location. The staff was great and the Hostage Room (which was on our list for our next visit in St. Louis) was a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: We played Hostage last night while on vacation and had an awesome time. It was definitely challenging and we almost made it out of the room! Customer service was excellent. I would definitely recommend doing this to a group of people looking for something different and fun to do besides the normal Mini Gulf/Go-Cart scene. Thanks for the great time!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: So much fun and quite challenging! We "broke out" of Hostage with 45 seconds remaining!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: We loved this adrenaline pumping experience! It was very difficult but we Broke Out with only 45 seconds to spare. We did the hostage room and truly enjoyed it! Would definitely go again! Jessica was great!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: I highly recommend this to anyone visiting the area. Wow this was a blast. My family did Hostage and was within a minute from solving the puzzle and breaking out. Great staff and very helpful!!!! I would definitely do this again went in Orange Beach

room_title: Escape room "Clancey's Lodge" by Next-Gen Escape in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Containment Breach" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: This place is very well done! Super awesome experience! Our team was able to Escape the Containment Breach with quite a few minutes to spare, but don't let this fool you into thinking that it was in any way easy! Puzzles were great and stayed on theme, ambiance was cool and well manufactured, and the people were fun and just as excited as we were when we completed it! Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Containment Breach" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Planned a family fun night here with our kids 18yrs to 26yrs old. We had an absolute blast!!! This was the first escape room experience for all of us, and we had so much fun...... And we were able to successfully complete the Containment Room. Will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Containment Breach" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Decided to book last minute with my boyfriend. The staff was friendly and the place was clean (and the mood lighting was the perfect touch). We escaped the Containment Breech room. It is honestly all about the puzzles but the storyline and theatrics/special effects were what put this location over the Top.

room_title: Escape room "Containment Breach" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: This was my first escape room ever (Containment Breach). My friends and I had a blast. It was a great time, puzzle difficulties were perfextly balanced for our group, ambiance was great. Can't wait to come back and try Whispering Halls.

room_title: Escape room "Containment Breach" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: I have done many escape rooms, and this was by far one of the most well crafted. The physical puzzles were custom made and high quality. I did this room with 7 of my middle school gifted students, and one other teacher. We were able to escape, but don't be fooled - this room is challenging, but the right kind of challenging, and creepy, but not too scary. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Beta Labs" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: These rooms are fantastic. They are well thought out, challenging, and rewarding. Captain Lockjaw, Madame Lumina, and the Pearled Pachyderm are really great for first timers or experienced puzzle room fans. The Beta Lab room is simply challenging - no antics, no frills, just boxes, locks, and puzzles so I don't recommend it for people looking for the more engaging/ theatrical experience. All in all, we were thrilled with all of these rooms and would gladly revisit if and when a new room is created.

room_title: Escape room "Beta Labs" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: My group and I had a great time! Unfortunately, the Beta Labs room got the best of us and we couldn't get out lol! Well be back soon :) This was my very first escape room and it was amazing, couldn't have asked for a better experience!

room_title: Escape room "Beta Labs" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: We tried the Beta Labs for the nephew's birthday. So much fun, even though we missed escaping by just a couple locks!

room_title: Escape room "Beta Labs" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: So much fun. Four of us took on the Beta Labs room and we had a blast and even made it out alive. It was challenging, rewarding and required a complete team effort. Looking forward to escaping another room again soon.

room_title: Escape room "Sound Escape" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: My group did the Sound Escape challenge and it was amazing! Everything was so unique and challenging. It really made you think. The developer/owner was extremely nice and very good at what he does and creates! I highly recommend not just the one escape room but all this place has to offer!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Option" by ESC Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: AWESOME escape room!  Great puzzles and art direction.

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Option" by ESC Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So... We did Esc Escape Rooms "Nuclear Option" last night and it was amazing. I haven't seen much discussion about this one in my Facebook escape room groups, but it's in a double wide shipping container in North Hollywood behind a tiny community theater. Room was super fun, creative, and the owner Rick was a hoot. Highly recommended. This one deserves more way attention from the community. I've done more than 100 rooms worldwide, and this is one of the more memorable ones. Superbly well executed and staged. Check it out!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Option" by ESC Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: SO FUN!!!! Its was kinda sketchy at first then we went it and it was AMAZING!! My favorite escape room by far.

room_title: Escape room "Beyond Medusa's Gate VR" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Red Door was a ton of fun! We went for our second escape room there and ended up doing a VR experience this time around. Medusa's gate was one of the COOLEST experiences I've ever been in. Mary was the one that helped us get started and she was the sweetest person ever. So helpful during the game as well. After the fact, Kevin was able to help us wrap up and was super enthusiastic as well. Glad I'm a part of their loyalty program. :)

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: This review comes from a group that has completed about 20 escape rooms across the nation, including in cities such as Orlando, St. Louis, Las Vegas. We have encountered some so-so rooms, some decent rooms, and some amazing rooms. What we LOVE - They don’t mix you with strangers in the rooms! That is awesome! This room, the Zombie Lab, was a little bit of a disappointment for us. We had previously done, over several years, both the Bank Heist and the Western room at this venue. The western themed room has the best theming of them all, as it is the most immersive, though even there you’ll see odds and ends that appear to be incomplete, like a certain ceiling tile installation/work-around that looks sloppy.  First off - TONS of locks. Locks, locks, locks! That is typical of many entry-level rooms. The puzzles ARE fun, but not many of the puzzles relate to the stories! It seems like the rooms are decorated, and then filled with a hodgepodge of random puzzles that don’t actually contribute to the theme or the story. You’re walking around thinking, “How is this puzzle related to the story at all?”  Another aspect that is a bit of a letdown: Having to watch an intro video in the lobby in front of other groups. It’s just awkward standing around a television next to the counter to watch a poorly written (and full of grammatical errors and misspellings!) video before entering the room. Lastly, it would be nice if the employees conveyed some enthusiasm for the job at hand. The instruction segment given to each group by the employee is too long and rushed. It’s a LOT of talking for them, and they talk fast to get through it, which is just annoying for everybody. The instructions should be more concise. Our favorite to least favorite room at his ensue: #1 Wild West (We were told the owners built this one themselves - They’ve obviously learned a lot from running the other two rooms) #2 The Bank Robbery #3 Zombie Lab

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: I took my 18 year old son and niece to the Zombie Lab. We had a great time and can't wait to try another scenario.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: Thank you so much. We had such a good time. The owners really set us up to have the best experience possible. It made my weekend to save the world from Zombies with my smart friends. Your welcome world! I called my buddy who has an events group on my way back to town from Phoenix to tell them have your groups drive 2 hours to this one. Its worth it. Awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: We went for our 1st wedding anniversary and it was PERFECT! We did the zombie lab and it was everything we wanted it to be! My favorite part was all of the special effects... it was really immersive! We can't wait to go back to do the Bank Robbery room! Thanks for an epic experience!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: The most immersive and thrilling experience in town! I have competed in both the rooms (escaped successfully once) and in both cases had an amazing time that I am still talking about with my friends. Cannot recommend enough, whether it be with friends, family, or co-workers, you will love it!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: As someone who has done multiple "Escape the rooms" before, this was the most dynamic and exciting one I've done so far! We did the "find the zombie cure" one and it had so many exciting and interesting aspects that it kept us all on our feet. I can't recommend this place highly enough! It's the most fun when you go with everyone you know so make sure you bring five other people!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: I've never done an escape room before so when my sister and I saw it pop up on Facebook we immediately wanted to do it. We booked 6 people for the Zombie Lab and completed it today at noon and finished the room with 14:15 left! It was very fun, had us working together and the puzzles were great. Definitely want to go back already and try the bank heist room, this place was great! It's even cuter because it's ran by a Husband and his Wife, they were extremely nice.

room_title: Escape room "The Inventor's Workshop" by Mountain Room Escapes in Big Bear City
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Treasure Island" by ALL IN Adventures in Tuscaloosa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Horror Hotel" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: Had a Blast! Horror Hotel Rocks! Racked my brain, and everybody in our group had a great time. A lot of laughs with great friends.

room_title: Escape room "Horror Hotel" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: My wife and I went today for the first time and tried the horror hotel themed room! Would definitely recommend to anyone who is looking for a fun time! It was worth every penny paid!

room_title: Escape room "Horror Hotel" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: My boyfriend and I went for our 5 year anniversary! We went in the horror hotel with 3 other girls and it was SUCH a blast!!! The room was so carefully planned out and was really a great challenge! I would recommend anyone to go! Such a sweet and caring staff, as well! Thank you breakout for such an amazing experience! So worth the money!!

room_title: Escape room "Horror Hotel" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: This was such a fun interactive activity, so much better than a movie or eating out! I will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Horror Hotel" by Breakout in Tuscaloosa
review: It was a blast!! I can't wait to go back. The staff was extremely friendly!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: Had a great experience! Loved the puzzles & rooms & great staff! Really clean & fun & whimsical! The upsidedown photo at the end was different too!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: This is a cool place.  It is such a unique and creatively decorated space- the details really draw you in.  We arrived the 15 minutes early as you are supposed to and were greeted by the owner.  She was super friendly, energetic and you could tell that this place was a passion project for her and her husband.  She chatted us up about their business and we could tell that a lot of planning went into the whole thing.A few minutes later her husband and our game master walked us through our scenario for "Spellbound".   My hubby and I were the only two slotted for this spot.  That was a good thing since others were supposed to be with us and the room was a small space.  I am glad we didn't have other people in there or we would have been a bit crammed.  The room was neat.  It had a good combination of technology, quirkiness, puzzles and good old need for attention to details.  We have done about 10 escape rooms between us before this one and it was thoughtfully created and a good level of difficulty.  We made it out with 4 minutes to go too!  It is definitely worth the visit.  I can't wait to check out one of their other rooms next time we are in town!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: This is a must-do in Monterey. It is so fun!! The staff is super friendly and funny as well! We went in to do Alice's Dream. Came with 3 others so we played with 4 total. It was big enough where we all could contribute and find clues. We absolutely loved it. So fun, some really good challenges! We loved it so much that when we went outside and got In the car we all decided we didn't want to leave. So we went back in and played Spell Bound. That one is very good as well! Very tricky. Over all we had SO much fun. Would definitely try their other location on our next trip.

room_title: Escape room "Vacation Vandals" by Key Quest in Modesto
review: We had a great time hanging in the escape room and will totally be back to solve the mystery! We were so very close but needed a bit more time or a couple more heads to put it all together!

room_title: Escape room "The Will" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Was lots of fun. My boyfriend and I were the only ones in the group and we had a fun time solving the room we were in. Great owners. Very nice people

room_title: Escape room "The Will" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience! Highly recommend. It was well thought out and provided a different experience than other room escapes. The story was great! Can't wait to do the other room!

room_title: Escape room "The Will" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Nice birthday adventure! The staff was amazing!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Will" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I had a lot of fun with both their rooms, some clever clues and fantastic puzzles they got.

room_title: Escape room "The Will" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So far I have done 6 Escape Rooms, and Enigma provided the best options BY FAR! Can't wait to go back for their third room! A great way to spend time with friends and family!

room_title: Escape room "The Will" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Two months ago I had stopped by enigma and tried the secret temple with a few friends from work and I had a blast going through the room and solving puzzles! Just came back again last weekend to try out their newest room, the Will, and it really showed me how lacking I am on my puzzle skills, lol.The will had so many things right! Not too many puzzles to manage, but that doesn't mean they won't make your brain hurt in a good way. They also incorporated some really flashy tech that made the next moment thrilling! Now all we have left is to tackle Apartment 205 and we are golden. Can't wait to come back for a third time

room_title: Escape room "The Will" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I had some friends visiting from out of town who didn't want to do the usual tourist thing so we picked Enigma based on the high Yelp reviews. This was our first time trying escape rooms, and we were not disappointed. We went up the stairs of this old school building and were greeted by a friendly host. After some chatting he told us the back story to 'The Will,' their newest room. We went in having read the prologue, but not really knowing what to expect. We were brought into the room and locked inside this beautiful office. The puzzles inside were beautifully integrated  into the story of this rich tycoon and his last wishes.The tech in this room is just awesome!My friends and I really enjoyed the experience and I can't wait to come back to try Enigma's other rooms

room_title: Escape room "The Strange Thing" by Cinema Escape Rooms in Orange County
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: This was by far (and for the moment) the best escape room we did !We did the Asylum and we had so much fun, but not only ! The story is incredible, the decorations so realistic and the puzzles super AMAZING ! We are a bit sad that it is the only escape room we didn't escape (only for 20 seconds). We don't remember the name of the girl that hosted us, but thank you so much for letting us finish the game despite the time that was over.I don't know if it's because it was our very first escape room, but we really had a blast ! We loved the fact that almost all the pieces in the room were to be used, not too much useless information that could lead you to a false way. The story line is amazing, the mood, EVERYTHING !HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !We look forward coming again to LA to try The Basement.Good job guys !

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Looking for something different? You've arrived. Your first puzzle is finding the place. Second puzzle? Parking. After that? You're on your own!! "Vash" will take very good care of you after he leaves you to rot! We will be back for, "The Bunker". "Asylum" was taken down after 58:30 and we loved and languished every second we were inside!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Thanks Celena! We did the bunker & Asylum & it was so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: (No spoilers) Very fun! I did the insane asylum with my girlfriend's family today and we really enjoyed the clever puzzles, creepy ambiance, and fantastic receptionist. The only thing I would change is the size for the price. I totally understand there's only so much that can be done with the size of the house, and while definitely worth it, I think that a larger place with more puzzles and traveling (inside, outside, roof access, adjacent housing, etc.) would really add to the experience. I could definitely see myself spending a bit more for a couple hours in a mansion solving similar puzzles--but that's just me.All that said, this was a whole lot of fun and I will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Amazing time! Can't wait to do the next room!Loved all the little details that went into everything.

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: WOOHOO! We escaped the Asylum and with an additional 20 minutes to spare too!The concept is simple, you and your group of 5 friends are locked in a dark room and you have 1 hour to find a key to escape. The clock counts down and you are left scrambling through props and items in the room to solve puzzles and quizzes in hopes of finding clues to get out. Prior to starting the game, they will go over the rules and have you sign waivers. I've played several escape room games and this one was challenging yet really fun! I would highly suggest it for a first timer player. Tips:-The best way to solve the clues is to work together. I can't stress enough that team work is vital! Keep track of your clues and communicate with everyone so you don't have 5 people looking for the same clues. -Wear comfortable clothes! It can get really hot/cold in the rooms so wear something you feel comfortable moving around in.-Keep hydrated and use the restroom beforehand. You will be LOCKED in the room for an hour!-Be very observant. There's clues everywhere! Look underneath stuff, in cervices, high above you, move things around...etc-Parking is terrible here! We ended up parking right next to the building because we couldn't fit our car in the tiny driveway. Make sure you tell them where you parked your car so you don't get towed.

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Definitely one of the better run puzzle rooms in LA and there are definitely a lot of pretty good ones in the LA area now.  It's a bit hard to find parking on the busy Barham Blvd, but there is street parking if you look for it.I have done both the Asylum and the Bunker rooms and they are both fun in their own way.  Without giving away too much, I liked the puzzles in the Bunker and the atmosphere in the Asylum.  Everything is pretty well thought out.  The hour flies by.  I love the tension and relief of every puzzle.  It's very satisfying to hear that *click* when a lock is open.They have great customer service and guide you through what you need to know about the experience.  I'm definitely ready for the next room!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by PanIQ Escape Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: This was a crazy crazy experience! I loved trying it once but I'm not sure I can do it again. Haha this kind of experience is aimed toward gamers who like to solve puzzles on the spot. I'm the take my time kind of person so this was so fast paced for me. I came here with a group of 6 to try out the Bunker room. Parking is really crazy with a max of three cars pulling into a narrow lane in front of the place. Carpool if you can! Before the craziness starts you get a lot of info and then of goes the timer.I would suggest bringing as many people as possible because you need all the thinking brains! Video gamers highly recommended haha. We all had a lot of fun and were just running all over the place and we were able to solve it under the given time limit. Pretty cool but not the shortest time ever! We were aiming for that of course but not all dreams get fulfilled. Even though I wasn't the main puzzle solver I still had a lot of fun doing this experience. There's a good mix of puzzle solving and just finding clues that there is a lot to do. It's good to try this at once, and if you like it, there are other rooms too!

room_title: Escape room "Kate's Motel" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
review: AMAZING!!!! By far the best Escape rooms out there! Great friendly family owned. Any questions you have they always answer for you. I've done all the rooms. The newest "Kate's Motel" Extremely thought out and fun. Totally makes you feel like your in a real Motel. 10 star plus!!! Sending all my friends and family to try their rooms.

room_title: Escape room "HERO escape room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Had a blast, highly recommend  this place, defiantly coming back to try more of the rooms

room_title: Escape room "HERO escape room" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: What a fun time!! Definitely recommend this place, Stanley helped led us through the Escape room and did a great job. We were nervous going in it would be too hard but it was perfect and a fun time!

room_title: Escape room "Camp Mary Lee" by Nightmare at 3008 in Birmingham
review: A group of us from The Haunt At Camp Liberty came to check it out and had the best time! It was intense and scary and honestly one of the best haunts I've ever been to. They're doing something amazing here. The staff was very friendly and the actors were very skilled! definitely recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Vault" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: We had a blast! Such a nice, friendly staff! Challenging but fun adventure for the whole family!

room_title: Escape room "Vault" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: It was extremely challenging, the perfect birthday gift for my boyfriend!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Vault" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: Auburn Escape Zones is so much fun!! Corrie and Sarah T. are so cool and super sweet! The rooms are so much fun and will puzzle you with all the different clues. Me and some friends have done every room and I would recommend every one of them!! Such a cool thing to do whether it’s rain, shine, or snow.

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: Loved the vault room.. great experience had fun with my fiance and friends . The Staff was awsome , they where so nice and helpful.  Great experience overall I would go back and try the jail one next ..

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: It was Awesome!!! The Ragole's finished with 3 minutes to spare.When we started I was thinking What the heck are we doing.But as we started to work with our team, it all came together.Can't wait for the next room.

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: This escape game was so much fun!! When we got to the place (walking distance from angel city brewery I might add) we were greeted by the owner who was very energetic and excited to get us started. I definitely don't want to give anything away to anyone that hasn't played an escape game, but this was not my first experience with interactive escape puzzles and I can confidently say it was my favorite that I've played.The Alcatraz theme was very well thought out and and after a short briefing of the rules and laying of the settings, our group was in for an intense ride. Our group managed to escape with just minutes to spare only adding to the build up of anxiety of being trapped for life.The owner had mentioned adding another game into the mix in the coming future. He mentioned something about a Bank, so I can't wait until this one opens to play. If you are ever looking for a team building event I would highly recommend this place to any group (or works as a fun date night gentlemen). Had so much fun and it's been the talk at my work for the past week.

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: So much fun. First time doing anything like this and I loved it.

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: So much fun! It was challenging but just the right amount. More witty and exciting than other room escapes I have done. Can't wait to try the new room when it opens!

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: This escape game was so much fun!! When we got to the place (walking distance from angel city brewery I might add) we were greeted by the owner who was very energetic and excited to get us started. I definitely don't want to give anything away to anyone that hasn't played an escape game, but this was not my first experience with interactive escape puzzles and I can confidently say it was my favorite that I've played.The Alcatraz theme was very well thought out and and after a short briefing of the rules and laying of the settings, our group was in for an intense ride. Our group managed to escape with just minutes to spare only adding to the build up of anxiety of being trapped for life.The owner had mentioned adding another game into the mix in the coming future. He mentioned something about a Bank, so I can't wait until this one opens to play. If you are ever looking for a team building event I would highly recommend this place to any group (or works as a fun date night gentlemen). Had so much fun and it's been the talk at my work for the past week.

room_title: Escape room "The Fed" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: We had a blast tonight. We were the first ones to solve the newest room The Fed. It was super challenging but incredibly fun. I encourage everyone to check out Lockdown. You will be hooked and want to do all the rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Fed" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Definitely going again! It's a fun challenge, we did the Federal reserve, next time we are gonna do the Attic. Want to try them all!

room_title: Escape room "The Phantom Soldier" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Phantom Soldier was awesome! Challenging but fair. The room is super decked out compared to other ones I've tried.

room_title: Escape room "The Phantom Soldier" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: The decoration is on point. Staffs are nice. Puzzles are challenging.

room_title: Escape room "The Phantom Soldier" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: This is a great way to have fun with a group of friends! I'm not someone who typically enjoys puzzles, riddles, games, etc., but Square Room Escape has really elevated the experience for me. This is an excellent alternative for when you're looking for something to do and want a different option than going to the movies/bowling/karaoke. The clues are never the same, the rooms are beautifully decorated, and the whole thing from start to finish is very immersive. Definitely go check it out!

room_title: Escape room "The Light Room" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Wonderful experience! We did the Light Room and were impressed by the quality and intricacy of the puzzles. It was made to be solved by a group, so it allowed all eight of us to work together. No one was standing around bored. The puzzles felt cohesive and very carefully crafted. It was great to meet and talk with the designer, Alex, as well! So much fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Light Room" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did The Light Room and got out with 6 seconds to spare. It was great to work together and figure out the clues to successfully finish on our first try. Will definitely go back to try the other room and see if we can conquer that one as well.

room_title: Escape room "The Light Room" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: First time at Nodus805 and went for the Light Room. Alex provided us with a great back story and was very helpful when we needed hints. The room itself was very interesting in the setup and how all the puzzles work together. Can't wait to go back and try the other room.

room_title: Escape room "The Light Room" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My coworkers and I (4 total) did the Lightroom. It was quite challenging and we used the whole hour but completed it! The puzzles were challenging but one or two hints in the right direction help A LOT. Alex at Nodus 805 is a great guy and has done a lot of work to balance the room and provides helpful clear hints if necessary.The ambiance is a little low BUT if there were too many false clues or distractions then it might be too difficult. This was my first escape room but my coworkers had done a few before. I recommend going with a team of more experienced people.

room_title: Escape room "The Light Room" by Nodus 805 Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Our family went there and tried the Light Room - a lot of fun and pretty challenging. Cori at Nodus was great and explained everything clearly before putting us in the room - she also helped by providing 15 minutes updates as to the time remaining (yeah, there is a clock in the room but trust me it is the last thing you'll have time to be looking at).  We had a great time. Next stop - The Study!

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by The Locked Inn in Grover Beach
review: Awesome room! Great experience of all the rooms I've done (about 15). I can't wait until they open back up from this pandemic so I can try their other room! Unique and the flow really keeps you surprised the whole time.

room_title: Escape room "Time Machine" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Shout out to our gamemaster Chelsea for The Psych Ward! This our first visit and we had a blast! Will be back to try another!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Truly a blast! Even though I'm still trapped in the Psych Room. I am definitely coming back to do the others. Thanks Chelsea for your guidance.

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: I was amazed the second I stepped in the room (Psych Ward)! It was awesome and every little detail seems to matter. They will also provide hints through out the game if asked so that's a nice component. We did not escape so we're bound to go back and get a win!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: This was SUCH a great experience! We went with a group of 4 to the Psych Ward and got paired up with a family of 3. It felt a little awkward at first since we had never been and weren't expecting to be working with anyone else, but we quickly got past that and worked together to escape with 5 minutes left. Sooo much fun and I would recommend it to ANYONE who enjoys a good challenge. The staff was amazing, super friendly, and very helpful. I am already looking forward to the next opportunity to get a group together to go!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: My boyfriend's mom booked an escape room for the whole family. We got Psych Ward, which they said has the lowest escape rate of all the rooms.We made it out with 1:43 left! I was really nervous, but it's the quickest hour of your life. Such a thrill! We had 6 people and it felt like the perfect amount. I hope we get to go back soon and do the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Last Experiment" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: This wonderful outfit will submerge you in the world of a creepy supernatural experience. Pay attention, work together and you might just make it out of there...

room_title: Escape room "The Last Experiment" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: This was a great escape room.  Very scary, great use of live actors.  Puzzles were tricky but very doable.  Staff was very helpful and engaging, gave us great advice for additional escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Last Experiment" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: Me and my friends came to do the experiment and Zoe today! I was too afraid to do Zoe but the experiment room was creepy and fun and had a live actor. It had a couple things I've never seen before in previous escape rooms. I wish I was brave enough to do the Zoe room with my friends, but the room looked REALLY scary and fun! The game master was excellent at giving hints and staying in character and made the experience memorable, and he explained the origin of the Zoe story and the rooms! Thank you so much!! I will be back when I am braver!!!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Kindergarten" by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: Super fun and challenging! Will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Kindergarten" by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: I had an awesome time with my friends. We did the escape from kindergarten and it was a blast from beginning to end! The staff was friendly and helpful. The puzzles and clues were challenging, but doable. Every step forward was extremely rewarding and we escaped with under a minute to spare. This was an amazing way to spend an hour with friends and I highly recommend it for families and coworkers as well.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Kindergarten" by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: We did the Kindergarten escape room and had a blast! We had 4 people in our group and then they added one additional person. It was pretty challenging but we laughed the whole way through! Hoping they bring back a Halloween room because we would definitely go again!

room_title: Escape room "Tesla's Mystery" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: One of the best escape rooms we have done! Well designed - really cool wow factor features. We did the Tesla room, which was challenging, but our great host Neg coached us through with some clues for the extra tricky parts! Didn't make it out, but will go back to try another one soon!

room_title: Escape room "Tesla's Mystery" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: We did our first escape room ever today. It was extremely enjoyable and I believe it will soon be an addiction. Great production. Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Tesla's Mystery" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: High quality rooms compared to most I've done, with very unique puzzles. Itching to come back for more!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Outdoors" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Husband and I took 6 grandkids and my daughter and we did the Great Outdoors. We almost made it to the last room. We had so much fun. This year two of the kids are down and the only thing they want to do (besides swimming) is Breaking out of Alcatraz!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Outdoors" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We have done two escape rooms Alcatraz and the great outdoors. Both are amazing the staff is super nice and the rooms are fun and immersive. We will be going back. Thanks guys!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Outdoors" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This was our first escape room experience and we had a great time trying "The Great Outdoors." Some of the challenges came to us quickly and some had us absolutely stumped. You can tell there was a lot of thought put into the scenario.

room_title: Escape room "The Great Outdoors" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Booked this activity for my birthday and had 11 of us playing the Haunted Great Outdoors. Surpassed our expectations as we all were working on various parts of the puzzle to try and get out. It really gets you thinking. In the end, time ran out... but we were soooo close and had a blast! Can't wait to try another room!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Outdoors" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We had such an amazing time! I loved all the hard work and creativity that went into creating our room. The staff was fun and friendly. We will definitely be back for the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Overgrown" by Escape Room Era in Los Angeles
review: Just finished the Overgrown room, it was super fun I highly recommend! The puzzles were fun and the theme was really cool and the time and work that went into making the room you can tell.

room_title: Escape room "The Overgrown" by Escape Room Era in Los Angeles
review: This place was incredible! We did The Overgrown and the puzzles were so well thought out and intuitive. It was very well created in that the room was nicely decorated to the theme and you can tell that the employees really care about the experience. Joe was our guide, and he was so enthusiastic and kind! I am definitely looking forward to coming back and trying the other room they offer!

room_title: Escape room "The Overgrown" by Escape Room Era in Los Angeles
review: Jacob was awesome! Very friendly staff! The Overgrown escape room was good! Very decorative! I'd recommend this room to any group!

room_title: Escape room "The Penitentiary" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: I've been to all three rooms at Omescape, and each room has a very different theme and feel from the other. For me personally the best one was the Penitentiary! It has a very cool laser tunnel and we were separated into two groups and had to work together to rescue the two that were locked up in a room and escaped together. We didn't solve the last puzzle in time to escape but were very close! Highly recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "The Penitentiary" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: I booked a Sunday evening penitentiary game for a group of my smartest friends and we had so much fun! Very engaging and everyone in my group adored it. The Cons:Finding this place takes time.It's in the middle of nowhere.They charge $15 for cutting a cake in the lobby - even if you cleaned after yourself.The Pros:The game is excellent. Play with complete strangers and you'll become close friends at the end of the 60 minutes.

room_title: Escape room "The Penitentiary" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: Completed the penitentiary room. It was super legit and all the items were of quality. Laser, mirrors, secret keys, the works!!! (I promise I doesn't take anything away!). Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Worth the drive up. Will probably come back for another room. Challenging but definitely able to solve it.

room_title: Escape room "The Penitentiary" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: We came here last Friday for a team building exercise. It was really a lot of fun, even though we didn't escape from the penitentiary room. We actually got to the last stage, but just couldn't cross the finish line. However, the journey was much more enjoyable than the final results.

room_title: Escape room "The Penitentiary" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: Room Omega is not so hard (though we still failed to escape), but the Penitentiary is way harder and has more traps and information that try to confuse you. Really enjoyed my experience in Omescape today.

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Mummy" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
