review: Having fun and adventure in one place, Magiq room is what you need. I celebrated my birthday in here and I had so much fun. It was not just an ordinary birthday celebration but also a fun filled adventure time. We tried one of the escape rooms and my friends and I had so much fun escaping out of the room before the time is out. The clues and solving the puzzles made us closer to each other and the team work has unleashed in us. I recommend this place for a great Team Building place, surely your workmates and you will have a great time in here.

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Mummy" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: Finally played Pharoah's Legacy! It's now one of my top 10 favorite rooms! (This was my 73rd room) Even though this place is great for kids and families, both times I've gone has been with adults and we've had a blast.The quality and production value in these rooms are amazing. Especially this room. This is the second pharaoh-themed room I've played and it's beautiful inside. The puzzles are fun and logical. There are physical puzzles and a passageway. I highly recommend this room for anyone. Beginners will have a great time and enthusiasts will enjoy what you get to do in this room.Our Gamemaster, Sophie, was amazing as well! Book them today!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Mummy" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: Birthday party perfection for adults and children alike!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of the Mummy" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: SO MUCH FUN! Mixed group from 10 - 48 years old and we all had a blast in Pharoah's Tomb. Cannot wait to return soon!

room_title: Escape room "13th Room" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: We really enjoyed our time at the 13th room. We will definitely be back. Dio was a great host to our experience!

room_title: Escape room "13th Room" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: First time doing an escape room and the 13th Room was great! Got us hooked! We will definitely be going back to experience the other two rooms.

room_title: Escape room "13th Room" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: Did the original 13th Room and it was such a fun experience. It's challenging but not to the point you can't get most of the clues. Plus, the staff there is awesome.

room_title: Escape room "13th Room" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: The 13th Room was my first escape room experience and I totally enjoyed it. I was a bit freaked out that it would be too scary but not at all. It was just the right amount of creepy to make it fun and exciting. I highly recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Curtain Call" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Red Rum Cottage" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: We had much fun doing the Red Rum Room. We had a party if 6 and a party of 2 joined us and together we had so much fun. I highly recommend this adventure. We can't wait to do another one!

room_title: Escape room "Red Rum Cottage" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: We had a really fun time! We laughed, we screamed, we used our brains and we escaped! The room was very well done, seriously impressive (we did the Red Rum Cottage). Our game master Courtney delivered her clues in character using a great spooky voice!

room_title: Escape room "Red Rum Cottage" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: We had an amazing time in the Red Rum Cottage. Unfortunately, we did not get out but looking forward to booking again. Our group of 6 paired well with the other four that booked the room. The room master was amazing! Such an awesome time - will definitely be coming back. If anyone is looking for something to do that is out of the norm I highly recommend the escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Red Rum Cottage" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: A really good time away from the world of electronics to have fun, use your brain and take a break from reality into a world of solving puzzles. A great time for all.

room_title: Escape room "Red Rum Cottage" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: Absolutely awesome experience! Very cleverly thought out room designs. My family went and we all loved it. I would HIGHLY recommend this place! It will not be easy, it will challenge your thinking but is definitely doable with cooperation. We escaped with just 45 secs to go. Will definitely do another!

room_title: Escape room "The Dorm Rooms" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Illusionist" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: Surprised by the glowing reviews of this room. My group of five has done about 20 escape room across the nation, and this was not the worst we've done, but not the best.The decor looked old, dirty, and worn out. It also seemed quite sparse, like someone threw this room together hastily in their garage or something. The puzzles were okay, but one of them seemed completely nonsensical and we're not sure how average folks are intended to guess how it works without assistance. Maybe we're dumb, but there's only one room we didn't completely in our entire history of playing escape games; And we rarely ever ask for clues..So, who's to say?I would recommend the Six Shooter room over this one any day. Also - Locks locks locks galore! Not our favorite escape room attribute.

room_title: Escape room "The Illusionist" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: I did the illusionist room and it was amazing! The rooms were very well thought out and the puzzles were clever. All the puzzles were interactive and involved different mechanics. We had a large group, but there were plenty of puzzles for everyone to participate.

room_title: Escape room "The Illusionist" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: We went for a work outing and did the Illusionist room, the hardest one. It was a great time and the puzzles and clues were very well thought out. Every solve felt like an accomplishment and even all us tech support nerds barely solved it with less than 4 minutes left on the clock. Great time, recommend it for anyone!

room_title: Escape room "The Illusionist" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: We had such a great time. We may not have escaped however as first timers working the Illusionist room and 3 locks away..we're impressed. Thank you ACE of Escape!

room_title: Escape room "The Illusionist" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: We had a great time escaping from The Illusionist room today, with only seconds to spare!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by The Room LA in Los Angeles
review: On yelp this room was listed as easy and not challenging. However, ever since they hired a new game master & revamped the room. it is definitely a more difficult room from before. My wife & I have done 29 room & this  Cabin was great. we did not get out in time & the clues were helpful & followed the story. I believe this room is now a 3-4 key  compared to other room with the same rating. WE Loved the room & great puzzles. we will be back for spaceship!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by The Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Just finished the Cabin today. It was a great room, although some of the puzzles were difficult, it wouldn't be fun if it was too easy! Very well done and thought out.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by The Room LA in Los Angeles
review: My first escape room experience was a lot of fun. The puzzles in The Cabin were definitely challenging. Our group had somewhat limited escape room experience overall, but we did escape, with just over 11 minutes left! Looking forward to returning when the Spaceship room opens!

room_title: Escape room "The Path" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: One of the more memorable escape rooms I have done, the design was excellent, both in the room and the puzzles themselves. It was great change of pace to do a room that didn't use any conventional lock puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "The Path" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We had such a great time here on a Thursday night!!! The customer service was great and the room was SO FUN!!

room_title: Escape room "The Path" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This is a really fun place and the staff are really nice and helpful stop in for some unique challenges!

room_title: Escape room "The Path" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: I just finished their two new rooms, The Path and Curse on the Emerald Sea, at their new location and I must say that they were both quite well done and very indicative of the care they put into the business. Both rooms had great set designs, ambiance, and the puzzles were creative and, excluding one that I just wasn't getting for a bit, just the right side of difficult but achievable. I want to also praise the staff, they were all friendly and funny and each had their own unique style that I think really brings an air of friendliness to the business that you don't see in a lot of escape rooms. They clearly care about you having a good time. If you're looking for something to do I really recommend giving these rooms a try, where else can you find yourself in the hold of a ship, a zen garden, search for a magical creature, and help save a city in one day? Go, go do it now.

room_title: Escape room "Murder Scene 2.0" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: This place was soooooooooo cool! I went here for my birthday with my sisters and bf we had so much fun! We range in age from 15-27 and everyone was an asset in different areas of finding clues which was cool to see. It's definitely something I would do again. We did the Murder room and it was HARD but I loved it! I want to try the bunker room and the temple which is their newest room. The staff is really good at making this a good experience.

room_title: Escape room "Murder Scene 2.0" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: Perfect group bonding activity to test your problem solving skills and ability to think fast. I highly recommend trying out Xcape Room Fresno. The Murder Room was my favorite because of the unexpected surprise to solve the case. You and your friends definitely won't forget the experience!

room_title: Escape room "Murder Scene 2.0" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: We had such a great time!!!! The Murder Room was so much fun. We went with a very diverse group and everybody loved it. The staff was awesome, great way to spend some quality time together

room_title: Escape room "Murder Scene 2.0" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: Definitely worth every penny!! A lot more tricky than we thought. Murder scene was great! Will be coming back for the other scenes!

room_title: Escape room "Murder Scene 2.0" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: I have never done something like this, but i went for my birthday with my family. It was AMAZING. The staff was very nice friendly, the environment was excellent and puzzles were very cool. The puzzles were challenging and definitely required thought, but not so difficult that it caused frustration. We did the Murder Scene room and even though we didn't get out in the time, tonight's experience would definitely encourage me to recommend it to my friends and go back to try again. Thank you Xcape Room for an awesome experience!!

room_title: Escape room "Temple" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: The Temple room is awesome! I really had fun with my friends.

room_title: Escape room "Temple" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: Did the Temple! Tons of fun! Tyler was awesome, but unfortunately our party did not escape in time!

room_title: Escape room "Temple" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: I took my middle school aged son. We were joined by 4 other people that booked the same time we did. The staff did a great job in making sure we would be a good pairing. We did the Temple room and had an amazing time. We were able to solve all clues and escape the room. I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Temple" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: We had a blast. We had a group of 8 and did the temple room and it was tough and challenging! The staff was awesome and only one of our group had done an escape room before so we were all nervous! I highly recommend this place and highly recommend the temple room!

room_title: Escape room "Temple" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: We had an amazing time escaping the Temple room. It was challenging and the room looked incredible. The staff was friendly too.

room_title: Escape room "Alice in Wonderland" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Just did Alice in Wonderland and it was amazing! we had a great moderator as well. We did Dracula last time didn't love it as much and our moderator who was a female don't her name was not very friendly. But Alice in Wonderland is great!

room_title: Escape room "Alice in Wonderland" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loved Alice and Wonderland! Super fun and challenging. Victoria was the best game master too!

room_title: Escape room "Alice in Wonderland" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: First time doing an escape room game (Alice in Wonderland room), and it was so much fun! Challenging puzzles, but not difficult to the point of frustration. Seems like a good room for first-timers. And Victoria, the game master, was great!

room_title: Escape room "Alice in Wonderland" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: In terms of the theme, this one is probably my favorite out of all the ones that  I have done. I attempted this room as a group of 2 and I felt like we could have definitely used an extra brain or 2 for this room. Overall we had a blast doing this room as our game master was definitely helpful in pushing us in the right direction. The room was well made, with all the techy and non-techy parts of the room. Overall we had a great experience with this room.

room_title: Escape room "Alice in Wonderland" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We recently escaped the new Alice in Wonderland room at 60out. This room is on the bottom floor and is accessed by their new lobby area. The room had great production value and is definitely the cutest, brightest, and most colorful room there. It is also challenging and has a variety of puzzles, good tech, and some playful challenges that might best be managed by a group of 4 people. We had one mechanical issue, but it didn't affect the flow of the game.

room_title: Escape room "The Bake Off" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: great escape games! all are well themed and fun to do

room_title: Escape room "The Bake Off" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: It was a lot of fun with my family.

room_title: Escape room "The Bake Off" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: It was a lot more fun than I expected it. Our whole group enjoyed it very much. These guys did a great job. thank you.

room_title: Escape room "Discoveries Through Time" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: We didn't know what to expect and it was definitely a challenge for our group, but what fun. We all want to do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Discoveries Through Time" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: I took my 13 year old son and two of his best friends (aged 14) to Hot Springs for spring break. It's a tough age to please. However, Escape Hot Springs was the hit of the vacation! We went to the room of famous scientists/discoveries through the ages. The boys loved their first escape experience and immediately wanted to try a second room. I highly recommend this to anyone with teenagers to entertain. It was cleverly done and the staff were helpful and encouraging...especially with three distraught teens as the time ticked away......

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes - Moriarty's Parlor" by Mystery Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Transfiguration" by Unlock Escape Rooms in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: This is some serious fun. Grab a group of 4-8 people and head over there before they get so popular that you can't get in. This game will spark your creativity as well as challenge you to think. I'm hooked and can't wait to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: We loved our time here!! Blitzkrieg was so much fun and we already can't wait to go back & try The Cure! We will definitely recommend this place to everyone. The staff is so friendly and it was just an overall great experience! Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: Teenage boys had a great time working through Blitzkrieg, and they are determined to give the Cure a shot!

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: We had a group of 8 in the Blitzkrieg room with ages 13 thru 40. Every one of us had a great time and truly enjoyed ourselves. We are already planning our next adventure of finding The Cure.

room_title: Escape room "Blitzkrieg" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: Three of us did the Blitzkrieg escape room and it was tons of fun! We're planning on doing more. The staff was nice and helpful.

room_title: Escape room "The Initiation" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: My group of 7 did the Initiation Room. Great staff, room immersion, and puzzles. Highly recommend this as a group event!

room_title: Escape room "The Initiation" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: So much fun! Did the Initiation. I'd say 5 people is a perfect amount for that room. The other rooms apparently are bigger so maybe more for them. Loved the service and the ambiance. Difficulty was perfect for us 5. Will definitely return for the other rooms. Completed the secret society in 53 minutes. Not bad for the first time!

room_title: Escape room "The Initiation" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: So much fun! We did the initiation room tonight and it was a blast! There were 7 of us, and it took us all but one minute to escape! Definitely a great group activity! I can't wait to go back! Thank you for a fun night!

room_title: Escape room "The Initiation" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Our group did the Initiate Room. At first look it seems like an easy task, until you begin to look at the details. After 52 minutes and 20 seconds, we found the final clue and Beat the Room. What a great time! I highly recommend it if you are looking for something fun to do. Good Luck in there.

room_title: Escape room "The Initiation" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: We did this for my birthday and it was a blast!! The ambience of the location was really neat the put a lot of detail into the business. We did the Secret Society Room and it was well done. There were lots of interesting clues and tricks to each room. They also make sure it's fun for any skill level by helping you if you need it. We wouldn't have finished in time without there help, so even though we didn't get on the leader board we got to complete the room. Great for skilled intellectuals and fun for newbies. I definitely can't wait to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Missing" by Kingdom Keys NWA in Centerton
review: Decided to do the Missing escape room with my four young adult (20s) children during their visit for Christmas. It was definately challenging but so much fun. They were initially concerned that it would be all "Bible stuff." Most clues were very general, with little to no Bible knowledge required. We didn't make it out, but had so much fun and got pretty close to finding the keys. This would be great for a little family bonding, get together with friends, or even team building.

room_title: Escape room "Western Renegades" by Extreme Escape Redding in Redding
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: I've done a good number of escape rooms now, and this ranks high on the list! The waiting area is thoughtfully outfitted with some fun little table games, water, and even chocolate kisses. Then a kind and nice guy led us to the Asylum Room. It looks bare at first, but it is absolutely packed with interesting surprises, sensors, puzzles, logic games, and a few special effects. We definitely needed our three clies. Will return to do the Party in Vegas Room for sure!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Appointment on a weeknight was easy to set up for my team of 10. My coworkers and I had a blast escaping the Asylum. It was challenging, and the clues provided were helpful without giving the answers away completely. We dressed in the gowns they had, which was definitely a nice touch. Decor was on point as well. I was very impressed with the amount of technology at this escape room; it's a change from the other escape rooms I've played! Will be back when they introduce a new room!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: The Asylum room was just amazing! It's a step up from all the other escape rooms that I tried in San Francisco. Don't wanna give spoilers, but it was so real.. and creepy lol. Great narrative as well... based on a true story. Hosts are super friendly and funny. Definitely will check out their other rooms!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Two friends and I tried the Asylum. The room was immersive and well-done, and the puzzles were a lot of fun. The staff was friendly and informative.

room_title: Escape room "Closed Quarters" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Area 405" by The Escape Little Rock in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Bill and Ted's Excellent Escape Room" by Escape Westgate in Phoenix
review: Had an awesome time! Bill and Ted’s most excellent adventure! Highly recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Bill and Ted's Excellent Escape Room" by Escape Westgate in Phoenix
review: Fun impromptu day date! Easy online reservation. Great, helpful staff and fun time escaping the Bill & Ted’s room. So many fun details to the room. We look forward to returning for the other rooms! Perfect location near restaurants and shopping.

room_title: Escape room "Bill and Ted's Excellent Escape Room" by Escape Westgate in Phoenix
review: We went through the Bill and Ted's escape, but they have other movie-themed rooms as well. The puzzles were good, but the rooms were way more unique and detailed than other escape games we've been through. Looking forward to heading back to try the Terminator room soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: This place is a win all around. I’ve never seen such well put together rooms. It was like the props you see at Disneyland. The stories were detailed and fun and the staff add extra icing on the cake for being the nicest people! I highly recommend, especially The Heist game.This place is a win all around. I’ve never seen such well put together rooms. It was like the props you see at Disneyland. The stories were detailed and fun and the staff add extra icing on the cake for being the nicest people! I highly recommend, especially The Heist game.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Our group of 4 did the heist escape room. Very fun with good interactive set, and the right balance of hard but solveable puzzles. The only thing is that I can't imagine having more than 5 or 6 people in that room - we were lucky enough to not get grouped with anyone else and thought 4 was the perfect size.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: All the doors were locked!!My group and I did the heist room. I was nervous at first because this was only my 2nd escape game ever but the staff were really warm and welcoming and room itself was a lot of fun. As we unlocked each door the puzzles got harder and harder. What I really liked was how well themed each room was. Really clean and nicely decorated. Even the mechanics of things opening and closing were really done well. I would definitely go again for another room.I went with a group of 8 total people(the max) and it felt a little too cramped at times so I would suggest to go with no more then 5 people.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Granted, this was our first time participating in an escape room game so we had no expectations, but it was really fun!  We can't wait to do it again. My Baby Boomer husband and I, along with our 22 year old son, joined a group of five young teens and we all had a blast in the "Heist" game which was extremely challenging and well thought out. Only one person in our group had participated in an escape room game before and when we left, all of us said we would highly recommend it. What an intense and exhilarating hour!  You won't be disappointed if the other games were as good as the Heist. The San Francisco location is brand new and the staff is doing a great job.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: This is probably one of my favorite escape room so far! We had a lot of fun in "The Heist" room. The puzzles and clues were very creative and well designed! Highly recommended for team building experience! We will definitely come back!

room_title: Escape room "Rush Hour" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: I am a big fan of escape rooms. Did the Rush Hour room with just my boyfriend and I and it was a good mix of simple and complex. I felt that this helped the game progress at a good pace without being discouraging or obvious. The staff was AMAZING and SUPER polite.I am picky about my escape rooms and I can say that this one passed my expectation. Worth every dollar!

room_title: Escape room "Rush Hour" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: We did the Rush hour room. I did like how it's not linear, meaning you can be working on different things at different times. There were 3 of us in the room and I think that was enough. It is a small room, but it's meant to be on a train. They had screens that showed the city of Tempe passing by like you were on the light rail. Very nice touch. We all enjoyed the escape room and made it out with 10 minutes to spare and didn't even use all our clues!! WOOHOO!!Can't wait to try the other rooms there.Well decorated room and the staff was friendly and fun.

room_title: Escape room "Rush Hour" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: Our family of four had a great time at the Escape Zone. We did the Rush hour room and it was a lot of fun! We didn't make it out in time but we got pretty close! Great location in downtown Tempe near ASU!

room_title: Escape room "Rush Hour" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: Went here yesterday with my son and tried Rush Hour. The lady running the game was really nice. She spent time explaining things we had questions about and she answered our questions about upcoming rooms. The room was really fun and it had a lot of unique puzzles. Though we enjoyed the room and I recommend trying it, I would not recommend the room to beginners. We have done around 25 rooms, and this one was pretty tricky. We will definitely be back for their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Rush Hour" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: This is our third visit to this place! Today we did Rush Hour which had less clues and required more brain power. We had a great time and we were SUCCESSFUL!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Lost Workshop" by The Grand Detectives Society in Los Angeles
review: We had a lot of fun. Very challenging setup. The host put on a very entertaining show for everyone. We want to do it again for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Lost Workshop" by The Grand Detectives Society in Los Angeles
review: The smart detective approves. The Grand Detective's Society gives full access to the hottest mysteries, quandries, enigmas, curios, whodunnits, whodidndunnits, conspiracies, secrets and hopscotch.

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Lost Workshop" by The Grand Detectives Society in Los Angeles
review: What a GREAT time! The staff were great, making the whole experience even that much more pleasant. Very high quality puzzles and challenges, some humor, a few thrills and chills, and a wonderful time of teamwork!Great job, can't wait till you've got more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Medieval" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Lots of fun! I can't wait to go back! My friends and I did the Medieval room. Can't wait to try the western room next!

room_title: Escape room "Medieval" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: This was awesome! The Medieval room was an exciting adventure. My husband and I worked as a team trying to beat the clock. We can't wait to go back for another fun date night and couples building. As well as to go back with the kids. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Medieval" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Great addition to the San Diego escape room scene :)Came on a Sunday with a group of 8 (mixed experience levels), to do one of the "easier" rooms - Medieval. Employees were super friendly, and the intro video gives backstory to your experience. I was absolutely wow'd entering the room. Great design and attention to detail. Unfortunately, there were a couple of disappointing things, including one of the puzzle pieces being broken. If you were inexperienced with escape rooms, this might be a blocker. Yet they opened just recently and I'm sure will work out all of the kinks.

room_title: Escape room "Medieval" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Solid escape room experience. We did the "Medieval Room" with a group of 8 on a Sunday. Staff was friendly and accommodating of our group and schedule. We made a reservation in advance, and the entire event ran smoothly. We had the room for an hour, and it took us about 30-minutes to complete all of the puzzles without hints. It felt shorter than other escape rooms I've done, but the size of our group could have easily impacted that.SLOPS: Medieval Room puzzles felt a bit easy. That being said, this WAS labeled as "medium difficulty."

room_title: Escape room "The Office: Race To Erase" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I had the most fun time here today than I had in years. I have never done an escape room and I can't wait to come back again!!!! We chose the Race to Erase and it was challenging. WE all worked together and brought in our own unique talents. When we ran out  of time, and mentioned to the sweet young lady working there that our "hint button" didn't seem to respond in time, she added 10 minutes - as no one was waiting for the room, and  we finished the rest ( with a little help from her too!). I love love love this place. Everyone in the other rooms came out laughing and looked like they did equally.  The help, attitude, and also easy location added even more icing on the cake. thank you for a great time during the  Thanksgiving holiday. We had a multitude of choices of rooms AND times

room_title: Escape room "The Office: Race To Erase" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The Office- Played this as a group of 3 and we loved it! We got through the first clues in no time and the GM even asked "Have you guys done this before?" (We hadn't). Got stuck on two of the puzzles but after asking for a hint we figured it out and noticed that the answer was right under our noses the entire time! This room was higher tech than than the others at Amazing Escape! Looking back at it, this room was one of the easiest (If wouldn't have gotten stuck on the ones we had to ask for hints on. PS read clues throughly!). When we got to the last puzzles we had 3 minutes left and we finally escaped with 0.5 seconds left!!! A very close call!

room_title: Escape room "The Office: Race To Erase" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: A nice room, but not the best I've ever done

room_title: Escape room "The Office: Race To Erase" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We tried our hand at the "Office" with a group of four. The gamemaster was helpful and funny. I can't be too specific about the details of the room, but it was definitely well thought out, complex, and continued to keep us captivated throughout our time limit. I took a star off for the overall appearance of the place; it's a bit run-down.

room_title: Escape room "The Office: Race To Erase" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Came here yesterday as a group of 4 for "The Office" room. Got paired up with another group of 4 and successfully took on the room together with just seconds to spare.  Was a really fun experience and the clues were well designed. Would definitely recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: Second time here, did the Zombie Lab, extremely fun. Personally I find this one better than the Bank, but others do not share my opinion. We saved the world with 38 seconds to spare.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: The Zombie Lab did not disappoint! The room was very detailed with just enough props to get your mind thinking. The puzzles and clues reflected the storyline. My group of three did escape and only need a few hints. I look forward to returning to try the zodiac killer room.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: The Zombie Lab was my 30th escape room and it was a blast! The room is very immersive, the clues are given through a TV in the room and the game host was amazing. The room itself was very well done, the puzzles were unique to the other 29 escape rooms I have done and they were cohesive to the theme. Now that I have done this room, I can't wait to come back to do their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Arrested" by Open Door Escape Games in Redlands
review: We went to the STUDY it was hands down a very unique experience we had  a blast we didnt "escape" but it was still super entertaining while fun cant wait to try our luck at Arrested

room_title: Escape room "Arrested" by Open Door Escape Games in Redlands
review: Awesome fun. The clues and room were very interactive and fit the theme. Two thumbs up.

room_title: Escape room "Arrested" by Open Door Escape Games in Redlands
review: Great experience! This was our first time and we are hooked. We were met by a friendly host, everything was explained to us, and we loved every minute. We will definitely be back for more. Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Espionage 2: Under Fire" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Laboratory" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: I love escape rooms I've done tons in Los Angeles and came here with my family in Alabama. It's worth it! The puzzles for the lab are challenging and the people are great!

room_title: Escape room "The Laboratory" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: Really enjoyed our game. We did the Laboratory and while we were close, we didn't make it out. Game was fun, and really challenging. Would recommend the Warehouse first then work your way up through the tougher difficulties. We will be back to finish the other two rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Laboratory" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: We were in town for a gymnastics competition and decided to try this. There were 4 adults and 4 teenage girls in our group. We had a blast. So much fun. We did the laboratory room. We escaped with 2 minutes and 10 seconds left!

room_title: Escape room "The Laboratory" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: Came with my friend and her family for her birthday. We did the lab which has a 33% success rate. The timer started and we all went in different directions, each working on something different but ending up helping each other through problems. Finished with 14:41 to spare. It was challenging but totally fun. Can't wait to do the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Laboratory" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: Oh, so close!Visiting from Pennsylvania, and our hosts made reservations for the Laboratory. I'm thinking, "there's an hour of my life I'll never get back." Boy, was I wrong!This was SO much fun! It was a challenge both to get the clues, but also to work cooperatively! Academic intelligence isn't necessarily a necessity to make it through in time, but being able to converse is essential!I'm looking forward to returning and trying to make it out of another room.

room_title: Escape room "Paranormal Investigation" by Get a Clue in Orange Beach
review: As a filler of free time we decided to book the Paranormal room. Age range from 14 to 45, we all had a blast. Sharon was absolutely wonderful. If you have an hour of free time, get your family/friends together and book a room. We had so much fun tonight that we are thinking of doing another room tomorrow. Love from the STL.

room_title: Escape room "Wanted: Dead or Alive?" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My group of four decided to do the Wanted: Dead or Alive, the western theme.  The difficulty is listed as a medium, and we barely escaped! Our game master was really patient with us and we enjoyed the game a lot.  I've done 50+ rooms and the quality in the room is there!  My friends and I will continue to do more of your rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Wanted: Dead or Alive?" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We have completed two of their rooms and had a great time in both. We have their third room booked for this weekend and can't wait!

room_title: Escape room "Wanted: Dead or Alive?" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This is my 5th escape room and we did Wanted: Dead or Alive at Del Amo Mall. It is rated beginner- medium, but I found it pretty difficult even though we did escape with 8 minutes to spare using 2 clues. We had a team of 5 adults and we had a blast.  We totally recommend it :)

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Any room that requires multiple, laminated magic number puzzles to be solved is not worth $30

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: My friends took me here for my Bachelor's Party and I ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT. We took the Harry Potter challenge and I was amazed at the level of detail and the sheer brilliance of the clues and their hiding places. I'm scared of revealing too much but my favorite clues were the deceptively easy ones (clues that looked easy but were surprisingly difficult). I have one suggestion: I recommend putting out a poll or suggestion box for different rooms so that you guys can get more ideas for future room themes (My suggestions for a potential theme are a Sherlock Holmes or Clue theme). I can't wait for the next room change and I highly recommend it to people who want to play with friends or clubs who are looking to build teamwork! ORDER OF THE PHOENIX FOR LIFE!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: What an AWESOME an Amazing time We had in the Harry Potter Room! It was fun intense an so much fun! And yes we did escape with 2 minutes left! We kicked Butt! Looking forward to Mario Room Next!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: We had a great time! It was super fun even if we weren't totally successful.

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Wowowowowow! The front desk thought we were scared/shocked because of how loud we were all screaming and cheering. I had no expectations going in but have to say that my teammates and I enjoyed the Harry Potter room in particular to the nth degree! It was absolutely iiiiiiiiincredible! Quit being such a muggle and get over there!!!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Magical experience in the Harry Potter room. Would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: This is a great way to have fun with a group of friends! I'm not someone who typically enjoys puzzles, riddles, games, etc., but Square Room Escape has really elevated the experience for me. This is an excellent alternative for when you're looking for something to do and want a different option than going to the movies/bowling/karaoke. The clues are never the same, the rooms are beautifully decorated, and the whole thing from start to finish is very immersive. Definitely go check it out!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer's Study" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: I had so much fun with the Harry Potter escape room. This was my fourth escape challenge and I had so much difficulty. Without the hints I would not have solved it but I liked how we all could work together. I don't want to give it away bur great theme and design. Thanks for everything!

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire - Agents" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: Your money is worth it. It may look small on the outside but they'll take you to the back where the game is actually at. Puzzles are challenging and some require patience.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire - Agents" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: This was my third time been to this location. I played the Lost Kingdom and the Treasury of Empire: Allies before. I was here to take the challenge for the Treasury of Empire again. Since I played the Treasury of Empire: Allies, I knew that this time would not be an easy game. Although this time was still for the theme room the Treasury of Empire, the puzzles were totally different due to the different story line. The agent side was differently in the room, puzzles, and clues. On this sides, it had more electronic stuffs. It made the game to be more interesting. Also, I like the idea of the telephone. It made me feel like I was in a real base try to get the secrete code. I love it! Still the great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire - Agents" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: It was a very great experience. I love puzzles in the room. I played the Treasury of Empire: Agent in a 6-people group. We picked the most difficult one. And we still made it! More people with great team work will definitely higher helpful!Before the game started, the game master introduced the background story to us. In fact, all three rooms in this store are all connected together. I believe we should started with the first part of story to see the whole story. With the brief introduction from the game master, we knew that we have traveled back to WWII time and trying to get out of this military base. With this story introduction, we have had the idea about why we are here and what we are looking for. I believe that introduce is very important. Also, he told us many tips and rules.Generally, this is a great escape room experience. Although the game is not easy, we still enjoy the game very much. I like this type of challenge!

room_title: Escape room "A Clinical Trial" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My wife and I tackled the "Clinical Trial" room and had a great time. The owners are onsite and put a lot of time and effort into making this a great attraction. It was our first escape room experience and we will definitely be back to attempt the other room and anymore to come.

room_title: Escape room "A Clinical Trial" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My husband and I did this as a date activity for just the two of us. We had so much fun, we would do this again and again. We did the clinical trial room and it was challenging but not too difficult to take the fun out of it. The owners were super helpful and friendly and it was clear that they put a lot of work and creativity into making this a great experience for everyone. This was such a great way to spend time together and definitely worth the price.

room_title: Escape room "A Clinical Trial" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My wife and I narrowly escaped the Clinical Trial room. It was amazing. So much fun. The puzzle was linear, but not simple. The puzzles were varied and the clues were well thought out. You can tell that a LOT of effort goes into making the rooms and puzzles. We will definitely do this again next time we are in Hot Springs.

room_title: Escape room "A Clinical Trial" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My husband, 12 year old son and I did the room "A Clinical Trial" and had a blast! The clues were challenging, but each of us was able to play on our strengths. We got stumped once or twice, and they gave hints when needed. Other escape rooms I've been to gave a limited number of hints and/or penalized for hints, but A Narrow Escape does not. We solved the puzzle with less than 2 minutes to spare. We will definitely go back when we are in town again to try one of the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "A Clinical Trial" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: I took my husband here as a surprise because he loves a good brain game, and we were not disappointed. Based on the description, I chose to go with "A Clinical Trial" for the simple fact that we weren't a large goup (although the two of us might have been okay doing any of the rooms). After we succeeded in escaping, we immediately wanted to do another!!

room_title: Escape room "Zookeeper" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Had a great time working in the Mad Hatter's Tea Party for my daughter's 14th birthday. We were paired with 4 others that we did not know but worked to have the best time of the week! Returned a week later to testout the Zookeeper for kids which was awesome and my eight-year-old absolutely loved it! Wholesome and engaging fun for every age!

room_title: Escape room "Zookeeper" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: This is the first time we went to an escape room and since it was a family outing with younger ones, we went with the zookeeper room - we had a blast and the entire staff was friendly, super helpful in giving us stumped adults clues and polite! We will definitely go back!

room_title: Escape room "Zookeeper" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: What a blast. We did the zookeeper room since we had our 8 year old and 3 year old with us and it was perfect. Our 3 year old was busy with all the animal things in the room and the rest of us were busy solving our mission. Nothing like a room for 6-12 year olds to make an adult feel a little less than though haha Hands down recommend this for anyone who wants to be fully engulfed in a game and have fun. We will absolutely return.

room_title: Escape room "Time Machine" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: By almost any measure, the nautilus and time machine rooms were very good escape rooms. Do they have faults? Yes. The "kraken" you battle in the Nautilus looks like an original Nintendo character, reminding you of a 90s video game as opposed to an immersive experience. And many parts of the Time Machine room feel like an underwhelming museum exhibit. But overall, these are above average escape rooms that in most other cities would be top-of-the-line.I would say these are perfect escape rooms for new participants. They are immersive, and creative, and generally fun. They will deliver solid experiences to establish what escape rooms are all about.For experienced gamers, however, these rooms were let downs. The puzzles were too straightforward and predictable, These rooms were linear to a fault. And the production value does not match the leaders in the city (Questroom and the Basement). That said, 60Out offers reasonable pricing and still very enjoyable experiences. I expect to return for some of their more advanced rooms such as Jumanji.

room_title: Escape room "Person of Interest" by Unity Escape Rooms in Pomona
review: First time doing the escape room and we had a great time. We needed some help but it was still fun to think about what's next. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a fun hour to get away

room_title: Escape room "House Of Voodoo" by Nightmare at 3008 in Birmingham
review: This place was great!!! We had an absolute blast!! Very interactive and a great staff!!! Thanks!!!

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire - Allies" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: I have a great time with my friends here. Really helpful hints. Really hope there are more to experience.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire - Allies" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: We had no idea what to expect but this was truly a memorable experience!

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire - Allies" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: Helpful staff. Challenging escape room. Since I can't do it again, it would be cheating, lol, but I'd definitely recommend it

room_title: Escape room "Mailroom Madness" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: First time going to an escape room, and I must say, this was AWESOME! There were just 2 of us in Mailroom Madness, and even though we needed an extra 8 minutes, we did complete it. Our game master was fun and super helpful and you can tell he really loves his work. The puzzles were so much fun! There weren't any that were over-the-top frustrating, but we did definitely need some help. We will definitely be back for more!

room_title: Escape room "Mailroom Madness" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: The room was perfect for our group of 6. I brought my 18-year-old son, who doesn't get too excited about things these days. Boy was this place a hit! He led the charge in obtaining the first of many clues. It's a great place to reconnect with family.

room_title: Escape room "Mailroom Madness" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: Went here a week ago and it was a ton of fun! I would recommend doing the doll house themed escape room. Ariel, who was working that night was a great storyteller and perfect host.

room_title: Escape room "Christmas at Franklin's" by Escape Room Era in Los Angeles
review: We did this with a group of 8 yesterday and despite having done over many, many different rooms, this one had a number of things that pleasantly surprised us. You can tell David takes a great deal of pride in his work, and the way he incorporates historical stuff about Benjamin Franklin into the room was lots of fun. There is a good mix of physical and mind puzzles too. The ending was great! Can't wait to see the new room here. We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Christmas at Franklin's" by Escape Room Era in Los Angeles
review: I did this room with the full 8 this weekend. David was so nice and fun and creative. I think the payoff of solving the puzzle was the best I have seen yet! There were also a lot of fun, different puzzles to solve that you don't normally and the whole group was busy at work. Loved this room and the historical Easter eggs. Thanks David! We will be back when you open even more rooms for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Christmas at Franklin's" by Escape Room Era in Los Angeles
review: This escape room gets high marks for customer service and puzzle quality. The creator of this room (actually, rooms, since there are about three rooms for the game) put much effort into keeping the story line and its theme running throughout, from the signing of the liability form, to the grand finale. Many of the puzzles were very ingenious. Some really puzzled us, but once we figured them out we all had to say, "Oh, wow!"

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Meltdown" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Great time with the team, Vince made sure we all had a good time. It was everyone's first time so no one knew what we were supposed to do, but again, Vince was a lot of help and we escaped!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Meltdown" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We've tried a lot of escape rooms around the Valley. Today was the Nuclear Meltdown Room at Baffled. We did not get out alive. But still had tons of fun. Thanks Baffled, we want to try your da vinci room next.

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Meltdown" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We went as 3 adults and 3 children,6,10 and 11. We did nuclear meltdown and got out with 4 minutes 27 seconds to spare! Had a great time and the staff was friendly and made it enjoyable. The kids did feally good and want to go agon. We also did groupon to save money. My only complaint was it was kinda warm in there. A little A/C wouldn't hurt.

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Meltdown" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We had an amazing time! We did the nuclear room. It took us nearly the full hour, but we saved the world. So, you're welcome. The staff was very engaging and helpful for the clues we needed. I believe the man's name was vince and he was awesome. The room was well put together. Everything worked as it was supposed to work. Their hours are great. We went to the last time slot - and that worked perfectly.Thank you! We will absolutely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Nuclear Meltdown" by Baffled Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Our group of 6 had a great time in the Nuclear Meltdown room!The room had multiple puzzles to solve at a time, so we were able to split up the work instead of crowding over one area. The room still had a direction, however, so it was fairly easy to stay on track.The staff was present over intercom throughout the experience and provided advice when necessary.This was an engaging team-building experience that I would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Miss Jezebel" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So fun! Just finished the escape room with Miss Jezebel and it was great. This was my first time doing an escape room and I'd definitely recommend it. It wasn't too many puzzles to solve- more of a mystery theatre situation. Our "Miss Jezebel," Heather, was fantastic too. 5 stars.

room_title: Escape room "Miss Jezebel" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loved it. Dorothy was great. The Jezebel room was really fun. Would be interested in more rooms with an actor.

room_title: Escape room "Miss Jezebel" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Ms Jezebel was an incredible experience. Love all the rooms I've done for the most part. This company is incredible.

room_title: Escape room "Task Force Agency" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was my first experience with doing an escape room activity and it was AWESOME!!!. Did the TASK FORCE AGENCY ROOM. I felt like I was in Mission Impossible minus Tom Cruise . I can't give away any secrets, but I'm Definitely going to do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Task Force Agency" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Took a coworker for her first escape room experience. This place was close to our work and we decided to give it a shot picking the hardest room. Even though we failed the CIA Task Force, it had everything I wanted in a great escape room. The immersion, technology and flow of the room made sense. The owner and his wife were great and accommodating. I'll definitely be back to try their easier rooms in the near future!

room_title: Escape room "Task Force Agency" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had an amazing time here with my friends! We did the TFA room which is high tech and well thought out. Also, the customer service is outstanding. Can't wait to come back and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: Very creative room and way different from a couple other places I've been. Asylum was much harder than typical escape room experiences. I loved the challenge. Be ready to think outside the box. I will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: We had an absolute blast! Celebrated our mom's birthday by challenging ourselves with the Asylum room! We were certainly impressed! What an absolute GREAT way to have some incredible fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: First time doing an escape room. We failed but had a great time doing it! I wanted to go big or go home so we did the hardest room which was Asylum, creepy is exactly how it would describe it. Thank you so much Down The Rabit whole we will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: This was so fun. I took two 14-year-olds and we did the asylum room. We had such a great time. The gentleman who helped us was funny and helpful. My cousin and brother were so thrilled they were begging to go back the next day. We will definitely be back. 10/10 would do again

room_title: Escape room "The Asylum" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: I loved this place. The Asylum was challenging but super interesting. I loved the vibe the room gave off. I definitely recommend giving this place a go and trying to solve one of the rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Room Academy" by Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: We planned an adult date night with four couples and completed the Escape Room Academy. Lots and lots of fun. We'll be back!

room_title: Escape room "Escape Room Academy" by Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: We did the Escape Room Academy room and we had a blast! Loved it! Definitely worth it.

room_title: Escape room "The Hideout" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had an absolute blast! The staff (Scott) was very patient and thorough with all our questions. Our team lived through "The Agency" and beat the record time for the week! Can't wait to return and try "The Hideout".

room_title: Escape room "The Hideout" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The Hideout is really amazing. A bit different than most of the rooms I do, but it was thoroughly engaging and really well done for the space. My group cannot stop raving about this one! It is definitely challenging and fun!!! Their Agent room is also a great, but we did prefer The Hideout unanimously.

room_title: Escape room "The Hideout" by Arcane Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Best experience ever! We had a blast in the Hideout room and we will definitely be back for more. Can't wait for new rooms to be added too!! Staff was amazing (Scott, we loved you!) and the thought that went into this is mind-blowing!

room_title: Escape room "Evans & Sontag Jail Cell Escape" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: we had a great time. highly recommend

room_title: Escape room "Evans & Sontag Jail Cell Escape" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: This was my family's first time doing an escape room.  The host couldn't have been much nicer.  He was friendly and inviting.  The ambiance was warm.  They have lockers so you can store your personal belongings while you are in the escape room.  Puzzle are fun.  Even the easier riddles/puzzles can be challenging when out under pressure.  You are given an hour to escape the room.  Definitely coming back to try the other themed rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Evans & Sontag Jail Cell Escape" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: Excellent escape room!  The host was fantastic and kids had great time!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Room" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: This was our family’s first time in an escape room and we had so much fun in the zombie room. We had no idea there was a “live” zombie in the room which made it very exciting and challenging. The puzzles and riddles were very challenging. We actually did not complete the escape, but had a blast trying. We will for sure do be back!!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Room" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: I had so much fun! The zombie room was so intense! Loved every minute!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Room" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: My friend wanted to do the zombie room for her sons b-day so we decided to do the mafia room at the same time!! We all had an ABSOLUTE BLAST!! I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TO ANYONE WHO LOVES A CHALLENGE!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Room" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: First time ever doing an escape room... Gotta tell you, was super fun and exhilarating!!! Did the Zombie room for a friends birthday and it literally came down to the last minute!!! Totally recommend it, we all had a blast!!!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Room" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: First time ever doing an escape room... Gotta tell you, was super fun and exhilarating!!! Did the Zombie room for a friends birthday and it literally came down to the last minute!!! Totally recommend it, we all had a blast!!!

room_title: Escape room "Y2K Mystery" by SUBScape Games in San Diego
review: Y2K Virus was the first room we did.  I feel that this was the easiest of the three rooms we did.  I thought the puzzles were challenging, but simple enough to figure out.  I don't think that there was a moment where we didn't know what we were supposed to do in this room.  It's easy to connect the dots and figure out what to do.  I would say this is an easy-intermediate difficulty room, and would recommend this if this is your first time or if you aren't that experienced at escape rooms.  We were told that Stage Call is their easiest room at Subscape, so if you are a beginner, you can start there as well.

room_title: Escape room "Y2K Mystery" by SUBScape Games in San Diego
review: I brought my group to do a team building game at this escape room and we had a blast! really great rooms and great customer service! highly recommend 😊👍

room_title: Escape room "The Hidden Elixir" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: I was with a group of 3 friends in town for a weekend and we decided to do this escape room! We had a lot of fun! The room was designed to be fun and challenging but not stressful, and the employee on duty was very nice and helpful. We had a lot of fun and if we are ever back in the area would definitely return!

room_title: Escape room "The Hidden Elixir" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Our family, including our 7 and 10-year-old kids, had a blast today! Friendly staff, fun puzzles, and just an overall great experience (and we didn't even win)!! Can't wait to go back and try a different room!

room_title: Escape room "The Hidden Elixir" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: We escaped the Hidden Elixir room on a Sunday afternoon. It was set up properly, clean, and so much fun! I'm definitely going back.

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: It was me and my wife's first anniversary together and we both like horror but we had never done a escape room before, we're used to puzzle solving in games and even at work and we're not easily scared by horror attractions eather, but this, hands down was the best, we worked together ad got scared at the same time. Would recommend it to anyone.

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: I've done most of/only the horror escape rooms in the LA and Anaheim area including the Basement LA (all 4 chapters),  Mission: Darkest Hour Torture Chamber, The Hex Room, Amityville House, The Orphanage, Fright Fest, Horror Nights and even the 17th Door. The "Zoe" room is hands down the scariest room/attraction I've ever been in. I did not know I could even be this scared and honestly fared for my life. Keeping your group small (3 people) will make the experience even more scary. This is my number room as of now!!!

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: Ahhhhhhmazing!!! This has to be the best room my boyfriend and I have ever done. From the moment you sign the waivers till the moment you run out of the house your heart is beating.Coming from another escape room, it is great to find one as amazing as this place. It does not disappoint one bit!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: I'm scaaaarrreeeddd ahhh💃🏽

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: Excellent immersive horror experience. Not for the faint of heart! Definitely recommended for horror enthusiasts. Recommended for escape room enthusiasts who wants to see something different than your typical puzzle rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: Our group of 6 had a lot of fun! It was our first escape room so I have nothing to compare it to but it definitely had our hearts pumping a few times! The puzzles were well done and the actors were committed! Well done.

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: If you love going to scary theme parks, then this is the perfect thing to tide you over during the offseason. This escape room is as challenging as it is terrifying. Even your toughest of friends will scream like little girls.

room_title: Escape room "Zoe" by Escapade Games in Los Angeles
review: Brilliant. Truly one of the escape rooms that pushes the concept toward the potential of what it can be versus simply doing the umpteenth iteration of "a mad scientist's lab" or "a spy's secret office," etc. This room is smart, well-planned, and forces you to perform under exciting pressure unique to the minds of its creators. I will happily support any future rooms that Escapade dreams up.

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We did the Grim Stacks escape room as a team-building exercise, and it was definitely a team effort! Ultimately, we escaped with just a second left! It was difficult, fun, and exhilarating at the same time. I've done about half-a-dozen other escape rooms, and this one was definitely amongst the best.Thanks to Heather, Tucker, and the rest of the staff there. It was a great time, and I recommend it to anyone looking for a fun escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This was SO MUCH FUN! My friends took me to an escape room to start off my bachelorette party! We did the Grim Stacks room. It was challenging and fun. Had some exciting moments during it! Very well put together. We didn't make it out in time, but we were so close!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: Phoenix Escape Room was a great time! The group I was in participated in the Grim Stacks challenge. It was so much fun! The challenge was just right and we missed the final clue to solve the puzzle by just a couple minutes but it was still so much fun! Looking forward to visiting again!

room_title: Escape room "Kill Switch" by Endgame Escape Rooms in Redlands
review: Unique escape room with 4 different rooms and multiple possible endings! The 10 of us had enough room to work in and got through with 19 minutes left and didn't use any hints!

room_title: Escape room "The Machine" by The Game Room Adventure Cafe in Sacramento
review: We had a great time!! And we set a new record of 30 min completion time! The puzzles were great! Excited for more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Machine" by The Game Room Adventure Cafe in Sacramento
review: We did the escape room with a group of four people for a birthday and it was awesome! Great puzzles and creativity kept us busy the full hour. Would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: Had a great experience. We started of "simple" and did the 'Wonderland' room....we quickly realize...not so simple. It was fun and challenging. Can't wait to go again.

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: Mark and I had so much fun!! We completed Wonderland, but not Alcatraz. We had to come back the next day and we did it!! Very creative!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: great time fun and exciting eexperience ! Definitely recomend as a family event we had a blast doing alice and wonderland !

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: It was great!! We all got scared at some point, real fun and entertaining the whole time

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: We just did chapter 2 of the 13th floor. So much fun and it was a great time. My family and I did it and really enjoyed it. Eddie puts on some great rooms and can't wait to see what he does next. Can't recommend these rooms enough. We have done 4 of his and over 15 total and all of his rooms rank at the top of our list.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: Just finished doing the chapter 2 escape room  This is the best escape room hands down! The actors that was part of the experience were very into their roles  We had an amazing time, definitely coming back in the very near future

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2" by The 13th Room in Los Angeles
review: Have now completed all of their escape rooms... All are really good; but just completed Chapter 2 and it's probably the best! Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Cure" by Exodus Escape Adventures in Sacramento
review: GREAT escape room! I've done many rooms and this was one of the most elaborate ones I've done. I was very impressed and had a great time! Looking forward to their next addition.

room_title: Escape room "Enchanted Forest" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The enchanted forest was full of creative puzzles with a fun atmosphere! Enchanted ER has a talent for creating amazing rooms that immerse you in your adventure. We'll definitely be back to tackle the Task Force escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Enchanted Forest" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Just did the Enchanted Forest this last weekend for a friend's early birthday celebration. The Forest was super awesomely set up, it was gloomy and only mildly creepy if you're faint of heart, and the puzzles themselves were clever and entertaining. I don't like it much if they focus too heavily on math or calculations (simply because it's harder to do as a group activity) but this one had fun puzzles that you could do independently or with someone else.I definitely want to try the other rooms at this location now!

room_title: Escape room "Enchanted Forest" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Did the Enchanted Forest room for friends birthday. Had a lot of fun. Great team building and communication exercise. Short review because I don't want to give any spoilers.

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the Lost Dutchman" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: First timers and we did the lost Dutchman room! So much fun we laughed so hard, and just had an awesome time! The room was challenging but definitely made it more fun and super clean! Staff was very friendly! We will definitely be back to try hopefully all rooms at some point!

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the Lost Dutchman" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Had a blast in the Dutchmans Escape Room, close to finishing but ran out of time. Not easy with only three people highly recommend bringing a group of 5 or more.

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the Lost Dutchman" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We did the Lost Dutchman room with a group of 7. Had such a great time and managed to escape! Definitely want to come back and try another one!

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the Lost Dutchman" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We had a group of 10 and did the lost Dutchman room, we had a great time... we did manage to escape in record setting time... our guy told me so. My ONLY thing I would do to improve our experience is to have a larger sign or lit up because we passed it as it was not easy to see especially at night.

room_title: Escape room "The Legend of the Lost Dutchman" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Last night I did the "Lost Dutchman" room with 5 other people(all of us have never done an Escape room before) for a friend's birthday celebration. We worked together, solved puzzles, and had a blast. Definitely planning another trip soon and highly recommend others go as well. We escaped with 2 minutes and 11 seconds left on the clock...

room_title: Escape room "Confinement" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: My girlfriend and I did the "confinement " room for our first escape the room and we are HOOKED!!! Not only was the challenge a blast but the employees we interacted with were amazing!!! Austin was our game master and he was great! He went above and beyond from the moment we got there. There was also a girl working who was just as awesome. We will definitely recommend this to everyone and we will be back soon!!

room_title: Escape room "Confinement" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: We did the confinement room last night. Our game master sandy was amazing! We have done a lot of escape rooms and this is one of the best. The tasks made sense but we're still challenging.  We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Confinement" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: My family and I had a great experience. We did the co confinement room and we were SOOOOOOO close to finishing. The clues were well thought out, great set up and multiple rooms made for a challenging and exciting time. It brought us together and the kids keep talking about it days afterward. Zahara, our host, was amazing, super friendly and helpful. Definitely will go again!

room_title: Escape room "Vampire" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My family and friends have done almost all of the Maze rooms and the Vampire Room is now one of our favorites. It is scary, atmospheric, and features some very unique and clever puzzles. There is excellent use of tech that is smooth, surprising, satisfying, and well-integrated. More than any other escape room we have done, there is a definite cause and effect with things you manipulate. There is good audio and visual confirmation when something is done correctly. Our group produced some genuine squeals, eeks, and a bonafide scream or two. It is not gory, freaky, or bloody and those who are not horror fans should be fine in this room.We escaped with quite a few hints, but I was glad we were able to experience the entire room and all its tricks and treats.

room_title: Escape room "Vampire" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Back again for another game at Maze Rooms! The new Vampire Room was very cool. The theme and immersion was impressive and the puzzles were clever! We took a friend who hadn't played before and he was blown away. I really enjoyed the flow of this game and the difficulty was very high, but we escaped! I really liked how much teamwork was designed into this game, there was always something to do and everyone contributed in a significant way. Loved it!!

room_title: Escape room "Vampire" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the Vampire Room and it was very well done. Cool props and neat puzzles. Flowed well.

room_title: Escape room "Bunker 77" by Extreme Escape Redding in Redding
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Theater" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: A very well organized room. The gamemaster is the best. Me and my team enjoyed the experience a lot. Looking forward to visiting your other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Theater" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: Great addition to the mall! Tons of parking and food options available. Make a night of it! Some of the toughest and coolest looking rooms around!

room_title: Escape room "The Theater" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: My girlfriend and I came here and did the room called "The Theatre." Our cluemaster Asher did an excellent job of letting us go through the room but giving us help when we needed it, allowing for it to be challenging but still really fun so we could finish the room with 7 minutes to spare. We'd love to go back at some point and do the other rooms, as the rest of the staff was great too.

room_title: Escape room "The New Atlantis" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: My son and I played the Atlantis room and had a blast. We didn’t escape but our game host, Luke, was great and took the time to show us the last three puzzles we missed. I have played escape games at other locations and in my opinion this room had difficult but logical clues that clearly led you to the next puzzle - not all rooms are like this. My teenage son can’t wait to play at this location again!

room_title: Escape room "The New Atlantis" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: We recently did the New Atlantis. It is the only room we have done here since we don't live in Huntsville. We love escape rooms, probably having done about 15 in total. I am amazed that this is a local business, because it is as high a quality as many of the larger chain escape rooms. It was a really well thought out room, I would say one of my favorites of all time. It was challenging, one of the tougher rooms I have done, but with some clues and good help we escaped. We will definitely be back to try the other rooms someday. I think our game master's name was Chloe. She was fantastic. Lots of fun.

room_title: Escape room "The New Atlantis" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Had an incredible time at this escape room! Staff was incredibly helpful and friendly, especially Miranda. The room was extremely well put together, sometimes there is just so much going on its hard to stay on track, but I thought the "Atlantis" themed room we completed was well thought out and creative. Would definitely come back again!

room_title: Escape room "Amazon Rainforest" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: This was an amazing experience! My wife and I happened to walk by it and she said jokingly "want to do an escape room?". Without hesitation I said yes and in we went. It is by far the most decorated escape room we've seen to date. The two hosts were incredibly friendly. We choose the amazon plane crash room. The decoration and the detail were incredible! It was mildly difficult. My wife and I completed it with 10 minutes to spare. We can't wait to try the other one!! You will not Be disappointed with this escape room! Well done!

room_title: Escape room "Amazon Rainforest" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: After doing now 60 escape rooms, the Amazon room is definitely one the neatest set designs I have seen so far. You can definitely tell that a lot of work went into it to make it as immersive as possible. Please take note though that I played with 2 other people and some of the puzzles would be easier to achieve with 1 or maybe two more people. Also attention to detail is needed for this room as it is easy to miss items you are needing to find in order to do some of the puzzles. Our game master Aly was fun and refreshingly enthusiastic! Thank you for the fun experience!

room_title: Escape room "Amazon Rainforest" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: *I am an internationally experienced Escape Room enthusiast with hundreds of rooms under my belt*These wonderful owners have created some beautiful rooms here. They are quite deserving of their High Production Value/Immersive award that they won for their Amazon Rainforest room. From start to finish, that room was one of my all-time favorites.
