So much attention to detail and overall fun. And the price is even lower than other Escape Rooms. Their Gravitational Effect room was a step-down in puzzle quality, though the interior design was still above-average. I especially enjoyed the physical dynamic in the middle room. Gift shops usually put me off, but in the lobby you can buy beautiful flowers hand-made by the owner. It was a nice touch.Games played: Amazon Rainforest, Gravitational Effect

room_title: Escape room "The Bionic Dilemma" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: We were blown away by the imagination shown in the design of the Bionic Dilemma room. After talking for a while with the designer we understood his passion for originality. They were great fun puzzles with some great surprises. Great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Bionic Dilemma" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: Bionic room was both fun and rather difficult. Our family experienced many challenges in solving, but with help and extensive guess-and-check, in the end it was extremely fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Bionic Dilemma" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: Excellent time with our teenage boys....nobody argued! And we all worked well together on their very unique, fun & challenging puzzle! We did the space lab puzzle with Ava. She survived too! Thank you, Narrow Escape!

room_title: Escape room "The Bionic Dilemma" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: Had a blast and made it out alive!! Thanks the bionic room was the one we did. Fun loads a laughs. Would do it again!!

room_title: Escape room "The Bionic Dilemma" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My mom took me, my dad, and my sister to this earlier today, and I have to say that I'm deeply impressed and satisfied. We did the story where we tried to break out of an abandoned lab with the help of a Robot named Ada. The story was intriguing, the riddles where clever, and my family had fun over all. Kudos to the guy who put this together.

room_title: Escape room "The Bionic Dilemma" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: My wife and I took our precocious grandkids, ages 13 and 8, to our first "escape room" adventure while on their Spring Break last week. It was the highlight of the whole week. Working as a team, we solved the room's various puzzles, found keys and codes and brain twisting solutions to riddles, problems and posers of all sorts. Ada the trapped Robot became a friend and ally of invaluable worth as we strove to save us all before the power drained out for the "subterranean" lab we had stumbled into. Loads of fun and well worth the modest expense. Triple Wow!

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: My sister and I decided to do the detective room not knowing what to expect and it turned out to be so fun! The puzzles were very challenging but we worked as a team and solved most of the puzzles but ended up running out of time. We are now going to do the cavern next and we are determined to get it of this room. Definitely would recommend!!

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: We had 50 minutes to follow the clues and escape, we did it in 46 minutes. The clues were challenging but logical and it was really fun to work with good friends and people I didn't know well to solve them.

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: This experience was quite fun, at first I was a bit hesitant to try this because the thought of being locked in a room with strangers just didn't appeal to me. After my first escape room, I couldn't wait to try all of others. I've seen 3 of the escape rooms from Escape Room LA and their all very well produced and designed, compared to a few others I've seen that aren't nearly as well produced. Once you step into a room, you feel like you're in the environment of the game. Even though you may be a room with strangers, it's fun to be able to talk and meet with new people even if it is for an hour. It's definitely a good way to spend an hour to an hour and a half in LA if you're visiting LA with some free time.

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: *The Detective*Damn Gina - we didn't escape! :( But overall the entire experience was super fun and a nice alternative to do something different!Diving into the deets:You go into this kinda shady looking building and wonder if you're at the right place, on the outside it looks pretty rundown and nondescript, but trust you're at the right spot. Once you arrive, you'll be waiting in the hallway with others until they call you in. Check in is simple: show your email confirmation on your phone or print out. After, they asked we go around the room and introduce ourselves and give a tiny blurb about yourself, which was a nice icebreaker especially since we didn't know the others that signed up for the same event. Next, they went over the rules and hinted at a couple of things, but nothing that would take away the guesswork from us. The staff waited a couple of minutes past our slotted time for the 2 missing people in our group, but they ended up a no show. There's a last chance to use the restroom, make sure you take it because once you ask to leave the room, you aren't allowed to go back in.Once in the room, they started a clock and we broke into an immediate frenzy. It's good to work in pairs and call out to everyone if you found a clue. Meanwhile, there was a staff member dressed as a detective inside the room and a few times he hinted at something if we half-uncovered a clue and were struggling, in a major way. Without him, I honestly don't think we would have solved 3-5 clues... I could see how some people would be really frustrated if they got stuck.Anyway, the next hour went by REALLY quick! Like a lot of the other reviews say: Teamwork + Communication is KEY to well, find the key! The puzzles overall were fun, some more challenging than others, but clever nonetheless and you had to solve all of them in order to find the key. Time ran out and we didn't escape but had a great time anyway. I'd be interested in trying The Cavern.In the end, the only thing I could think they could improve on is:-Rather than allowing 12 people into a room, I'd say 6-8 max is better.-Allow an additional 10-15 minsThe staff was great in offering to take pictures after the event, even when they were literally given 7 different cameras and took multiple photos on each device. We left with a coupon for their other events, i.e. RaceLA, CityRace.Anyway, last tips:Plan ahead by allotting plenty of time before your scheduled event. Parking is in DTLA where majority of the streets are one-way and if you're trying to save yourself a few dollars, you'll most likely circle around a couple of times before deciding on where to park. The lot right next to building where you do the event was $7 on a Saturday, cash only. HAVE FUN and GOOD LUCK!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: The puzzle was SO HARD in the detective. We got to the last piece and struggled on that for about 20 minutes. This was a perfect challenge. This is the best escape room I've done. The staff is super friendly as well and parking was a breeze. 10/10 would go again.

room_title: Escape room "The Detective" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: The puzzle was SO HARD in the detective. We got to the last piece and struggled on that for about 20 minutes. This was a perfect challenge. This is the best escape room I've done. The staff is super friendly as well and parking was a breeze. 10/10 would go again.

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: LOVED Hourglass. We did Alcatraz and Asylum over the same weekend and beat both. I was nervous due to having been worthless in the first escape room I ever did in New Jersey, but this was fun and engaging, even for my 8 year old nephew.

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: We loved the Asylum rooms!! So creative and fun! The staff was super nice and helpful as well. We can’t wait to go back

room_title: Escape room "Asylum" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: Fun, creative rooms. The Staff was super friendly and helpful. This was our first time, and we can't wait to do another one. If you go - Asylum is the room to go to! So fun!

room_title: Escape room "Defenders of the Galaxy" by Xscape Pods in Los Angeles
review: Our group had a great time! The Galaxy room was cute fun :). It was my first escape room experience, thank you for making it an enjoyable and successful one!!!

room_title: Escape room "Defenders of the Galaxy" by Xscape Pods in Los Angeles
review: We attended the Xscape Pods last night and had a blast.  Three of us did the defenders of the galaxy room and it was Perfect as an intro room since neither of us had ever done any escape rooms.  We will defiantly be back with our hubby's and do the government room.

room_title: Escape room "Defenders of the Galaxy" by Xscape Pods in Los Angeles
review: Our group of 4 did the Defenders of the Galaxy room and we had a great time!  I think 4 players is then perfect amount for this room. The decor was really cool and the puzzles were difficult but not too much so. Will definitely be back to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Pandemic" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: Love coming to Hourglass Escape Rooms! The staff are always so nice & the games fun. Played the Pandemic room with the zombie actor tonight & he was a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Hotel" by Great Escape Mystery Rooms in Fort Smith
review: My husband took our daughter and a few friends for her 12th birthday and they had a BLAST! The loved the Haunted Hotel and highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Hotel" by Great Escape Mystery Rooms in Fort Smith
review: Spent our weekend in Ft Smith and Took my wife to the Great Escape for something different on our Anniversary.We had an Absolute Blast and Made it out in the nick of time!!We will definitely be returning and bringing our three Teenage sons with us next time! Would recommend this place to anyone!!

room_title: Escape room "Haunted Hotel" by Great Escape Mystery Rooms in Fort Smith
review: What a fun way to get your team together and have fun! The staff was amazing and we really enjoyed the haunted hotel!

room_title: Escape room "Caskwerks & Capone" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: great fun for all 10 of us!!!! good time for our whole group, we had people ranging in age from 10 to 70. everyone enjoyed it.

room_title: Escape room "Caskwerks & Capone" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: It was a great time! I went for a team building event for work and can’t wait to go back with the family!

room_title: Escape room "Caskwerks & Capone" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: I did Caskworks and Capone with a friend. It was my first time only having two people solving the clues. It was fun and I really enjoyed the set up of the room. It looked like a speakeasy. I think we would have solved faster with one more person but we made it out with 19 seconds to spare! The hints are good and we didn't need to use any clues, which cost time. This one was also cool because you start in a dark room and have to figure out how to turn on the lights! Not totally dark, but you definitely need to get the lights figured out first.

room_title: Escape room "Western" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Super friendly and helpful staff with a great setup. We tried the Western room and came *THIS* close to victory, but were thwarted by an oversight on some simpler puzzles. Loved it, definitely coming back to try the Science room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Western" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: My husband and I did the Western room with our two kids (13 & 17) and we had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Western" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Our group of 8 consisted of 5 adults and 3 teens. The Western Room was so funny and just perfect for our first ever escape room. Definitely stimulates teamwork. We were so excited solving each puzzle! We can't wait to book the Voodoo room next.

room_title: Escape room "Western" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Did three out of four rooms at Lockdown. It was a great experience each time, and the Western theme was my favorite. The decorations are really good and authentic and add to the story. Lisa did an awesome job greeting us, getting us ready, and helping us when we got stumped. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Western" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Very nice set up. We had a great time doing voodoo and western!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: X-13" by Trapped! Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This is the second location of the original Upland Trapped. Our team of four played the X-13 Room and escaped with 8 min left using only one hint. Very fun, realistically immersive game. Good puzzles and tech. The staff was fun to work with and helped us keep the story going throughout the game. Highly recommend any of their rooms, and can't wait until the new ones open!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: X-13" by Trapped! Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We enjoyed operation x-13, it was a great themed room with awesome puzzles, we recommend it to everyone

room_title: Escape room "Operation: X-13" by Trapped! Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was really cool! Tried the Operation: X-13 room with a couple of my friends and they all had a good time (it was their first escape room). Definitely would want to try the Sector 13 or the Down the Rabbit Hole at their other locations. Overall a good experience, would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Hexadron" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: We loved it! We did the Hexadron with my son for his 13th birthday! Most fun I've had in a long time! We escaped! Thanks to our guide, Paul! You were awesome! All the staff was really nice!

room_title: Escape room "The Hexadron" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Had an absolute blast! John was our host and he was phenomenal. The interaction between guests and staff was top notch. Escaped from Hexadron with just under ten minutes to spare on a first visit, I can't wait to visit again!

room_title: Escape room "The Hexadron" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: Absolutely spectacular fun! Very clever puzzles to keep you on your toes as you move through the room to escape. The Hexadron (Alien Room) was out of this world! I can't wait to come back!

room_title: Escape room "The Hexadron" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: I couldn't believe how much fun I had. My dad and I went back the next night to do a second room, we loved it so much. The people running it were great too, especially Jamie. The new room, Hexadron, was awesome! Thanks for running such a great place to escape to (and from!) !

room_title: Escape room "The Hexadron" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: My family loved our escape experience! We booked the Hexadron room & escaped with 2 minutes left! It was such a fun night working together to figure out the clues! You really have to think outside of the box but our game host gave us great clues without giving it away! The staff was awesome! I would recommend this activity for all ages & groups! Can't wait to go back & try a different room!

room_title: Escape room "The Workshop" by Escape Room Yuma in Yuma
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Spy Game" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: We visited on a Saturday night, the staff were so friendly and helpful. The room was challenging and fun! If we were local we would definitely return!

room_title: Escape room "Spy Game" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: This was our first time to do an escape room! We had a blast even though we didn't make it out. We will definitely be back and with more people. Everyone was so nice and helpful!

room_title: Escape room "Nautilus" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Makes for a very fun evening with friends! Rooms have a creative theme and fun puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Nautilus" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've been to three different 60out locations and each as been wonderful. The rooms are decorated to feel realistic and the clues are clever. Staff has been friendly and professional. We just keep going back. One of these days we will finish without assistance! No way.

room_title: Escape room "Nautilus" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had so much fun! Our host Rose was the best!!! We can't stop talking about this great experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: We did the cabin and had an amazing time! The clues were perfect and the room was so fun! Chad was the best host, make sure you ask for Chad!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: I wasn’t really sure if this would be for my 30+ friend group, but it was a blast! We got out with 13 minutes to spare and it was just awesome.Fun, Challenging, and Interesting! It truly exceeded all of my expectations. Honestly I can’t wait to go back and do another room! We did the cabin, but I look forward to the next one. Literally so fun!Also a super nice facility overall. Not cheesy and the room felt like an immersive experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: Thank you so much! Best people and best escape rooms in Tuscaloosa. We did The Cabin and it was challenging and fun!

room_title: Escape room "Revenge of Mosi" by Escape This in Hesperia
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Malice Manor" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: Had a great time with 9 of my friends today! It was our first escape room and we had a blast, although choosing the hardest room (Sorcerer's Shack) was maybe not the best idea! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a fun few hours!

room_title: Escape room "Malice Manor" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: This was my first escape room experience and I loved it!! We went for the sorcerer's shack and had a blast!  I definitely recommend escape out for a fun activity or for team building events.

room_title: Escape room "Malice Manor" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: Took my husband and 7 friends to the Sorcerer's room. It was a real challenge and we all loved it! Can't wait to go again.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Panic" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: Our little group went in with minimal teamwork, however I’m super satisfied how everything turned out. Audrie was a great guide who did a wonderful job at helping us work through. And shoutout to Diego the zombie, hustle on point. Definitely would recommend to others.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Panic" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: This is one of the many escape rooms that I have visited and it is one of the best. My favorite room by far is zombie panic in which zombie Rochelle scared me to death, and my game master Grace was really sassy but fun! Keep up the good work!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Panic" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: This place is amazing! I have been to quite a few escape room places and this one is my favorite. I went there with a group and we did the zombie room. It completely delivered! It was scary (they also have other rooms so don't let the scare-factor turn you away) , and It introduced some puzzle elements I had never seen before. This, combined with numerous object puzzles and a really kind staff made the night very enjoyable. This place is a definite recommend for all escape room enthusiasts.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Panic" by Alcatraz Escape Games in Phoenix
review: This room was so fun. Our Zombie Thomas was awesome. This room was on the difficult scale but have plans to do it again with my family!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect San Luis Obispo in Grover Beach
review: This place is awesome! One of the best escape room companies in the country hands down. If you are looking for something fun, exciting, and new to do while in SLO... CHECK THIS PLACE OUT. Grim Stacks was a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect San Luis Obispo in Grover Beach
review: I highly recommend Puzzle Effect -SLO! Our first ever Escape room experience and O!M!G! SO MUCH FUN! It was one of the most fun and exciting things I’ve done on a very long time. We finished “ Grim Stacks” with 24 seconds left. I’m shocked I can even speak today from yelling. Such a great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect San Luis Obispo in Grover Beach
review: with this being my first attempt at an escape room - I completed Grim Stacks yesterday - it was great at being interactive, which was really enjoyable, and had a ton of fun finding things and figuring out the clues!

room_title: Escape room "World of Illusions" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The world of illusions escape room was awesome! We jumped into a world of carnivals and magicians. This very interactive escape room had more to solve than just locks and combos. Natasha was a great guide and it was awesome to solve this tricky "hard level" room!Featured on Ellen and VH1, this place lived up to the hype!

room_title: Escape room "World of Illusions" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did World of Illusions room. Definitely a tough room, but nothing short of amazing! I'd recommend to anyone!I just wasn't sure what the storyline was. When we got there, the initial employee that introduced us to the waivers and instructional video was great - but then we got passed off to another guy who brought us to the wrong room at first and I don't know if we were explained the whole story when we got to the correct one. Then when we asked for the first clue, they gave us a clue for a wrong room. Luckily I recalled their mix up earlier and clarified if they were giving a clue for World Of Illusions, and they acknowledged that they gave us the wrong walkie (which wasn't even synced to the 1st room they put us in; it was for the 3rd room).When we solved the room - there was no fanfare. And as we left, there's no enthusiasm. We totally forgot to take a photo too for escaping - I wish there was more excitement when we escape and then a reminder to take a photo. Maybe there would be if we didn't use hints.I just can't wait to go back and play the other rooms because the tricks and locks and clues are high tech and wonderful. They missed the mark on creating a seamless experience start to finish though.

room_title: Escape room "World of Illusions" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I attempted this room with a group of 4, but this will definitely accommodate a bigger group. Great room, nice visuals and effects. I would highly recommend this room for those who have a group on the bigger side (6+).

room_title: Escape room "Movie Night" by XIT Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Ritual Room" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: My daughter and friends did "The Ritual Room" for her 12th birthday. They had so much fun! Pete was a great host, super accommodating and helpful when they needed help. Especially liked that he walked them through the final steps when they didn't "escape". They couldn't stop talking about it all the way home and are already planning when they can go back. Thanks for a great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Ritual Room" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: We took our daughter here for her 10th birthday and did the Ritual Room. While they did need many clues and adult help they had a blast! I can’t wait to go back with my adult friends and try another room!

room_title: Escape room "The Ritual Room" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: The Ritual room got us! Had a great time this being our very first escape adventure. Definitely will return.

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: I can honestly say I had a great time! It was my first time doing an escape room so i was a little scared at first being blindfolded and handcuffed. But the game master was the BEST and he was so friendly too. We broke out with 12 minutes left. Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Last night was my first experience with breakout bham! It was amazing! Def can't wait to go back! We did kidnapping! We broke out with only two seconds left! next time looking forward to hostage!!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: I went with a group of friends not knowing what to expect yesterday and we chose the Kidnapping room. I was nervous from the beginning! Our game master told us the rules and we were blindfolded and ready to go. After using our clues and finding everything around the room, we escaped!! It was so fun and a great group experience, we will definitely go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Very fun and challenging! I did the Kidnapping room, give it a try!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: We had such a great time in the kidnapping room. We didn't escape, but we haven't stopped talking about it. The room was very well thought out. You can tell they really took their time with the planning of this. Will was an awesome game master! Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: My group of friends and I really enjoyed our experience playing #TheKidnapping. We had to work as a team and it was super creative how we escaped. If we hadn't have had the people we did, we wouldn't have made it out. It was great! Awesome team building exercise!

room_title: Escape room "The Kidnapping" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Today was my first time playing as well as the first time for my family. We rather enjoyed ourselves. We booked the Kidnapping room and finished with 1 min 30 sec left. I will definitely be back. Our game master Rochelle was absolutely AMAZING! She does her job really well and she definitely makes me want to come back again. Thanks Breakout Birmingham for a wonderful time!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by Fox in a Box Tucson in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Circus" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: First experience with an escape room. My group did the "Circus" theme. From the second you walk in the door, this place is a 5 star. The ambiance is top notch. The decor is fantastic! The staff is very engaging and in costume. They seem to really enjoy what they do. The room itself was awesome! My group of 6 failed to beat it. Very challenging and incredibly fun. We can't wait to come back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Circus" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: So much fun! This place really does a great job and gives you a good bang for your buck. I loved it as soon as I walked in. The way everything is decorated, you're immediately in the "zone". I don't want to say too much and give anything away. Just grab some friends and do it!

room_title: Escape room "Circus" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: I walked in to check the venue out while I was doing some sight seeing in LA. I hadn't expected to a) be allowed to attempt a room solo or b) there to be any rooms available when I was there. Sure enough, I could and there was. So, since I was there and was offered a discount by Danny, I took advantage. Sadly, I could not escape Carnival. If I ever get back to LA from the East Coast, I'm coming back for revenge! Decor and costuming was beautiful.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Keep" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: Been here three times. A couple friends and I have done most of the rooms here and we always have a blast doing it, even when we get frustrated and lose the game, we still have fun overall. The rooms are really well thought out with awesome props and themes that by-far exceed any other escape rooms the Fresno/Clovis area has to offer. Wizards Keep was my personal favorite. It used very imaginative puzzles that had us doing some silly things to try and solve them. I definitely recommend this place to anyone who doesn't take themselves too seriously and is willing to have some fun, I know I can't wait til we go back.

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Went with my friends and we were all first timers. We lucked up by being paired up with of a group who had some experience. We did have to use a few clues but we managed to escape! We had an absolute wonderful time and look forward to doing it again!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Awesome escape room!! Puzzles are great and not overtly hard...unless you over think some things (like I did). Their first room has a great setup and definitely gives you a museum feel. Can't wait for the second room!!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Had a great time. We have done other Escape rooms and this one is really fun. Challenging, but not so advanced that beginners will feel lost. Can't wait to try their next room.

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: 14th Birthday for my son Cole and 7 of his middle school friends. They said it was "Legit". They love it and escaped in 42 minutes. On the way home, the kids were figuring out whose birthday was next so they could go back and try the second room. Great job to Tangerine and staff! We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: We had a great night at escapism SD!  It made for a mysterious, challenging, and fun ladies night out!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: This was amazing!!   This was my first of many escape rooms and it ignited a burning passion in my loins that drives me to discover more escape rooms to escape over and over again.  Love this place, cant wait til they open the next room!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Escapism in San Diego
review: We had a blast at Escapism! It was my groups first time doing an "escape room" so we didn't know what to expect. You get exactly 1 hour to try and complete your mission. The escape room itself was challenging and full of surprises. There were 8 of us total and it definitely took teamwork! We escaped with only a few minutes to spare. The staff was really friendly, I would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Superheroes Adventure" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Had a blast in the Super Hero room celebrating our daughter's 13th b-day with her friends. Challenging and well put together! Using all our hints we made it out with 4 minutes to spare. Highly recommend! Can't wait to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Superheroes Adventure" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Absolutely loved it! We all had so much fun and could not stop laughing our way through the Superhero escape room. Highly recommend for a night out with friends or as a team builder.

room_title: Escape room "Superheroes Adventure" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Did the Superhero theme and it was awesome! It was more fun that I have ever I imagined. Good thing I had a bunch of nerds with me to get it done with 10 minutes left. Thank you Alex and team for the great birthday celebration.

room_title: Escape room "Superheroes Adventure" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: We had a ball. I was a bit anxious as didn't really know what to expect! Did the superhero room with some friends for my husbands birthday. It was such a giggle! Josh was a great moderator, without his hints we would surely never have got out of there! Highly recommend it! We got out with just 32 seconds to spare so it was a close one! Very cleverly put together

room_title: Escape room "Superheroes Adventure" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Best place in San Diego! Their set up is clean and super challenging and fun! I've done the Japanese room and last night we did the Superheroes room! Loved both rooms so much!!! Never made it out of the Japanese room but did make it out of the superheroes room with 22 mins to spare! Can't wait til they get another room going...I will definitely be trying my escape skills to break out

room_title: Escape room "Masquerade Manor" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: This place was great and the owner was super nice. We're planning on trying all of the rooms

room_title: Escape room "Masquerade Manor" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: Probably the highest quality escape room we've seen. Every puzzle worked flawlessly and was cohesive with the flow of the room. The detail put into the aesthetic of each room was amazing. We'll definitely be back

room_title: Escape room "Masquerade Manor" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: This is the BEST escape room I have gone to. The rooms were very detailed, high tech, clean, and very thought out. The hints do not cost you time and are very clear without giving away what to do. The game masters were very present and considerate, we never waited very long for a response. My group was small so we were paired with another couple. They ensured that things would be fair and made sure we knew one person from their group (2 people) had to agree to a hint before they gave one. They were very welcoming from start to finish, they don't rush you at any point. I highly recommend visiting them! They have 2 locations. You will not regret it! P.S. photos are of their waiting room with puzzles and some awesome seating. They have intricate brass chandeliers too that are very pretty.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: The puzzles were complex and really made you think, yet nothing felt impossible. The clues are quite solid and it was lot of fun to see how everything was connected. It was a great experience - highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: We had a completely awesome time escaping. The building is a perfect setting and the puzzles were challenging without being impossible.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: I had such a great time escaping the room here! It's a great team bonding event and I highly recommend it to everyone to try it out. The story and puzzles are carefully thought out so you'll definitely be motivated to work together to find all the clues. I have only done one other escape the room before, but this one was definitely my favorite. You won't regret it!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: Went with a group of friends to celebrate my birthday. Everyone had a blast. The gamemaster was timely, friendly, and informative. It escape was challenging enough to be fun but not so challenging to be frustrating. We are planning to return to attempt the second room once it opens.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: We had lots of fun. The Alien escape is a great mental challenge which we weren't able to solve. Our host, Bob, was great! I highly recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: A mixture of hunting and solving skills, along with teamwork. The puzzles were just challenging enough, especially given the time constraint. It was a lot of fun, and definitely worth doing again when new challenges become available.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Aliens" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: This was our 3rd time doing something like this and by far our best experience. Our 'guide' was awesome. He made sure we were all engaged and gave us just the right amount of encouragement. Highly recommend this to anyone who likes puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Oracle Mystery" by SUBScape Games in San Diego
review: The second room we did was Oracle Mystery.  I would say this room is intermediate difficulty.  It's gypsy/supernatural themed, but I wouldn't consider it scary.  This room was definitely more challenging.  I enjoyed this room.  It took us a minute to figure out where to start, and the puzzles in this room required more thinking.  We did require a hint for this room.

room_title: Escape room "Oracle Mystery" by SUBScape Games in San Diego
review: Great time for any age. Did the Oracle room. Challenging, but made it out with 3 minutes to spare! Staff was helpful and knowledgeable. Peter sent us in prepared for our mission! Would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Long Lost Pharaoh" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: The room was decorated amazingly and staff were very friendly

room_title: Escape room "The Long Lost Pharaoh" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: The decor of the room was fantastic. The actors were also great. The theme we did, Nightmare, was wonderful. We felt like the clues weren't very sequential and we spent a majority of the time just searching for items. The front desk ladies were also nice.

room_title: Escape room "The Long Lost Pharaoh" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: We were really surprised on the amount of detail in the rooms and the complexity. The staff were super nice people. My impression was that is would be one room, but we actually had 3 rooms to traverse. You have to solve one part to get to the next part, and so on. It was worth it! We had the room to ourselves with our family. The kids really enjoyed the challenge as well. Just make sure you ask if it's kid friendly if you plan on bringing your kids.

room_title: Escape room "ELF" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room " Bates Motel" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: The folks that worked there were very nice and the "Bates Motel" escape room was a lot of fun. The only criricism I have is that the room was very hot.

room_title: Escape room " Bates Motel" by Gulf Coast Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: Thank you Holly for an amazing experience! We enjoyed our time so very much! Bates motel was fun and entertaining even our preteen daughters enjoyed it!

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Excellent ! 10 stars This company knows entertainment , the staff treats you  like family  . The clown and his assistant love their jobs and it shows  .  I am so impressed with the attention to detail , the props  are so unique  you become immersed in the room .  Thank you for making our first escape room so memorable.We can't wait to try tuts room! The Converse Clan

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: We had a blast and the clown and the young lady were so fun they made it so exciting. They were so friendly and you can tell they really enjoy their job. This was my first time going to an escape room we will be going back next month for sure. I will  be telling my friends about this  place. They gave us your of the other room we can't wait for the next room.

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: What a great experience! The staff was very friendly and accomodating. My wife and I went for our anniversary with some friends and we had a great time. The owner was respectful and didn't scare my wife with his clown costume. I don't want to give too much away but the Clownatorium escape room was so much fun. Awesome experience, go check this place out. You will not be disappointed!

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: I've done a little under 10 escape rooms in San Diego and this has been one of my favorites. We played the Clownatorium and had a great time! This is by far the best themed and atmospheric escape room I've been to. I'm looking forward to trying the Space Parody and also their upcoming room as well!

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: What a great experience! We went with our family to celebrate my wife's birthday. The staff are so awesome and accommodating! They had a Birthday balloon and candies for her! It was such an awesome experience with live actors and innovative puzzles! We had such a great time! We are definitely coming back! They have various themed escape rooms. We experienced the Clownatorium escape room! We are looking forward to experience their other themed rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Awesome experience! Our group was all newbies except for one. We had a great time. Did the clown room and want to go back to do the mummy room next time! Highly recommend. Leave the kiddos at fun and have a night out with friends... loved the clownatorium. Staff were great, funny and very etertaining!

room_title: Escape room "The Clownatorium-2. Upside Down" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: I have only gone to one other escape room before but I know Nightwalker Caverns' Clownatorium is absolutely brilliant! It was so much fun and was so incredibly detailed. I was worried that our party was too big at first, but there was so much to do that it seemed like everyone was doing something at all times. It was also a perfect blend of creepy and hilarious fun. I'm definitely excited to go try out more of their escape rooms soon! If you like pop culture references, make some time to notice the details!

room_title: Escape room "Jesse James" by The Experience Escape Rooms in Centerton
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Heroes of the Galaxy" by Action Hero Studios in Phoenix
review: Great concept that works for the whole family! My kids, my husband, and I all really enjoyed it.

room_title: Escape room "Heroes of the Galaxy" by Action Hero Studios in Phoenix
review: Stopped in tonight to try this place. Very accommodating. Great decor and fun atmosphere. Thanks again!

room_title: Escape room "Heroes of the Galaxy" by Action Hero Studios in Phoenix
review: My kids and I had a great time at Action Hero Studios! Very kid friendly, my boys loved the robot and solving all of the puzzles. They're already talking about going back!

room_title: Escape room "The Space Station" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: This was my first escape room experience, and I had a really good time.  I would definitely go back and try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Space Station" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: My sister and 15 yr old niece came up from Los Angeles to visit and we took them here on a Friday night.  Great time for all of us.  We didn't escape but had a blast.  My niece couldn't stop talking about how fun it was and wants to go back as soon as she can.  Thank you to the ladies running the experience. Great times!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Space Station" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: What a great experience we had with a group of others we met at escape room. The challenges we were tasked at solving were age appropriate, anxiety provoking (in a good way) and of course a lot of fun. You have ample opportunity to try to solve problems and help is readily available by phone. Most of all, it's fairly affordable at about $35 a person. Will definitely do this again!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Santa's List" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Solid escape room.  The themes were thoughtful and relatively well done.  I did two here.  The seasonal Christmas theme was good for the kids but you can tell was not as well integrated into the puzzles.  I find the best escape rooms integrate the puzzles into the story or logic of the escape in such a way that one does not feel like one is doing a puzzle just for the puzzles sake or just to get to the next puzzle.  It really does feel like you are solving a mystery and are performing some deductions and detective work.  The Santa Operations felt like one puzzle after another.  Still the kids had fun.  I have done one of the other staple Escape Rooms and felt like it was well done.  Definitely worth doing with friends or the family.  This is a well run escape room company and serves the customers well.  The staff was friendly.

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Santa's List" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the Santa themed room today at the Del Amo location, 3 adults and 2 kids. It exceeded our expectations. We wanted to do one that wouldn't be too scary but were a little worried it would be simple..it wasn't! Really fun, super tricky, great family fun. The staff were really friendly and professional and it was clean and well organized. We all left wanting to come back. Thanks guys!

room_title: Escape room "The Dynasty - Royal Library" by Legend X in Los Angeles
review: This is my first escape room and it was fun! I came here in a group of 6 and we tried the Royal Library room (first room). Everything there had a purpose and required us to be very resourceful! We could work on multiple puzzles at once so if we couldn't figure one out right away, we could always focus on the other. We barely got frustrated/stuck for a long time and used 2 hints in the first room. There are also some pretty cool tech things/mechanics and some things could be deceiving! Also, I really like how the rooms have some sort of storyline - I think it becomes more interesting.Solving the first room led us to the Alley (second room) and we used our remaining time from the 1 hour time limit to explore/solve things. I think the transition from the library to alley was the most frustrating part because only 2 people could work on the puzzle (very clever but took too long and I had nothing to do) to get us all into the second room. But that second room was actually really pretty. I actually came back with a different group of friends to try the 2nd room, but I thought the first room's puzzles were better (2nd room was also crowded).I would suggest using up all your remaining hints to get as far as you can on your second room because we wouldn't have completed the second room given the amount of time we had left - but perhaps we could've gotten farther. Also, don't play with the pocketwatch they lend you because I accidentally stopped it and couldn't tell how much time I had left OOPS :P Finally, a huge thanks to the guy working there. He's super nice and helpful! He also explained the hints really well (and straight to the point so that we didn't waste time) when we needed help. We even got a photo printed at the end for completing the room, hurrah!

room_title: Escape room "The Dynasty - Royal Library" by Legend X in Los Angeles
review: Super fun! This is my first time at an escape room. I had never even heard of the concept before this. My husband and I had so much fun playing the Royal Library. We were the only ones who reserved the 5pm timeslot on Friday evening and we got done solving everything before time ran out. You get 1 hour which is a good amount of time. There were a lot of interesting things to find and the puzzles were really tricky and fun to solve. I loved the special effects and the super powers you need to use to unlock hidden objects to reveal the clues. Cool use of technology! I would highly recommend trying it out. I really appreciate getting a printed team photo at the end. What a cool souvenir to remember the experience by! The staff is super friendly, helpful, and nice!

room_title: Escape room "The Dynasty - Royal Library" by Legend X in Los Angeles
review: Super fun! My husband and I had so much fun playing the Royal Library. We were the only ones who reserved the 5pm timeslot on Friday evening and we got done solving everything before time ran out. You get 1 hour which is a good amount of time. There were a lot of interesting things to find and the puzzles were really tricky and fun to solve. I loved the special effects and the super powers you need to use to unlock hidden objects to reveal the clues. I would highly recommend trying it out. I really appreciate getting a printed team photo at the end. What a cool souvenir to remember the experience by!

room_title: Escape room "Slaughter" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: So much fun! My boyfriend and I stumbled across the Hotel when a zombie slammed her face against the window we were casually walking past. Definitely got our attention and we went right on in. We joined two strangers in the Slaughter House. We were blindfolded and handcuffed to the floor and WOW, thankfully we worked well with the other two guys. This is definitely a team effort. No way you could do this on your own. We almost made it to the end but "died" right before the end. All in all it was a great experience. We will be going again.

room_title: Escape room "Slaughter" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: Did Slaughter. Succumbed to the room but definitely best escape room experience by far.

room_title: Escape room "Slaughter" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: We did slaughter and it was for my best friends 25 birthday. The beginning felt like a flashback of Saw! I was so excited my heart was beating... The front desk hostess was very hospitalble, and the café hostess was very cool and served us all a very delicious drink to get our energy up while we waited for the serial killer. Overall a great experience we definitely will be back in the upcomong weeks.

room_title: Escape room "Murder at the Mansion" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: My crew of 4 did the Murder at the Mansion. We had such a blast! Almost made it. We definitely will return and do more of the rooms! We are still talking about how much fun we had!

room_title: Escape room "Murder at the Mansion" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: Tonight was a lot of fun with our group of 8. We did "Murder in the Mansion" and all had a blast. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Murder at the Mansion" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: My husband, some of his friends and I did the haunted mansion- it was a blast. We liked it so much we did the other 2 rooms by ourselves. Although we didn't make it, the 13th floor was my favorite.

room_title: Escape room "Murder at the Mansion" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: Eight of us did the Murder Mansion room and had a great time! It made our brains work! This was such a unique activity that is great for a girls night out, birthday or even for couples. You will have a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Murder at the Mansion" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: My motley crew of 7 friends booked an escape from "Murder at the Mansion". It was what the birthday girl wanted to do on her special day and by golly (yes, that is still cool to say) we had a truly "terrifyingly" wonderful time. Having been the only Escape Room aficionado, I walked into the room with the understanding that...we WOULD escape. It soon came clear that we would all have to put our minds together to get through the clues, puzzles and questions to get out. And we would have done it, if it hadn't been for those meddling kids!

room_title: Escape room "Catalina Pirate Challenge" by Catalina Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: There were 4 adults and 4 children ages 3, 9, 9 and 11 in our group. We had such an amazing time! The people who run the escape room were incredible with the children in showing them how to solve the clues while the children felt like they were solving them on their own the entire time.

room_title: Escape room "Catalina Pirate Challenge" by Catalina Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: A labyrinth of mystery! I had the greatest time with my team of friends, searching for clues, keys and combos to getting out.

room_title: Escape room "Catalina Pirate Challenge" by Catalina Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: This was so much fun! Great theme, followed through methodically and well put together. Jeanette was extremely nice, helpful, and made the experience extremely enjoyable and fun!

room_title: Escape room "Once Upon A Time" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: The room we did here was called Once Upon a Time. We really liked it. We were a group of five. We finished with just about 25 minutes left and thought it was a little quicker than we thought. The mechanics on the room was really impressive too. The doors popping opens were fun to watch. I'm looking forward to going back and trying another room.

room_title: Escape room "Once Upon A Time" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: First time at Red Door : Sunday 3:50p .. Malcom was our Guy.. He did an amazing job, he gave us the best nuggets when needed.  We all felt comfortable and really appreciate the staff (Malcom) at Red Door.  Our Escape Room - Once Upon a Time- .. Thank you !  We will return.  Kelley's and Geyer's !!

room_title: Escape room "Once Upon A Time" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: If you want to do an escape room try The Red Door in Rancho Cordova it was fantastic! We did once upon a time it was so much fun! We will definitely return to do another escape room!  It's a nice location with restaurants surrounding it.

room_title: Escape room "High Roller" by Extreme Escape Redding in Redding
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sherlocked" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: This place is awesome!!!! You will have a great time. The staff is friendly and will work hard to give you a great experience. Great for all ages and groups. It will challenge your thinking and sharpen your "dectective" skills. Looking for a unique birthday event or just for fun tou will not be disappointed here.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlocked" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Best escape room experience I've had! The staff was friendly and the room we did was well laid out and challenging! It seems like they put a lot of thought into their design.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlocked" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Great night with family. My first time as it was for most of us. Great enthusiasm! Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Emerald Isles" by Trapped In Decatur in Huntsville
review: This was the first escape room for our group of 4. We had the best time! It was exciting and challenging, and we felt pretty accomplished when we found the treasure with 10 minutes to spare! We will definitely return, multiple times, I'm sure.

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: A group of us did the Jack the Ripper room this week and it was so much fun! For most of us it was our first time participating in any escape room. Our host, Stephanie, was very fun and helpful! She was as excited as we were, ha! We plan on visiting Palm Springs again soon and trying out the Bank Heist room! Thanks for making that part of our vacay memorable!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: We did the Jack the Ripper room. Not only was it really fun and challenging but Stephanie helped us from start to finish even when we told her we only had 2 people and the room required 3. The experience was everything we wanted it to be and Stephanie really helped make it that way. The room itself had the perfect mixture of challenging clues but not so challenging they made you feel like it was impossible. Definitely worth trying!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Challenging and FUN experience for our family group of 8. Ages ranged from 13-52. Everyone had a blast. Our host, T-money was very friendly and helpful. Thanks to her clues we solved the mystery of Jack the Ripper with a minute to spare.

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Soo much fun. We did Jack the Ripper and beat it with 20 minutes left!! I already want to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: It was such a great time! We went for our daughter's 21st birthday. We did the Jack the ripper room! Amazing and so much fun! We definitely will be back! Beth was our game master and she was wonderful! So sweet and helped with clues, Top customer service! Can't wait to go again!

room_title: Escape room "1969 - Insurgent Attack" by The Escapeopolis Project in Fayetteville (AR)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Workshop" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The Wizard room was really fun!  This was our second time at an escape room - the first time for Mother's Day and this time for Father's Day!  Since my family and I are mentally challenged at times with puzzle solving, Apprentice "Dan" was awesome and helped us make it out with just 3 seconds to go! I highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Workshop" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I went with a group of 5 to the Wizard's Workshop room. I enjoyed the variety of puzzles that had to be solved and the outcomes of solving each of the puzzles. There were some fun and unexpected surprises that kept things interesting and really motivated us to keep pushing ahead.  I would definitely recommend 60out to anyone that is interested in trying an escape room for the first time. Judy, our game master, was great! She did a fantastic job orienting us on the ground rules, and also was great with giving us hints when we got stuck.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Workshop" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Our wizarding apprentice Judy was super helpful though we took no hints, her briefing and intro got us going. Our experience in the wizarding room went really well for a mixed group that some had escape room experience and some didn't. The room has cool tech and interactive puzzles. We had some really cool moments after solving them.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Workshop" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Wow, this place was awesome! I've done three escape rooms so far at other places, but this is definitely my favorite! On Halloween, we showed up to do the Wizard's Workshop one, and we were running late, but Damien (who was totally awesome, by the way!) was super chill and flexible and set up the room great for us and got us really excited to do it! And man, was it fun! Really great quality puzzles that were solvable and logical, but still very challenging... Awesome design and theming, and Damien was attentive and enthusiastic and made it a great experience! We all agreed this was maybe our most fun Halloween we've ever had. Thanks guys, can't wait to try another one of your rooms soon!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard's Workshop" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've played around 10 escape rooms now, and the 3 rooms I've done with 60Out were amazing! I've played Titanic and Wizard Workshop at their Marina Del Rey location, and Mystery of Senator Payne at their West LA location. Titanic was a little easy, but a lot of the puzzles were really innovative and impressive. Wizard Workshop was a lot of fun, but it's the hardest of the three of done so far. Definitely save it for when you have a bit more experience with escape rooms. Parking at Marina is easy, there was a lot right next to the building that we were able to use.

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was a lot of fun! Definitely want to come back for the Crime Scene Room.

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Great time with visiting Family from Oklahoma. We did good.

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Done a number of Escape Rooms in LA & this one beat them all! We did The Temple and the room was clean, everything worked properly, clues were HIGH QUALITY and the story was fun! Even more so, the lady who sets up the group for the room was a great storyteller and did a great job of setting the atmosphere before we even started. We are going back again this weekend to try their next room!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I did the Secret Temple room with 7 other people for a friends bday party.  It was $25 each.  It was definitely a fun activity, but it wasn't as logic, puzzle-solving centered as I expected.  There was more trial and error and a little randomness involved.The man and woman that greeted us were fun, nice and engaging.  The guy continued on to monitor us in the room and was helpful (with clues) when we needed it.  Obviously this whole operation was set up and is run by some fun & creative people.  I see in some of the other reviews people mentioning an actress, but maybe we didn't get that far?!  I would definitely try a different room or other escape activity but didn't love this one.  It was a little more frustrating than it was fun in retrospect because I think that specific puzzle needed a main clue to bind all the random stuff together (maybe as a hint, they could reveal another framed clue that would give you an idea of what move you need first instead of the monitor giving verbal clues).  I'm not going into any detail so as not to give anything away.I also think a few details would make the room aesthetically a lot more cooler and make you feel like you are actually in a secret temple room.  There was laminating (which I get makes things last longer but just printing out new little papers seems worth it to heighten the experience) and labels/stickers that kind of took you right out of the secret temple and into Staples. lol.  I'd rate this experience a 3.5 but since everyone else's reviews are so high and it was worth trying, I don't want to lowball!  I'm curious to try the Apt. 205 room since people seem to love that one!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Writing this review after our second visit to this amazing escape room! It all starts with the awesome staff! They really have gone the extra mile to intelligently design the rooms. Loved the exciting twists and turns while keeping to the theme from start to finish. On our first visit we were not able to solve The Secret Temple - it left us scratching our heads and more determined to complete a room. We came back to try Apartment 205 and solved it. We had so much fun we had to try the Temple again... Second time was a charm and we were able to solve it too... with clues from the secret society of course ;-) we can't wait for room three. We will be back again! Enigma Escape Rooms makes for a fun night with friends! Six thumbs up!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience! I think it's very unique although i've only been to the Exit game. But reading all the reviews, this would be one of the top.This experience is for sure worth it. Me and my co-workers have tried the Secret Temple, and Boy, our mind was boggled! They really put a lot of effort and thought with the puzzles and combinations. Lots and lots of surprises.I love how they have a narrator with you who's a really good actress. You can ask for a hint which i suggest, would be really helpful to get out.Online booking was great, they have a really good website, easy to navigate and great price! Parking is not bad, you have a few parking space at the back of the building. Great Area, and i love the interior setting. Can't wait to try Apartment 205!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Temple" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We experienced the Secret Temple...such an awesome experience!  A great way to spend family time!  Would love to do it over and over again!  Great times!DO IT...you won't regret it!  :)

room_title: Escape room "The Bathhouse & Gambler" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: I loved the Bathhouse/Gambler room. The props were great, the staff was freindly and helpful. Can't wait to try one of the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Bathhouse & Gambler" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: We held our annual company Christmas party on December 19th in the Bathhouse Gambler escape room and it was SO MUCH FUN!! This was the first escape room experience for the majority of the group and they were nervous about getting started. But the room was very engaging and interesting, so they got into it right away. The puzzles/problems were a great combination of difficulty and cleverness that picked the brains of even the seasoned escape room participants. Everyone loved the Hot Springs theme and were talking about it for days after we played. Everyone agrees we will return soon to play the two other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "The Bathhouse & Gambler" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: My boyfriend and I escaped Bath House and Gambling! We were yelling at each other and laughing the entire time. The room was super challenging & great staff.

room_title: Escape room "The Bathhouse & Gambler" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: We had a blast solving the Bathhouse and Gambler room with Heather as our guide! Tons of challenging fun for the whole family, no matter the age. Thanks Escape Hot Springs!

room_title: Escape room "The Bathhouse & Gambler" by Escape Hot Springs in Hot Springs
review: A great experience!! Took two grandsons and they loved it!! First time they have escaped. We have been to other escape rooms, but really enjoyed the Bathhouse and Gambler room. All our family loves escape rooms and this one is great fun!!

room_title: Escape room "The Gift" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: We had an awesome time at Red Door! It was my first escape room, and we did "The Gift" which was challenging and clever. Unfortunately, we didn't escape, but we had a blast! Our Gamemaster was great; he was always ready to give hints when we needed them, and even walked us through the rest of the puzzle in the last room when time was up (we were so close!) Overall, we had a great experience and I can't wait to return sometime in the near future!

room_title: Escape room "The Gift" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: I've been to several across the country. They have nice props and great atmosphere. Staff was great and super friendly. Eugene our game master was very nice and supportive during our game of family v family with The Gift. Interesting loyalty program that makes you want to come back for more.

room_title: Escape room "The Gift" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: My team and I have frequented many escape rooms in Northern California. This one had to be one of the best yet. The puzzles were challenging but with some head-scratching and brain power, they were a fun and welcome challenge. Friendly and efficient Game Master. Accomplished "The Gift" and look forward to attempting another room in the future! I would give more info, but anyone who has participated in game rooms know the mystery is the best part.

room_title: Escape room "Chemical Lab" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Probably the hardest of the Lock Down rooms as of Nov. 2018. My wife and I have done 50+ rooms and solved this room with only 2 minutes to spare. Better played with 3-5 players. The immersion was realistic. Perfect mix of modern and unique traditional elements nicely themed. I highly recommend any of the Lock Down rooms. The staff was friendly and polite. They were very accommodating with the booking process. The game master was tracking our progress carefully and gave hints promptly. Can’t say enough about this company and their rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Chemical Lab" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This is a well-done room. The puzzles were somewhat challenging but very creative, and the room's décor was really spot on for the theme. Everything worked well and it was a very enjoyable experience for myself and my husband.

room_title: Escape room "Chemical Lab" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This place rocks! We barely made it out of the chemical lab in time. What fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Chemical Lab" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: I went with my husband and teenage girls and did the chemical lab. It was challenging and fun! I would recommend this to anyone who wants to be challenged.

room_title: Escape room "The Triton" by Escape This in Hesperia
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Heist" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Mafia Heist was a totally immersive experience with the Speak Easy decor and inventive puzzles and clues!! Our team has completed almost 50 escape games and we absolutely loved this one! A must do!!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Heist" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My three friends and I did the Mafia Heist escape room. Two were escape room rookies, but everyone did fine. The employee (I forget their name) was really nice and helpful explaining the rules to us. We're planning on going back to try and escape from The Attic.

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Heist" by EscapeX Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Went here for my friends birthday (group of 10) and we all made it through Mafia Heist with 8 minutes to spare. This was my first escape room experience and I had a really fun time. I think Mafia Heist is a great start for first timers like me!

room_title: Escape room "Mysteries of Egypt" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: Great attention to detail, and wonderful storylines. Highly recommend. Every aspect of the building is immersed in mystery. Really great!

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Went Friday night for my friend's birthday. It was a group of 6 of us. We didn't complete the Alchemist room but it was super fun. I want to do every room now. Great group of people we were paired with also. Good team effort. Fun evening.

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: We were a group of ten for my friend's birthday and everyone really enjoyed themselves. We did the Alchemist and enjoyed the puzzles and the room setup, staff, and easy parking. It is downtown, but it was fine. Definitely worth the money for the uniqueness, creativity, and knowledgeable staff. Everyone agreed it was worth it for something special.

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Did the Alchemist room. It was awesome. I have done escape rooms before and they were cheesy. This was one awesome. I highly recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: The room was pretty well done although I thought it was a little too dark. We did have a flashlight and a lantern, though. The puzzles were a little too easy (all of us had only done one or two rooms before). I wish the timer appeared in all of the rooms, but it was only visible in the first room. We could only communicate to the game master through a walkie talkie, which was unexpected. Sometimes it was a little challenging to understand them. I think the room used its space well, and we only ever felt too crowded in the first room (with 6 people). We did end up finishing with over 20 minutes. I think everyone still had a good time.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We did the Wild West room on a double date and it was so much fun! We were talking about it the rest of the weekend. We can't wait to go back and try another challenge.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: THIS WAS AWESOME! My husband, mom (visiting from out of town) and I did this on a free evening we had together because we had all heard of escape the rooms and wanted to do one. We wanted to do this as a bonding activity but also because all three of us enjoy good challenges. Typically, my mom and my husband are competitive and I'm the one telling everyone "it's only a game, calm down!" However, by the end, I was cursing (I don't curse) and getting frustrated as a completive side I never see in myself was coming out. We failed the room, going over our 60 minute time by 3 minutes or so. It IS challenging doing the room with only 3 people (as it says on their website) partially because there were times when my husband and mother were solving a clue in one part of the room and meanwhile I was trying to solve a clue on my own in the other corner. Time is of the essence and the more minds working together, the better. However, it is by no means impossible to do this with only two or three people.We did the Wild West room and we felt like this was a good challenge level for us since this is our first escape room (we've heard that at PanIQ, the Kidnapping room is the most challenging with the Alien room being a close second). We would have finished the room in time (I imagine) but we didn't realize it was "okay" to ask for hints. Although the lovely woman working there told us we could, we figured that a) that was "cheating" and b) we were going to escape this room ourselves, gosh dernit! In the future, we will phone in a few times and ask for hints...! So again, this location is not "too tough" to complete as some other puzzle rooms I've seen reviews of in the Phoenix area. They want you to have fun! We will definitely be coming back with more family and friends in the future. It was SUCH a blast! We will be talking about this for a long time afterward.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: Sooooo much fun. Got locked up in the Wild West room with my brothers and dad (all adults) and it was challenging enough to make it entertaining but not so challenging that we were frustrated. Can't wait to go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: What a unique experience. My brother got locked up with his wife (a great idea, btw), and I got to save her (and him). Da da da da! We were the heroes! We asked if we could leave him, but just like the forest: "Pack it in, pack it out...don't litter". The staff was friendly and considerate. We needed a LOT of clues! It really requires community and communiction-which the world needs more of. It was good, wholesome, and great fun. Thanks, PANIQ Room Phx!!!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: It was our first time doing this and it was a blast! It was myself (adult) and four teenagers and it was challenging enough for all of us but tons of fun!! We can't wait to come back and try the other rooms! Plus, the staff was awesome! Thank you for a fun experience!!!!! Hope to see you guys again soon!!

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: Have done 2 of the 3 rooms, Kidnapping and Wild West. Went thru the Kidnapping room with my family and friends (5 of us) and came out with a few minutes to spare. Wild West one went thru with my coworkers (6) for team building and we end up going way over our time. Everyone had a blast and was talking about how they wanted to do the other rooms with their other friends and family. I will most definitely be going back to do the Alien room.

room_title: Escape room "Wild West" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: First time doing a panic room. We went with a group of 6 friends. At first I wasn't sure how I felt about being locked in a room for an hour, but it was a lot of fun working together to escape with only our own ingenuity. The time seem to pass quickly as we were racing the against the clock to solve the series of puzzles that would enable us to escape. I thought it was great! Especially with friends. Would be fun to do with a group of friends, family or team building for work. Grab a coupon and go check it out. Now I want to try all the rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: Lots of room choices, will have to go back for sure! Staff was nice and they don’t make you lock up your stuff, which is a plus.

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: We went for my mother's belated birthday and had a blast! The staff was friendly and informative! You're also allowed to leave the room if needed. Although they don't provide clues upon request like others, I believe it makes it all the more challenging! We may go back for my birthday as well!

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: My family took me for my birthday and we had a blast! Staff was great!

room_title: Escape room "Day of the Dead" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Blaine's Basement" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: We LOVE Escape Games AZ! The staff are so friendly and personable, we've come back to do all of their rooms. We've talked to our other friends to bring different groups to try out their rooms, too.Specifically reviewing Blaine's Basement: You should definitely go in the evening when it's darker out. It definitely adds to the creepiness of the room. Unfortunately, our group did not escape Blaine's Basement (because we were so terrified of the darkness in the room). But when we told our other friends to do it, they escaped and loved it. One of our favorites rooms in all of Arizona.Definitely recommend their "Quest for the Throne" and "Condo" rooms also. Very fun puzzles and a good blend of "locks" and more "technical" triggers.

room_title: Escape room "Blaine's Basement" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: I had a BLAST! For my first escape room - Blaine's Basement was a great way to start! It was innovative, creepy, thrilling and ultimately very well done! I would recommend this to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "Blaine's Basement" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: We've done two escape rooms here and I have to say we love it! Blaine's basement was soooooo much fun! Loved everything about that room! Definitely recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "Blaine's Basement" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: Escaped from Blaine's Basement. Probably our favorite room so far. Very engaging. Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Blaine's Basement" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: It was a blast, Blaine's Basement was ultra realistic and real suspenseful!

room_title: Escape room "Blaine's Basement" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: Braved 'Blaine's Basement' last night. Hate to say it, but he got us! We almost escaped!

room_title: Escape room "The Locked In Dead" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
