review: We did the zombie room and it was awesome! The place was easy to find it's a super clean and the people running were super cool. Unfortunately, we did not escape but we had a great time and will come back again to do the train room.

room_title: Escape room "The Locked In Dead" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Great way to celebrate an 18th birthday with friends and family. While the group did not set any records they did not get eaten by the zombies - thankfully. Watching and listening to the action inside the room was fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Locked In Dead" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Just did the zombie apocalypse room and won! It was so fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Locked In Dead" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: I had such a fun time! This escape room is awesome and is a really good challenge. The zombie room is very fun and brilliantly designed. This makes a great team building exercise or just if you want to have fun with your friends.

room_title: Escape room "The Locked In Dead" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Very clever, well done, entertaining and challenging. Other than being eaten by zombies, we had a great time! The staff was fantastic. The puzzles were challenging, but doable. If we had five more minute, those zombies could never have gotten us!

room_title: Escape room "Queen Anne's Revenge" by Victor Valley Escape in Hesperia
review: This was our 5th and best escape room experience. Our group really enjoyed the whole adventure.  It was really well done.  The puzzles were fun and challenging. There were some clever and surprising ideas that we were still talking about on the way home. We liked the props and professionally done room design.  The staff were helpful and friendly, especially Chelsea. :) We are looking forward to going back when they open their second room.  Great work Victor Valley Escape!

room_title: Escape room "Bio Lab" by Brain Busters Escape Rooms in Daleville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: This is the 3rd time I have played with Breakout Games - Birmingham. All experiences have been great. Can't wait for a 4th attempt.

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: What a fun place in Birmingham. I had a great first experience here with co-workers as a team building activity one afternoon. The staff is super friendly and accommodating, and also very helpful.Our group of 12 split in two groups, one doing the Mystery Mansion and the other called Do Not Disturb, which I was a part of.  We had so much fun with this in a "hotel room" theme trying to track down a kidnapper who had us trapped in the room. Trying to find clues and get out of there in one hour is a challenge but we had a blast. We didn't quite breakout, but were very close! The staff even helped along the way. They gave us 3 free clues we could ask for at any time if we were stumped. After we finished, we even went next door to get pictures taken, which is always fun.All in all, a super cool venue in Birmingham. I highly recommend coming here and hope to be back soon bringing some friends! A big thanks to Jeremy for arranging and helping make it a fun day.

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Me and my wife love Escape Rooms and today we had an opportunity to play both the "Do Not Disturb" room and the "Kidnapped" Room and both were a ton of fun! James was an excellent game master for both rooms. Unfortunately we do not live in Birmingham, but I highly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys Escape Rooms. We will definitely be coming back when we stay in Birmingham again and will bring more people with us! Thank you so much for the wonderful experience!

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Went here for a team building at work. It was very enjoyable. I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Do Not Disturb" by Breakout Games - Birmingham in Birmingham
review: Went with my husband for our anniversary. We were the only two people in the room so it was difficult. Luckily our game master Emily was nice enough to help us out a few times. We had a blast. Will definitely be back but will bring more people with us lol. Also the lobby staff was so nice and friendly. Love this place.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: Oh my God just got done doing Spellbound had such a great time set is unbelievably amazing pretty hard but all of it makes sense. I don't think we would have gotten as far as we did without our GM. Wish they had more rooms can't wait to do another one.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: Our group have completed around 15-20 escape rooms in Arizona and "Spellbound" is our consensus favorite room. The attention to detail and the design of the room is amazing. They definitely spent money creating this room.It was very challenging and we escaped with less than 3 minutes on the clock. But we have a pretty great group of six that work together really well. Wouldn't recommend this room for beginners, but once you've done a couple, you have to check out this room. Since completing "Spellbound", we compare every room we do to this one, and unfortunately, nothing compares to this room. Very friendly staff at Mind Spark, too.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: The Spellbound room was amazing! The quality of the room and props were superb.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: We had an absolute blast. We did the most challenging room, Spellbound, and almost completed the challenge. We will definitely be back again, thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: First time here. 14-year-old girls in the Spellbound room. SO FUN!!! The room is very decorated and the theme is great. Make friends with Alyssa and you can get extra clues if you request them. Clues are totally personalized and helpful. We had so much fun we booked the Zombie room on our way out! Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: I did the Spellbound room this last weekend with some of my favorite people, and it was a wonderful experience. Everything was well-organized, well-made, and very challenging. The production quality and staff are top notch!

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: We just did Spellbound and it was amazing! The clues were all super clever and let me say as someone with a few escape rooms under my belt, it was very different and more difficult than most, but in a fun way! Thanks so much to the amazing staff - you guys were awesome and we are definitely going to come back again! We drove all the way from Tucson to try it out and it was totally worth it!! Thanks for the great escape experience, Mind Spark!

room_title: Escape room "Distress Call" by Unity Escape Rooms in Pomona
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Vault" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: The best experience I've ever had! Puzzles were witty and fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Vault" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: Put away your smart phones/tablets/laptops and exercise your brain power. What a fun place to spend an hour team building. Will definitely come back to try the other rooms! Thank you Spencer!

room_title: Escape room "The Vault" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: So much fun! It was challenging but just the right amount. More witty and exciting than other room escapes I have done. Can't wait to try the new room when it opens!

room_title: Escape room "The Vault" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: It was Awesome!!! The Ragole's finished with 3 minutes to spare.When we started I was thinking What the heck are we doing.But as we started to work with our team, it all came together.Can't wait for the next room.

room_title: Escape room "The Vault" by EscapeIQ in Los Angeles
review: Put away your smart phones/tablets/laptops and exercise your brain power. What a fun place to spend an hour team building. Will definitely come back to try the other rooms! Thank you Spencer!

room_title: Escape room "The Cell Block" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This is an amazing place! Great for everyone. We did the cell block. It was really fun. We had four people and barely made it out in time. A lot of good puzzles. Some really simple and some difficult. The customer service here is top notch. I love hay they say we want y'all to have fun. It's not like other escape rooms where they take pride in you not finishing. They want you to succeed.

room_title: Escape room "The Cell Block" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: The cell was so fun and creative - my 3rd escape room and the best yet! The hosts were fantastic- we will go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Cell Block" by Cluemaster Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We just finished doing "The Cell Block". Well done! Very difficult, but the challenge was worth it! Make sure that you ask for clues. I love it when rooms are not just lock and key. This room included more "reactive" than items when certain puzzles were solved. Right up my alley!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Riddler's Lab" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We have gone to several different escape rooms in Phoenix. This one was by far the best. The staff was friendly and the room was challenging. We did the Lab and made it out in time. The puzzles were creative and there are some neat effects and surprises.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Riddler's Lab" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Had so much fun doing Dr Riddlers lab! We will be back if we come back to Phoenix area!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Riddler's Lab" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Had so much fun doing Dr Riddlers lab! We will be back if we come back to Phoenix area!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Riddler's Lab" by Riddle Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Had so much fun today at Riddle Escape Room. I did Dr. Riddler's Lab with two of my co-workers as a team builder. We had a blast. The owners are great and very friendly. The room/clues were very creative. I will definitely come back here, can't wait to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Marquise Heist" by Escape Room 104 in Pine Bluff
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Jekyll and Hyde" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: this place is awesome. People are so nice

room_title: Escape room "Jekyll and Hyde" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We came in and did Jekyll and Hyde and Mad Hatter on the same night. These rooms were fantastic and you can tell that they are definitely made with love. Jack and Braden were awesome as control masters and the rooms were a lot of fun. It is tough to make the drive all the way out to Mesa, but we will definitely be back to collect the rest of those bracelets!

room_title: Escape room "Jekyll and Hyde" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We did the 90 minute Jekyll and Hyde room. There were four of us. Two adults, two teens. It was a multiple room room. Lots of fun and excitement! Was one of my favorite escape rooms to do. The three people I was with were new to escape rooms. It said medium difficulty. A very well thought out room. We will be back soon to do the carn-evil room.

room_title: Escape room "The Study" by Stockton Escape in Modesto
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Patient 17" by Breaking Point Escape Rooms in Pomona
review: None

room_title: Escape room "International Thief" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: The best escape room experience I have found in Tucson so far! Did the International Thief room with my family while visiting for the holidays. Everyone (newbies and escape room veterans alike) had a great time. Fun, diverse puzzles and an awesome value... I would definitely return.

room_title: Escape room "International Thief" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: None of the eight of us had ever done an escape room. We had two 40 yo youngsters in the group; everyone needs youth!!! The hour in the International Thief Room passed swiftly and our team worked so well together.....we got out with 3 minutes to spare.Everyone agreed, this is really something to share, to keep in mind when entertaining,and do again.

room_title: Escape room "International Thief" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: My 11-year-old son and his friends had an AMAZING time in the International Thief room. Kathy was wonderful. Thanks!

room_title: Escape room "International Thief" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: We had a blast in the International Thief room. The puzzles were tricky, but solvable, and the tips were handy when needed. We'll definitely be back! Thanks for a great time!

room_title: Escape room "International Thief" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: I just had a blast doing the International Thief room with 3 strangers and my girlfriend. Ace of Escape strikes the perfect balance of fun and challenge. Our host (who runs the room) was incredibly gracious. This is a Tucson staple and a must do for anyone looking for a fun time!

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: We did the Alcatraz room and it was a BLAST! Super fun and not terribly expensive, a really wonderful time.

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: We had so much fun in Alcatraz! Even though we lost, we will definitely be back!!

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: We did two rooms in one day bc we loved it so much. Lost was fun Alcatraz way harder but still so much fun not too hard tho we beat both rooms will go back again!

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: For my birthday, my group did the Alcatraz room. It was excellent in design, difficulty and variety of challenges! I have done rooms in Denver and Las Vegas. This was just as good, actually better, than these. Uses an iPad to get clues, so more high tech than just a walkie talkie. A+.

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: So we have been there three days in a row!! We love it and I think we have a new addiction! We escaped Alcatraz tonight, attempted yesterday but got stumped. I love how it makes you use your brain and we are a competitive family so this is so much fun for us!!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Plunder" by Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: Had a great time and loved that the room was truly a challenge. Bring your thinking cap for Pirate's Plunder - you're gonna need it! Will be back for sure.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Plunder" by Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: Had a blast with the family for date night in the pirate room! Much better than just catching another movie!! Highly recommend and we will be back for the spy room!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Plunder" by Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: Brought our family (ages 16-46) for the pirate room. What a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate's Plunder" by Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: We did the Pirate escape room, loved it!! Super fun!

room_title: Escape room "Dragon Snack" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Took my grandkids to Escape Rooms Mesa this weekend and we had a ball! Braden was awesome and made us feel so welcome. He really contributed to our experience. We did the Dragon Snack and escaped with 49 seconds to spare!! Great, great fun!

room_title: Escape room "Dragon Snack" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We did the Dragon Snack room for our 11 year old's birthday party, and it was AWESOME! They were very helpful to ensure that we had a positive/successful experience.

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Escape" by Escape the Room LA in Los Angeles
review: We did the Jurassic Park room for a friend’s birthday! It was SO much fun. Really interesting, complex puzzles. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be back!!

room_title: Escape room "Riddle High" by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Dragon's Lair" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Dragon's Lair was fun and challenging! Went with a group of 6. It was my first escape room and it was a great experience. The Dragon's Lair had an awesome set. My friends and I all got super into it and worked as a team to solve the puzzles!

room_title: Escape room "The Dragon's Lair" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Came out with some friends to play Dragon's Lair and ended up staying to do Jack the Ripper as well. We had so much fun and Michael was super cool.

room_title: Escape room "The Dragon's Lair" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Been to a bunch of escape rooms and this one was one of my favorites. We did dragon's lair and it was so well put together with puzzles and cool effects. Michael was an excellent host!

room_title: Escape room "Shanghaied" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Secret Society" by Escape Enterprise in Daleville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Assassins" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Such a fun/different activity to do on a date night or with a big group! Definitely coming back here again. The staff were very friendly and helpful!

room_title: Escape room "The Assassins" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: We just had our first experience in an escape room today. We had a party of seven and did the Assassins room and it was a lot of fun. We didn't get through it in time but we still had a great time. The staff is very helpful and informative. We would go back and try some different rooms it makes for a fun family hour. Put on your thinking caps :)

room_title: Escape room "The Assassins" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Was here this Saturday for a work team building exercise.  This was my first time doing an "escape room" event. There was no wait and it was not busy, but then again we made an appointment for 11am.  They have a large waiting area and water bottles for sale for a dollar. We were a group of 10 but we were broken up into two groups of 5.  My group did the Assassin themed escape room and we had an hour to escape.  I have to say it was fun albeit the puzzles were challenging (so many locks!).  The room we were in was nicely decorated to the theme, and it had a nice "creepy" ambiance to it to set the mood.  I don't want to say too much and give it away, but overall it was nicely done. The owner is nice, and she also provides up to three hints if you get stuck.  The only downside is that they have a small parking lot.  I recommend carpooling especially if you are a big group like mine.I definitely recommend this place if you love solving puzzles with friends/family and/or as a team building exercise.  We definitely learned teamwork and how to quickly share ideas to get the task done.  It is too bad that I am not close by to Salinas because I would like to come back here again to do the other themes.

room_title: Escape room "Resurrection" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: I'm an escape room enthusiast with 140 rooms under my belt. My group of 4 did both Amnesia and Resurrection. These rooms are absolutely amazing. Quest rooms production value is the best of the best. They did a great job utilizing the actor sparingly in the room which I much prefer than having them standing over your shoulder the whole time. These are must do rooms no matter what your escape room experience is. They have set the bar even higher!

room_title: Escape room "Resurrection" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Incredible!!! I have played over 500 escape rooms and I see between 30-45 haunted attractions each year and Amnesia & Resurrection both impressed me! I highly recommend these experiences for anyone that loves story-driven escape rooms and/or haunted attractions. They are both a lot of adrenaline filled fun. Also Jasmine & Isaac were great! All the staff was great but they were our game masters.

room_title: Escape room "The Lab" by Escape Long Beach in Orange County
review: Finally a local escape room! The group had a great time. Drinks before and dinner after. Great location for a cool event. Highly recommend...

room_title: Escape room "The Lab" by Escape Long Beach in Orange County
review: What a great addition to Long Beach! We did both the queen Mary and the lab and had a lot of fun! Jack was very helpful and it's clear a lot of thought went into the escape rooms. It's especially nice that you are able to customize the level of difficulty for each room. We did the lab at intermediate difficulty and found that to be very enjoyable. We did the queen Mary at advanced and found that to be great too as it's the easier room of the two. Definitely worth a visit!

room_title: Escape room "The Lab" by Escape Long Beach in Orange County
review: We went to Escape Long Beach for my friend's bachelorette/ bday! I did not know what to expect as it was my first go at an escape room! We had so much fun! The staff were very friendly and accommodating!! They have a lounge/ party room where we were able to enjoy some wine and apps we brought while half our group tried to " escape" the "Lab"... It was a great time! There were plans made to return for their "Queen" room, which is opening soon!!

room_title: Escape room "Steampunk" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Terrible experience with my family. The owner/manager was very rude.. I recommend to go elsewhere. Too many escape rooms to be treated like that. They don't set the rooms back up properly either.. if you want to spend a lot of money to be stressed and cursed out be my guest. If you want to have a good experienced don't go to Mesa escape rooms

room_title: Escape room "Steampunk" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We've done 3 different rooms at Escape Rooms Mesa. Great experience every time! We especially enjoyed Steampunk and Outbreak! They put so much effort into their rooms. You truly felt the experience. These rooms are not just lock and key. Great puzzles, and a decent amount of tech. So many other escape houses could learn a thing or two from this place.Worth every penny! You won't regret it

room_title: Escape room "Steampunk" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: I love this place. My friends and I have done several rooms and have never been disappointed. We keep coming back and they keep making new rooms! The latest one we did was Steampunk- the room was super cool! We had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Steampunk" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: I really enjoyed my adventure at Escape Room. The Steampunk Room was well thought out and had some interesting puzzles. The only drawback was a couple of the puzzles had very small writing and that writing was in shadow, it made them difficult to read, thus solve.  The staff was friendly and helpful.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Empire" by Action Hero Studios in Phoenix
review: We had my son's 9th birthday party there and him and his friends LOVED it!! It was a big hit with his friends too. The owner was very friendly and helpful, and explained things to the parents that were outside watching the video screens. I would highly recommend this place

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Empire" by Action Hero Studios in Phoenix
review: Thanks for a great experience and fun challenge! The room was one of the best we have seen and we have done a lot of escape the room challenges across the country! Good to see some new and creative ideas along with the well thought out technology!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Empire" by Action Hero Studios in Phoenix
review: The room was very well designed and it had many puzzles that I have never seen before. I have done many different rooms but this was definitely one of my favorites.

room_title: Escape room "Love Divided" by Kingdom Keys NWA in Centerton
review: Great place, great service, awesome fun! Loved this and the kids were awesome at figuring everything out! Great night of fun for the whole family!

room_title: Escape room "The Family Jewels" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: My aunt and mom really enjoyed themselves and the experience of finding the family jewel. Check in was easy and the staff was very helpful and nice. The challenges were hard and you had to use your mind to figure out the clues and good teamwork with each other. Afterwards the staff was able to show us future games coming up, which made us want to go to another game. Had a lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Family Jewels" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: Celebrated my 12-year-old daughter's birthday there with 9 of her friends. They split up into two teams and did the Family Jewels competition. They were thoroughly entertained for the full hour. They had so much fun. They couldn't stop talking about it when they were done. Staff was friendly and accomodating! They want to come back for more!

room_title: Escape room "The Family Jewels" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: Never been in an 'escape room' before and I was presently surprised. The staff was very friendly and were very patient with us. Great sense of humor!! We had a good laugh.  Gave us enough clues to figure out locks. Come here for a good time then go have dinner and a drink or two!! We had 7 minutes to spare.

room_title: Escape room "The Family Jewels" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: The staff was amazingly friendly, and super helpful throughout. The puzzles they made for us were really fun and forced us to get witty and crafty. The room felt a bit small, but had an impressive amount of "stuff" around to keep us busy with everything. Definitely going to be trying to get a few other people to run another room with me some time.

room_title: Escape room "Alien" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Russellville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Atlantis Treasure Hunt" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: My brother, my husband, and I have been there a few times now and have had a blast every time. The Time Machine game was the first Codebreakers game we attempted. Although we did not escape the first time, we don't give up and kept trying until we escape which we did on our fourth try.My husband and I attempted the Atlantis game the day before our anniversary and again on my husband's birthday. We didn't escape either time (it was just the two of us which makes it more difficult) so we're trying again in a few weeks.The staff and owner are friendly and personable.

room_title: Escape room "The Atlantis Treasure Hunt" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: While visiting from Phx, I did the Atlantis Treasure Hunt with my sister. Codebreakers is a great escape room business. The lobby and restrooms are clean and neat. The game itself was neat, uncluttered and well lit, with plenty of room to move about. Our gamemaster was Corrine who was spot on giving us clues when we needed extra help. (Thx, Corrine!) The game was well decorated and challenging. This room is a great family room that would appeal to any age. (We are both over 60 and loved it!) I would recommend this business to locals and travelers alike.

room_title: Escape room "The Atlantis Treasure Hunt" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: This was our first escape room ever. We did the Atlantis themed escape room. Got to say, got the best of us  Luis, the employee, was very sweet and was very patient with us. Its also very clean in there! Time sure flies by! Many of us were so close and managed to figure some clues out but geez! Lol we overall had so much fun! And definitely recommend this place. We most likely be going back to try the time machine escape room!! great experience for us first timers!

room_title: Escape room "Battleship" by Red Door Escapes in Little Rock
review: Battleship was such a fun room! They have developed a really great back story and it flowed so well into the room. You can tell the owners put lots of thought into the room which made for a great experience! Can't wait until your other rooms open up

room_title: Escape room "Battleship" by Red Door Escapes in Little Rock
review: Awesome experience! We went as a family of four. (Kids age 9 and 11)We did the battleship room, but will definitely be back to do any others! The owner is amazing and was very helpful with clues when we got stuck. My youngest said it was more fun than a video game, so I'll say it was a huge success! Much more affordable than most as well. Thanks for a wonderful evening!

room_title: Escape room "Battleship" by Red Door Escapes in Little Rock
review: We did the Battleship room and it was a blast. The entire room is so well put together and the clues are so challenging to figure out! We were so immersed in the escape that it really felt like we were in that situation trying to save Captain Nemo! The owner was so awesome and we will definitely be back for the opening of the next room. Thanks for the experience!

room_title: Escape room "Battleship" by Red Door Escapes in Little Rock
review: We did this room with two adults and two kids ages 6 and 9. The room was really well set up and felt like we were in the Captain's quarters on a carrier . It was really well done and everything from the detail in the room to the sound really added to the ambience.The story was cool and drew us in and the puzzles were neat to figure out. The kids had a great time contributing and working the physical pieces while we did the tougher pieces (with some help when we needed it, which was nice :)). It was the perfect level of challenging vs fun to complete.Would do again and looking forward to what Red Door makes in the future!

room_title: Escape room "The Missing" by Fort Smith Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Elf Cabin" by Unlock Escape Rooms in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Alice & the White Rabbit" by Unlock Escape Rooms in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Parental Advisory: Story of Sledge Dixx" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: Third day escape is awesome, with many different escape rooms for everyone to enjoy 😇👍🏼

room_title: Escape room "Parental Advisory: Story of Sledge Dixx" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: great experience meet awesome people! puzzles were Challenging but overall I had a great time!!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Carnival Challenge" by Brainy Actz in San Diego
review: While visiting from Phx, I did the Carnival Room with my sister. This was a challenging room for us, in that you sometimes couldn't move on until you won a carnival game. But we DID beat the games, and we escaped and had a blast doing it! Sean was our gamemaster, and he was spot on giving us help. (Thanks, Sean!) This is an amazing place, and I recommend it for the entire family. (We are both over 60 and loved it!) I highly recommend this room for locals and travelers alike.

room_title: Escape room "The Great Carnival Challenge" by Brainy Actz in San Diego
review: Really fun for the whole group. There were eight of us and we made it out in an hour but needed clues. Fun night, I would recommend it . Can't wait to try it again!!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Carnival Challenge" by Brainy Actz in San Diego
review: So much fun!! Did the carnival escape game and was surprised by how fun and interactive it was! Difficult enough to be a challenge for adult groups but not so much so that families with kids couldn't go and have a blast. Gaelin was our host and was fabulous. He was funny and made our hour in the room that much more memorable. Look forward to trying the other SD location's escape room!

room_title: Escape room "The Tomb" by ESCAPE! Alaska in Anchorage
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Central Intelligence" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: We are big lovers of escape rooms, but this was easily the worst room we have ever tried. We did the CIA room, and it was so convoluted to the point that it was not even fun. We used all three of our clues and still couldn't progress without help. We are not stupid or incompetent, this room was just not designed well at all. I would not recommend this company to anyone. It was really disappointing too because we had some "first timers" with us, but the experience was so poor that they may never want to try another one. Very upset- total waste of money.

room_title: Escape room "Central Intelligence" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: We've done two of the rooms here and really enjoyed both experiences. We've done some rooms at other places as well, but we found some unique puzzles that we hadn't seen before. Our one quibble is having a gamemaster in the room with us. It's a little disconcerting (it's harder to argue over a puzzle solution with a stranger watching), but it's a minor point, and we look forward to trying more rooms (also trying to get a group together to do the Asylum...we are motivated to escape that room!).

room_title: Escape room "Central Intelligence" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: Friendly group. If you like brain teasers, you'll like this. We had a good time. Thanks "Down The Rabbit Hole".

room_title: Escape room "Central Intelligence" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: We've done two of the rooms by Down the Rabbit Hole, including Central Intelligence. We've done some rooms at other places as well, but we found some unique puzzles that we hadn't seen before, particularly while working on the Christmas room. Our one quibble is having a gamemaster in the room with us. It's a little disconcerting (it's harder to argue over a puzzle solution with a stranger watching), but it's a minor point, and we look forward to trying more rooms (also trying to get a group together to do the Asylum...we are motivated to escape that room!).

room_title: Escape room "Locked Out!" by Unity Escape Rooms in Pomona
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Fah-king Space Grail" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: This was a great experience! It was my first time doing an escape room and they made it fun freaky!

room_title: Escape room "Fah-king Space Grail" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: First time visiting this place and all i can say it was AWEMAZING! Did the space escape room  with my boyfriend and i and it was super hard! You can tell that alot of hard work and cleverness was put into the escape room! Most definitely coming back to experience the other rooms !

room_title: Escape room "Fah-king Space Grail" by Nightwalker Caverns Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: We came here as a team building thing with some of my team teachers. We had so much fun. Having never done an escape room before, I was not sure what to expect. The puzzles were engaging and each unique. The story lines within each unique section of the puzzle kept our team active the entire time. We did the space themed room with 4 people and that felt about the right amount. I would highly recommend a trip to Nightwalker Caverns for any reason! I especially enjoyed that it is opened and operated as a family business. The father/daughter team were very passionate about the amount, variety, and complexity of puzzles. They're even traveled world-wide in their escape room quests. Again, highly, highly, highly recommend!!!

room_title: Escape room "Missing" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Took my staff to Ozark Escape for some team building and bonding. We did the "Blood Bath" room, and had a blast! The scenario was appropriately designed (creepy, but not too scary), the puzzles were creative, and our team managed to escape with four seconds left. The staff was clever and helpful, and we all left with the desire to do more puzzle rooms. I highly recommend Ozark Escape for any group wanting some fun. We'll be back!

room_title: Escape room "Missing" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Our 13yr old's birthday "Blood Bath" party turned out awesome! The easy going staff was always right there to help us with our needs--they were great! We will definitely be back soon.

room_title: Escape room "Missing" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: My group had a GREAT time! The staff was very friendly and accommodating with our scheduling requirements. The puzzles were clever, challenging, engaging, and fun. On top of it all, the price was quite a bit cheaper than other places I've seen (granted, we had a large group, which helped). I'll be back!

room_title: Escape room "Missing" by Ozark Escape in Fayetteville (AR)
review: We came here to visit our boys in college and decided to try an escape room for the first time. The Blood Bath room was super challenging and a lot of fun. There is so much detail in everything from the props to the challenges and puzzles. We would definitely do it again!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Werewolf Village" by Two Bit Circus in Los Angeles
review: The funnest place in town! You can't find this level of high quality immersive tech and gaming experience anywhere! ❤😁😁🔥🔥🔥🔥💣💣💣

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Werewolf Village" by Two Bit Circus in Los Angeles
review: Two bit circus a must go see in downtown LA

room_title: Escape room "Dead End" by Constant Evolution Escape Rooms in Cottonwood
review: They did such a great job preparing the rooms to make them challenging, but doable. So much fun. Can't wait to do it again when they get the new room.

room_title: Escape room "Dead End" by Constant Evolution Escape Rooms in Cottonwood
review: So fun! The puzzles are creative and challenging! We'll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Dead End" by Constant Evolution Escape Rooms in Cottonwood
review: I brought three friends to the Double Crossed room for my birthday celebration. We had so much fun! The room was challenging but not too hard. We solved it just in time! I definitely recommend that anyone in the Northern Arizona area go check it out!

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: I'm the Owner of Escape Game Alaska and regarding Julie's review, I just want to share this because I clearly remember the two of them as customers. I would never feel the need to write this but I do feel that, as business owners, we live in a world where customers are able to review us but we, as business owners, are not given the opportunity to respond. While I am grateful to have customers play and avidly try to make it through the game, I also need to ensure that my prop decor, investments in making the rooms authentic and detailed, and game pieces do not get damaged- so that other players can play the game as well. During the game, it was clear that there was not a lot of respect for the facility or objects in the game room. (NOTE: some of the books in the rooms are antiques that were gifted to us with the intent of us caring for them; I intend to uphold that responsibility. As well, if a game piece is damaged, it can impact the game experience of people who are scheduled to play following that game). During game play, I observed the two of them dropping and damaging items in the room, kicking gaming pieces with their feet to move them after they'd dropped them on the floor and walking on top of materials. This is not how many of our participants and visitors play. While it may have appeared that I was ushering them out of the room with the intent of going to lunch; I did not go to lunch (despite the fact that I'm quite sure many other humans do)- I just didn't want to have them play any other games especially not our Gold Rush room which is stocked with many items that are over 110 years old. Regarding the difficulty of the game, while experienced gamers may make it out with time on the clock, there are still a lot of players in our area that have never played a game before and we work to ensure that all gamers escape. Our escape games are different (we note that 'everyone escapes' on our website) and we think that people enjoy the positive experience. While we can't please everyone, we do think preservation of the experience for other players is more important than allowing our games to be damaged for solely two people. While input is always appreciated, as business owners, we weigh out cost and benefit on a regular basis. It was my decision that it was potentially more costly to have the two of them play another game than it was beneficial. As well, if our experience was so bad, I'm not sure why the two of them asked to play another game.

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: The game itself was enjoyable, if shorter than we were used to. My sister and I got out with 20 minutes to spare and we looked through every inch of space in the room (which, for anyone that’s done a hard escape room before, is the trademark of an experienced team. You have to go through everything to avoid missing an “obvious” clue). The woman running the show was the reason for the bad review. She had her boyfriend stop in before we entered the room and told him that after she was finished here that they could grab food. She’s allowed to have a personal life, sure, but shooing customers out the door after they beat the game saying she has “a thing to do” is just unprofessional. We told her that we had an interest in doing another game (there were no bookings after us) and she told us that she it was doable with 2 people, but she “would rather not have [us] in that room because *this* (gestures around to the scattered items of the room) can’t happen in that room”...it was extremely rude. Then she went on to complain about how LONG it’s going to take her to clean up and that she’s never seen this level of “disaster” in the room before. The staff was unprofessional and I’ve never felt the need to leave a scathing review for anyone. Ever. Feel free to enjoy the game itself, but don’t get in the way of the employee’s free time...

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: Our family  Christmas gift from son was a trip to do the escape room. Nikki was really fun and patient. A great time had by all.

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: Our family did the Espionage room the day after Thanksgiving and had a great time. All ages had fun - we had 3 generations participating. Staff was friendly, encouraging and helpful, but did not spoil the experience. There was no shortage of clues to find, but we did find some red herrings along the way. We enjoyed ourselves and would recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets of the Illuminati" by Puzzle Workshop in Orange County
review: My family and I completed their CSI: Hollywood room and we LOVED it! Awesome decorations, well-designed puzzles. I hear their owners make games at Blizzard Entertainment, so that explains why the puzzles are so well done. The staff was really friendly and made sure we had the right amount of hints so we felt challenged but not stuck. I can't wait to check out their Illuminati room - I hear that has some cool moments too.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets of the Illuminati" by Puzzle Workshop in Orange County
review: My group of friends have grown a love for escape rooms and the Puzzle Workshop: Illuminati room was the third one we've done together. I liked the variety of puzzles that we had to solve and the overall flow from one puzzle to the next seemed very intuitive and linear. The tech in the rooms were also very cool and think those always add a very neat "wow" factor! I actually think the Illuminati room was fairly easy compared to the ones we've done in the past. The waiting area is very clean and nicer than most of the other escape rooms I've done. The manager, Stephanie, was very kind and friendly.

room_title: Escape room "Secrets of the Illuminati" by Puzzle Workshop in Orange County
review: My inner Robert Langdon and Indiana Jones would be proud. The Illuminati Escape Room was really straightforward and needless to say, the four of us escaped. PLOT: you are trapped in an office trying to steal a valuable Egyptian statuette and you need to escape before the Illuminati overlords come back.The clues, puzzles, tech, storyline were all so much fun and very well done. They were diverse, challenging and more importantly a lot of fun to solve. We were constantly busy! There is a staff member monitoring your progress, who gives out hints (unlimited) if you really need them. When we arrived, we were greeted by Stephanie who was really kind, helpful, and super sweet! Overall, this is probably the funnest escape room that I've ever encountered and I can't wait to try out their second room!

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Island" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was very amusing! We tried two rooms the first one being awakening. The second one we tried the Jurassic one and it was definitely one of the better rescale rooms that we have done

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Island" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Lots of fun. Come with your family! You even get a chance to win a free game. Try the Jurassic Room. You won't regret it.

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Island" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Yes! Just did jurassic island it was fun!!

room_title: Escape room "The Submarine" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: So much fun to do. This was our second time here and it was as much if not more fun this time around. I highly recommend this place for a group of friends to do for a night out! Try the Submarine or the Agency. Both are awesome.

room_title: Escape room "The Submarine" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: There were 5 of us - a perfect group size for this specific game. We had a blast while solving the riddles and working together. We managed to beat the clock with about 4 minutes to spare. I really enjoyed the challenging atmosphere and having the opportunity to work with my boyfriend's family in the tense situation. The employees at the Scottsdale location were incredibly friendly. They were professional and made our group feel comfortable too. I would highly recommend trying an Escape The Room experience to anyone. It is the perfect setting for team building, but also family bonding and plenty of laughs.

room_title: Escape room "The Submarine" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: Our first escape room experience was here. My husband and I did it to celebrate our 13th anniversary for something different to do. We were placed with a family of 4 that we didn't know but it was fine. We did the submarine room and it was so much fun! Definitely looking forward to trying other rooms at Escape the room AZ with a group of friends.

room_title: Escape room "The Plundering" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Lots of fun! Challenging but super exciting! Kids and adults loved it!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: I have been a couple times. Each time was an incredible time. The staff is amazing. They explain everything very well, and are professional and personable. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: We did the newest room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" and this room was AWESOME! Only done 2 rooms and this one is by far my favorite (and I'm not just saying that cause we were able to escape lol) you will definitely be in for a surprise! So try out this room!!

room_title: Escape room "Grim Stacks: Books & Bindings" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: This place is so much fun!! I was initially somewhat skeptical as I'm not great at puzzle solving, but it was surprisingly awesome. We did the Grim Stacks room, such a fun room. We did have 7 adults in the room and I think that it would probably be even more fun with a slightly smaller group. I can't wait to come back again with my kids next time!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: Highly recommended! The staff here are very friendly. We did the Cabin room and had a blast.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: We had a spectacular time in the Cabin and saved our friend. The facility was very nice and is adding rooms that we're excited to visit. We'll be back up that way. Definitely worth an hour and a half drive.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: Escaped The Cabin and Blackbeard's Brig. Both really well done rooms. I would highly recommend The Cabin! Very friendly staff and excellent facilities!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: Auburn Escape Zone is awesome!! I have completed the Cabin, Imprisoned, and tested the new Puzzle master room. All are unique and come with their own challenges. The staff are friendly and are interested in your opinions of the rooms and are constantly thinking of new and creative rooms. If you want a challenge and a fun time I HIGHLY suggest you give one of the rooms a try.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: I now have played all of the rooms at Auburn Escape Zones. As a huge fan of escape rooms, I can tell you this is top notch. Their puzzles and tasks are certainly challenging but not so overwhelming as to intimidate those new to escape rooms.  The Cabin room was a blast. The decor and immersive story really enhance the experience overall and it is my favorite room so far. So if you haven't tried Auburn Escape Zones, grab some friends and sign up for an hour of some of the best and most intense team building challenges you have ever faced!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Captain" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: My son and I did the pirate room and had a lot of fun. Intelligent puzzles and a great group to solve them with! The staff was awesome. Such a fun place, definitely doing it again!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Captain" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: Absolutely loved it! Took my parents and we all had a blast. Great puzzles, great setup, great atmosphere. Go! You will love it!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Captain" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: My family and I have played many different escape rooms, and this is one of the best. Well balanced and a good amount of challenging but not over the top puzzles. The room is very well themed and well thought out. A rare room that will play well for beginners as well as experienced players. Can't wait to see the Toy room.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Captain" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: We went here for my daughter's 14th birthday. She and her friends had a ton of fun. The room was decorated really great and the puzzles were a ton of fun. We escaped with the treasure with 5 min to spare. Can't wait to try their other room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Captain" by Escape Games Riverside in Redlands
review: I took my family to do the Pirate Room, to celebrate a birthday - they added a time slot for us! Two of our group had never done an escape room and the other two of us were doing our second. We had so much fun - definitely going back to do the other room. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: We had a blast and so close which means we'll have to go back so we can ESCAPE. To get a "W" in our box.

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: We had the greatest time. Friends and Family with us team work was amazing. Until next escape. Very very awesome time. Thanks for a great night. Staff was amazing!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: The best escape room i have ever been to. Staff was very friendly and game was very fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: I've never even attempted something like this before but it was absolutely worth the price of admission. I want to say so much but I will not spoil anything for anyone. It's foolish to not give this place a try. Thank you for the great experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: The staff was great. The waiting room was excellent (I didn't find any clues there. I think I failed at waiting.). We were all so excited when we figured out the last puzzle that we were jumping all around, and several of the staff were just as excited as we were. It made the whole experience amazing.

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: My wife and I just got back from doing our first escape here. It was so much fun! The suite is around at the back of the lot, but its not too difficult to find. The staff is super friendly and greets you with a smile when you walk in. After you sign in they brief you on all of the rules and give you the story set up for your room. Then they walk you to your room and its time to escape. Actually "escape" is a bit of a misnomer, its not really about escaping, its about solving the puzzle. I didn't feel "trapped" and there was nothing scary, which is a good thing for a claustrophobic haunted house baby like me. I don't want to spoil anything about the puzzle but I will say that it was just difficult enough that it never felt overly frustrating and that my wife and I had an absolute blast solving it along with the other couple in our group. We finished with 20 minutes to spare! We will definitely be back again to try out more escapes. I just hope they will keep more new escapes coming so that we can come back more often!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Bakersfield in Bakersfield
review: This was so much fun! We failed, but had the best time with our friends! I would highly recommend this place, and the staff was so friendly and fun! We will be going back soon.

room_title: Escape room "The Prison" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: We had so much fun on the Cabin we came back and did the Prison. It was really well done and the staff was friendly and helpful

room_title: Escape room "The Prison" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: We came to visit my daughter as she was in school and couldn’t come home. We looked for something new to do so the four of us me my wife son “22” and daughter “20” have this a try. What a gem Tuscaloosa has here!!! Very much a great treat for all of us!! The amazing thing is the team work that goes into it. We did the prison room and will be back to do all 4 , thanks for a great day!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Prison" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: Our school staff spent some professional learning time escaping the prison. There were 10 of us and each of us was able to participate in the escape. It was a great way for us to get to know each other, learn to work together, and have fun while building relationships. It was really cool to see the leadership styles and problem solving skills that emerged. Best first day of school ever!!

room_title: Escape room "The Puzzler vs Superheroes" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: We were in Auburn for a Travel Softball tournament and looking for something different to do! Did we find it at Auburn Escape Zones! It was fun, entertaining and full of laughs! Great family evening or team event! The staff really tried to make it enjoyable for us! If we are ever in Auburn again, we will be back!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Puzzler vs Superheroes" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: We've completed Imprisoned, The Cabin and the Superheroes vs Puzzler escape rooms and have had so much fun with each one. Imprisoned was our favorite, Superheroes was a close 2nd. Can't wait for the next theme! We've been twice with our Girl Scout Troop and once has a family. Fun, great way to work on communication and teamwork. I highly recommend Auburn Escape Zones. Well worth the trip (we drive 45 minutes to visit). The staff is friendly and courteous.

room_title: Escape room "The Puzzler vs Superheroes" by Auburn Escape Zones in Auburn
review: I've been too Auburn Escape Zones twice! We did the Cabin Room first and last week we tried out the Super Hero Room. Both are very challenging but very fun. I highly recommend you to check out this cool place!

room_title: Escape room "Hors D'oeuvres & Obituaries" by The Escape Little Rock in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dragon Tower" by Legend X in Los Angeles
review: We had such an amazing time doing the escape room. These people are so innovative and have created such a cool experience. Seriously. Wow. I can't wait to go back and try the next room!

room_title: Escape room "Dragon Tower" by Legend X in Los Angeles
review: Dragon tower Origin. Oh my god. It's so hard. Extra extra teamwork needed. This is probably the hardest escape room I've ever done. Everyone will do something to contribute to the escape. Everyone are locked in different rooms with different puzzles, but you're not the key to your room..you'll need your kins. Sooo many puzzles (A LOT) and technology. 6186382 hints needed (mirror mirror on the wall PLEASE HELP US). We have to add extra time (30minutes) to get out lol. Have to pay for the extra time though. If you want to challenge yourself and your teammate I recommend this place. Love the costumes and the production value. And the weapons! Use them! Game master is amazing. Thank you, you're our savior.One tip..escape :)!By the way, they got restroom now!

room_title: Escape room "Dragon Tower" by Legend X in Los Angeles
review: The Dragon Tower Room was a fun experience!  Definitely takes teamwork and paying attention to detail!  Asking for clues was easier and more clear than other rooms.  Wayne (the owner) was a great game master. You do start separated, but thankfully not for long.  I recommend checking out this room!

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Huntsville in Huntsville
review: We did Under Pressure. It was fun, although we didn’t finish! Our screen went black during our time so that was kind of an inconvenience, and we weren’t offered anything for it. It also would have been nice to start with a clue. We wasted over 15 minutes of our time trying to figure out where to start, and most escape rooms start you out with a clue. Overall it was fun! A little pricey Versus others, but fun!

room_title: Escape room "Under Pressure" by Escapology Huntsville in Huntsville
review: We just finished the Under Pressure room as a family. It was awesome and we set a record!! Thanks for having a great family fun experience for us

room_title: Escape room "​​​Yin & Yang" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: They have the best rooms! They are well maintained, great balance of hard and easier puzzles and great variety of types of puzzles. I've 2 of their rooms now and looking forward to doing more!

room_title: Escape room "​​​Yin & Yang" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: so fun! first time doing and will definitely do it again!

room_title: Escape room "​​​Yin & Yang" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Camry was a great game master. Very fun Ying Yang room. Great for beginners. Family fun time.

room_title: Escape room "The Game Show" by ClueMasters Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: Had a great experience there with some friends. We did the Game Show escape room and it was really fun.We did well through most of the puzzles but got hung up on the last one. Didn't use hints though and made it out with a little time to spare.The hosts were very kind and the experience was solid. Highly recommend for a fun group activity.

room_title: Escape room "The Game Show" by ClueMasters Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: My friends and I enjoyed ourselves so much in The Game Show room, we came back two hours later for Murder in the Manor! Most fun I've had in a long time!

room_title: Escape room "The Game Show" by ClueMasters Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: The escape room was so much fun. We went for my 30th birthday & had a blast! We ended up having the fastest time which was icing on the cake. The staff was awesome & helpful & made the whole experience even more worth it! Definitely recommend trying your hand at one of their rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Lost Cabin" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: My husband and I did the The Lost Cabin together and had a blast! It was a great mind game! Can't wait to come back to Florence and do another room! The people were so helpful and great!

room_title: Escape room "Lost Cabin" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: Our whole group really enjoyed our time at the Escape Room! The atmosphere there is really great, super friendly staff & beautiful building! We escaped from the Lost Cabin and we can't wait to go back and try the other room!!

room_title: Escape room "Lost Cabin" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: Took my daughter and her friends here and we had a blast! We did the cabin and it was very well put together and realistic. Really made us think! Can't wait to go back! Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for something fun to do in the Shoals area!!

room_title: Escape room "Lost Cabin" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: My family and I had a blast this past Friday night. We did the Cabin room! If your looking for something to do with the family that's fun and challenging..this is the place to go! Awesome staff as well!

room_title: Escape room "Lost Cabin" by Escape Room Florence in Florence (AL)
review: This is such a unique and fun place in Florence! We went last night and did the lost cabin room and had a blast figuring out the clues! Bobby and the staff are so friendly and nice and made sure we had the best experience possible!! I can't wait to come back!

room_title: Escape room "Chinatown" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: Truly a blast! I have only had experience with one escape room before - my office did the whole "team bonding" thing. Anywhoo! This time I got a group of friend together and the room/experience by far exceeded the first. A few points to highlight...The room - the room itself was very well done. The decor and space. Something I didn't love about the first escape room was how small and crowded it felt. We did the "Chinatown" theme and they did a great job giving a restaurant feel.The clues/ puzzle pieces - what really set this place apart was the clues! Again, comparing it to my last experience, there were far less obvious clues which really made us think and work as a team. More importantly the type of puzzle pieces they engineered were phenomenal and extremely creative. Not to give anything away, but you really have to exercise all options with everything in the room touching, aligning, and pushing. Nothing came too easy with this room! Customer service - the girl who assisted us was polite and sweet. Plus, the few times we did have to ask for hints, she gave us the perfect nudge in the right direction. All in all a great experience. I will defiantly be forming a new team and heading back soon!

room_title: Escape room "Chinatown" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: Such a great time!  3 of us did the Chinatown Room and it was so much fun! We barely escaped but I think it would have been better if we had a couple more people.  The 3 of us had done a few escape rooms before, but this was by far the most fun. The room was decorated in a way that made you feel like you were really in a restaurant in Chinatown. The owner Greg was also super accommodating as the same afternoon of our reservation we were going to run late. He was really nice and put us in at a later spot, which was still open. He didn't have to do that, so we really appreciate it. Staff was also very nice. The clues were also really helpful when we needed them. Can't wait to come back to do the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "Chinatown" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: We escaped Chinatown and had so much fun with the challenge! Thank you Mango for an amazing game!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This room had the perfect flow and was heavy puzzle-based. Soundtrack was awesome and as you progress through the room it just gets better and better. The last part was probably the best thing ever. It starts off with an FBI kind of vibe and turns into a detective like situation and then you walk into a scary movie right after that. The game master Curtis will give you candy!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Had a really fun timeDid the "Jack the Ripper" room and found it to be very historically accurate. The puzzles were hard but solvable. Not crazy scary but quite macabre which was great. Strongly recommended!!

room_title: Escape room "Jack the Ripper" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: These rooms are the real deal! Strongly recommended! The Culver City branch let my fiancee and I play their new "Jack the Ripper" room early, and good golly, it was amazing. A wide variety of clever puzzles that are integrated with a full, 3-Act narrative. No puzzles exist "Just because". They are all either literally riddles/challenges Jack left behind or direct metaphors for the investigative process. Not only are the puzzles thematically enthralling, they are entirely challenging and creative. Each of them is very different than the others while also containing different thought processes. Some are riddles that require abstract thought, whereas another puzzle may be a straight-forward scavenger hunt that requires a keen eye, curiosity, and thorough investigation. My fiancee and I work together well but also have very different thought processes. To this end, it felt entirely rewarding to split up and apply this, with my interpreting coded messages and her noticing the clues and items I would have never caught onto. So rewarding!As well, the room's hosts are beyond kind and generous. We were provided a walkie talkie that was intended to be used for a limited amount of clues, as well as emergencies.  I can't say enough nice things about this room. It's the real deal. Rooms like this are textbook examples of why Escape Rooms are big and what a unique experience they can provide.Please go try it as soon as you can!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: We loved it! The guys working there were so nice and informative! The Psych Ward was so creative and fun. We can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: We busted out of the asylum and had so much fun. We had a group of 5 and everyone had something to do at all times. Can't wait to go again and check out more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: I did an escape room here for the first time. We went on a double date in the Psych Ward and it was so fun! The staff is nice and the rooms are great. They were very busy, so if that doesn’t tell you this place is great, I don’t know what will!

room_title: Escape room "The Psych Ward" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: We had a blast going through the Psych Ward! We made it out with just seconds to spare! We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter Three: The Morgue" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Wow, these guys did it again! We came back to see the Evil Genius once again but this time we faced his challenges in their new room The Morgue. From the start, I knew this was a gonna be a good time. The room is such a new concept that it was truly a breath of fresh air! I am a big scaredy cat but this room is not supposed to scare you but it does get the adrenaline pumping. Take a chance and try their bonus room, you will be SO GLAD you did. So gooooood:)

room_title: Escape room "Chapter Three: The Morgue" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Came here to do Chapter 3: The Morgue and we were very impressed.I have always heard great things about Evil Genius but never got around to trying them. Well we finally got around to it and are so glad we did. The Morgue Room had great elements of tech and involved puzzles that we had never seen before! The theme of the room was consistent through out and the decor was high quality and visually appealing. We were kept on our toes the whole time and enjoyed all the puzzles. Customer service was great as well and we look forward to coming back and trying their first 2 chapters!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter Three: The Morgue" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did Chapter 3 last night and it was AMAZING. Legitimately the BEST escape room I've ever done. The details, the theme, everything. You MUST do the Morgue!

room_title: Escape room "The Experiment" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: I just did their new "The Experiment" escape room last night with a date, and it was so much fun! Bob was perfectly in character from beginning to end, fun to work with, and clear on instructions.The room itself was interesting and had an amazing storyline and never-before-seen challenges. I highly recommend it for first timers and escape room enthusiasts alike!!

room_title: Escape room "The Experiment" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: I had a great time at The Experiment Room. Not gonna lie I was a bit scared haha but the room was well thought out and we escaped right at the buzzer! I liked how the room had a back story and the owner took his time to walk us through everything. You can see he really has a passion to create escape rooms. Can't wait to try The Virus!

room_title: Escape room "The Experiment" by Get the F Out in Los Angeles
review: Amazing amazing amazing!Loved the escape experience and I loved it 10 times more when Our game master cane inside to explain the whole game and to explain how everything links with the story. MIND BLOWNWe tried The Experiment and we will definitely be back to try The Virus.

room_title: Escape room "Genie Ransom" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I brought my daughter and three of her friends (all smart 14 year olds - only two of which had done an escape room before) to this location, and we had a great time. The man who helped us was fun and kind, and we were able to escape the Genie room with 4 minutes to spare. Whew! Challenging but not impossible, that room was perfect for the girls. Note: since the girls were under 16, I had to purchase a ticket and be in the room as well. This was actually a good thing because they needed a bit of help here and there. Thanks so much for a great memory!

room_title: Escape room "Genie Ransom" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We wanted to try this room for months after randomly driving by. I, finally, had a chance to take my husband as a surprise for his birthday. The owner was so friendly and understanding when we showed up late! (We called first and he was so nice.) The coded door to get in is very fun. The waiting area is on the roof of the building and was genuinely stunning to walk into. We did the Genie room because it was the easiest room and there was only the two of us. We ended up making the Top 10 wall. He offered us a promo for a second room and ended up doing The Enchanted Forest immediately after. The Enchanted Forest is beautiful/creepy ambience and a total immersion experience. I loved this room so much. Even the scary features that I did not want to go near. We didn't make the Top 10 wall in this room but that's okay. We talked to the owner about creating the rooms and he was so personable. I can only say good things about this experience. We will definitely be back to try the other two rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Genie Ransom" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My Group and I loved it!! had so much fun and great experience.

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience! Highly recommend. It was well thought out and provided a different experience than other room escapes. The story was great! Can't wait to do the other room!

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loads of fun! It's a challenging puzzle with live actors. We finished with only a minute to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Last day in LA , me and my film friends decided to be random and do the escape room. We underestimated the experience and it turned out to be great. The actor was great and the escape room was definitely challenging. We achieved it with 2 seconds left. Will definitely do this again. We did APT 205

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Nice birthday adventure! The staff was amazing!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I had a lot of fun with both their rooms, some clever clues and fantastic puzzles they got.

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Celebrated my birthday by doing the Secret Temple room. Amazing. Very fun. Without any spoilers, I can say they made my birthday very special. Can't wait to come back for the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "Apartment 205" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So far I have done 6 Escape Rooms, and Enigma provided the best options BY FAR! Can't wait to go back for their third room! A great way to spend time with friends and family!

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Throne" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: It was very fun! We really enjoyed the experience. The only thing I would change is the rooms need something else like background music or something to add more pressure to it besides the timer. But we will be back to try the other rooms! We did the quest for the throne.

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Throne" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: Absolutely LOVED every minute. Engaging, fun, interactive and great decor which transports you to the era you're in, plus amazingly thought out clues! It was so much fun!!!. My teenage son wouldn't stop talking about It! Hats off to you for this amazing venue. I wish you the very best!! So much fun, I'm already thinking of a next date night!

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Throne" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: We have done several escape rooms at other places and Quest for the Throne was by far the best one we have done. It was well thought out and had very and had very unique puzzles to work through. Great job

room_title: Escape room "Quest for the Throne" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: The Quest for the Throne room was lots of fun, had a decent level of challenge, but was reasonable enough to figure out most clues. The hints were helpful and timely. For the Groupon price, this room experience was a steal! Thanks for a fun family night out! We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer’s Sanctum" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: My team and I went for our holiday party and everyone had a BLAST!! We played Sorcerer's Sanctum, which was quite challenging but definitely doable for experienced escape room players like ourselves. Puzzles were great and Matt was a phenomenal game master! Can't wait to try out some of their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer’s Sanctum" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: I came here as a team bonding exercise and I had an absolute blast. My group and I played the Sorcerers Sanctum game and it's was amazing. The design is incredible and, while it was quite difficult, we were able to escape! I would definitely recommend this place

room_title: Escape room "Sorcerer’s Sanctum" by Omescape in San Francisco
review: I've played all 3 rooms at this location (4 if you count the room they discontinued) and they are all good.  I was not a fan of the pirate / treasure themed room, but thankfully they replaced that with a room called Sorcerer's Sanctum, which is their best room yet.  The second best room is The Penitentiary and Omega is a distant third (but still enjoyable).   I would recommend the following head count for these rooms:Sorcerer's Sanctum: 6-10The Penitentiary: 4-6Room Omega: 3-5Sorcerer's Sanctum is the most satisfying of the rooms as the puzzles are straightforward and logical.  Penitentiary has one or two puzzles that make you roll your eyes when you finally get the answer because they just aren't quite fair.  Omega is a smaller room and probably better for people who are very analytical or math oriented.Overall, you really can't go wrong here.  I think this location has two of my all time favorite rooms and it even better than some of the pricier rooms in SF.

room_title: Escape room "The Haunting" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Holcomb's Lost Gold" by Big Bear Escape Room in Big Bear City
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Pawn Shop" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
review: I've been to a couple of escape rooms, and really I've been lucky enough to have a great time at all of them, and this one is no exception.  I did their "Pawn Shop" room, which was lots of fun and I would consider pretty difficult - but in fairness most of the difficulty came from us overthinking the problems.  ;)  It's run by a husband and wife that are very passionate about it - and even go so far as to make the different gadgets in the rooms - any place that casually mentions doing things with Arduino's gets an automatic bonus from me.Overall a great location and a great place to take a date, family or company to do something a bit more memorable an interactive than just going out for drinks or a movie.  Can't wait to go try their next one...

room_title: Escape room "Pawn Shop" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
review: Our family had a birthday party here.. it was so much fun!! It was my first time at an escape room. The owners were a blast and really made the night fun. We did the Pawn shop room and barely made it out with seconds to spare. We can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Pawn Shop" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
review: Me, my wife and two of our family members experienced ESCAPE: Chandler's first room "Pawn Shop" and we absolutely loved it! The theme was fun and the puzzles were awesome! Thank you ESCAPE: Chandler for the amazing experience and we will be back when you all have new rooms open soon!

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock Holmes" by Limitless Escape Games in Modesto
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Perfumer" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Oh yeah, it's just incredible! The first quest I played here in LA. It's a damn interesting game, very high quality, with excellent sound and great scenery. If you never played quests - you need to visit here. But if you are an experienced player, you should look at how the cool guys are doing a real cool room!
