room_title: Escape room "Perfumer" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: This is only my second escape room experience BUT I can tell already that all other ones are going to pale in comparison now. I do think "quest room" is more apt because the focus is more on a real story solving a real problem and not simply just escaping. The attention to detail in the rooms and the storyline is so great. I tried the perfume room but I'd definitely go back to try the others in a heartbeat!

room_title: Escape room "Perfumer" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Perfumer was awesome! It was my first escape room experience and it was beyond amazing! I didn't know what to expect and was a little anxious going in but once we entered, I was hooked. The story is so interesting and the escape room was so intricate and well designed. Loved it and I want t o go back to try out the others!

room_title: Escape room "Kraken Casino" by Escape Room Napa in Rohnert Park
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Prison" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: It was so much fun. Really well done!! I can't wait to do another of their rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Prison" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Refreshing fun for the curious kid in me! Somewhat challenging, but we made it out of the castle room in ~40 minutes. I can't wait to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Prison" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Had a great time! Challenging and fun at the same time! The only thing I can tell you, Don't overthink it!

room_title: Escape room "Prison" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was a phenomenal experience. I had so much fun with my family it brought us together, the clues and awesome interactive objects and puzzles within the rooms were amazing! We had to get out of three prison cells and there are clues everywhere

room_title: Escape room "Prison" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had so much fun! Great staff, the room was more fun than we even expected. We're already planning to go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Prison" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Amazing and fun experience!! If you love adventure, want to spent great time with friends, and you are looking for unique entertaining experience, - this place is for you. The design of the maze room makes you feel as if you were really locked in a medieval castle. The puzzles keep you challenged all the time. Every time you find a new hint, you feel truly excited! And when you finally unlock the very last door, and step out of "prison", you feel like popping a bottle of champagne.

room_title: Escape room "Prison" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Prison - The weak part of this room was certain puzzles could be better camouflaged to blend into the environment better, with one of the puzzles that could be subjective, which slowed our group down. Otherwise, this was an excellent and very fun room. We attempted to do something using our mouths which was the wrong way to go at it, but made us all laughed either way. Loved starting off in different prison cells and working together to escape. Both the Motel and Prison are located in the same location.

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: I had such a great time completing the Casino challenge! The staff and the actual room were both amazing. Great experience, I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Had a great time doing my third room at Breakout Montgomery. Tony was a fantastic game master and the Casino game was incredibly well done. If you are looking for a great way to spend an afternoon or evening with friends, coworkers, family, or strangers, I highly recommend Breakout. Lots of fun surprises in the rooms and fantastic people.

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: I had an awesome time playing "Operation: Casino". It was very fun and I had amazing people in the room with me. I would definitely recommend for other couples looking for something exciting and different to do.

room_title: Escape room "Dracula Experience" by Prescott Escape Room in Prescott
review: Did this for a team builder! So fun! Totally worth the time and the clues make you think.

room_title: Escape room "Dracula Experience" by Prescott Escape Room in Prescott
review: My wife and I had a great time here. I highly recommend this! It was challenging and very enjoyable.

room_title: Escape room "Dracula Experience" by Prescott Escape Room in Prescott
review: This was one of the most memorable things we have done as a family. The staff were friendly and we had a BLAST. The room was challenging but not so hard that you could become discouraged. Definitely telling my friends and returning for their new room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Exit Protocol" by SUBScape Games in San Diego
review: The last room we did was Exit Protocol.  We were told that this was the hardest room they had, and before we played, there were only 3 teams out of 25 that completed this room.  There is a lot to do in this room.  This is a great room for a diverse team.  There's something for everyone to do (puzzle people, people who are good at searching for things, etc).  It was definitely the most challenging out of the three we played.  We required 2 hints.  We did have an issue with one puzzle in the room.  Thankfully, our game master came into our room, helped us out, and gave us 5 extra minutes for our troubles, which was lucky because I believe we had 5 minutes remaining on our timer.

room_title: Escape room "Exit Protocol" by SUBScape Games in San Diego
review: Great escape room experience! My kids took friends to SUBScape and went through the Exit Protocol experience. They were talking about it for hours after it was over as they had a great time. The place was nice, clean, and the staff we're very attentive. Was the perfect birthday experience for teens!

room_title: Escape room "Baker Street Mystery" by Chico Escape Rooms in Chico
review: So fun! We solved the baker street mystery, definitely coming back

room_title: Escape room "Baker Street Mystery" by Chico Escape Rooms in Chico
review: Just completed Baker Street and had a blast!!! Missed solving it by just seconds and still had a great time.

room_title: Escape room "Baker Street Mystery" by Chico Escape Rooms in Chico
review: Such a great time, did the Baker Street Room for my boyfriend's birthday, perfect event and a we had a blast figuring out the puzzles. Look forward to completing another room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break 2.0" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: Our group had a blast at Escape Modesto! So fun, and we were so close to escaping from prison!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break 2.0" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: Such a great experience with my coworkers yesterday evening escaping from Prison Break with 6 minutes left! It was a great team building experience, and I look forward to trying out the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break 2.0" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: The Jail Break Room was challenging and encouraged our group of ten to work together as a team to try to break the code.  The room was very well designed and made you feel as if you were in a real jail cell and booking area. We can't wait to go back and try to escape the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break 2.0" by Escape Modesto in Modesto
review: I Love Escape Modesto! My team was the first team EVER to escape from the Prison Break room and we had a blast!!! There were three separate groups that came together as a group of 9. We used our individual strengths to complete the escape with 10 minutes to spare! Everyone should come here, you won't be disappointed. The staff is super friendly and they are there to show you a great time. Cant wait to go back and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Palace of Destiny" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Mountain Ski Lodge" by Mountain Room Escapes in Big Bear City
review: Great for good family fun! Friendly staff and easy to get to. Had lots of fun with a 16 and a 11-year-old. Can't wait to come back again for some more fun!

room_title: Escape room "Mountain Ski Lodge" by Mountain Room Escapes in Big Bear City
review: Excellent fun, we had such a blast! I had done many other escape rooms in the LA area, but this was the first one for the other two people in our group. At the end, everyone was all smiles at the rush of puzzle solving and discovery. We plan on returning soon to do other rooms coming soon. Thanks again!

room_title: Escape room "Mountain Ski Lodge" by Mountain Room Escapes in Big Bear City
review: We have done around 10 escape rooms and finally made the trip from Inland Empire to check this one out. The owner is an enthusiast and it definitely shows in the thoughtfulness and creativity of the puzzles. Joan was friendly and accommodating when we got stuck in traffic. No spoilers but there's a unique element of fun for the early finishers. Worth the beautiful drive!

room_title: Escape room "Mountain Ski Lodge" by Mountain Room Escapes in Big Bear City
review: This was our first escape room experience. Had a great time with my wife and three kids (age 15, 13, 10). The staff was attentive and friendly and the theme of the escape room was perfect for the being up in the mountains. We are glad that we escaped, and the kids said it was the highlight of our short summer getaway!

room_title: Escape room "Mountain Ski Lodge" by Mountain Room Escapes in Big Bear City
review: We went as a group of eight with ages ranging from my 76 y.o in-laws to my wife and myself and our four kids ranging from 15 to 8. Everyone participated and had a great time. The theme was called "Escape from the Ski Lodge". It was very family friendly, no scary stuff at all. We've been to other escape places where it was a dark or supernatural theme and this one had none of that.The staff member, Sue, was very friendly and thorough, explaining everything to us and giving us clues if we wanted them. We escaped because everyone worked together and my kids absolutely loved it.

room_title: Escape room "Area 53: Lunar Lockdown" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: Me and my husband went for our 18th anniversary, we had so much fun! We're definitely going back to conquer!

room_title: Escape room "Area 53: Lunar Lockdown" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: Good fun, definitely will be back to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Area 53: Lunar Lockdown" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: This is so much better than going to the movies with friends or even a great way to break the ice on a date It's unique, twist and turns along the way, with a lot of laughter! I love the clever clues and puzzles you have to solve! I highly recommend Escape Room for a good time!

room_title: Escape room "Area 53: Lunar Lockdown" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: What a fantastic experience! The Area 51 room was well organized and looked like this would be the room my friends and I could beat but, looks can be deceiving! Super fun with great team building potential!!!

room_title: Escape room "Area 53: Lunar Lockdown" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: Great time, lots of fun and well worth it! Thank you!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Area 53: Lunar Lockdown" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: So much fun. And even though we didn't escape I will go back and try again. We got to meet new people and really use our brains. Do this.

room_title: Escape room "Area 53: Lunar Lockdown" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: My hubby and I have been 3 times now and have had so much fun... whether we escape or not. It can be a little challenging to find something new and exciting in Tucson, but this is always a blast! The owner is super friendly and personable. The rooms being at different levels allows you to find something fun for your group without being in over your head. We have such an enjoyable time whether we win or lose. So, if you are like me, a sometimes overly bored Tucsonan, get some friends together and try something new!

room_title: Escape room "MURDER CO." by Black Market Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Don't think twice about booking MurderCo Hardcore! It's easily one of the most fantastic horror experiences out there. From the actors to the scenery, this place has it all executed perfectly. If you decide to pick Sideshow don't forget to bring your brown pants...

room_title: Escape room "MURDER CO." by Black Market Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: **Murder Co Hardcore is an experience, keep that in mind**As a huge fan of horror, I was pretty stoked to try Murder Co. I do not jump or scare easily so I thought I had this in the bag...boy was I wrong. My heart was pounding and my anxiety was through the roof. The room was so immersive that I thought I was going to be the next victim of Maneater (the scare actor who played Maneater was absolutely amazing!!). Everyone involved in this room did a phenomenal jobs and scared the daylights out of my whole group. If you have the chance, do Murder Co. Hardcore! This was truly the best horror escape experience I have ever had. Thank you Black Market Escape Room for such an amazing experience and making me feel alive (ironically lol).

room_title: Escape room "MURDER CO." by Black Market Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This is my favorite escape room I have ever done and I have done more then 20. I can't wait to come back again and bring different friends to see how they do and watch their reactions. It truly is an immersive experience. Great staff from the second we got there til the second we left. I wish I can give them 6 stars. Everyone did an amazing job thank you so much for your hospitality. Highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "Santa’s Naughty List " by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Tavern - Chapter 2" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: As a first time escape room player I went in completely unaware of the types of puzzles to expect. The puzzles were challenging and engaging which resulted in an extremely enjoyable experience. I would highly recommend this escape room and I will be back for another challenge.  The owners did an amazing job informing the group and myself about the rules and how to play the game. After being left to find our way out of the "TAVERN", one of the new rooms. All the electronics worked and we used the on screen clues successfully. As a group we had fun digging through the props trying to find and decode the next clue which lead to a challenging escape.

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Huntsville in Huntsville
review: I took 3 teenage girls to Budapest Express for my daughter's birthday and we had a great time! Our host, Chris, was excellent. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Budapest Express" by Escapology Huntsville in Huntsville
review: Megan was our game Master, and Ashley was our Host. Both did a fantastic job, considering it is a new experience for everyone. They made sure we knew the rules, gave helpful hints when needed, and took a photo at the end. Although we didn't complete the room except for one remaining clue, it is something we will revisit again. Thanks Megan and Ashley.

room_title: Escape room "Lord of the Swords" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Lord of the sword is a great room. Seemingly simple yet deeply complex. Always great to find a new room that presents a challenge without leaving you banging your head on the wall. Swords are cool.

room_title: Escape room "Lord of the Swords" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did the Lord of the Swords room, very fun. The theming and the mechanics are great. Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Lord of the Swords" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the Lord of the Swords room and we had a blast. Really fun and challenging. Recommend it for teens and birthday parties.

room_title: Escape room "Area 15" by Escape the Place in Orange County
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Escape" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: This was such a cool and fun experience! More than I expected and really a great time for all of us. I will definitely be going back to try another room. We did The Escape this time, it was definitely challenging and had a great story line. So glad we picked The Unlockables for my first escape room experience, cant say enough how much fun I had!

room_title: Escape room "The Escape" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: We had an amazing time in this escape room. The story is great, the decoration and the effort that they put to create a scary ambiant is amazing !We were 4 friends and we did it ! It wasn't easy but it was so much fun. The puzzles are amazing and very original. Maybe 1 or 2 things that are 'too much' but it would be the only details. We only can recommend you to go. Staff is very friendly !

room_title: Escape room "The Escape" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: So much fun. With group of 7 first timers ... This was such a great first room. We didn't make it in time but it was still so much fun!! They got us hooked for sure!!

room_title: Escape room "The Escape" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: Went with my trusted group last week and really enjoyed the experience. There were a couple quirks/bugs but the GMs helped us through it. The first act of the game was quite unique (it's the second time we've seen it done in escape games). We passed and made leaderboard (yay!). We look forward to the future rooms from The Unlockables.

room_title: Escape room "The Hex Room" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: LOVED this escape room!!When I first received the invite to come along, I thought okay, what is going to set this one apart from the rest? I've been to my share of escape rooms, some were great, others needed to mature a little more, but after you've done so many, you want to find a uniqueness about the next one.I read the concept of everyone starting off separated into different rooms, that really caught my eye. The idea of everyone being a different character based on a quirky personality test was also nice. I had my eye set on being the detective (which I was able to be ). I watched as my friends became elected into the other positions - the jock, the rebel, the nerd, the virgin and the prom queen.To conquer this escape room, you really need the right dynamic. Everyone has their own puzzles to conquer, but at the same time, one may have something for someone in another room. I don't want to spoil much, but I will speak from being the detective. If you find yourself in this spot, I hope you don't get overwhelmed easy. You are the glue that bonds everyone and it is your responsibility to make sure everyone is okay and gets what they need.I highly recommend this room and will be speaking nothing but good things about it to anyone interested. What a great team at Crossroads, I can't wait to see what rooms you all come up with next.

room_title: Escape room "The Hex Room" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: My friends and I haven't had this much fun in a long time.

room_title: Escape room "The Hex Room" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Had the most amazing time!There is no slacking and letting your friends lead in this game. Everyone must do their own part of the puzzle before you can come together as a group.Room is detailed and immersive. Characterization is unique and adds a fun element.Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "The Hex Room" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: It was my 24th escape room overall and we set a record with their Hex room! It was one of the most unique experiences from most escape rooms I've played that wasn't as scary as I thought it would be (so don't fret, if you hate haunted houses, it's nothing like that).I'll definitely want to come back for their funhouse room coming in March! If you win, you're in for a special treat! The owners know what they are doing with look, feel, immersion, puzzles, and your overall experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Hex Room" by Cross Roads Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: So amazing! My friends and I couldn't stop talking about it after we left. We were SO CLOSE to escaping and now all we want to do is go back and try it again!It's beautifully designed and with the dramatic lighting and eerie sounds, it seriously felt like we were in a horror movie.It was everyone's first experience in an escape room and we were all nervous about what we were getting into, but the owners we so kind and helpful that they were more than willing to make sure we were all going to have a fun time!I just recommend to book in advance because those time slots fill up fast!

room_title: Escape room "The Witching Hour" by Will You Escape? in Tucson
review: My favorite room in Tucson! The staff here is attentive and friendly, the Witching Hour has a spooky vibe and bewitching puzzles. I loved the secret reveal!

room_title: Escape room "Potion Master's Apprentice" by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "X-Child" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: We've done a lot of escape rooms around the valley, but Dare to Escape's rooms are by far the best! Cult of Mithras and X-Child (which we broke the records on!) utilized the most creative puzzles, riddles, and devices that our group has encountered in AZ. Some of the secrets in the rooms actually left us with a sense of awe and wonder! I'd say the rooms strike the perfect balance between making you think outside the box and communicate with your team while avoiding frustrating, ridiculously-hard and obscure problems that are impossible to solve. Loved the themes of the rooms as well and can't wait to return for The Cell! These are the best escape rooms in AZ that we've encountered and I would definitely recommend them to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "X-Child" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: If you've never done an escape room, do it! This was my first one. We had such a great time we came back later that night. And then booked the third room two days later. Recommend starting with Mithras and then X Child. Haven't done the cell yet. That's tomorrow!! Nice to talk to one of the owners -- local boys and their own ideas. Love that!! Great customer service and fantastic experience.

room_title: Escape room "X-Child" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: My friends and I have done many escape rooms around the valley and the x-child room is definitely one of my favorites! It was so much fun! Definitely requires a lot of communication between group members which is part of the reason I liked it so much. We'll definitely be coming back to check out the other room(s).

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: Loved this room! Initially, being separated from my boyfriend freaked me out. But we were able to quickly jump into the clues and start working on the puzzles! This was our 2nd escape room and we Escaped with seconds.

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: Took my husband and our friends for a birthday celebration, had a great time, super fun! We did the Jail Break room and escaped. Will definitely plan to go back to try the other room.

room_title: Escape room "Jail Break" by Greatest Escape in Lancaster (CA)
review: We went as a group of four and did the jail room. Two of us had never done an escape room before, but we made it out! Granted, we needed a few hints, but we had a blast trying to figure everything out! Sometimes we had to step back and try another strategy to solve a puzzle, but that's what makes it fun! I would highly recommend the jail room, and I can't wait to try the apartment!

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: I love these escape room games! The Phoenix escape room was super fun. Unlike others I have been to this one is hard but still so much fun. We did the Pipe Works room and loved it. I look forward to trying their other ones!

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: I've done their Knight and Rook and Pipeworks, escaped both and now I'm an addict. :) The rooms are a lot of fun, the clues are pretty clever and well executed. Awesome place to go do something fun with your date or friends. Can't wait for the new room to open!

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: The Phoenix Escape Room has been remodeled and games improved significantly over the past 6 months. The first thing we noticed was how clean the facility is (it even smells good). We played the Pipes game and it was both challenging and a lot of fun. It's now one of the best escape rooms in the valley and highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: Went with a group and it was so much fun. Very challenging and well done. We did the Pipeworks Room. I highly recommend and will definitely go back and try another room.As a side note, if you are over 40 make sure you bring your reading glasses. There are a lot of tiny numbers on combination locks. I forgot mine but luckily I had some younger people in my group who could see!

room_title: Escape room "Pipe Works" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: I took 3 teenage girls and my 11-year-old daughter. We had a blast! I can't wait to do this with a group of adults. It was really challenging and exciting as we figured out clues. We can't wait to go again. The room was so authentic looking! Pipe works was def worth the hour...which flew by.

room_title: Escape room "Booty Battle" by Brain Busters Escape Rooms in Daleville
review: We had three adults and four kids, ages 7, 9, 10, 11. We participated in The Grove and it was fun even with the kids. The prices were reasonable and it was a great time with child rainy weather! While the wwe decided to participate in the Booty Battle and it was soooo much fun! We split up kids verse adults and it was a great time!!Highly recommend if you are looking for something to do!!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci’s Office" by Escape Room Yuma in Yuma
review: Great room and well-done puzzles. Very friendly and accommodating staff. My Mom uses a cane and they brought a bench in for her to sit down. The room's hardest physical demand was to bend down/crouch down to open a combo lock. The Da Vinci room was very well themed.

room_title: Escape room "Rogue Agent" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: It was a lot of fun!!! There were definitely some challenges and some fun surprises! Our clue master was great! We will absolutely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Rogue Agent" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: We had an awesome time even though we also should have started with an easier room for our first time. We had eight people and in our case we probably would have done better with 6.

room_title: Escape room "Rogue Agent" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: The staff are really friendly and our Clue Master Amber was helpful with hints and feedback. Rogue Agent was incredibly challenging but really fun. This was a fun date! If we lived here, we'd be back to check out the other rooms. Super fun time!

room_title: Escape room "The Bayou: Legend of the Midnight Raven" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: My group of four did both Fogmore Manor and the bayou rooms. These rooms are done really well! We've done a bunch of escape rooms in San Diego and this one is definitely in our top 3 favorite places.  The tech in these rooms are really awesome! They are very challenging which we like but doable. We got trapped in both rooms but we're about a minute away from solving them so the owner let's us finish. The owner is really passionate about his rooms which is really cool. He designed and programmed everything himself which is very impressive. I wouldn't attempt this room with any less than 4 people because it is challenging. Definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to do an escape room.

room_title: Escape room "The Bayou: Legend of the Midnight Raven" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: We read somewhere that the Entrapment (Bayou Room) was a Top 5 Escape Room in San Diego so we decided to give it a try. We usually have 5 in our group but were missing our 5th this night. We were a tad skeptical upon arrival as their location shares a main entrance way with a car sales & sketchy massage parlor. It also had a strong smell of pets or the bad smell of a public bathroom. Then their guest waiting room was nothing to brag about when compared to the 20+ other escape rooms we've visited...That's where the negative observations stop. Upon entering The Bayou room, it was well designed/decorated, very interactive, and had a lot of variety involved to keep you interested the entire time! It wasn't a typical escape room where you have to open 20 locks to complete the game. Our game master had to inform us we were doing the right thing but gave hints if say something we're doing wasn't lining up quite right to obtain the desired result but this didn't detract from the overall experience. Teamwork is definitely needed as there's lots to do in there! In the end, it turned out to be a very fun yet challenging experience. Give The Bayou room a try if you want something a little different than you're accustomed to! You won't be disappointed.

room_title: Escape room "The Bayou: Legend of the Midnight Raven" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: I did this room when I was on a trip to San Diego last year.It's the best escape room I've ever done. We did the 90 minute Bayou room, and it was AWESOME! I loved how items could be reused and the puzzles were not like not typical and formulaic. You definitely had to think outside the box.

room_title: Escape room "Galaxy Quest" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We've done a lot of 60out rooms and let me tell you, this place is something SPECIAL. Galaxy Quest: more challenging than Krampus. LOVED Cosmo, who gave me as much sass as I gave him. And the little friendly alien, who distracted us for longer than we probably should have been- but he was just so cute! If you like more tech-heavy effects do this one. I recommend at least 3 people if you're just casual escape room fans.

room_title: Escape room "Galaxy Quest" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We loved playing Galaxy Quest!!! My 10 year old daughter and I enjoyed the high immersion, the sense of humor, and the sci-fi nature of the room. The puzzles were quirky and fun. I found myself repeating some of the directions because they were useful. It was also important to listen to directions given. We enjoyed ourselves immensely and found we had a lot to do and were fully engaged in either saving the world or destroying it. We did have a couple of tech issues, which honestly, happens in escape rooms in Los Angeles. I've come to expect them, but they didn't take away the joy we had in playing this room. (The only place where we've played escape rooms that have a lot of high tech and did not have any tech issues was in Israel, but the puzzles were not that interesting in the rooms we've played there.) We both enjoyed the puzzles at Galaxy Quest because of the mix and uniqueness.I would highly recommend this room to families of tweens, couples who want to laugh and work together and get to know each other better, and groups of friends looking for a fun, challenging time.There is a parking lot in the back and clean restrooms. The GM and owner, Brian was stellar.

room_title: Escape room "Galaxy Quest" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I love the 60out Escape Rooms! I've been to the Marina Del Rey location a few times and was very impressed. This was my first time at this location, and it did not disappoint either.First off parking is very easy. There's a huge free attached parking lot. They have a few different rooms of varying difficulty. We chose the Galaxy Quest room which is by far the hardest room I've ever done. It is very different from many of the other rooms that I've done. 60out is great, and I can't wait to do some of their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Party Hard" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: My first time at the Quest room, had an amazing time. Very clean facility. Totally recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Party Hard" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: I loved the storylines, the decorations and the way how puzzles were created! Very great job! We had a lot of fun and definitely coming back!

room_title: Escape room "Party Hard" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Quest Room always has great customer service.  We have done two rooms at this location and look forward to doing the third.

room_title: Escape room "Coma" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: The escape room was very well put together with a good theme. We had a great time solving all the clues. Though it took us a little longer then an hour to solve they allowed us to stay and finish without kicking us out of the room. Definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Coma" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Had a great time with my 3 daughters tonight!! The staff was helpful but not to much where they give away the rides. It challenged our intellect and pushed our minds to really think about the clues! Had a blast we shall enjoy back again. Thank you!!

room_title: Escape room "Coma" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: First time doing the escape room thing.  6 girls celebrating a birthday.  We had a blast! Will definitely come back  -  thanks JC!

room_title: Escape room "The Royal Jackpot" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: My family and I had such a fun time at Escape Room Salinas! Awesome customer service, and a place you can go multiple times!! Can’t wait to try another room!

room_title: Escape room "The Royal Jackpot" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: SO much fun. I visited a friend in Salinas for a weekend and she took me here. I would totally recommend it - unique entertainment and really fun for a group. The staff there really knows the rooms which makes it a great experience for the guests. We ALMOST made it out. Cant wait to go back for a rematch! Thanks again for a great experience Escape Room Salinas!

room_title: Escape room "The Royal Jackpot" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Super fun times! We needed the clues, and they were soooo obvious that we felt kinda lame afterward! The only critique? Give a 'clue' to the clue, not just the out-and-out answer. Even so, it was a great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Rabbit Hole: Welcome to 221B!" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: We played the escape rooms this weekend, Ante Up! It was amazing and great team building. So if your looking for a great time and something to do this is the place to go. Next time we will try the Central Intelligence and the Asylum.

room_title: Escape room "The Rabbit Hole: Welcome to 221B!" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: Went for a date night with our adult kids and we had a terrific time! We started with Ante Up and 'escaped' in 45 minutes. We are all hooked and will definitely be back to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Rabbit Hole: Welcome to 221B!" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: For our group, 3 out of 4, this was the 1st time trying an escape room and for the 4th, only the 2nd time and we definitely will do it again! Just Elfing Around was a hoot and we managed to solve! It was fun, exciting and makes your brain work! Can't wait to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Rabbit Hole: Welcome to 221B!" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: I had such a blast tonight! The room was full of lots of fun tricks! It really made me think hard and focus on all the details in the room. I enjoyed every minute of it, literally! I Will definitely be visiting again and will try my best to beat the room next time! Can't wait to see the rest of the rooms and try them out!

room_title: Escape room "Titanic Room" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: This was my birthday present (age 62) ,group of four, first time for three of us, we escaped from the Titanic with 1:19 left, game master was great, the clues were challenging , it was great fun and we will do it again

room_title: Escape room "Titanic Room" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: A fun time was had by all! We decided on the Titanic room and it was a group of 4. They gave us the room to ourselves, which was greatly appreciated because the room would have been tight with more. The actual escape room was exciting and we all enjoyed the experience. Game master May did a good job explaining and facilitating.

room_title: Escape room "Titanic Room" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: This was fun. We picked kids against the adults in the Titanic Room and neither team made it out. Lots of fun finding keys, unlocking the clues and solving the riddles. The staff was great. Great for team building or family fun.

room_title: Escape room "Titanic Room" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Never did an escape room before. We did the titanic room. It was an absolute blast. Will definitely go again. Caitlyn was our moderator she was fantastic.

room_title: Escape room "Titanic Room" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Our bachelorette group had an amazing time today in the Titanic Room! It was unlike anything we've ever done before. As a party of 3, we were expecting to be paired up with another group, but were pleasantly surprised to have a room all to ourselves. Our game master was great and explained everything well starting off. I thought it was really helpful being able to get hints from him, though we never took advantage of that. The clues/puzzles were challenging but not impossible, though I will say the very last one was pretty tough! The room was superbly decorated, the sound and light effects really added to the overall atmosphere and it was one of the highlights of our day. We ended up freeing ourselves, take that 28% success rate! Can't wait to come back again!

room_title: Escape room "Titanic Room" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: We had a group of five women a.k.a. The Pussy Cat Dolls that went to escape the room in Palm Springs. Three were rookies, so they had no idea what to expect. Two of us had done this before. We all had a blast. We did the Titanic Room and escaped with 9:44 minutes to go. Booking was easy and employees were fantastic. Would go back again.

room_title: Escape room "The Informant" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: I had a blast doing the Huntsville Escape rooms. The Informant was incredibly fun and intriguing, I came with my family and would definitely do it again to actually beat it. Can not wait to come back and do the Hexadron!

room_title: Escape room "The Informant" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: A fun time with 5 of us working the "informant' riddle; a great group activity; highly recommend, and btw, we solved it !!!

room_title: Escape room "The Informant" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: This was my second time. We did the informant this time and it was so much fun! Definitely a great way to get to know your friends and learn everyone's skills

room_title: Escape room "The Informant" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: I am from Bermuda and was in Huntsville for a training class. I couldn't wait to try an escape room As I had heard of them but never tried one before. Huntsville Escape rooms did not disappoint. My group had a blast and just missed getting out on the last clue. Our escape master was funny and quirky with his hints when we needed them. We did The Informant which was challenging but not too difficult. Wish we had time to try all four rooms. But will definitely find another one whenever I return to the states.

room_title: Escape room "The Informant" by Huntsville Escape Rooms in Huntsville
review: We were so close. Just a few more minutes and I swear we would have escaped! We had so much fun. I totally recommend this room.

room_title: Escape room "Amityville" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: it was the greatest thing I've ever done- I really appreciate the production quality you guys put into the design and execution of your rooms. They're above and beyond everyone else.

room_title: Escape room "Amityville" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So much fun and a really good way to bond with family/ friends. I would definitely recommend coming here.

room_title: Escape room "Amityville" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Amityville and Cartel - Silverlake locationOur first escape room experience in LA, and it was so much fun.  The difficulty level was perfect.  We started with Amityville, and although we needed a few clues along the way from Andrew (our GM), he was very careful not to make it too easy.  We had such a good time escaping Amityville, we stayed to escape the Cartel.  Location was easy to find.  Parking lot holds 4-5 cars/plenty of street parking.  No lockers, so anything you bring along comes with you into the rooms.  Nice clean bathrooms.  Filtered water in the lobby.  Both rooms are great for your first escape room experience or your first escape room as a team.

room_title: Escape room "The Salem Witch Hunt" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: First time doing an escape room and I loved it! We did the Salem Witch mission and solved it with 5 minutes to spare. There were four of us which felt like the right number. Any more and it might be a little too crowded. Great staff as well.

room_title: Escape room "The Salem Witch Hunt" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Had so much fun in the Salem With Trial room! Can't wait to go back for the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Salem Witch Hunt" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Such a fun experience! Cool puzzles, riddles, and room altogether! Can't wait to come back for Area 51!

room_title: Escape room "Hansel & Gretel: Chapter 2" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: This was our 4th time here. Each time was so much fun. I think my favorite so far has been the Hansel and Gretel room.

room_title: Escape room "Hansel & Gretel: Chapter 2" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We've done several escape rooms and this was definitely one of the best. The room was decorated so perfectly and the puzzles were very clever. We did the Hansel & Gretel room, which they said was their hardest room. It was hard but we were able to complete it with just a few minutes to spare. Super fun!

room_title: Escape room "Hansel & Gretel: Chapter 2" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We had a team building activity here and it was great! The staff was so friendly and accommodating; they split 24 people up into 3 different rooms and we competed against each other to see who would get out the fastest. The room I was in was Hansel and Gretel and it is very difficult. We got out with 8 seconds to spare! I will definitely go again. Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Tombstone Judgement Day" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Sheriff's Office" by Unlocked Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Great place for some group fun. Family or friends. We did the Sheriff's Office. Went through most the puzzles fast but the last one stumped us. We were so close! We will definitely be returning.

room_title: Escape room "The Sheriff's Office" by Unlocked Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did this room on Fathers Day with my two kids. Gary the host was awesome! Both before we entered, and during the escape. Very clever, and cool things inside. We did the Sheriffs Office. My kids and I had a blast. We will be coming back for sure with a larger group for the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Sheriff's Office" by Unlocked Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was really fun!!!! I took my 2 teenage grandkids to Unlocked. They had done a couple of Escape rooms, but were really excited that they were going to do another one. We did the Sheriff room and couldn't stop talking about it after we were finished. This is a really great activity for all ages. My only suggestion is to have more than 3 people. We will be back to do the other rooms. HAVE FUN !!!!

room_title: Escape room "Doctor Psycho" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We played the Doctor Psycho room. It was GROSS! Haha but it a totally good way. You really feel like you are locked in a gross dungeon. This room is ranked "medium" on the website but we really struggled! We had to ask for a few hints and it still took us 45 minutes to escape. There was A LOT to do in this room too, and there was one really cool surprise element that made us laugh out loud.The game masters were very helpful and they have a big parking lot in back. We loved this location and once again we're super impressed by 60out!

room_title: Escape room "Doctor Psycho" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We played Doctor Psycho and it was crazy! It was super intense and creepy but we LOVED it! Our game master was friendly and helpful. The lobby was really cute and cool! I will be going back for another room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Doctor Psycho" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Did this in a group of four. This room is really, really interesting. Well decorated and makes you feel like you are stuck in a really gross doctor's office. Make sure to look EVERYWHERE, we missed a lock and didn't realize it until we needed it towards the end. Despite some lock-and-key puzzles, there was still some cool tech in here and I enjoyed it. Interesting mix of sheer physical activity and brainpower. We escaped with very little time to spare and had an awesome time!

room_title: Escape room "Doctor Psycho" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The moment I walked in I was amazed and whisked away to amazing mazes and puzzles that not only gave me a high sense of adventure but also challenged me and helped me think. The puzzles are amazing and you're automatically drawn into the action whether you're chasing a criminal or saving the world. I had a phenomenal experience.

room_title: Escape room "Doctor Psycho" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: One of the best things I did on my trip. I definitely recommend doing the Doctor Psycho room with a group of your friends who are scaredy cats Such a good experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Black Rose" by Twisted Exit in Lancaster (CA)
review: The pirate room was a blast. The puzzles and clues were extremely well planned. It wasn't easy, but we all worked together and escaped. I can't wait to go back and do the next room.

room_title: Escape room "The Black Rose" by Twisted Exit in Lancaster (CA)
review: Amazing staff! Katie was very professional and kind during our team challenge which made our experience even better. The facility was clean, designed nicely and the puzzles were spot on! We may not have escaped The Black Rose but we'll be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Black Rose" by Twisted Exit in Lancaster (CA)
review: We did the Black Rose room and it was so well thought out and creative! So much fun! And although my daughter and I walked the plank, we can't wait to try the others! Strongly recommended and very friendly staff.

room_title: Escape room "The Black Rose" by Twisted Exit in Lancaster (CA)
review: The Black Rose was a great challenging game. We didn't escape this time, but we are definitely coming back to conquer the next challenge!

room_title: Escape room "Murder at Silver City" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Treasure of Captain Lockjaw" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: These rooms are fantastic. They are well thought out, challenging, and rewarding. Captain Lockjaw, Madame Lumina, and the Pearled Pachyderm are really great for first timers or experienced puzzle room fans. The Beta Lab room is simply challenging - no antics, no frills, just boxes, locks, and puzzles so I don't recommend it for people looking for the more engaging/ theatrical experience. All in all, we were thrilled with all of these rooms and would gladly revisit if and when a new room is created.

room_title: Escape room "The Treasure of Captain Lockjaw" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: This was a fun and unique experience, I would highly recommend it.  Great location in downtown Phoenix, friendly staff. The puzzles were challenging and intriguing. Get your friends together and try it out! Great for groups.

room_title: Escape room "The Treasure of Captain Lockjaw" by Phoenix Puzzle Room in Phoenix
review: It was a great experience and very fun and challenging. We did treasure of captain lockjaw definitely coming back to do others

room_title: Escape room "Grandma's Surprise" by Trapped! Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My office team tried out the grandma room yesterday. So much fun. Roland was great and all my employees liked the experience. We had to work together to get through the many puzzles. It was neat to see who took the lead on certain tasks and who helped put the right people in the spots working each task. We got out by the skin of our teeth.

room_title: Escape room "Grandma's Surprise" by Trapped! Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My husband, son and I really enjoyed Grandma's Surprise!  One of the best things about this room was it is only your group.  If you don't fill all of the spots, you don't have to play with people you don't know.  Nice clean place with nice staff.  We really liked it!

room_title: Escape room "Grandma's Surprise" by Trapped! Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Grandmas surprise! This was my first escape room, and let me say it was awesome. We had a party of five which seemed like a good number of people to solve all of puzzles to complete the mission. The room was a challenge and the hints helped out a ton! Dream our hostess and helper was amazing, will definitely try the other puzzle soon. Cannot recommend this place enough and location was close to home:) Thanks again!!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Adventure" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Pet Snatched" by Exit Strategy in Sacramento
review: We did the Pet Snatched game for our 10 year old's birthday and it was great! The story was fun, puzzles were challenging, and our gamemaster was very helpful and friendly. It was a super fun activity!!

room_title: Escape room "Pet Snatched" by Exit Strategy in Sacramento
review: Had a wonderful experience at this escape room company. The game master was very welcoming and was also very helpful. We played pet snatched and we had such a wonderful time. Can't wait to go back for the other rooms that they have. Thanks for a fun and amazing experience. See you soon!

room_title: Escape room "Pet Snatched" by Exit Strategy in Sacramento
review: I took group of kids 10-13 and we did the pet game.  We had a blast.  All the kids want to do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Escape From Alcatraz" by ALL IN Adventures in Tuscaloosa
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loads of fun! I personally felt that there should have been a bit more theatrics with the introductions.

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This place is awesome! Came with a few friends and we had a blast. Totally worth the money for the experience you're getting

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Definitely a place to go! Must have experience! Great way to spend quality and memorable times with your friends! Love this place! Can't wait to come back ~

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had a wonderful time here! It's great to have something different to do and each member of our family truly helped "get us out"! Great for families and friends!!!

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Although the parking was a bit strange and finding the place a bit difficult, this was the most fun thing I've ever done. Challenging but fun and will definitely be going back to do other mazes.

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: After much anticipation, the actual experience completely exceeded our expectations. Tons of fun, lovely staff, would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Motel" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The idea of coming here at first was exciting, but the actual experience is much greater than what you could anticipate. The staff was really friendly and interactive with us, not only were they nice, but they are quick in resetting the rooms so that others may enjoy the thrill of escaping as well. This combination allowed for my group to decide that we will be trying to solve all other that are available and further encourage anyone to come and try your luck in defeating these puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "The Initiation" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: More difficult for our group than the Shelter was, but had good flow and beautiful scenery. All of us had to work together on many of the puzzles and we really liked it!

room_title: Escape room "Fort Ord Lockdown" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: I've gone multiple times. It's challenging but a wonderful experience! It's definitely worth a visit or multiple. Friendly staff and a fantastic time.

room_title: Escape room "Fort Ord Lockdown" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Escape Room Salinas is awesome. The owners are super cool people and all the rooms are really fun to do even if you don’t escape. Rooms are all super family oriented so kids can help out as well. Thanks for bringing this to Salinas!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Fort Ord Lockdown" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: We had a great time! Super fun activity for everyone.

room_title: Escape room "Sister's Secret" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: My previous review was for The Escape (a great room). Now that I've done Sister's Secret, I have to say it's my favorite room I've ever done. Out of 54 rooms, this one was the most immersive I've experienced. Edwin, the owner, has an attention to detail, high quality puzzles, and intriguing story line that all come together perfectly in this room. I was scared, but not to the point where puzzles couldn't be completed. There's just the right amount of cool tech in the room, and it all added to the spooky theme. I'm also a sucker for a story - if you pay attention you will be carried through a movie like storyline from beginning to end. A cool bonus is the lobby has a mini escape room practice game. I highly recommend The Unlockables!

room_title: Escape room "Sister's Secret" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: It was my first time trying an Escape Room, and it was a pleasant experience! Staff was super friendly and great at moderating the experience. We tried Sister's Secret- we didn't succeed, but the room was really detailed and well done!I would recommend not doing this room if it's your first time, since it's a little more complicated than The Escape or Informant. I'm going back to try an easier room for the ego boost :)

room_title: Escape room "Sister's Secret" by The Unlockables in San Diego
review: Came in on a Saturday afternoon.  My crew and I love escape rooms so this is not our first rodeo.  Place has 3 room, two of them sister secret and the escape are a bit more advanced and technologically involved.  The last one is more of your traditional escape room.  We did sister's secret and it was one of the better escape rooms in terms of atmosphere, challenge and puzzle flow.  For this room you need atleast 3 people and i'd recommend more if some of the people aren't that experienced.  Puzzle complexity is average and they all make sense.  Its perfect for larger groups since it is non-linear (something they tell you at the beginning) so you can all work of different things at the same time.  There are a lot of things to do in this room so its going to be hard if your team doesn't have multiple competent people.The atmosphere of the room is great.  Nice spooky ambience with a few things that go bump in the night.  Really a nice immersive experience with a bunch of fun puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire: Axis Vs. Allies" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: It was good fun. Very challenging. Would definitely recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire: Axis Vs. Allies" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: Soooo much fun!!! Can't wait to go back and try the next room

room_title: Escape room "Treasure of the Empire: Axis Vs. Allies" by Xcapade in San Francisco
review: Great place. Rooms are well designed and really makes you think. Would go again

room_title: Escape room "A Tale of Two Forts" by XIT Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: Great time in this Xescape Room. Lovely people operating the game. Enthusiastic, welcoming, with the right customer service attitude.

room_title: Escape room "Ex Machina" by Stockton Escape in Modesto
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Orphanage" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was our first escape room experience we planned as a girls night fun for something new and exciting. And I must admit we were impressed!!! The puzzles kept us challenged without losing the idea of just having fun. The gamemaster was awesome and the elements of their room was very impressive and on point. All I can say is... we... will... be... back!

room_title: Escape room "The Orphanage" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did The Orphanage last Friday and it was absolutely amazing! One of the best escape rooms I've ever done (roughly 50 escape rooms give or take). The atmosphere was perfectly creepy and kind of kept you on your toes, very different and fun puzzles, great game master (we only knew him as our Dark Lord) and just a great time overall. I can't recommend this game enough!

room_title: Escape room "The Orphanage" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My group and I are Escape RoomEnthusiasts and really enjoyed the experience at this location for the Orphanage. To start off the staff is very nice and informative if it is your first time, but we didn't need any explaining, so they asked us about our previous experiences doing escape rooms. The puzzles were well thought out and some were elaborate especially from the very beginning, you have to use your head and pay attention to all clues around you. We did use 3 clues to only find out we were already on the right track we just needed reassurance. We escaped with 15 minutes to spare ! They do have one other room at this location called Nautical (remember I'm talking about the one on western). The location might be a little hard to find at first but the sign is on their door. Street parking only, they have meters, or you can park down the side street during certain times around the corner. Highly recommend for a small birthday party, company outing for 6 employees, or even something to do when bored or looking for more things to do in LA aside from the common tourist things .

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: Had a great time at Escape Oakland! If you're looking for a fun and unusual experience in the Bay area, this is the place the check out. The room was challenging but very interesting, and got our creative juices flowing as a team! Owners were warm and friendly (and helped us when we needed some clues ). Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: Incredible fun! Clever puzzles.  Kind staff.  Just the best experience! The whole family enjoyed our night!

room_title: Escape room "The Bunker" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: What an adventure! We had a blast, and I can't wait to go back! "The Bunker" was full of surprises, and it was perfect for our group of friends. We were able to escape from the room with a few clues. The location is perfect with a lot of street parking and walking distance to the bart station. The host was awesome! She explained all rules to us as for some of us it was first escape room. Thanks a lot!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Dungeon" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Had a great day with the kids solving the puzzles. We escaped!

room_title: Escape room "The Dungeon" by Escapism in San Diego
review: What an awesome team building experience! Tap into the creative side of your brain while getting a nice dose of adrenaline

room_title: Escape room "The Dungeon" by Escapism in San Diego
review: A fun, yet challenging group activity! Highly recommended!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Dungeon" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Great experience! We went with kids (11 YO and 13 YO) and had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Dungeon" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Had a great time. Working together is the key! Everyone should try this atleast once.

room_title: Escape room "Takeover" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: This is one the BEST escape rooms in all of San Diego. I've done this 6 other times and I am impressed on how elaborate their rooms are. I took 2 different youth girl basketball teams and we all had a blast. This was great for team building and can accommodate all age levels. The staff is very professional as well. Denzel was very good in facilitating the groups and I can't thank him enough.

room_title: Escape room "Takeover" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: I love how the games are immersive and require unique character traits for solving each puzzle. Definitely a great way to spend a Saturday night.

room_title: Escape room "Takeover" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: Such a great first time experience! Went in with friends as a group of 5 which was a good size for the escape room we did. The tasks weren’t too complex but involved just the right amount of brain power and at the end of it we felt pretty accomplished and happy! We escaped! 🔓🕵️‍♀️

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: 8 friends went to All Locked Up last Saturday night. Some had tried escape rooms before but the majority had never been. Most of us didn't know what to expect. This place is AMAZING!! We had the GREATEST time escaping from The Classroom! I can't wait to go back and try all of the other rooms that are available. The location is creatively decorated, realistic and you really have to see it to believe it. They did a FANTASTIC job designing The Classroom. It's so easy to get lost in its reality and play the game to win. The owners are so friendly and so supportive and the customer service we received makes this our #1 Escape Room! We highly recommend this place for a fun night out with friends or family.

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: So happy to have a great escape room right here SCV! My group and I have played 100+ rooms and we loved it here! The decor in the rooms are spot on! We loved to be challenged and these guys def do that with their puzzles! We did the garage and the classroom! Both a great time I def loved the classroom there are 3 diff levels to this room junior high, high school, and now college (def expert level) the garage had that creepy vibe but nothing to scary (I'm a scary cat). Can't wait for their next room... the owners are what really makes this place... their passion for escape rooms shows...

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by All Locked Up in Los Angeles
review: The "Classroom" was spot on. My kids loves it and we actually got the record time-as of March 15 :) ! Will come back to do garage.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Adventure" by Limitless Escape Games in Modesto
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The List" by Chico Escape Rooms in Chico
review: We love making memories with our family, especially during the holidays. This year we tried Chico Escape Rooms and had a fantastic time. With 1:38 left, the six of us were able to solve all of the clues and write our names on Santa’s Nice List! A great way to spend a solid hour problem solving, laughing, and working together. Our family ranges in age from 18 to 65 and we ALL had a great time. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Da Vinci Code" by Xcape Flagstaff in Flagstaff
review: We loved the DaVinci Code room. It was a great time with my friends. We can't wait to come back and try the 20 minute room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Trump's America" by Tales From The Cryptex in Sacramento
review: So much fun with interactive help and clues if needed to solve problems. Each puzzle made logical sense with the theme. Person at the front desk was great and excited to help. Thanks.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Trump's America" by Tales From The Cryptex in Sacramento
review: Went with 5 family members, and none of us had ever done anything like this before so I was apprehensive. But we loved the theme so wanted to try it out. We ended up having a blast! It was definitely challenging but not impossible. We solved it with 3 extra clues. It was very exciting to figure out the puzzles together. I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Escape Trump's America" by Tales From The Cryptex in Sacramento
review: Puzzles were just hard enough, amazing how many components you can fit into one small room!

room_title: Escape room "Escape Trump's America" by Tales From The Cryptex in Sacramento
review: I really enjoyed myself and it was very challenging. It was a very small room and maybe one couple too many, I felt a little overcrowded. It was still a fun time.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Trump's America" by Tales From The Cryptex in Sacramento
review: My family took me here as a birthday surprise and it was fantastic! We solved the puzzle with one other family, and it turned out that we really needed every member to solve this in the nick of time. It was like living in a Mission Impossible scenario for an hour. I want to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Gravitational Effect" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Great time! Staff was very helpful and engaged. Definitely worth trusting your next event with these very capable professionals.

room_title: Escape room "Gravitational Effect" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Awesome experience, very fun game! Thank you! We can't wait to come back for Amazon rainforest!

room_title: Escape room "Gravitational Effect" by International Room Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Gravitational Effect - I think I liked this room better than Amazon Rainforest. They tried to make the room 4D by giving you 3D glasses to enhance the experience but, let's be honest, they're not going to do anything other than make you trip and/or make the puzzles difficult because you can't see them straight. They are not needed to play the game so they are pretty pointless, in my opinion. We didn't even put them on. For the most part, the puzzles made sense and a few were challenging but not overly difficult. There were a couple of puzzles I felt that if they were improved upon they would make the experience more immersive. One of the puzzles involved "jackets" which, at first, we thought were just plastic bags. This made the puzzle seem kinda cheesy because they were just cheap rain ponchos that didn't really fit with the room. Perhaps investing in some actual jackets to make it more themed would help spruce up this puzzle some. The other puzzle was the final puzzle. I don't want to give anything away so I won't say anything about it other than it had absolutely nothing to do with the theme of the room. But even with that being said, I do want to say that there was one "puzzle" that was more of a physical challenge and that was a lot of fun. It caught us off guard when we saw it (which is almost always a good thing in the world of escape rooms) and we laughed a lot through it. I thought it was great for them to have this in the room and really added a lot to the experience.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Had an awesome time at Breakout Games. The rooms were awesome! We've done three different rooms here, Kidnaping, Hostage and Mystery Mansion, all were challenging and so much fun. The guys at Breakout were awesome as well, celebrating with us like they had broken out too. If you are looking for a fun group activity, this is the place to go, I would recommend going on days when it won't be too busy, or having enough in your group to take up all the spots. Definitely well worth it though!

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Fun! Brought my dad and family for Father's Day and he really enjoyed it! He had never done anything like this before. We did the new Mystery Mansion room. It was a little hard, but fun nonetheless! I will bring him back to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Mystery Mansion" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: This was a multi-generational family event and we had a blast! Our game-master was first rate and made the experience challenging and still fun. We did the "Mystery Mansion" room and recommend it. Have fun!

room_title: Escape room "Home Alone" by Padlocked Inc. in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Tiki Time!" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: So much fun. Experienced Krampus and Tiki room. Can't wait to go again.

room_title: Escape room "Tiki Time!" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loved this experience! Did all 3 with my team and escaped all of them! The Krampus room was by far my favorite, some great theming and excellent spooks. The Tiki Palace and Spaceship were challenging but lots of fun. Staff was welcoming and very accommodating. Cheers to Countdown Live!

room_title: Escape room "Tiki Time!" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My teen son had a group of friends in the Tiki Room last night. 9 kids ages 11-15. To be honest, they're a very gifted bunch and my 3 kids had done multiple other rooms in the past. They actually escaped with 38 seconds to spare (took 3 hints). They all had such a great time and the host Brian is a really great guy. Can't wait to work up my courage to come back with my husband and some friends to try out the Krampus room. We'll be back!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by XIT Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: So me and a group of friends went yesterday to the new escape room, words cannot begin to describe the experience. We did the insane asylum and the other group did tale of two forts, and every single person was amazed. We are already planning our next visit, zombie room here we come!!!

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by XIT Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: This was our first time doing an Escape Room and it was awesome! We did the Asylum and it was challenging, but Cristol gave us helpful hints and we got out with 6 minutes to spare! It was so much fun and it’s a place that I will recommend to anyone I know coming down to Gulf Shores.

room_title: Escape room "Insane Asylum" by XIT Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: Our group of 5 ladies aged 20 to 58 chose the Insane Asylum. All of us except one had done an escape room before, but this was our first time at this location. The lady at the front desk was very nice and helpful. The room was challenging, but not ridiculous. We had a great time, we escaped with time to spare, and if we are in the area again, would love to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the X Corporation" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This place is so much fun! There was a group of 8 of us that did Escape the X Corporation room, this was definitely challenging! We did escape though! So we decided to do another room and did Starlight Lounge, but this was only with 6 people. This room was much easier than the first, but still made you think a lot. My tip is to not have everyone work on one thing, split up but communicate with each other very well, no matter which room you decide to do. I believe that 6 is the perfect amount of people to escape. We escaped the second room, breaking the record and becoming second on the leader board! #dinner2go  I will definitely be back to do other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the X Corporation" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My first escape room ever! Played it with 4 randoms and had a blast. It is a fairly medium-tech room (meaning theres is more to it than just finding keys and combinations) with great puzzles. I didn't find it too difficult at all. We escaped with 4 minutes left!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the X Corporation" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We did the Corporation X room tonight. It was really fun even though we didn't escape in the end. Our host Frank was great, really funny. Parking is easy and there is a lot of it. The building is a little hard to see from the street, but we found it just fine.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the X Corporation" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Great room design, clever puzzles, and interesting plot for the Escape from X Corporation room. I was in a group of 6, and were so jubilant when we escaped with 26 seconds to spare! Hints are helpful, use them wisely. Overall, it was a brain-pumping, adrenaline-rushing experience.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the X Corporation" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Way more involved, creative, fun and nerve wracking than I thought it would be! We had a GREAT time and can't wait to do the other rooms! It allowed us to work together as well as use our individual strengths to conquer each task! Also, the guy who greeted us was very welcoming and extremely friendly. I HIGHLY suggest trying this place out!

room_title: Escape room "Dracula's Castle" by Mystery Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Inception" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The staff was nice and funny even though my party was 15 minutes late. The Inception escape room was tough but our group of 8 had a blast. We highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "Inception" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: **NON-SPOILER REVIEW** This is only my second escape room and was the first for the other 5 friends I did this with. I chose this one over the other because the premise seemed more technical and the other room was rated as scary, which was a no-go for one of our members. The puzzles were very technical in nature rather than relying heavily on math or word puzzles, which was a huge positive for the room as it fit the theme and every time we solved one we were blown away with the amount of technology that had to have gone into creating the puzzle. Comparing this to my first escape room experience, this escape was far more satisfying and we all can't stop talking about each puzzle and the creativity behind them. I can't wait to try out future rooms that they have in construction.

room_title: Escape room "Inception" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My sister in law was in town for her birthday and we decided, spur of the moment, to do an escape room. I wanted to do the inception room because it was rated harder than their other room. The puzzles were a fun mix of physical and more traditional. Some of the physical puzzles were difficult for our group, but I expect that if you or someone in your group is more of a spacial thinker then you probably won't have the problems we did.Inception is a rather tech heavy room, which often feels gimmicky to me. However in the Inception room they used the tech to their advantage really well. It fits the theme and feel of the room superbly.Overall, Inception is an excellent room and is one of the few rooms I've done that actually gets better in my mind the more I analyze it.

room_title: Escape room "Game of Swords" by Planet Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: My dad gifted my family the Game of Swords escape room for Christmas.  It was a lot of fun!  Challenging enough for the five of us to work together and manage to get through the entire thing.  Hunter was very enthusiastic and a great game master.  He made the next few rooms that will be opening soon sound really fun so we might have to be back!

room_title: Escape room "Game of Swords" by Planet Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We ha great time with our data faction team today.with both rooms game of swords and wise guys.the team at escape room were very nice and helpful throughout the day and special thanks to them.when our turn came for wise guys guys the person by name of Hunter was very helpful

room_title: Escape room "Game of Swords" by Planet Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We've been here twice with two different groups. Once to their mob room and once to the game of swords. We really enjoyed it both times. The staff is super attentive, offering just the right amount of help at just the right times for you to feel successful and still be challenged. We can't wait for them to open more rooms so we can return.

room_title: Escape room "Suspects" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: I've been to this place twice and love it! I recently did suspects and boy was there a twist on that room, but also did bookie! Fantastic place and one of the best escape rooms that I've been to. Def worth the money and I highly recommend seeing if there is a groupon, then call and ask them for the same deal and they will give it to you! More money in their pockets and you still get a great deal. Jack was our control master and he had fun with us as well, sending celebratory messages on the screen when we would get the next clue unlocked. Can't wait to go back, already scheduled my next adventure 3/2... doing captains quarters :)

room_title: Escape room "Suspects" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Escape Rooms Mesa was a great experience. My girlfriend and I tried the Suspects room and had a fun time. Shawn was a great game master. I'll certainly be back!

room_title: Escape room "Suspects" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Thoughtful scenario and enjoyed,  immersive and glad we went to introduce 2 more people to this concept

room_title: Escape room "Yakuza" by Top Tier Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "A Diamond Dilemma" by Escape Room 104 in Pine Bluff
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Pyramid" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: I had so much fun my first escape room and I can't wait to go again! I tried the pyramid room and our group made it out with about a few minutes to spare it was a great experience!i loved being put in the room with people we didn't know and working together as a teams!

room_title: Escape room "The Pyramid" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: My group of 8 loved, loved, loved The Pyramid (which is Mayan, not Egyptian).  My first Escape Room and we made it out.  Super colorful and multi-sensorial.
