Staff Guide Theresa was all that to assist if needed.  It was so much more stimulating and challenging than I thought it would be.  Cool to see friend's skills come out.  Can't wait for the next one!

room_title: Escape room "The Pyramid" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Just did the newest one of the four choices, The Pyramid, and it's really good. Pretty difficult and we didn't quite finish in time to escape, but it's so well planned and interesting that no one really minded. The design is great and even better than the other rooms - just sorry that we were rushing to finish the clues and I didn't get adequate time to admire the workmanship. Highly recommended! (And if you haven't done one of these before, teamwork is a must - sharing things you've figured out with the others in the group. Don't worry, you'll all quickly become friends if you don't have a full group of your own.

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: This was my first escape room. I went with 3 friends and we were able to finish with 9 minutes left! (And we are minors) We had so much fun, and there were a lot of ‘aha’ moments. Overall, this was an amazing experience and I would love to come back!

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: This was the first time I have ever done an escape room, so I wasn't exactly sure what to expect. Two friends and I went and had the best time. It was nice to do something different. It was also nice to challenge yourself and really use your brain. The entire setup was very realistic and not janky. I have heard a lot of these types of escape rooms tend be cheap looking and use cheap props and this one was very nice. The owners have definitely put a lot of time and effort into making this a really awesome, organized experience that you can enjoy with friends, family and even coworkers. I will for sure be back to do more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: Such a fun but yet challenging experience! I went with two close friends of mine. We completed it with about 10 seconds to spare. GO US! The owners put a lot of work into the room to make it a realistic, fun experience. I had never done an escape room before and I walked away so excited to come back and do another one. For days I was talking about it and telling all my close friends and family about it. I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: Amazing story and room, the owner and staff were very friendly. Had a blast with my friends and solved the room, with only 1 minute and 50 seconds left. A great and fun thing you can do with your friends. Worth it! Everyone should check it out. They have a new room opening soon, will so be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: My friends and I were not sure what to expect going in to solve this mystery, but it was fantastically constructed with twists and turns; great clues and just a really fun experience. You HAVE to try it!

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: This was the 4th escape room I have been two (the others being in Vancouver) and I was really impressed. The level of interaction inside the room was a great change of pace and the subtle aid system made sure we didn't leave feeling disappointed like we did at many of the others. I'd definitely recommend this place for first timers or anybody wanting to check out escape games but even someone who has done quite a few of them like myself really loved it as well. 5/5 for sure.

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: I'm a pretty avid gamer but I had never done an escape room before. So during a family trip to San Diego (after a half day at the Zoo), we brought a team of 5 Corleys intent on cracking this code. As we joked and stumbled our way through the riddles and lore, we chased a few too many red herrings on our exciting journey toward eventual defeat. Even the insights of my six year old (who was sometimes helpful!) did not allow us to 'defuse the bomb and save the world' in time.While frustrating, no game worth playing lets everyone win. Would I recommend it? Hell yeah! If you have a couple of clever friends and want something fun to do . . . or maybe even looking for the perfect double date activity to go along with dinner then absolutely: go for it.Can you prevail where 5 Corleys came up short? There's only one way to find out . .

room_title: Escape room "The Lazarus Crystal" by Enigma HQ in San Diego
review: After reviewing other posts in TA, my husband and I decided to give Enigma HQ a call to see if there was any availability for the same evening. They made availability! Without giving away any of the plot line, we were forced to work together to solve a mystery and it had some great twists and turns! Solved it with one second left on the clock. Whew! Tons of fun and a great memory to share. Thank you, Enigma HQ, for a wonderful evening full of laughter and problem solving!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: It's a beautiful setting with a friendly staff. My group played the Antidote game and we had a blast! There was one surprise after another. I can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Antidote" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Had so much fun in Antidote. The game master was awesome! From my 10-year-old to us adults was worth the cost. Lots of fun can't wait to come back!

room_title: Escape room "Voodoo" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: This is honestly the best experience I could have! Best escape room! uwu

room_title: Escape room "Voodoo" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: My husband and I reserved the Voodoo Room. We didn't realize they were private rooms (no grouping with strangers). That was an awesome surprise. This place was top notch. All the puzzles were challenging and Mark and Alyssa were fabulous hosts. The room itself felt authentic and all of the props were cool. We loved the tactical feel of everything, having to use your eyes, ears, nose, and brain! We agreed we are doing the Western Room next and dragging some friends along next time!

room_title: Escape room "Voodoo" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Loved it! My buddies and I were in for San Diego Comic Con and stopped to do the Voodoo Room. Not only did we play the Voodoo Room, we did the Western Room after that!The staff is great and fun to work with, the puzzles complex and insightful, and a blast all around! I'm definitely planning on returning, as well as recommending Lock Down to all my friends and family!

room_title: Escape room "Voodoo" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: Took the family there for son's birthday and we had a blast solving the Voodoo room. We will be back to solve the other rooms for sure.

room_title: Escape room "Voodoo" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: So much fun! Had an absolute blast playing the voodoo room with a group of four friends. Will be back to try other rooms! Make sure to give yourself a little extra time to find parking if you have a reservation.

room_title: Escape room "Voodoo" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: A fun time at Lockdown Escape Rooms! Did two rooms with my in-laws, Voodoo was great, challenging but not impossible, and fun!

room_title: Escape room "LeRoy's Garage" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Nemesis" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Had an awesome time here for a team building event. Really have to work together. The clues and rooms are very well thought out! Highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Nemesis" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Our family has been to many escape rooms in the area and this was great. Very accommodating with time availability and easy to book it as private, which we prefer. Also great for adults and kids, we brought our 7 year old and she had fun too. Very fun!!

room_title: Escape room "The Time Machine: Nemesis" by Dynamic Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: I brought a group of my employees to Dynamic to have a team building session and to check it all out. We absolutely had a blast! I will definitely be back and will do more group events in the future!You guys did a great job building the scene and making the escape a little harder than we thought we’d experience.Thanks for having us!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Bunker" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: This was probably the best escape room experience I've had. I've been to 5 different companies and this was by far the most engaging! It's not your typical room with some decorations and puzzles, it truly feels like you're in an underground bunker trying to escape what's coming after you.We had 4 people and completed the Chapter 1 experience. The puzzles were creative and challenging. The atmosphere, story, live actors, and overall experience was incredible. We could feel the pressure of trying to escape and the fear of losing. This made the puzzles more difficult and definitely had our hearts racing. We're definitely going back to complete Chapter 2!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Bunker" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: I brought my work team here to today for a fun team building exercise. It was OUTSTANDING. The actors and all the staff were amazing, the set design and production value top notch, the story was great, and was just scary enough to be so. Much. FUN. We completed Chapter One with about 10 minutes to spare, and we will DEFINITELY be coming back for Chapter 2.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Bunker" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: The Bunker Experience helped me have a great birthday celebration with my friends! We thoroughly enjoyed Chapter 1.

room_title: Escape room "Hyde Circus" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: The set decor is mind blowing. The puzzles are intuitive and fun. Highly recommended. My friend runs an escape room of her own and she had a blast as well.

room_title: Escape room "Hyde Circus" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Was really fun and challenging. Great price for an hour of fun. Definitely will visit again very soon.

room_title: Escape room "Hyde Circus" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Definitely one of the best escape rooms in town. Clean. Challenging but also not impossible to solve!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Blackout" by Escape Room Ak in Fairbanks
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Tomb" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was one of the best experiences ever! My first time going here. The Pharaoh's Tomb was epic. I honestly didn't know what to expect. Time flew by and it was so much fun. We did escape with just a few minutes left. I definitely will be back to experience the other rooms. It is definitely a team effort to get through. Everyone brought their 'A' game.

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Tomb" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I went in last Thursday and played the Pharaoh's Tomb and One Way Ticket. Loved my experience with both rooms. Both rooms had great themes and fun puzzles. Natasha and Natalie were both great as well. Definitely check them out! The location has its own parking lot as well so it's super convenient. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Tomb" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: 8 of us did Pharaoh's Tomb. The room was so well decorated, the game was challenging, but still fun, and the operator was very helpful with clues. We had a great time, and finished with 4 minutes left. It was so much fun! I plan to come back and do other rooms, and would definitely recommend this as a group activity. Very cool!

room_title: Escape room "The Incredible Machine" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: This was the best room I've ever tried in San Francisco! I liked the style and the puzzles. I and my friend spent there a great time! Highly recommended, you will not regret!

room_title: Escape room "The Incredible Machine" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: This room is so immersive! This is definitely in my top 5 of escape rooms in San Francisco.  The room is big enough for lots of people and has tons of puzzles.  I never felt like I had nothing to do.  There are also a few puzzles that I haven't seen anywhere else!Also without any spoilers, the ending has got to be ONE OF THE BEST!  It is such a big payoff for completing the room.

room_title: Escape room "The Incredible Machine" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Incredible Machine was truly an incredible game! Visited this escape room with 3 of my friends during our trip to SF, we were hooked by the unusual theme and story of the game. Decided to give it a try and didn't regret it! Puzzles were highly interactive and unique, they used some technology that I've never seen before (no spoilers=). Clues and puzzles made sense and were well though out. Heads up, this room uses a lot of audio clues, so make sure to listen carefully. We missed one of them, but our host played the audio clue for us again. And they give unlimited clues! Definitely recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Incredible Machine" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Amazing!! My husband and I tried this escape room company out based mostly on the high reviews and it 100% lived up to and exceeded our expectations.The rooms are extremely fun, challenging (in a good way) and are created with really high quality fixtures and puzzles that let you truly interact with the environment. The owners are wonderful to deal with and the pride and effort they have put into each room is clearly evident. We had to come back and do the other one it was that great - definitely definitely give this place a go, you won't regret it!

room_title: Escape room "The Incredible Machine" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Fun puzzles, great decoration, interesting stories... as an escape room owner myself, I'd definitely recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "The Incredible Machine" by ClockWise Escape Room in San Francisco
review: On Saturday, the 24th, my friends and I went to play the Incredible machine. It was great with enough puzzles for everyone to keep busy. The puzzles were quite interactive and well thought out. Elizabeth was nice and helpful when we needed hints. :) Definitely check this place out. :)

room_title: Escape room "The Cube" by Padlocked Inc. in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2: The Hive" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: This was a fun experience. Highly interactive and pull you immediately into the story plot. There is a scare factor so come prepared. Also try to wear closed toe shoes since it's pretty dark in there. I'd definitely enjoyed this escape room and recommend everyone to give it a try!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2: The Hive" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: This was our 20th escape room and we were very impressed. I would definitely recommend doing it. We did chapter 1 and 2 back to back. If you have the time, definitely the way to go!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2: The Hive" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: We had such a blast tonight! I've always wanted to do an Escape Room and I'm so happy that we chose The Bunker Experience. We had a private event and we also elected catering by Pop Champagne, both were amazing! The 50-minute escape room was more challenging than expected but our group had loads of fun solving each puzzle and moving on to the next one. The whole experience was top-notch, highly recommended!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Glad that one of our friends suggested that we try this new game room in the city and we weren't disappointed! We had an awesome time and the room was well thought out and was well made. We've tried different escape rooms in the city and so far, I would say, theirs are the best in terms of props/production. I really liked and highly recommend it. Check them out!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Great escape room experience ! Loved it, lots of fun. Highly recommended. Very experienced escape roomers. This was at the top.

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Gold Rush was a fantastic escape room. Highly recommend for a group of teen boys. And if you book 7 people they give you the room to your self which was great. Room was challenging but do-able, and bonus if you do it on your bday you get a special sticker and pin!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Found this place just walking past. Great to find. Staff are amazingly helpful. We played 1 game (don’t know the name of the gentleman who helped us), the staff member who walked us through everything and gave us unlimited clues (we were terrible). He even gave us an extra 3 minutes to help us complete the last puzzle. The game we played was called gold rush and was challenging but again the man who helped was great - hopefully can visit again soon!

room_title: Escape room "Gold Rush" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: The Escape Game has some of the most amazing escape room experiences! We completed the Gold Rush room and the decor and design of the room was fantastic. There were puzzles that I had never seen before and the detail that went into the tools/clues were awesome! The puzzles were challenging while also able to be completed with common sense. We did not need to use any clues to solve the room and that made the experience all the more immersive. Highly recommend and we'll be back to solve the other rooms soon! Tip for those visiting, 7/10 is not so challenging. My teammates and I have about 5 rooms experience on average and we completed the room in about 25min out of the hour provided. If you and your party have experience with escape rooms, you may want to aim for one of the rooms that are ranked 8-9/10 for a harder challenge.

room_title: Escape room "The Other Side" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Had a fun time doing Dracula an the other side. The other side just jumped into my top 5. Josh our games master was really cool. Diffidently recommend checking out these rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Other Side" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: I just did The Other Side and it was amazing! People who love stranger things will love this room! The room looks amazing and the puzzles were like little nods to the 80s. Shout out to Olivia our GM! Also Chris was dope!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Other Side" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: We escaped from "The Other Side" at Fox in a Box. The room was well done with a nice variety of tasks and puzzles supported by good room design and tech. There was a challenging use of transitional spaces that demanded some brainpower. It wasn't just an easy stroll to the other side.This Fox in the Box location has game masters that are invested in you having a good time. They are positive, enthusiastic, and genuinely seem happy to be working there.Definitely do this new room and if you haven't had the pleasure of doing the other rooms here, they have a twofer Tuesday special for their older rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Dragon Tower VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: Could not have had more fun! The VR experience is unbelievable! Can’t wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Dragon Tower VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: VR experience was fun. Highly recommend

room_title: Escape room "Dragon Tower VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: Did the dragon virtual reality. First time doing vr.  Pretty cool. Employees are solid too.  I enjoy this place.  Save the chief. Go illini

room_title: Escape room "Tony's Bistro" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
review: We had family visiting over the holidays, and tried to do something different each day. The day we did Tony's Bistro at Escape: Chandler was the most fun day!  Of the 8 of us, none had previously done an escape room. We got as many hints and clues as we wanted, and escaped with 25 seconds to spare!  If you're looking for a fun adventure, I highly recommend this place, it was challenging and so much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Tony's Bistro" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
review: Such a fun experience! Did the Tony's Bistro room and had a blast. The room felt very realistic and the clues that we were lead through were just enough - not hard/to the point where it was impossible, but rather involved the right amount of thinking. Took us just under the hour to finish. Not only was the actual room experience great, but the staff was SO friendly! Zuzu was our game master and she was incredibly sweet and kept the whole experience fun from start to finish. Would definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Tony's Bistro" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
review: First time doing an escape room and it couldn't have been better! Wanted to do something for our daughter-in-laws birthday so 5 of us did Tony's Bistro. Kate was so welcoming and helpful and we even got some extra "birthday" help! Room was very detailed and even though challenging, we had the best time. Definitely want to do the other rooms next time we visit our son and daughter-in-law!!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystical Murderess" by Code Red in Orange County
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Ninja Protocol" by Break Through Sac in Sacramento
review: The ninja protocol room was a lot of fun, with some interesting surprises built into the room. My group and I got out just in the nick of time! I liked that they tried to be unique from a lot of other game rooms that already exist and added in some modern techy stuff. Cant wait to come back to try their other room!

room_title: Escape room "The Ninja Protocol" by Break Through Sac in Sacramento
review: My first ever escape room didn't escape but had a fun time. I was challenged for the most part and would recommend having as many people as you can. Highly recommend the room ninja protocol if you want a challenge.

room_title: Escape room "The Ninja Protocol" by Break Through Sac in Sacramento
review: First time in an escape room! Ninja Protocol was trilling, 110% recommend! Llaurel was super nice! :)

room_title: Escape room "A Wrinkle of Wormhole" by That Escape Room in San Francisco
review: I played so many escape rooms in my country China. Escape rooms there was like real sites of movies. I also played some other escape rooms in the Bay Area. I realized American escape rooms are so much different than China.Get back to this escape room. I came here by friend's recommendation. We tried the "A Wrinkle of Wormhole" it was really hard for us. There are so much details in the game that we have to remember and pay some attentions on it at the same time. And remember! Team work, team work, and team work! I felt I went to the gym after play this game. So tired but it was fun.I really recommend you to play this with your close friends since you have to do something together and yelling to each other's for those clues.

room_title: Escape room "A Wrinkle of Wormhole" by That Escape Room in San Francisco
review: I went there for my friend's birthday party. It was so fun. We played the Wrinkle of Wormhole. and get out of there in the last minutes. I played a few escape rooms in the bay area. So far this is the most challenging one. The room was dark and we have to interact in several different rooms at the same time. I love the story that a prodigy created the time machine and the last part was awesome. Unfortunately we cannot take a photo in there but it was so pretty. Base on the other reviews the other rooms are not that good but I'll definitely give a try.

room_title: Escape room "A Wrinkle of Wormhole" by That Escape Room in San Francisco
review: I recommend to try the wormhole game. That game has a difficult logic in it. Players have to travel between two years to make things right. There were a lot of things to do and my testing team finished in 57:58. That was a completely different experience.

room_title: Escape room "Farmhouse" by The Experience Escape Rooms in Centerton
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape from P.E." by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: So much fun! And the girls who worked there were all so friendly and nice!!! Can’t wait to go back and try another room!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from P.E." by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: We had so much fun at School of Hard Locks!  It was our first time at an Escape Room and we definitely want to return to try another room.  It was a perfect family activity, especially since we have some family members who are not overly active and we have others that are!  The age of our group of 8 - 75 and we had 8 people, and everyone helped and participated.  We did Escape from PE and it was pretty hard. We needed help, but I was still proud of our progress.  The staff was kind and fun!  Looking forward to going back again soon!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from P.E." by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: Great fun! Really nice staff. Escape from PE was tough with all the locks. Wish there had been more than one room to escape from besides the locker room. Overall good experience.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Mad Hatter" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: I came here last weekend to do the mad hatter room with some friends I had visiting. A few of us had been to escape rooms before, so we kinda knew the drill! I felt like the puzzles here were hard (but not too hard) and our host was always making sure we were having a good time. I'll be back to try another room soon!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Mad Hatter" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: Shout! Thank you Kily and Grace for amazingly hosting    The Mad Hatters Tea Party escape room. You made it so much fun! My daughter had a great time. Thank you again for an awesome time

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Mad Hatter" by Ryptic Room Escape in San Francisco
review: What a great activity! Our group of 7 loved solving the puzzles in the Mad Hatter escape room- they were all really clever and challenging. Our game master, Ethan was super fun and enhanced the experience. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Secrets of Wizardry" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: It is great to see a company with all kid-friendly rooms. The game master recommended to start off with this one and then progress to the other rooms. I took my nephew and it is his favorite so far. Secrets of Wizardry had the perfect amount of spookiness that is appropriate for children. The puzzles were perfect for my nephew to figure out on his own. He barely needed my help, I was crying happy tears that day. I can't wait to take him to the other 2 rooms offered here.

room_title: Escape room "The Secrets of Wizardry" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: Ton of fun! My friends and I reserved a spot and checked out "Secrets of Wizardry".  It is technically a "rookie" level, but admittedly, I thought it was pretty hard...or at least very tricky.  This was my second experience ever doing an escape room. I went with my girlfriend and four other friends and we had to find our magic wands (we being wizards and all, cursed by an elf...perhaps a Hungarian elf) and find out how to escape the room in one hour. Nicely decorated with clever puzzles, you can ask for hints using a walkie talkie if you are really stuck. It is a type of experience you talk about long after it is over. Quite fun! Side note: street parking is recommended as there are just a few parking spots in the back.

room_title: Escape room "The Secrets of Wizardry" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: Puzzle rooms are a very popular activity in Los Angeles. You get 60 minutes to solve a bunch of puzzles and find the item you are looking for to get out. I played the pirate & wizard rooms here. The rooms are beautifully decorated to their unique themes. The puzzles are not too difficult, so children would enjoy them too. They are still challenging enough for adults, especially first time puzzle room players!

room_title: Escape room "Edmond's Attic" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: Absolutely phenomenal! We did Edmonds Attic and it was a great time. Creepy, but not scary at all. Best escape room that I've ever done. Ava was a great time and her humor is hysterical.

room_title: Escape room "Edmond's Attic" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: Edmonds attic was so fun, I've been to a few escape rooms and this one stood out. The live actor in it was hilarious. Highly recommend

room_title: Escape room "Edmond's Attic" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: First time doing an escape room.  My friends and I had a great time! Definitely  volunteer when asked.

room_title: Escape room "The Cult of Mithras" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Did the Cult of Mithras. There was a mishap where it kept us on the first puzzle but it wasn't too big of one since our group split up. Had an awesome time and compared to the other two escape rooms we had done already, this one was immersive in the story and had puzzles that confused us as a group. We escaped with 45 seconds to go! Definitely going back to try the other two rooms as well as future rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Cult of Mithras" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: The Cult Of Mithras game is definitely the next level of room escape games. It has a wide variety of puzzles that I have never seen in any other escape game. The game really has a scenario and they motivate you with a nice video on the game scenario before the game. The design of the room, objects, puzzles are all in a harmony with the game scenario. Puzzles were both challenging and entertaining. I was surprised by all the details in the game and room design. We played as a group of 6 and all of us loved the game.

room_title: Escape room "The Cult of Mithras" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Honestly, this was one of the best Escape Rooms we've ever done, and we've done a lot! The puzzles are challenging, thoughtfully done, and incredibly inventive. We did the Mithras room, and we will definitely be coming back here!

room_title: Escape room "The Cult of Mithras" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Came here with my family for the first time, and we all had such a blast. The x-child and the cult of Mithras were awesome! Puzzles were not easy, but not too hard. Definitely make you think outside the box. We broke the record for the cult of Mithras room! Can't wait for the new game and to come check it out!

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Escape" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: We did The Dig and Jurassic Escape. Both werr great! Ive never done these before and was honestly blown away with how smart the puzzles were. The only complaints I have is both were for 10 people ( our party had 5) and it felt like 10 was way too many people. In both rooms it really felt like maybe 4 or 5 clear leaders took the reigns, 3 people helped and at least 2 people were completely useless and either got in the way or stood in the corner probably not enjoying themselves. The rooms really should be capped at 8. Also there should be an option to book a room as adults only or kid friendly. I can see for adults who've paid the money and are really into doing the puzzles, having to let little Timmy unlock the box or push the buttons or have a turn reading clues is just obnoxious and ruins the experience they played for. There should be like Escape the Room Junior for kids (of appropriate age) so that anyone who books that knows what they are signing up for. Likewise, being the only kid in a group where you might mot know everyone in the party is awkward for the kid and really opens up the door to awkwardness if your kid isn't totally well behaved or is competing with random adults to solve a part of the puzzle.

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Escape" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: Went with friends to the Jurassic Escape room. The quality of the room was fantastic. The sound effects, props, etc. I really enjoyed the storyline and found parts to be challenging. We were grouped with 5 other people, as the rooms accommodate groups up to 10. If you prefer to be with people you know, I'd recommend looking into it. The personalities of others you don't know can be overwhelming and squander the experience at times.Our room guide/host would offer assistance at times, but her timing was somewhat frustrating. I understand escaping the room isn't meant to be spoon fed, although timelier guidance would've been appreciated. Overall a fun night out and we'd consider coming back again.

room_title: Escape room "Jurassic Escape" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: We had a really fantastic time doing the Jurassic themed escape the room, the staff was friendly and funny! The room was a bit more simple design wise than I thought it would be, but it was still complex and pretty difficult! We rented the whole room for our party of 8, which while expensive that meant we could work together as a group and not have to worry about having someone we didn't know in the group.I highly suggest it though! It was a lot of fun and really made us think hard!! We were part of the 18% that beat the clock!

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: The Rainbow Dental Center Kapolei Team, had a wonderful and mind blowing experience at the Playground Classroom!!!

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Hands down the BEST escape room I have ever been to! Everything was perfect. From the excellent customer service to the cleanliness of each room, I had the best experience ever! We did the Playground room, which was so fun and nostalgic, but I can't wait to try all the other rooms. Shout out to Oscar and Haylyn for being awesome!10/10 would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: We found The Escape Game because it was right around the corner from our office, but the experience far surpassed the convenience of the location. We held a team-building event for a group of twelve in the Playground room. The game was highly engaging, fun, and just the right amount of challenging. Our group was twelve people, the maximum for the room. I would recommend a slightly smaller group, because in such a large group, people could disengage.Overall we had a great experience and recommend The Escape Game for small team-building events.

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Played Playground a few days ago with some friends and it was such a good experience. This was my first escape room and it was more than what I expected! The room was aesthetically pleasing. It really looked like a classroom which brought back some memories. Our game guide was also really friendly and helpful. Made us feel at home. Great experience and would recommend to other friends for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Playground" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: The "Playground" room was my first escape room ever and it was super fun! All the staff were extremely nice and helpful especially @oscar and @haylyn. The room itself was right on theme with a 4th grade classroom and playground set. I definitely recommend coming here - I know I'll be back to finish the rest of the rooms! Thank you so much for the experience!

room_title: Escape room "Midnight on the Bayou" by Red Lantern Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My group and I escaped "Midnight on the Bayou," and we all had a really great time. The tasks were arranged such that most of us buddied up to tackle different parts, and we all became very engaged in our separate tracks. So even though we all did the same room, each of us had an individual experience.The effects were really well done, the tasks were a good difficulty level, and each one felt like an accomplishment. Our host(/MC) was very entertaining, gave good hints, and really added to the atmosphere of the place. Not to mention, the story was compelling, creepy, and really engaging.If I could magically forget the clues, I'd be more than willing to do it over.

room_title: Escape room "Midnight on the Bayou" by Red Lantern Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was my 5th escape room and definitely my favorite. The plot is very well thought out and immersive, the puzzle chains were challenging without being impossible, the integration of the tech with the room was very innovative and the set was artistically beautiful. The staff was very friendly too. I very highly recommend it if you like escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Midnight on the Bayou" by Red Lantern Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I was fortunate enough to beta test this game. I was in a group of about 8 players, some of them seasoned, some were new. The waiting room is nice and comfy with a few puzzles to bide your time (and one puzzle which I still am bitter over not solving). The bathroom is well kept and spacious. The staff is really nice and clearly put this room together with a ton of love.The room itself was really cool - very different from the others I've played as the game itself had a full story from beginning to end, and everything you did within the room related directly to the story. The room is very spacious to accommodate larger parties. My friend I went with was really jumpy - she was afraid of being scared and the funniest thing about that is that nothing in it was overtly scary. I've already recommended this game to my aunt for my niece's birthday, as she's always wanted to try an escape room and I can guarantee this is a room she'd enjoy and wouldn't be frightened by.There are some really challenging puzzles and tasks in this, and some that are a little more intuitive to solve. At the end of it, our group had succeeded! Yayyy! I really loved the more detailed plot and the love that was put into this escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Z0d1ack K1773r" by Bakersfield Breakout Zone in Bakersfield
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Escape" by Escape Room Adventures in Henagar
review: This was the best escape room I have been in. It was super exciting with multiple rooms . very large game great for our large group. And the price was affordable . They also have a portable room that we booked for our company event this fall.

room_title: Escape room "Diamond Heist" by Escape Mystery Rooms in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Harvest Motel" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: So fun and really scary in The Harvest Motel. So grateful for the hints... we made it out alive!

room_title: Escape room "The Harvest Motel" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: This was our 2nd escape room and it was great! Loved the separation and having to work to get back together. Great puzzles. Loved the theme. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Harvest Motel" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: It was an amazing escape room ! The decoration, the mood, the story and the fact that you are alone for the first minutes of the game until you figure out how to escape from your own room.Scary, funny, entertaining, friendly staff, good story line...If you want to have fun with friends or family, we definitely recommend you to come here !

room_title: Escape room "The Harvest Motel" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: Loved both rooms! Fun, exciting, a little scary and overall a great time! I recommend both. But if you can only do one, I'd choose Harvest Motel.

room_title: Escape room "The Harvest Motel" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: Fist time ever doing an escape room. Can't say enough how much fun it was. Went in a group of 8 for an early bday celebration for my sister. The staff was super friendly helpful and made our visit fun. Definitely looking forward to our next visit.

room_title: Escape room "Carn-EVIL" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: It was my 4th time there and for my brothers birthday I decided to take him. My mom had always wanted to go so that was the plan. We did the carn-evil room!! We had a blast!!! The staff was great,we got there early and they got us right in!! I want to thank your staff and the great experience and we will be back!!!

room_title: Escape room "Carn-EVIL" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We had a great time doing the Carn-evil room with some friends. It was fun, creepy and challenging. We can't wait to go back and try the other rooms as well. The facility is very nice and the staff was great.

room_title: Escape room "Carn-EVIL" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: We did the carni-evil room last night and it was awesome! Such a different experience than we expected. Thanks for a great time! We might come back before we leave town.

room_title: Escape room "Science" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: We’ve done a couple escape rooms before but REALLY had a different experience here. They totally take the escape room experience to the extreme. The staff was also very helpful in assisting us while trying to get a last minute booking in! We’ll certainly be back!

room_title: Escape room "Science" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: I had played a few rooms in Las Vegas so when we went out to San Diego for the Baked festival, we decided to stop here in our spare time. This room was really cool. It is challenging and I would say that you need at least 4-8 people in order to be successful. I liked the puzzles and the suspense. I would definitely come back here.

room_title: Escape room "Science" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: So much fun! We thought we had this one in the bag, but we were quickly reminded that we weren't as good as we thought. This room was challenging, but perfect for 6 people. We made it out with a few seconds to spare! This escape room was one of the nicer I've seen. The store location is in the middle of Hillcrest, the lobby is decorated so nicely and everything was in good quality. The staff was fun as well. We liked it so much that we stayed and played another room! Thank you, Lockdown!

room_title: Escape room "Science" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: My husband and a few friends had time this Sunday and we tried out two of the room here. The Science room was definitely challenging. There is a lot of math involved and a LOT more 3-5 number combo locks and some red herrings. The answers to those also involve more math. Thankfully, you get white boards to help keep them straight. The puzzles felt more there to provide a challenge than fitting well in the narrative. Some of the puzzles were clever and unique though and not all are math ones. Overall we liked and had a lot of fun.

room_title: Escape room "Science" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: This is the first room we failed (out of ~13)... We were just one puzzle away. I would recommend doing this room with 3-4 people. Before we even started, they warned us that this room is their most difficult one and they recommend 4 people and that we start off with 6 hints (as opposed to 3 and 4).The moment we stepped into the room, we were overwhelmed by the sight of a surplus of puzzles. We messed up on one of the first puzzles and were stuck on it for very long and the hints we were initially given did not help us solve the actual issue we had until way later. Near the end, we blasted through the remaining puzzles but it wasn't enough to make up for the time we wasted with the initial puzzle. They do provide white boards with working board pens but it's still difficult to remember different qualities, move to a different location, solve the puzzle, then move to a different location to actually open a lock. The room just felt like a room filled with a bunch of harder puzzles with no real story that connects the puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Science" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: We were on a road trip when we saw the sign and decided to stop by. This was our first time ever escaping a room, and Steven made it that much more fun! He explained the concept and helped us whenever we got stuck. Excellent room design and well thought out puzzles. Glad we stopped by!

room_title: Escape room "Science" by Lockdown Escape Rooms in San Diego
review: We had a great tome here. Did the Science room first, was challenging and we barely escaped. We'll be back for the Voodoo room! The staff was welcoming and great. Would recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Mosi's Curse" by Escape This in Hesperia
review: This was a great room.  The puzzles were challenging and fun.  There were also some cool surprises to be found.  My only complaint with the experience was being paired in the room with strangers.  It makes the experience less enjoyable when you are solving puzzles with people you don't know and when their style of working is different than yours.  They had been drinking and were loud and cursing a bit, to each their own,  just not what I enjoy being around. Overall the experience was good, but it would have been so much better had it just been our group alone in there.

room_title: Escape room "Mosi's Curse" by Escape This in Hesperia
review: Absolutely great experience. Very challenging for everyone. Focus on everything from the second you walk through the door!

room_title: Escape room "Mosi's Curse" by Escape This in Hesperia
review: This was a great experience! All boys age 13-17 had a blast. The hour goes by so fast too. We’ll be back when the new room is ready!

room_title: Escape room "Taken" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Had a great experience, didn't solve Taken but got to the last puzzle in the final room. It was a blast with all the puzzles and the time pressure our game master was helpful but didn't give us more than what kept the experience moving and exciting. Totally recommend this to anyone trying to have a unique and fun time.

room_title: Escape room "Taken" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: This place is awesome if you're looking for something to do with a group of friends or family! I went here for a birthday celebration/ cousin bonding and we escaped the "Taken" room! It was really fun/challenging and probably one of the best escape rooms I've done thus far. Shoutout to the game master, Malcom, for being so helpful and fun. Definitely excited to come back :)

room_title: Escape room "Taken" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Super fun place! I went with my cousins and did the Taken room, and it was definitely fun & challenging! Shoutout to Malcom, he was really helpful & professional and made our experience great! Looking forward in doing the other rooms too

room_title: Escape room "Speakeasy Mobster's Hideout" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: This was a great family event. This challenged every one of us and everyone needed to participate in order to escape. And even though after 60 minutes we didn't escape, we had a blast and will do it again soon

room_title: Escape room "Speakeasy Mobster's Hideout" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: Last minute reservation for a Monday night and we had a blast. We did not escape but we did only have 3 people...so close.The staff was friendly, took our picture and emailed immediately to us.Highly recommend this as an hour of fun with family and friends then you can take advantage of the proximity to the other shopping, restaurants and bowling alley in the same parking lot.

room_title: Escape room "Speakeasy Mobster's Hideout" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: First time trying an escape room and it was a lot of fun. It had the right level of difficulty, and the staff was very organized and polite. I would definitely go back and try other rooms at Escape Room 101.

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition Ransom" by Boss-Play Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: I had not been to any Escape Rooms prior to this one, and had no idea what to expect. The theme was fun and the room fit the theme very well. The puzzles were challenging but do-able with the "right" people! I was impressed with how the puzzles worked and the electronics of the room. Super fun and we are already looking forward to when Boss-Play has a 2nd room.

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition Ransom" by Boss-Play Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: Went here in a group of 4 and was blown away by the quality of the entire experience. So many puzzles, all of which make perfect sense with the theme.You will be immersed in the situation as you race to beat the clock. My team did succeed although we had a few challenges that almost beat us.Foe the price there is really no better entertainment. Way better than seeing a movie as my friends spent the rest of the day talking about the experience.

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition Ransom" by Boss-Play Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: My friends and I had a blast escaping the room from Boss Play! We went a couple of weeks ago and were all really impressed with the quality of the room. I had done one other "escape room" before at a different company but was very disappointed that it was just a boring room with random puzzles scattered about. Boss Play's room actually felt like a real room we had to escape with thoughtful puzzles that fit the theme. There were also a few surprises that blew my mind when we discovered them. I would highly recommend choosing Boss Play if you ever want to do an escape room.

room_title: Escape room "The Chocolate Factory" by Boss-Play Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: Having done more than 15 rooms, all of which with my cousins, I would say that Boss Play is one of the more impressive designed rooms. I was fortunate to try their new Chocolate Factory (already did their Prohibition room), and it was one of the most creative themed rooms I have seen.Jeremy, the owner, has done something that few escape room owners can say, which is that he built his rooms using no locks and keys. Therefore, you aren't looking for padlocks or combination locks to open, only to find another locked box. The electronics he uses for opening doors, solving riddles and special effects are second to none.Anyone in North County who hasn't done an escape room before, come to Boss Play first and try their Chocolate Factory room. It will set the standard to which you will compare all other future escape rooms you go to. For those who have already done escape rooms, Boss play is worth the trip.

room_title: Escape room "The Chocolate Factory" by Boss-Play Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: We have done both Prohibition and the Willy Wonka rooms and loved both! I had a preference for the Willy Wonka one definitely. Great puzzles and design. Easy to find, easy parking. Very friendly! There is a cabinet to lock your purse in if needed and it even has phone chargers.

room_title: Escape room "The Chocolate Factory" by Boss-Play Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: Second time playing at Boss-Play, and it was just as wonderful as the first time. The game masters are friendly and helpful and help you get into the spirit of the room! They even recommended other escape rooms to us at the end.

room_title: Escape room "The Chocolate Factory" by Boss-Play Escape Rooms in Oceanside
review: It was fun! I highly recommend the Willy Wonka room.

room_title: Escape room "Bonnie and Clyde’s Great Getaway" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My wife and I do a lot of escape rooms and we had a lot of fun here! We did both the Bonnie and Clyde room and Houdini's Hideout with just the 2 of us, and both were entertaining. The Houdini room was quite challenging, we escaped with just under 2 minutes left. The staff here is very friendly, and this place is just going to get better as they add more rooms, we are definitely coming back to do the Orient Express room. Also, very easy street parking, and we were treated to some magic from one of the GMs!

room_title: Escape room "Bonnie and Clyde’s Great Getaway" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Really happy that this place opened - especially that it's down the street from my house. My boyfriend and I love doing rooms just to kill time, we booked the Bonnie and Clyde room and it was great! Puzzles were fun, original and creative. The staff and owner were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Bonnie and Clyde’s Great Getaway" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Went here on a Saturday with my girlfriend. This was our first ever Escape Room experience and it was amazing! We did the Bonnie and Clyde room and it was super fun. Really thought-provoking and challenging. The staff was really friendly as well. We will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 4: The Courtyard" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: Wow! We just tried The Courtyard. It's an amazing game. So well done. The puzzles are great. The actor was superb. We loved every second.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 4: The Courtyard" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: WE DIED.No seriously, we did die.The Courtyard is different. Extremely different and more cumbersome with the clues and puzzles that it requires for you to solve.All in all SUPER INTERESTING!!! Gonna clear my head and try to solve this all again in a few months!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 4: The Courtyard" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: Had such a great experience at the Courtyard! My team and I definitely had the best experience here. Dani or "Quinn" is SO good , she plays the live actor. So awesome overall had a great time and we'll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Grandma's Masterplan" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: 60Out Escape rooms are A1! Very immersive, clever puzzles and the staff are super accommodating - specially VICTORIA! She was a dope game master! All the rooms in this location are really fun but Grandma's Master Plan was my favorite! 6/5!

room_title: Escape room "Grandma's Masterplan" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This is in my top five rooms. It is a 75-minute room because there is quite a lot to do. Unless you are a seasoned vet of escape rooms, this is a room you need a bigger group for, for sure, because there's just way too much stuff to do for two people. I went with a group of five and had an excellent time. The items you find might not be useful right when you find them but everything has a place in the story, I promise! They put a lot of thought into the storyline and the room definitely corresponds with the narrative they give. I found myself thinking, "Granny is such a hoot!" The end of this room is really fun.

room_title: Escape room "Grandma's Masterplan" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did Grandma's Master Plan and unfortunately didn't escape. It was very challenging, but so much fun. They did a really good job with making you feel like you were PART of the story.

room_title: Escape room "Grandma's Masterplan" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I just recently went here with coworkers (6 of us total) and we successfully escaped Grandma's Master Plan although it was very challenging! Two of us had done escape rooms before but the rest were all new. Everyone LOVED the experience and we are already talking about doing another one. The puzzles went well with the theme and the decor was great.

room_title: Escape room "Grandma's Masterplan" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Fantastic rooms! They are a little expensive compared to some of the other rooms in LA but absolutely worth it, no question. The spaces are nice, just make sure you arrive early to find parking. The people that assist you are also all friendly and helpful.

room_title: Escape room "Grandma's Masterplan" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've been to 16 escape all in LA and 60 out is the most fun I've done 5 rooms with the outbreak , grandmas master plan , wizards work shop casino and senator Payne all amazing my favorite was grandmas master plan and the game master Tony Tommy Tyler Taylor all cool people makes game more fun when u have a knowledgeable game master will definitely be coming back for the rest !!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Principal's Office" by Red Door Escapes in Little Rock
review: This was our first escape room and it was SO much fun! The time and effort that the owners put into making the room themselves really shows with the unique clues and layout. We can't wait for the next room to open and will be back as soon as it does!!

room_title: Escape room "Cursed Crypt" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: Cursed Crypt, my 3rd room at Escape Hotel, is a solid showing from a severely under-rated location.  Formerly the Tomb Raider room which displaced Sanatorium, your group is given the challenge of finding the final piece to an ancient artifact.  You start in a mausoleum that could have been straight out of the film itself.  The transitions between rooms was a little odd; mausoleum to a study to a boat to a temple but the production of those "roomscapes" was up there with the best.  Blaring sirens, wind and rain, lightning and thunder, the hum of the boats engine, the whole experience was flooded with immersive lights and sounds.  There was moderate amount of scavenging and tasking but overall, the puzzles were engaging and well tied to the theme.  The hosts in the lobby were friendly and professional but this room in particular, though, suffers from a lack of support.  For as much as these rooms cost, there really is no excuse for inattentive GMs.  Hints were generally "keep doing what you're doing", "look harder", or for something we had already finished.  And we escaped into an empty corridor with no GM to greet us.  Combined with the poor quality walkie-talkies and loud sounds I mentioned earlier made communication that much more frustrating.  But hint system and GMs aside, Cursed Crypt still comes out strong and ranks 42nd out of 129 rooms I've done so far.  Highly recommended for fans of deeply immersive rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Cursed Crypt" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: I've been here so many times and i love coming every single time! The first time I came, I walked in pleasantly surprised by just the lobby because of how it was decorated. It's meant to give you the creeps and they do a great job of doing that from the start. All of the employees are so funny too! You can tell they have a lot of fun with their job and they're not afraid to joke around with guests. I decided to bring some friends who were still pretty new to escape rooms and when they went to the restroom, someone went over the intercom whispering their names (and duh I loved that). Out of the rooms they have, I've done Cocaine, Circus, Escape Room Movie, Slaughtered, Cursed Crypt, and Espionage. All of them did a great job of making the group feel immersed and it was always a challenge. I'm absolutely coming back to try and finish the rest and whatever else they come out with!!

room_title: Escape room "Cursed Crypt" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: My bf and I are escape room enthusiasts and Escape Hotel did not disappoint. Staff was in character from the moment we arrived which was entertaining. Did two rooms, "Slaughter" and "Cursed Crypt" and both were very well put together; from puzzles, engineering to room design. Wish we had time to do the others! Thanks for your help, Jose! You were awesome.

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Challenge" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: We did the DaVinci room and it was so much fun! Just challenging enough to make it through and the props were so cool (there was a complete in-awe moment, you'll know it when you see it!). I've done 4 escape rooms before and this one is in the top 2. I'll definitely be back for more.

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Challenge" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: The Da Vinci room was a super fun room with lots of interesting puzzles and a great theme. I'd definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Challenge" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: My friends and I did the Da Vinci Challenge today and it was a great experience. It was the first escape room for 4 out of 6 of us, and we managed to escape in 39 minutes.Our host was wonderful. The production value was top notch - some of the puzzles were engineered brilliantly. A couple of things were a little hard to trigger but we got there eventually - you just have to be very specific with placements!Nothing in there felt 'cheap', and it was certainly challenging. We all enjoyed ourselves and I really want to come back to do The Bloody Elbow!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Challenge" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Terrific escape room! We did the DaVinci room and it was really outstanding. I've done at least 20 escape rooms and this was one of the best-themed rooms that I've done. From the moment you walk in, they give you costumes to wear to get in the spirit of the period.Then, when you enter the escape room itself, you are immediately transported to another time and place. The escape room is really well-designed to match the theme, and the puzzles are also related to the theme.This is not a simple "find the key" and unlock the lock room. You actually have to use your brain for some of these puzzles. And the unique part of this room is that you're separated from half of your team to start (and you have to work with them to find a way to get together and complete the challenge.Well done! I highly recommend this room!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Challenge" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: We had a blast doing DaVinci's Challenge at Quest Room. A good range of puzzles and the production quality was top-notch. HIGHLY recommend. Plus a big thanks to Ben for being such a great host!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: I had a Good times on Monday March 18.2019 came with my coworkers a group of ladies we had marvableous time.a Great places for family,friends and coworkers to go

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: We had a great time doing Hostage today, Maggie was a great master. 52.25 we broke out.

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: My group enjoyed the Hostage room! Loads of fun! Will definitely be back to try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Honestly, I was ready to do another one immediately. "Hostage" was a great room and Harley was an awesome game master. He let us fail, but was able to help at key times so that we still made it out.

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: We did Hostage but unfortunately didn't escape in time. It was a lot of fun though. There were 4 in our party and we got paired with 2 other couples. We all worked well together and had a great time trying to figure out the clues. My tip...don't overthink!

room_title: Escape room "Hostage" by Breakout Games - Montgomery in Montgomery
review: Booked the hostage game for my husband's birthday and invited three other couples... We had a blast! Our gamemaster, Parker, was fabulous!

room_title: Escape room "Return of the Paranormal Investigator" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: First off, I want to thank the staff for accommodating us without a reservation! This was our first escape room, and we had a blast! We wanted to start another room immediately after finishing The Return of The Paranormal Investigator. So... needless to say, my friends & I will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Return of the Paranormal Investigator" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: If you are looking for a fun, out-of-the-ordinary experience that is perfect for a family, work group, church, fraternity or sorority, ANY group that would have fun working together, Central Arkansas Escape Room is it! The problems were inventive and worked together well in reaching the final solution (Very clever writing!) We already have plans to bring another family group back at Christmas and this has got us anxious for the Escape Room's next story/escape in the spring!

room_title: Escape room "Tesla’s Secret" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Lots of fun. Staff was great and helpful. Room was challenging and interesting. I went with my grandson and it was fine; probably even more fun with three or four people.

room_title: Escape room "Tesla’s Secret" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I love this Escape room! It was my second time there and can’t wait to go explore the third room soon! Beautifully staged room, game is so much fun and all employees very helpful. Definitely go

room_title: Escape room "Tesla’s Secret" by Architect Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: It was my first time going to an escape room and it was awesome so much fun.

room_title: Escape room "Out of Order" by Brain Busters Escape Rooms in Daleville
review: Had an awesome time playing Out of Order last night. The most interactive escape room we've done. Staff were wonderful and we had fun enjoying some magic tricks after we escaped the room.

room_title: Escape room "Cartel: DEA Undercover" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Fantastic staff. Easily the best production value in an escape room I've ever seen. Definitely worth your time and money!

room_title: Escape room "Cartel: DEA Undercover" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Game Master J was awesome! Thanks for being patient with us :) Tip: follow the instructions they give you at the beginning!

room_title: Escape room "Cartel: DEA Undercover" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Jacob is THE BEST GAME MASTER EVER! It was my first time doing an escape room and I did it with 5 of my friends on a Sunday afternoon for my friend's bday. We walked into a room after being introduced to the problem we'd have to solve, and at first I was surprised because there was not much in the room, but there ended up being so many puzzles! It made me super hyped after we got a clue and got to go to the other rooms. Would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape the Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Awesome family time fun. Angie was so helpful with hints but not giving it all away. Our family of 5 all enjoyed themselves which is difficult with a 6, 9, and 13.

room_title: Escape room "Western Bank Heist" by Escape the Room LA in Los Angeles
review: We walked in without a reservation, and were able to join another group of 3. 5 seemed like the perfect amount of people for the western room! The design was beautiful, and all of the clues flowed together so nicely. It was definitely a challenging room, but with all participants having previous escape room experience, we managed to get out with 15 minutes to spare! Highly recommended, and cannot wait to try more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist 2.0" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Nathan is amazing! We made a last minute booking and he stayed overtime just so we can get the chance to do the Bank Heist. Which is an amazing escape room btw! Highly recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist 2.0" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We decided to stop in on our honeymoon and check out Exodus. On the drive over we were nervous and not sure what to expect. When we arrived we signed our waiver and we're locked up in our room. With teamwork and focusing on each others strengths we were able to escape with just 5 mins to spare. We had an incredible time and are definitely coming back to visit and try the other rooms! Thank you for making our honeymoon unique and unforgettable!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist 2.0" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Bank Heist in Rowland Heights was a blast! Connor & Nathan were awesome hosts and we can't wait to try the other rooms. It was just the right amount of difficulty for a group of 3-6. We definitely recommend this experience. So much fun!!!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: We escaped from the Basement. Twelve of us. It was exhilarating. We had previously done the Boiler Room. Even though we missed escaping it was still great fun (We subsequently went back and conquered it). The Boiler Room puzzles are sequential; you have to solve puzzle 1 to get to 2 ... The Basement is more of a free-for-all. We went as six couples who were friends; I think it might not be as fun to do with strangers. Not that there's anything wrong with strangers. A tip that we figured out after the fact: Designate one person to be the master of all the clues, etc. That way everything will be kept track of and there won't be a lot of redundant effort. Good luck!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: The Basement was my first ever escape room experience, and I can say it was one of the most amazing things I have ever experienced let alone in Los Angeles.They have made an amazing back story and theme for the entire attraction. My group tried both of the rooms they offer - the Basement and the Boiler Room. We failed both but came within seconds of solving the Boiler Room! The rooms are definitely far from an easy ride which just adds to their attraction. As of writing they are opening a third room next month which will be their longest yet - I am so excited to try it out next time I go to LA!The atmosphere, puzzles and employees make this an unmissable thing to do - you won't be disappointed no matter what kind of person you are. The whole thing is extremely innovative and for replay value they even have three different versions of the Basement which changes things up enough to essentially make it a new game. When they open the third room this means that you could easily visit at least 5 times, and I am sure they will look into adding different versions of the Boiler Room and third room in the future as long as they show continued popularity.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: We played their new room...and it is amazing...like you are really in the movie...still under impression after one day... Just a note, if you are a scary person this might not be the game for you... Of cours recomended :)

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: I've been in a few escape rooms now and I always have fun. The Basement was probably the most atmospheric room I've been in and I'll definitely be going back to do the Boiler Room and the Study.The price is a little high at $35 for 45 minutes but as a one off experience I can accept that. The one issue I had is that I booked with a group of 4 but we were then put in with another group of 6, without being told. I understand the company want to maximize their profit but I feel the more people in the room, the less you each experience and so I would have liked to have been notified before hand.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: This is one of the most unique, awesome experiences ever!!! You really feel like you are on the set of a creepy movie. It is fun if you go with a group of your friends and you reserve all the spots. I went to the Basement- haven't tried the Boiler Room yet, that is next !!!They have a safe spot where you can leave your keys, phone and purse which is nice. Good luck !! My group escaped with only 8 minutes left on the clock ! Worth the money.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: Amazing experience...will definitely be back to try it again! We failed to escape the basement but we are determined to not end up in Edward Tandy's freezer again! A lot of thought and detail went into making this experience very realistic. The props, art work and noises really make you feel like your trapped in a mad man's basement. I brought my gf, who is a big horror movie fan, for her bday and she loved it! She spent the first five minutes of the experience checking out how well the room was decorated. I had to remind her that we were on a time limit and had to start looking for clues to get out. If you haven't tried it yet, I definitely recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 1: The Basement" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: Four of us signed up for the Basement ( not ready for the Boiler) and it definitely was an amazing experience!!! It was worth every dollar and I am definitely going back to try to make it out alive.It was planned out really well and I'm still not over it!!

room_title: Escape room "The Playbook" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: Lots of fun! The young man working the desk was engaging and made the experience great. We did the Playbook with two 12-year-olds. Challenging but fun.

room_title: Escape room "The Playbook" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: First time ever trying one of these. We found Saban's Playbook! More fun than I even expected! We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Playbook" by Escape Tuscaloosa in Tuscaloosa
review: Escape Tuscaloosa is fun and challenging! It is very organized and the staff is GREAT! Great activity for small groups! We found the Playbook!

room_title: Escape room "Room 751" by The Locked Inn in Grover Beach
review: We had such a good time! The whole experience was great. Looking forward to your next room!

room_title: Escape room "Room 751" by The Locked Inn in Grover Beach
review: This is the best escape room we've tried! So much fun. Definitely recommend for team building!

room_title: Escape room "Room 751" by The Locked Inn in Grover Beach
review: My fiancé and I were invited to Locked Inn by friends of ours who have been before. It was absolutely amazing!! I was blown away by all of the intricate details, atmosphere, and the puzzles themselves. 100% will recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Room 751" by The Locked Inn in Grover Beach
review: We loved our experience! Had so much fun! Can't wait to do another! Would recommend this to all my friends and family! Even if you are unsure, take the leap. It's worth it!

room_title: Escape room "Room 751" by The Locked Inn in Grover Beach
review: This was such a blast! I recommend this place... Great staff. It was definitely a bonding experience, working together and communicating... I can't wait until they have more rooms open!

room_title: Escape room "The Slammer!" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Great Redemption" by Famous Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Great attraction! They really exceeded every expectation we had. Really great and surprising. Highly recommended for groups!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Redemption" by Famous Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Fun funny smartLove it!!!! Highly recommend!! You guys have to try

room_title: Escape room "The Great Redemption" by Famous Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Had so much fun finding clues and solving puzzle made it it right on time !!! Great room great experience wish I could do it again !!!:)

room_title: Escape room "The Great Redemption" by Famous Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: We absolutely loved it. Great for a date, ice breaker and teams learning to work together. So much fun. We haven't laughed and smiled so much in a long time. Awesome! Would love to do it again. Must open/find more of these.

room_title: Escape room "The Great Redemption" by Famous Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: We had so much fun at The Great Redemption Escape Room, Van Nuys! We were able to escape our cell by solving difficult riddles and by unlocking many locks to find 1 million dollars to clear our name and escape our room! From locks, to passwords, to blacklights, and special cameras... The Great Redemption is a definite place to go!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Redemption" by Famous Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: A very clever room with several twists on puzzles. Good use of red herrings. Enough puzzles to keep a group of six busy. Wish there were a few more as we escaped with about 10 min to spare. I enjoy getting to the last few minutes with the adrenaline pumping. Would be interested on returning if they had additional rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Pacific Rim: Shatterdome Defenders" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: We were able to find an open game slot the day of for a group of 6, awesome.  We did Pacific Rim, very cool!!  I personally think it helps to have seen the movie so you get the objective and some of the team requirements (like drifting).  Our group was 6 adults, 4 kids (10-13).  This was my second escape room, and I thought it was a really hard one.  There are a lot of mental puzzles, my kids had a hard time deciphering those.  They did have some physical challenges they could do, but they were out matched with this game, in my opinion.  They advised no less than 13 and I believe that is good advice.  Our MC was perfect, he helped just enough to keep it fun (versus really frustrating) but didn't give anything away, it was still a lot of hard work!  We didn't save the world, but our group still had a really great time!

room_title: Escape room "Pacific Rim: Shatterdome Defenders" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: Awesome first escape room experience! We did the Pacific Rim themed one and you definitely don't need to have seen the movie to participate. We didn't escape but we got really close. If we had about 15 more minutes we would've been okay but I'd say that's a win for the majority of our group being inexperienced with escape rooms. I don't want to spoil any of the layout or specifics but staff was super accommodating and helpful. Definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Pacific Rim: Shatterdome Defenders" by Real Escape Game in San Francisco
review: Looking for a fun activity to do as a family with our two teenage kids (13 & 16), we thought we'd give this a try. We chose the Pacific Rim game as it had an element of technology for our digital natives. It was lots of fun and time flew by. Our game host let us sweat just the right amount, but helped us along the way with a few clues when needed. Not only was it lots of fun and kept us on our toes the whole time, but it was really nice to see the family come together, each one taking on different roles naturally. It gave for a fun conversation afterward too on what we learned and how we can do things differently when we try another one, because we definitely will.

room_title: Escape room "The Collector" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: My friends wanted to do a girls night here. When you book the room, you have the option of booking it individually for that room.
