When we arrived, I guess someone else also booked the room, so he joined our girls night. lol. So there was a total of 5 of us. We ended up doing the Collector room. We were definitely advised that it was a very difficult room, which they were definitely right about that. You have to figure out a lot of combinations to open some locks. There is also some math involved, so bring someone who is good at math. I think it was a fun experience, the only thing I didn't like is if you ask for a clue then they take some time off of your clock. I've been to two other Escape rooms and I've never heard of that. They give you pretty good hints, so I don't think you'll need the clues, however we still did. lol. We were able to make it out with 4 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "The Collector" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This is the first time we have been to this particular escape room, and we chose to do The Collector room. It was definitely a challenging one, but it was worth trying to do. I've been to other escape rooms, and this one is a little different when it comes to hints. The first hint will cost you 1 minute, the 2nd one 3 minutes, and the third one 5 minutes. They had a television in the room with the timer, and this particular room had some higher-tech type puzzles. We had a good time there and would definitely go back to try the other rooms. Thanks to the staff for your enthusiasm and professionalism.

room_title: Escape room "The Collector" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We just went to this escape room with 4 people in our group and it was amazing! We went to other escape rooms as well but this one was our favorite. We tried The Collector. I would definitely recommend going with a bigger group because this was the hardest room! We were the first group to try this room(literally finished the room two minutes before we showed up) and although we did not make it, the two guys running the room were very helpful with guiding us. I would 10/10 recommend this place. They are very accommodating and the staff was super friendly!

room_title: Escape room "Doggy Dog World" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: I am finally getting around to reviewing this room - I just had to! My husband and I have done about 50 rooms and Doggy Dog World is our favorite so far. At first, we were concerned that it would be too easy (the pictures make it seem a bit kid-oriented). But, I'm glad I didn't let that stop us from checking it out. We had a blast! The puzzles are challenging but not frustratingly so and the overall concept is so unique and creative, we wish there were a ton more like it. If you're looking for a great room, try this one - you won't be disappointed!

room_title: Escape room "Doggy Dog World" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: Did the Doggy Room for my husbands birthday and what a treat it was! So much fun and a great idea for date night! The puzzles were super smart too !

room_title: Escape room "Doggy Dog World" by Level Games in Los Angeles
review: I just heard that Doggy Dog World will only be around a few more months and could close in summer (2019). This is a wonderful room - lots of fun and really well done. If you haven't done it, I recommend making time to play before the room closes.

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: I tried 'The Seance' with my co-workers. The room was fun! A creepy overall feel to the room but it was not too scary. I think a team of 4-5 people is good for this room. Overall it was a blast!

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: I loved the Seance room! It was eerie and creepy but exciting! I remember playing The Study before it retired and the games get better and better! There's so much excitement and I definitely want to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: Great local escape room offering a variety of escape experiences. We played at maximum capacity in one of their scenarios, "The Seance." Even with six people, it did not feel crowded or simple.The owner was very kind and explained the rules well while keeping the tone lighthearted. I will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: We had 12 people, so we split into 2 teams. The room we did was Séance. I can say it's a hard room, with 28% success rate per our host. My team finished the room and we beat our friends. It was challenging, but fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: I tried 'The Seance' with my coworkers. I really liked that they have 2 identical rooms so you can face off with another team. The room was fun! A creepy overall feel to the room but it was not 'scary'. I think a team of 4-5 people is good for this room. Overall it was a blast!!

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: Loved it! So much fun! Great team building experience with co-workers! I'll go back again with friends. Tried the seance room & I say tried because we didn't escape! Very challenging but so fun! Try it you'll love it!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Excido Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Our family team of 6 ranged in ages from 92 to 14!  Yes, we escaped from the CABIN!!!  Everyone contributed; we were down to the last minute.  What fun, couldn't find a better experience that includes all ages.  It does help if you have done one of these escape rooms before, however, not necessary.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Excido Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: First time with this company. There were 6 of us: age range 32 to 13 years old. We did The Cabin. Tons of great creative puzzles. We escaped with 6 minutes to spare. Love how they have a countdown timer. Room has a 30% escape rate, so we basically rocked it. We will definitely return to try the other rooms they offer.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Excido Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This place was a lot of fun! We entered the Excido and the guy working was very nice, explained everything to us very well. There were six of us locked in a room, trying to beat the clock to get out of the cabin. The place is clean and organized. He gave us a radio for us to communicate with him, you can receive a hint. We used that up pretty quick.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Office" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: What a great experience for our first escape room! I would definitely recommend going, especially the Doctor's Office room!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Office" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: It was our first time going. My fiance and I enjoyed ourselves, it was so amazing. Excited to go back again

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Office" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: It was just my friend and me in the Dr. Office. It was challenging but definitely fun! We almost made it out too. It had a great spooky vibe. Thank you again to the people who were working there today - ya'll were super accommodating. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Office" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: Wow! We had a blast. This was my 2nd Escape Room ever and our group loved it. It was very immersive and creepy. We did the Doctors Room and made it out with just seconds to spare. Our game master was so sweet and I will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Office" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: Just did the Doctor's Office and it was such an amazing experience! Great customer service, the story and the entire experience were amazing. This is by far the best escape room I have done yet, it literally has your blood pumping the entire time. Rachel the gamemaster was great. Def will be recommending this to all of my friends and family!

room_title: Escape room "Kidnapped" by Open Door Escape Games in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Great Eureka Springs Bank Heist" by Escape Room 13 in Eureka Springs
review: Great fun for the entire family! Everyone was involved and had a great time! Very good storyline based on an actual event. We all thoroughly enjoyed it and the hour flew by! Highly recommend! Raven welcomed us and went above and beyond to ensure we had an enjoyable experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Eureka Springs Bank Heist" by Escape Room 13 in Eureka Springs
review: Had a blast definitely the best escape room I have done. The owner is for sure part of why it is so great. If you haven't tried it yet what are you waiting for go check it out. Thanks for the great memory.

room_title: Escape room "The Great Eureka Springs Bank Heist" by Escape Room 13 in Eureka Springs
review: This is a top-notch escape room. Great clues and great decor! It totally immersed you in the story! Highly recommend to newcomers and veterans escapees!

room_title: Escape room "The Great Eureka Springs Bank Heist" by Escape Room 13 in Eureka Springs
review: Very well put together escape room. We had an absolute blast. Looking forward to doing it again next time we are in town.

room_title: Escape room "The Great Eureka Springs Bank Heist" by Escape Room 13 in Eureka Springs
review: Have done other escape rooms and this one in Eureka Springs is top notch. Would recommend this game room to anyone looking for a fun time with friends or family.

room_title: Escape room "The Cranial Carnival" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: This was my first escape room and it was awesome! Great team-building exercise. Keep it up guys! Can't wait to do another one!

room_title: Escape room "The Cranial Carnival" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: The Cranial CarnivalBrought a large group of co-workers out to Escapedom, so large that we had to split up and did all 3 of their rooms.  My group went through Cranial Carnival so this review will be about that room specifically.  The idea is that you have to enter a boy's mind and lock up bad memories that have traumatized him and put him into a coma.  Not the most believable of premises but fine.  I'll roll with it.After explaining the backstory, the GM walked us to the "brain" door and in we went.  I thought the entrance into the room was a little disappointing and could have been much more creative an in-line with the story (traveling down a dark passage way, a red slide), really anything more than just a doorway.   The production in the first room was decent but really felt like a square room filled with puzzles.  Other than the occasional pink squiggles on the wall, there was nothing really organic about it.  With a couple of exceptions, the puzzles seemed to mirror the memories that the boy had experienced at the circus.  A healthy dose of scavenging kicked off the room and we wasted time looking through the non-linear puzzles that are unsolvable until you finish the scavenger hunt.  One magnet/coin maze was a difficult frustrating time sync and we had some tech issues with an 8-sided polyhedron puzzle and one "locked" door was open.  That was room 1.  Room 2 was a mixed bag of some clever puzzles, some not so clever puzzles (light clock), and some downright frustrating tasks (fishing).  In hindsight, it was the tech issues that did us in and we came up about 2 minutes short of escaping.  Not the best, not the worst room, I've done and comes in at #112 out of 168 rooms I've done to date.

room_title: Escape room "The Cranial Carnival" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: Just successfully escaped from Cranial Carnival, the newest of Escapedom’s rooms. Like their first two rooms, production quality was great, the puzzles were unique, and the puzzles weren’t all linear so it was ideal for our large group of eleven. A lot of great “aha” moments. Chase was a great game master! Definitely recommend this room to newbies as well as experienced players. Thanks for another awesome room, Escapedom! 😊

room_title: Escape room "Doll House" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: I took 5 12-13 year olds with me to do the dollhouse room last night. We all had so much fun! This room was really well done and we will be back to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Doll House" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: My friends and I love Mesa Escape Room! We have escaped a lot of rooms and our favorites were Dollhouse, Carnevil, and Frosty! Big part of why those were favorites was our game master Kesiah who is the absolute best! Can’t wait to escape again!

room_title: Escape room "TEG Unlocked: The Heist - Vol. 1: Chasing Hahn [DIGITAL]" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: None

room_title: Escape room "CSI: Gulf Shores" by XIT Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: Staff and owner are very friendly. Was a lot of fun for us. We did the CSI one and escaped!!! Would definitely go back.

room_title: Escape room "CSI: Gulf Shores" by XIT Escape Room in Orange Beach
review: First time ever doing an escape room and loved loved loved it. We did the csi room and we were so close to issuing a warrant! But, the suspect Slipped right thru our fingers! We are definitely going to come back and try movie night when it opens.Everyone was so nice and very helpful!

room_title: Escape room "Human Xperiment" by Xcape House in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The School of Sorcery" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: An amazing experience, great little puzzle games and a good setup.  Any Potter fun would love this scenario.  Exit game is amazing for this great experience

room_title: Escape room "The School of Sorcery" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: For any escape room enthusiasts, would absolutely not recommend. Terribly produced and unenthusiastic puzzles, cringe worthy videos. Please stay away

room_title: Escape room "The School of Sorcery" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: My work team had a blast doing this! Highly recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "The School of Sorcery" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: The people who work there are SO FRIENDLY! And I was super impressed by the game exhibits! I had A LOT of fun! I would definitely go again.

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist's Laboratory" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: We did the Alchemist's Lab about a month ago and it was fantastic! The puzzles were challenging, but not impossible, and the clues were well thought out and presented! Our group had a great time! Definitely something we'd recommend to others and WILL be doing again in the future!

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist's Laboratory" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: We did "The Alchemist Lab" late last Friday night and thoroughly enjoyed it! Fun, frustrating, challenging, adrenaline-pumping adventure... Definitely want to do it again. Great way to celebrate our daughter-in-law's 25th birthday, and WE DID IT with a little over 7 minutes to spare!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist's Laboratory" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: This was so much fun! We did the Alchemist Room. It was definitely challenging! Our group of 6 were age 12-62 and everyone of us had a fantastic time!Christine was amazing!!! She made it even better!

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemist's Laboratory" by Central Arkansas Escape Rooms in Little Rock
review: So much fun!!! The staff were friendly, welcoming, and helped make our experience even better. The room had puzzles that were appropriately challenging and a lot of fun to work through. We did the Alchemist Lab but will DEFINITELY be back to try out Missile Silo. We loved it!

room_title: Escape room "Serial Killer" by Will You Escape? in Tucson
review: The serial killer room was a lot of fun! Creepy, challenging, and creatively put together. The staff were awesome as well - very entertaining and customer service oriented. We also noticed they have a lively game night at Will You Escape. Another reason to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Serial Killer" by Will You Escape? in Tucson
review: I've done quite a few escape rooms around the country in the last year and this one is definitely at the top of my list! Difficult but not impossible. My group escaped with 1 minute 32 seconds to spare. Great for team building or just a fun excursion with friends. A must do whether you live in Tucson or you're just visiting.

room_title: Escape room "Serial Killer" by Will You Escape? in Tucson
review: Such a good time! The serial killer room was a blast! Can't wait to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Serial Killer" by Will You Escape? in Tucson
review: Did the new serial killer room and it was so fun! Had a great time! Such a fun activity to do with friends. Going to try the pirate room next! Nick was awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Space Bus" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Booked Space Bus after playing the King Arthur game and it was worth it. To start with it is a GORGEOUS game. I played a few sci-fi themed escape games around the world and this one is the best one yet. The deep rumble of engines and a little bit of movement made it so real! The game puzzles are well done and games allow for many things to be done at the same time. Also, some puzzles could be solved in more than one way. Be sure not to overcomplicate, because in many cases the solution is simpler than you think.

room_title: Escape room "Space Bus" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Space Bus was great! I've never done an escape room so I had no expectations. The staff we interacted with were very friendly. The condition of the bus was excellent, quite new. The level of technology in the bus in regard to the puzzles was also unexpected. I thought the experience would comprise of shaking curtains for hidden keys or looking under loose tile and the like, haha. To finish the bus on time with the amount of puzzles, you should definitely have at least 4 participants.My 5 friends and I did not set any records but we finished with exactly 1 minute to spare! Oh, the drama!

room_title: Escape room "Space Bus" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: This is what the hype is about?  A resounding yes.  First time escaper!  But won't be my last.Came to celebrate my brother in law's birthday, so just finished dinner at Osso up the street and met the rest of our party (18 total) here.  The staff quickly separated the large group into 3 teams and set us on our way.  Preliminary instructions were quick, to the point, and off we were.  I was blessed with the Space Bus, a super detailed designed "school bus" outside of the facility.  At first I looked at he exterior and thought "huh", but once inside and locked it, the lights, sounds, and feeling of immersion was immediate.  And damn we're the puzzles cool and challenging.  No spoilers here, except we got maybe 4 hints, and finished the experience with 3 minutes to spare.  CANNOT WAIT FOR ANOTHER ROOM!  Definitely will be back.  Great job!

room_title: Escape room "Space Bus" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Below are all of the clues to finish Space Bus in record time.  Kidding.  Great time with team of 7 (4 adults and 3 teenagers).  Although we finished with plenty of time, not knowing how close we were (or not) made it a ton of fun.  Our guide Will was fantastic and actually recommended some escape rooms in Los Angeles (where we went next).Actual tips:  Listen during the guide's introduction -- it'll be important.  Read everything (even more important).  Assign the math-y puzzles to the Kumon lovers on your team.

room_title: Escape room "Santa's Workshop Head-to-Head Adventure" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Curse" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had fun with the group that we got the lady at the front had a great personality and was happy to be there and explained everything and would definitely recommend and go back had a lot of fun

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Curse" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was a corporate event, and the entire team had so much fun. The Exodus team was so easy to work with and get things set up. Our host had a ton of enthusiasm. Thank you for a great event!

room_title: Escape room "Pharaoh's Curse" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Very fun experience and the staff was upbeat and courteous. Multiple escape rooms and multiple sites as well. Will definitely try some of the other escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Ship" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We had the awesome opportunity to experience both The Hangover and Ghost Ship rooms. Happy to say we escaped both. Our favorite was the Ghost Ship. Next time we are in LA we want to give Grandma's Master Plan a try! Highly recommend 60out!

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Ship" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I had cousin's visiting from out of town and I was SO glad I booked this room. It was their first escape room and they fell in love! It was great because the story progressed after doing each puzzle. Ghost Ship is my favorite room at the Melrose location. The first puzzle was so fun and it perfectly set the mood for the rest of the room. Some puzzles were high tech and involved things I had never seen before. Even though it had a spooky vibe, I would say it's kid-friendly.

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Ship" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: LOVE the beginning of this room because it's definitely a different experience from other rooms. Lots of interesting puzzles involving props that look fairly innocuous. My partner and I did it by ourselves and had a great time (and got out), but struggled a bit just because there were only two bodies to use; I think others would benefit from having a larger group for this room because there's a fair amount of stuff going on.

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Ship" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Went on a date and had a fun time. The room looked professional with great and funny service. For our first time we did good but did not escape. Highly recommend with a group to get the night going.

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Ship" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've Been to two of their rooms and they were both excellent but even better were the game Masters Jarod and Damien. They are efficient, professional and passionate about their rooms. I have done rooms all over the city and these guys are the best! I can't wait to finish there rooms and move on to their new ones next month!

room_title: Escape room "Bird's Movie Zone" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Runaway Train" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: We did the train room. The facility and set up is awesome. The staff are one of a kind. Ryan even humored us in all of our craziness. We escaped and we'll be back to try to zombie room!

room_title: Escape room "The Runaway Train" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Both rooms were well thought out and well designed. Never once did we solve a problem and not have the thing open (a problem we've had at other rooms).The train room was particularly well designed with a separation twist at the beginning. I can't wait for the new one.

room_title: Escape room "The Runaway Train" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Absolutely amazing! The Runaway Train room was super fun and challenging, can't wait to try the rest of the rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Runaway Train" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: We did the Runaway Train room and loved it, even though it was our first puzzle room. It was just the right level of challenging, keeping us on our toes but never giving us a dull moment. The staff was very friendly as well. We'll definitely be coming back to try the other puzzle room soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Runaway Train" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: This was the second escape room I have ever done and we did the train room. It was awesome! First of all when you get there the logo on the door is very cool and code breakerish which sets the tone right away. There lobby is comfortable and clean and the owner was great at explaining everything and moving us right into the room quickly. The train room was very different then the other escape room I did in a great way. There were a lot of multi step puzzles and really creative deliveries and room design that made it a blast. We actually escaped with just under 4 minutes to go too which was really fun! I would highly recommend Quandary to anyone wanting to try an escape room and I will certainly be back to try their locked in dead room. Thanks Quandary!

room_title: Escape room "An Hour to Kill" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Really fun room!! One of my favorites Ive ever done. Its not scary at all (I dont do scary rooms)...and I loved the puzzles.  They were really fun to solve and everything was so well thought out

room_title: Escape room "An Hour to Kill" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: When my brother came to visit, one of the items on his list of things to try while here was an escape room. We chose the "An Hour to Kill" room. We had such a great time! The James Bond/spy theme of the room really stands out in all the great details they built into the room's layout. From the moment we started we were laughing and enjoying our race to get out in time. We did it with a team of four people, and we had so much fun we went and did a second escape room, "The Lab," right after.

room_title: Escape room "An Hour to Kill" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Best exit type game we've been to. High variety of puzzles. Very cool. We've played the villains lair and an hour to kill. Both were amazing. Would come back to try the other ones.

room_title: Escape room "An Hour to Kill" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: wow what a great room!! just opened 2 months ago. 6 of us entered, exit game victorious!! no hints!!! a linear puzzle that had us thinking. We have played all the games at exit game & have to say that this is our favorite one!! it was villian's lair, but now its this james bond themed room. Staff was great & video corny but funny!! we will be back when they come up with another room!!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Stillwater Asylum" by Kryptic Tales in Orange County
review: My friends and I had an amazing experience here!  The Stillwater Asylum was challenging and most importantly very fun! There were a lot of different components to this room and many different clues which made it interesting and also exciting! The room was clever and very well done. Our host Adam was awesome!! He was detailed in his introduction and very knowledgeable about every aspect of the room. I highly recommend Kryptic Tales!

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Stillwater Asylum" by Kryptic Tales in Orange County
review: Really liked the Asylum escape room. I came with a group of 5, some with more escape room experience and some with none, and we made it out in the nick of time with only two hints. I highly recommend it. Like others are saying, the puzzles were unique and the clues were given in interesting ways. Just the right amount of difficulty for me, and the overall setup was very good for the experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Mystery of Stillwater Asylum" by Kryptic Tales in Orange County
review: Pretty fun escape room.Solved in 54 minutes.We did the Stillwater asylum. Was fun. Can't wait to try there other one. Guy that GM'd was super nice.Would recommend. Not as hard as some of the rooms We've tried but it was super fun. I would say it's not as "scary" as I anticipated but it was very good.

room_title: Escape room "Runestone" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: My husband and I have done over 20 different escape rooms within Phoenix and Pittsburgh.  Runestone is definitely one of our favorites!  First of all we were blown away by the lobby.  Not at all what I was expecting to find next to the discout movie theater!  It is gorgeous and looks really upscale.  We enjoyed the room itself, Runestone.  It had a nice mixture of different types of puzzles and our clue master was great.  Can't wait to go back and try one of the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Runestone" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Amazing experience! We went tonight as a family and went through Runestone and I was fantastic. We've been to loads of other escape rooms and this was by FAR the best! It can be difficult but it is a challenging and rewarding experience! I can't wait to go to their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Runestone" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Best escape room experience yet!  Very well done guys!  Can't wait to come back again!  So much fun. We did the Runestone room and escaped successfully.

room_title: Escape room "Moonshot" by Reason in San Francisco
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Office" by Escape Eureka in Eureka
review: We had such a great time! We did the Da Vinci room and it was full of such fun puzzles. The best part was the owners who were very fun and excited about their business. Thank you for bringing something new and exciting to do in Humboldt County!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Office" by Escape Eureka in Eureka
review: my daughter and I did the DaVinci room. what a blast! 😊😊 Very friendly owner, challenging room! will definitely go back for the other room!

room_title: Escape room "Da Vinci's Office" by Escape Eureka in Eureka
review: My husband and I went through DaVinci's office and had the BEST time! It was challenging but a great exercise in team work. We are still talking about how much fun we had and cannot wait to test our skills with Quest for the Throne!

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Experienced “special ops” with a group of friends. Had a great time playing solving the puzzles. Staff was very pleasant and informative. Can’t wait to come back!

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Had a blast doing the special ops room! It’s an 8/10 difficulty but the staff are very helpful with giving you the clues. Beat the room with three minutes to spare! I would definitely do another room next time I’m in the area. I highly recommend for anyone who is looking for something fun and challenging to do!

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: This was so much fun! It was my first time going to an escape room and I would definitely try it again. My friends and I were in the Special Ops: Mystery Market room and we spent the whole time laughing. We mentioned to our host that we were there to celebrate our friends birthday and at the end of the game she gave my friend a birthday card that was signed by the employees. It was such a nice and unexpected gesture. I would totally go back again!

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Not wanting to give anything away, I'll simply say that the entire experience was amazing. We did the Special Ops room which has a terrific decor and feel. The clues are very ingenious, going beyond your typical puzzles and interconnected clues. Not that those are not present but there is definitely more. An overall fun immersive way to spend 60 minutes, or less if you escape.

room_title: Escape room "Special Ops: Mysterious Market" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Wow! Our family had such a great night out playing Special Ops at The Escape Game. We loved the realistic settings and intriguing puzzles.... thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Cashout" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: To be honest, I had never heard of this concept before they opened this location. I went there with my family and we did the "Cashout" room. (It was difficult but we had a lot of fun).We were welcomed and guided by Nick and Ben, who did a wonderful job. They were both extremely friendly and very helpful. They answered our many questions in a very professional way.It was a great experience and I look forward to going back there and trying another room.

room_title: Escape room "Cashout" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: This was the first time anyone in our group was doing the escape room. The staff member was friendly and filled us in. We did the Cash Out room which was an hour long. I should have known the longer the time, the harder the escape. We ended up getting every lockbox but two and the staff member walked us through the rest of the clues. It got everyone in the group thinking and it was a fun family activity.

room_title: Escape room "Cashout" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: We did the casino room and had a blast! The staff was great! The game was challenging! Definitely worth every penny. We will be back to escape a different room!

room_title: Escape room "Cashout" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: Loved it!!!!!! Staff was awesome! I can't believe the detail put into the rooms and so many fun clues to solve! I can not wait to do the other room and excited for more rooms to become available. I will be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Panic Room" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: First time ever doing something like this. The staff was great super friendly and made it extremely fun. I will absolutely do this again.

room_title: Escape room "The Panic Room" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: This was an awesome experience from start to finish! My husband and I merged with a group of 8 others, even though we were perfect strangers we worked together and made it out in time! It was funny, suspenseful, entertaining and realistic. A great mental workout and good bonding time.

room_title: Escape room "The Panic Room" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: My friends and family did the "Panic Room" and it was so much fun. There were a lot of puzzles for us all to solve and we broke up in small groups to do this. The room itself was very nicely done and very aesthetically appealing. The gamekeeper gave us clear instructions and hyped us up with the incentive we needed to escape.The different types of puzzles and locks were brilliant. This was my first experience and I am addicted now!

room_title: Escape room "Crematory" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: I never knew that escape room games were this great. Awesome stuff guys, commendable to play. We all had a blast and the group click at the end was just what I needed. Do play the game guys California State Escape has done a wonderful job here.

room_title: Escape room "Crematory" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: By far the biggest and most neat escape venue I've ever been to! No corners were cut in props and room design. Had an immersive experience in the Crematory room.

room_title: Escape room "Crematory" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: The Crematory room was awesome! Had so much fun!! It is a must do!

room_title: Escape room "Crematory" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: This was our first time in an escape room. Crematory was an incredible place! We had an amazing family time! We would definitely recommend this place to people that like riddles, puzzles, mysteries and more!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Los Angeles
review: So much fun for the kiddos and adults!!! Good place for birthday parties! Highly recommend it and there is a groupon for this too!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Los Angeles
review: Brought my son here for his 13th birthday and we had a blast. Definitely would come back again.

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Los Angeles
review: Went with a summer camp I work at. I was blown away at how much fun I had. I wish I lived closer to Fullerton so I could go more often.

room_title: Escape room "Deja Vu" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: This place was so fun we made it out with 50 seconds left!

room_title: Escape room "Deja Vu" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: This was so much fun! Our hostess was really friendly. My group made good progress but occasionally needed a hint. The hints themselves are put to you in a witty way and give you just enough information to help. They have another room in development and I can't wait to try that one!

room_title: Escape room "Deja Vu" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: Great Escape room. Our game master Lauren was amazingly friendly, super helpful, and made the experience great. The room (Deja Vu) can accommodate many size groups and is great for any level experience. Can't wait to try their new room!

room_title: Escape room "Deja Vu" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: We did his as a work team building event. The journey was very intriguing and fun. Highly recommend for any type of group.

room_title: Escape room "Deja Vu" by Escape Era in San Diego
review: Checked it out on a recommendation from an escape room group, and loved it. This was room 28 for us, and it had several unique puzzles and a fantastic flow. No Deja Vu had! I'd definitely recommend it as well.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Jail" by Real Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Tried the Escape from Jail scenario. Their small jail room escape was the best i've tried yet! It comes complete with an enthusiastic and convincing actor and has many many levels of puzzles intertwined!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Jail" by Real Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Real Escape Game on Polk was so fun! I was suprised such a small space could hold such a great game. I have been to the one in San Jose before as well. Came here with a group of friends and we all had a blast. I don't want to give any details away but we all had a great time and want to do another one some time soon!The jail one was a great storyline, and the employees were helpful at times and very committed to staying in character.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Jail" by Real Escape Room in San Francisco
review: Had an awesome time escaping from the jail. This was my first escape room experience and I cannot stop talking about it. Went with a group of friends and was amazed at how much fun I had. The game was challenging and exciting and just a ton of fun to work through with friends. Would highly recommend it to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Jail" by Real Escape Room in San Francisco
review: So my friends and I did Escape the Jail last week, and as fun as the puzzles were, I have to give major kudos to the woman who played our guard. She was spot on, and we keep coming back to here as our favorite element in the entire thing. Props, and thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from the Jail" by Real Escape Room in San Francisco
review: I went back to SCRAP and did their latest escape room - Escape from the Jail recently. We didn't manage to escape unfortunately, but we all really enjoyed ourselves and loved how they incorporated the theme into the game mechanics.

room_title: Escape room "Zodiac Killer" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: I love Fox In A Box LA. I have done two escape rooms there now. The first was the zombie lab which while fun, was only okay. The second was this one, and I thought it was amazing! We escaped with 5 minutes left. Some of the clues were really difficult and without a hint, we wouldn’t have solved. Somehow, we figured most of it out ourselves. We had so much fun and will definitely come back. This escape room is very nice despite the surroundings looking a bit sketchy (aka the strip club across the street) I would definitely highly recommend this escape room to anyone who enjoys a good time. It was also a bit scary at times.

room_title: Escape room "Zodiac Killer" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: This was our first escape room. It's very challenging. We tried The Zodiac Killer! It was great. The employees are so great and made it an incredible experience. We can't wait to go back. We are going to try every game. My husband and two kids have never tried an escape room before and they were very impressed.

room_title: Escape room "Zodiac Killer" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: Such a fun and entertaining hour!  The workers are super friendly. We had a group of 3 and were at the moment of getting the code to get out of the room when our time was up. I would highly recommend it to any age group. We did the Zodiac room and it was so much fun. Lots of puzzles to solve and clues to find. We will definitely be going back!

room_title: Escape room "Zodiac Killer" by Fox in a Box Orange County in Orange County
review: A great puzzle room.  It was very puzzle-heavy instead of easter egg hunt-esque. Super friendly and helpful staff, especially Matt. I would absolutely recommend for people who have done a puzzle room or two before. The Zodiac Killer room rocks!

room_title: Escape room "Cuban Crisis" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: I enjoyed this place a lot. Soon as we walked in the art and different crafts caught your attention, for some reason it reminded me of a tattoo parlor, haha. But we came for a birthday party and we had a good-sized group, my group chose the Cuban Crisis as our mission. You basically have 60 mins to find clues and crack the codes to finally receive the code to unlock the door. Just know we cracked our code with 9 mins left to spare and we beat the other team by 3 mins.I know we all enjoyed our experience as it was everyone's first time there. I know I enjoyed mine.

room_title: Escape room "Cuban Crisis" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: So much fun and very unique! You gotta try Antidote or Cuban Missile crisis!

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Key Quest in Modesto
review: Horrible escape room. Attendant was unavailable to give hints, and several items/locks did not work even for the attendant. The issue is that this escape room is part of a laser quest so the focus of the attendant is divided. Sounds and music from the laser tag section breaks immersion. Would not recomend.

room_title: Escape room "The Cellar" by Key Quest in Modesto
review: Had fun escaping from the Cellar with the kids. The clues were fun to decipher. Can recommend this to everyone.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by ZScape Games in Livermore
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Fort Smith Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: My husband, myself & our friends visited the spellbound room! Even though we didn’t escape we had a great time! Can’t wait to do it again!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in San Diego
review: The room itself has great reviews! The customer service is absolutely horrible and so far the worst I have run into at any escape room by far. Definitely will not be returning and really encourage people to go elsewhere. The experience overall was not nearly as good because of the people we had to deal with.

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in San Diego
review: Had an amazing time in the AI room. The interactions with both the room and the computer interface went seamlessly together. The challenges were well organized and the mechanics varied significantly so that you were kept on your toes the whole time. If you complete the room with at least 15 minutes to spare, an additional challenge is activated, so that added a whole extra level of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in San Diego
review: Excellent escape room! We did the AI Room, very high tech and unique puzzles that I won't spoil, but trust me, I haven't seen anything like it before. Awesome staff that are enthusiastic about the game, we had an amazing time. Looking forward to trying The Lab!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in San Diego
review: Just wow! The Exit Game is my favorite escape game company. Their rooms are unlike any other escape games I've played. The AI room has a talking robot. How cool is that?! Do listen to the robot, it actually responds to your actions in the room. The decoration is also top notch. My group definitely will be coming back for their other rooms. I heard the next room is coming out in about a month.

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in San Diego
review: Just finished AI room with 8 people. It was definitely a room that utilized the most technology out of the escape rooms I have done, which added to the experience. The room was committed to the theme throughout. I was more used to the flip-everything-in-the-room type of escape rooms, so it was definitely a nice change.The staff was extremely patient, friendly, and knowledgeable! So excited for the other rooms to be finished!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in San Diego
review: The highest rated escape room in LA on Yelp has come to SD! I was literally about to pee my pants because I was so excited!Our group of 7 came on a Friday night, we had all done escape rooms before except for 1. Our game master was very friendly. We watched the introduction video and began our mission. It was an extremely high tech room! It was definitely difficult but you will have to work with your team and communicate.

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: Did both the Fallout Shelter and Initiation with my group of four. We loved both rooms and can't wait to visit Havasu again to see if their other room is open. Good puzzle flow, made us all work together. It was a great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: Although we were 2 clues short of solving, the escape we had a great time with our friends and we will do it again soon.

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: Such a great time! Very well put together! From the look and feel of the rooms to the challenges and puzzles themselves! Awesome experience! Can't wait to see the next challenge when it opens!

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: Awesome experience! Clever and suspenseful! We did it with a group of 4 and I wouldn't change a thing!

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: We had a great time in the Fallout shelter! Definitely want to go back and try a new room when it opens up! Thanks Gray Matter Escape Room for the fun family time!

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: My daughter and I had such a fantastic time! Some of the puzzles were easy and some were very difficult. I loved the variety of logic problems and common sense solutions. Great job, Gray Matter!

room_title: Escape room "The Fallout Shelter" by Gray Matter Escape in Lake Havasu City
review: We've been excited to try this, and so happy that we did! It was such a great experience working together as a family. Too bad we died from radioactive poisoning!

room_title: Escape room "Depths Of Osiris VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: Amazing experience!! First we started with the hangover. Hard but not too hard. It is for 7 people so if you do not have 7 they will fill in the spaces. Something the website didn’t explain clearly. However, we had a great couple that played the game with us and we had a wonderful time. Then we switched to the VR side. I do have to mention it is not in the same building. So do not book these too close together. We did the ocean Osiris. It was fantastic!!!! The staff helps you so you dont feel lost. We ended our night with the hospital horror. This is not an escape room, it was an “experience”. I was so submerged in my experience that I,... kind of forgot it wasn’t real. I screamed and took off my headset. My greatest fear was in that room and it felt too real to deal with it lol when I tapped out the staff was right by my side with smiles. They made me feel comfortable and supported. I came we’re with my husband and 2 older teens. We ABSOLUTELY recommend his location to EVERYONE.

room_title: Escape room "Depths Of Osiris VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: My wife Sherrie and I along with our Scottsdale friends Mike and Lynette had the best time at Escape 101 in Phoenix. If you are searching for fun at a great price, with great service and team/friend building go to Escape 101. We did the Depths of Osirus and the Hospital of Horrors vitual reality rooms. So much fun we will go back for more. You won't be disappointed. Sean was out guide. Have fun

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: Working with others my husband and I did The Crimson Storm. We had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: My daughter decided to get kidnapped by pirates for her birthday because, why not? Phoenix Escape Room went way above and way beyond to make her birthday special for us. You guys are seriously amazing. Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "The Crimson Storm" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: This was such a fun experience and the staff was so fun! Me and my husband tried it out for date night, and we are hooked! Too bad we needed a few more minutes to escape, but we will be back to try all the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Edison Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: Just escaped the Edison room and escaped with a whole 3 minutes to spare! The puzzles were amazing and really well thought out, the look and decor were great and I would recommend everyone trying them out!

room_title: Escape room "The Edison Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: The Edison room was awesome! My family and I got together for a birthday celebration via the Palace Games escape room. Multiple generations working together to solve puzzles? Needless to say it was a blast. It was incredibly engaging, creative and interactive.

room_title: Escape room "The Edison Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: As of this past Tuesday I finally rounded out my Palace Games escaping skills by completing the Edison Room (my 3rd) and it was BEYOND INCREDIBLE!!! It was a seemingly endless adventure of discovery, technology, puzzles and teamwork. I really can't say enough about how fun and well done all of these room are.  I understand how technically complicated the Edison Room is and how much of a challenge it must have been to create. My hat is off to everyone that was involved in its creation. Wow. Just wow!

room_title: Escape room "The Edison Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: The Edison Room was awesome! It's the first room I've done, so can't compare to the others, but I had a great time. We had the full 8, and didn't feel too crowded even though it was above the "optimal" number. Had high expectations, and I was not disappointed. I look forward to doing more rooms with these guys in the future.

room_title: Escape room "The Edison Escape Room" by Palace Games in San Francisco
review: I've done all three rooms by Palace Games and they're all so much fun. Definitely worth the price. I'd recommend doing them in the order they were developed (Houdini, Roosevelt, Edison) as they just keep getting more and more impressive. We had a group of 9 for the Houdini and Roosevelt rooms and 8 for Edison and there was plenty to do for everyone. I've done escape rooms at 4 other venues but these three rooms are definitely the best 3 I've ever done!

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: What an experience this was. So much tension but yet so fun. I would definitely recommend this to friends and family.

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: Had a great time. Puzzles were intriguing and mind bending. Highly recommend to all.

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: It was a great and very high thinking experience! This is a must stop escape room! Now finally here in Bakersfield! I love it!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: Get ready to be tested psychologically..very well set up maze of puzzles an all out excellent group activity...

room_title: Escape room "The Classroom" by Rooms of No Return in Bakersfield
review: It was very fun , had a blast. Must try at-least once

room_title: Escape room "Magician's Library" by Skeleton Key Rooms in Sacramento
review: this escape room is HORRIBLE. I have no idea what game others are playing but let me tell you about it without giving the room away. For starters the clues and puzzles make zero sense. It's supposed to themed as a magicians lair but instead it is filled with gibberish as in made up words and symbols and nothing even remotely related to magic. also there is no roof to the room so it feels like you are playing in a small cubical. you can literally hear what is going on in the room right next you to clear as day also THERE IS NO AC so it was super hot in there as well. also the hints that they give you aren't relevant to what you are trying to do. I regret paying my money to go there so PLEASE BOOK ELSEWHERE

room_title: Escape room "Magician's Library" by Skeleton Key Rooms in Sacramento
review: What a great experience! It was quite challenging for just 4 people, but we finished with just under two minutes left! An hour really flies by when your solving multiple puzzles. The puzzles were intricate and entertaining, and force you to pay attention to small details! Owner came in after we finished and she was really sweet, we stayed and talked with her for quite awhile! Glad to help support a local family who genuinely wants their guests to enjoy the game! Will DEFINITELY visit again!

room_title: Escape room "Magician's Library" by Skeleton Key Rooms in Sacramento
review: This place was AWESOME! We had such a blast! Some puzzles were challenging, but the clues they provided were perfect. They didn't give anything away, but guided you if you were stuck. The comments they made were hilarious, too! We absolutely loved it and can't wait for more rooms so we can go back.

room_title: Escape room "Magician's Library" by Skeleton Key Rooms in Sacramento
review: It was a blast going with my colleagues. Definitely recommend doing as a big group. It was challenging and the puzzles are well organized. We couldn't solve the puzzles, but no disappointment. Overall it was a fun activity. Can't wait to go back and solve another mystery.

room_title: Escape room "The Society" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: WOW. I have to say this placed has really stepped it up with their new room! If you haven't I highly recommend the Society room especially if you are new to escape rooms. As someone who has done over 50, this room is very solid.It's a nice room with several varieties of puzzles throughout.  None felt too hard or poorly designed. I played the room with 2 others and it felt very comfortable and nothing felt impossible. Everything went at a smooth pace. We were all experienced, so we all took our time and didn't feel the urge to rush. With that said we still had a out 5 minutes remaining.There were some locks here and there, but it also had its fair share of electronic puzzles as well. (Thankfully nothing glitched). I highly recommend this room if you are a beginner to escape rooms because it contains the basics that most rooms give to you throughout the country.  And if you are an expert still play it because you can't go wrong.The lobby is nice and the staff is nice as well, but overall if you have played a game here before.... YOU NEED TO COME BACK and play Society because this hands down is the best room here. That's a fact. Not an opinion.

room_title: Escape room "The Society" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: Me and my coworkers played their new room "The Society". The puzzles were highly interactive. Very well done room. Challenging puzzles, sophisticated design, good engineering and decor. We really enjoyed our time there! I would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Society" by Escape Oakland in San Francisco
review: Very fun!!!   Our host was very nice and extremely helpful!    Did the society room.   Would def recommend to anyone.

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: We had a great time doing both the Amnesia and Resurrection rooms. Our wonderful game master Jasmine was enthusiastic and supportive. This Quest Room location is in the South Bay Galleria, so there is ample parking, lighting, and places to eat nearby.  We have done all the other rooms by this company and these rooms have the amazing build quality, story elements, and immersion of those rooms plus an added live actor element.  The actor provides some creepy and funny moments, and helps move the gameplay and story forward.  The structure and design of the game promotes collaboration. There is hardly a moment where you feel like you are alone solving a random puzzle and then reporting back to your group. The suspense and thrill are maximized when everyone is present when there is a scary reveal or jump scare. I never heard "What happened?" or "What did you see?" We all experienced the awesomeness together.  For those apprehensive to do these rooms because of the "horror" element, you will be ok. These rooms have plenty of humorous and engaging moments that perfectly balance out the fear factor.  So take a deep breath and enjoy!

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Wow!! It's so hard to write a review without too many spoilers. But we played Amnesia and it was insanely cool! The way it starts out is super different and makes you think more practical than other escape rooms (I work at one so I LOVE playing others and seeing what works and what doesn't) this one works!! Great staff and AMAZING tech. 10/10 recommend! Our actor Jasmine was great, our game master Matt was also really awesome! I'm hoping to get to see him act in the future. And Katey(Katie?) was one of the nicest bubbliest people I've ever met. Just an overall mind blowing and fun experience. (You May even get some free candy )

room_title: Escape room "Amnesia" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: We had an amazing time! Its a big room. Definitely a must try. They said group of six is the max they can do per game. We did Amnesia and it was funny/ creepy. Our game master was super awesome. I think his name was antoinne. Will definitely be back to try the other room

room_title: Escape room "Daycare" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: I came across this hotel by accident. Had no idea what I was getting myself into. My boyfriend and I did the Daycare Escape room it was creepy! We had a anniversary we will never forget! We will be back again!

room_title: Escape room "Daycare" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: The first time I went, my friends and I did Santorium. We loved it so much, we came back a second time that night and did Slaughter. And then, two weeks later, I came back again to do Daycare! This place is amazing, the staff are so wonderful and in character all the time. Creepy, yet supportive and just absolute fun to be around. As for the rooms, I can't even explain how wonderfully detailed and well thought out everything is. This is probably one of the best experiences I have had in my life.

room_title: Escape room "Daycare" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: My friends and I did the Daycare room and we had a blast! The passports are a nice touch. We want to come back and get more stamps. The Saturday night staff was fabulous.

room_title: Escape room "Daycare" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: We did the daycare and it was absolutely amazing. Random scares, and very challenging! I highly recommend this place we're booking for four other rooms to try! I can't get enough!!!

room_title: Escape room "Daycare" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: The experience was really fun! When you walk up, the employees are all in character as you "check in" - the check in process is lengthy, so definitely get there as early as they recommend! They need you to fill out waivers and have your photo taken for a fake passport, which you get to keep (and they stamp if you successfully get out of your room). We did the Daycare room, and it was surprisingly tough, but we got out with 12 minutes remaining. We had fun and would do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Revenger's Rescue" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Our family of five (with kids aged 13, 10, and 7) chose the Revengers Rescue challenge, and though we did not solve the room in time, we had such a blast!! We thought the room was very unique and inventive. The place was clean and the staff was super friendly. It was a great hour of quality time together. We would highly recommend it!!

room_title: Escape room "Revenger's Rescue" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: I've been to several escape rooms in this area and NWA Escape has been the best experience yet! Revenger's Rescue was a blast, even when we hit some snafus, we still had a blast! Will definitely return!

room_title: Escape room "Revenger's Rescue" by NWA Escape Room in Fayetteville (AR)
review: Had lots of fun with the family. The Revengers Rescue room was awesome. Can't wait to try out the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Reactor Escape" by Reason in San Francisco
review: Our team had a blast solving the puzzles to break out of the escape room! We did this as a team bonding activity to kick off the new year and it was incredibly effective. We were able to play with a drone, a 3D printer, virtual reality, and other technologies as part of the puzzles which only made the experience more fun!

room_title: Escape room "Reactor Escape" by Reason in San Francisco
review: I heard good things about this escape room before coming with my group of nine friends. I was absolutely blown away by the puzzle design, game flow, and hospitality of the room hosts. I've done a lot of escape rooms, and this one stands out with inventive puzzles that required lots of teamwork. Our gamemasters were very patient, encouraging, and provided an excellent customer service experience.

room_title: Escape room "Reactor Escape" by Reason in San Francisco
review: I've played over 80 escape games around the world, and I can say that this was one of the best! We had a group of 10 people (some new to escape games) and we escaped with a few seconds left! It was an awesome and unique experience with the technology that they use. I won't reveal anything here but just try it for yourself!

room_title: Escape room "Reactor Escape" by Reason in San Francisco
review: Extremely fun escape game (themed around future technology) located within an innovation lab. Expect some high-tech toys and a whole lot of fun!

room_title: Escape room "Reactor Escape" by Reason in San Francisco
review: The Reason team put a huge amount of love and detail into this room. It was fun, exceptionally designed, and clever. We were lucky enough to participate in the beta so learned more about the design and testing process they went through. I look forward to exploring (and escaping) the next Reason room.

room_title: Escape room "Aftermath" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Bank Heist" by Escape Zone Oxford in Oxford (AL)
review: We had a great time! The staff was super friendly and the game was challenging. We can't wait to come back and go through another room.

room_title: Escape room " Captive" by Twisted Exit in Lancaster (CA)
review: LOVED THIS!!!! This was my boyfriend and I's first escape room. The lighting/mood and decor were so well done that I had a panic attack in the hallway, hahah no joke. It was great though, once we got in the room and got going on the clues we were okay. We did not Escape, but were told that we were 3 locks from escaping. Overall GREAT ROOM!

room_title: Escape room " Captive" by Twisted Exit in Lancaster (CA)
review: I had a great time in the Saw room! Definitely coming back with some friends.

room_title: Escape room "Holiday Quest" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape Atlantis" by Game the Room in Rohnert Park
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape Game Iron Gate" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: My friends and I did the CSI room for a birthday. Matt was very helpful and nice, and even gave us an extra minute so we could make it out.  We will be back for sure to play high school detention and pawn shop.

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: Soooooooo much fun! An hour has never flown by so quickly. The rooms are great and the owners put a lot of thought into the set up and clues. Can't wait to go back!!

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: Challenging, fun, interesting story line and plenty of opportunities to be mislead!Great staff, too!

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: We had a blast going through this scenario. I love adventures that make you think outside the box and utilize those cerebral skills. It's amazing how you react in a situation like this and my team stepped up to the challenge. Mark made an excellent moderator and the whole experience was exhilarating! We must try another one here!

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: I've gone twice now. Both times were great fun. The scenarios were fun and the puzzles were a lot of fun as well. The moderators (we had 2 different ones) were both great. Gave hints only when needed and seemed to enjoy their jobs.

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: It was our first time in an escape room and we had so much fun! We didn't know what to expect but after our host shared the rules of the game we were excited. We made it out just after the plane departed.  We plan to return to try and conquer the CSI room. Can't wait for our next challenge!

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: First time here and had a BLAST!!! Definitely a must try, if you've never done something like this!Iydeen & Matt are the We'll be back to conquer the next case!!!

room_title: Escape room "The CSI Lab" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: The House of Hints was a truly unique experience! Our group had fun trying to figure out the clues to solve the mystery, but we also learned a lot about each other’s strengths in the different ways we approached clues. We had a great time! Thanks!

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: This experience may sound like it would be cheesy or tiring to do after work but it was not that at all. The staff is super sweet and friendly and seem to genuinely care that you have a good time. Puzzles are interesting and fun. 60 minutes transport you into another world and allow a chance to learn about your strengths and how you communicate with your team mates.

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: The Escape Game San Francisco is a great spot to hit if you're around the area and looking for something fun and new to do with your group of friends. Test your team building skills and your brain power as you try and escape rooms filled with different puzzles and riddles. A timed adventure that will give you a sense of thrill and excitement. I have done 4 games here already and it never disappoints. The staff is also super friendly and makes the overall experience 10 times better. Lonnie and Joanna did a fantastic job at getting my group started! 10/10 would recommend :)

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: The escape game was so much fun. Marc did an amazing job getting us hype about our game. It really was an incredible experience and a great team building exercise for my company

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Great team building fun. Staff was concise yet thorough and it's easily the best vibe and fun I've had at an escape room

room_title: Escape room "Team Building Opportunities" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: I had no desire to ever go to an escape room and when this activity was planned for us, several of the women were nervous about it. But after the experience, we ALL wanted to do it again! It was so much fun! I would definitely do this again!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: This escape room is a wonderful addition to the OC and is awesome for newbies and veterans alike. The Hydeout room is a wonderful mixture of linear and nonlinear puzzles that definitely challenge the mind. The in-room mechanics gave it the extra nudge into 5 stars along with the friendly staff. Definitely recommending this spot to friends. Can't wait to try their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: The Hydeout room was very extremely fun and of course, challenging. The worker Joe who was working there was very kind, friendly, and funny. If you're in Anaheim as a local or visiting, I'd recommend this to anyone else to do this escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience with great staff, challenging puzzles, and awesome props!! I had so much fun and definitely HIGHLY recommend. Great activity not only for friends and family to work together but also a good team building exercise for co-workers or sports team. Looking forward to the upcoming rooms that are scheduled to open.

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: We loved it!! My husband, daughter and I made it out with only 3 minutes to spare! It was fun to spend the time together looking for clues and figuring out how to apply them to the challenge of finding the door key. Can"t wait to try the new rooms when they are ready! Kudos to Joe! He was great!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Hydeout" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: This was an awesome experience! This was a first escape game for me and I can't wait to try others! I went with family, a group of 9 and we all had a lot of fun! Very exciting when you figure out the clues and it opens a new door! I encourage everyone to try it! You have to all work together! The staff was very friendly and engaging! We also made it out with 9 seconds to spare, which totally made our night!! Highly recommend!!

room_title: Escape room "Houdini's Final Act" by Escape Eureka in Eureka
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loads of fun! It's a challenging puzzle with live actors. We finished with only a minute to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Great time with visiting Family from Oklahoma. We did good.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was a lot of fun! Definitely want to come back for the Crime Scene Room.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Celebrated my birthday by doing the Secret Temple room. Amazing. Very fun. Without any spoilers, I can say they made my birthday very special. Can't wait to come back for the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Last day in LA , me and my film friends decided to be random and do the escape room. We underestimated the experience and it turned out to be great. The actor was great and the escape room was definitely challenging. We achieved it with 2 seconds left. Will definitely do this again.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: After hearing about escape rooms from a fellow co-worker I decided to get a few friends together to try one out! I looked around online and eventually came upon Enigma and after looking at all of the reviews we went and booked the Secret Temple. The website was really simple to navigate and we received a confirmation email with all of the details we needed. Once we arrived at the building, we were greeted by our host with a friendly smile and really hyped us up for what was about to come. After all of the rules and backstory, we were then led to our room. The room had a bit of a National Treasure feel and there was a lot of character to the room. The puzzles were well thought out and it really made us rack our brains trying to get everything solved. We did have to use our two hints to escape but the whole adventure was just a great experience all together and we escape with only a minute to spare. We are looking forward to coming back and trying another room in the near future here.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I'm still so pumped from just saving millions of lives! I just got out of Apt. 205 with 2 other friends at Enigma Escape Rooms, and I have to say Bravo! I haven't seen my college friends in a while because we've all been busy with work and never seem to catch some time to hang out. Today we all happen to have a few hours to kill, so we called up Enigma because we've been dying to try it out. Not only was the staff incredibly friendly, but there was also parking (which is a huge plus)!We got there, they greeted us at the top of the stairs very nicely, we were told a little of what to expect, then we waited about 30 seconds and someone came out, and we got started. The storyline is awesome! The actor there was so committed it made our experience so much better! The puzzles were challenging, the adrenaline was pumping, and my friends and I had a killer time! Totally worth the time and money! I can't wait to go back and do The Will!

room_title: Escape room "Space Squad in Space" by Two Bit Circus in Los Angeles
review: awesome games, clean, safe great staff. Drinks and food was good. will come again

room_title: Escape room "Space Squad in Space" by Two Bit Circus in Los Angeles
review: First time here and had such a blast

room_title: Escape room "The Detective's Office" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
review: We took my daughter and friends her for her birthday 12-14 y/os. They absolutely had a blast. We did the Detectives Office and with using all our hints, we escaped right on the dot. The crew there was so fun and helpful. We will definitely go back and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "The Detective's Office" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
review: This was the first time we ever did an escape the room and we had so much fun! The clues are fun to find and make you think outside of the box. We did the detectives room and had a blast... plus we solved it!

room_title: Escape room "The Detective's Office" by Escape House Mesa in Phoenix
review: We did the detective room..lots of fun! And the staff is wonderful, can't think of her name..she's blonde, very helpful and sweet :)

room_title: Escape room "Curse on the Emerald Seas" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: Fun! I wasn't sure what to expect it it was a fun challenge and I can't wait to try other challenges!

room_title: Escape room "Curse on the Emerald Seas" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: My family visited Phoenix Escape Room at the recommendation of a friend. Our ages varied from 6-46 -- and we all had an amazing time. The whole experience was really well done. I'd recommend them in a second.

room_title: Escape room "Curse on the Emerald Seas" by Puzzle Effect Phoenix in Phoenix
review: I just finished their two new rooms, The Path and Curse on the Emerald Sea, at their new location and I must say that they were both quite well done and very indicative of the care they put into the business. Both rooms had great set designs, ambiance, and the puzzles were creative and, excluding one that I just wasn't getting for a bit, just the right side of difficult but achievable. I want to also praise the staff, they were all friendly and funny and each had their own unique style that I think really brings an air of friendliness to the business that you don't see in a lot of escape rooms. They clearly care about you having a good time. If you're looking for something to do I really recommend giving these rooms a try, where else can you find yourself in the hold of a ship, a zen garden, search for a magical creature, and help save a city in one day? Go, go do it now.

room_title: Escape room "The Motel" by Escape Mystery Rooms in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Immersive Adventure VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Had a fantastic time here, the puzzles were just the right level of challenge I loved the cooperative aspect, great for going out with friends or office mates. I highly recommend it, make sure you go w/ friends.

room_title: Escape room "Immersive Adventure VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: This place is an absolute gem. Been twice with friends and once with my son. Everyone was blown away at the fun. Great staff and easy to find location in Hollywood.  The games are complex enough to play multiple times yet simple enough to grasp quickly.  The first time was sensory overload in a good way. Need to get back and try the new modules.

room_title: Escape room "Immersive Adventure VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: My family and I had a great time, staff was super nice, friendly, and helpful with the whole experience. Can’t wait to do it again!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Condo" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: I'm not one to write reviews but the staff is super friendly and Aunt Edna's condo was way fun! I can't wait to go back and do a different one!

room_title: Escape room "The Condo" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: We booked the Condo room for a little adult time away from the kids. Most of us had never done one before but everything was explained well and we had a blast. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Condo" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: Aunt Edna's Condo was so fun! One of the best rooms I've escaped.

room_title: Escape room "The Condo" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: Our two families had a great time playing in Aunt Edna's condo. The game had just the right amount of challenges for our group. I highly recommend for families with older and younger kids.

room_title: Escape room "The Condo" by Escape Games AZ in Phoenix
review: Enjoyed our time at Escape Games AZ. If you are a first time player-- this a great place to start playing.
