We played both Aunt Edna's and Quest for the Throne and were successful at both, but just barely. Locally owned and run. Aunt Edna's takes the cake for the most unique theme we've seen in a puzzle room. Great fun for friends or a date night. Check it out!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 3: The Gatekeeper" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: We had a great time. The added effect of having actors in the escape room made the entire experience very memorable. I have done a fair share of escape rooms and enjoyed the theatrics surrounding this escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 3: The Gatekeeper" by The Bunker Experience in Los Angeles
review: This place was awesome! The staff was very helpful and made you feel comfortable! My group was able to escape with .04 seconds left.

room_title: Escape room "Red Giant" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: My friends and I did the Red Giant room. It is one of the best rooms we have done. The puzzles were intricate and each room had unique tech that made it a lot of fun.

room_title: Escape room "Red Giant" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Took my 8 year old niece here and we had SO much fun. We did the easiest room (the red giant)and it was just the right amount of challenging for the adults and some simple things that she was able to do. Honestly, she probably figured out more than the adults (she's a smarty like that). It was great for her because it was so interactive and hands on. We've been to many rooms that are just a bunch of locks and keys and that's not what this one was. Props and statues put in the right place would activate a movement. It was well done!! The man at the beginning was great at getting my niece excited. He explained so sweetly about the game and made it sound so fun that she was confident and ready to conquer. That intro made it!

room_title: Escape room "Red Giant" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: This review is for Red Giant only."Red Giant" refers to a ruby in a crypt, not the planet, so leave your space helmets at home.Parking here is super convenient in the back of the building, but the driveway leading to the parking lot is FILLED with potholes, and when we went there, a giant pond was formed b/c of the rain. There is a ring doorbell and the words "QUEST ROOM" in red next to the door. It looks super sketch back there.But once you ring the bell and enter, it is NICE inside. It's obvious that they put a lot of effort in building and maintaining the place. The room itself is VERY well thought out, from where they orient you, to the hints, to the final puzzle. We only needed two hints. The first hint we needed because we weren't patient enough, and the second hint we needed because we weren't as observant when we first entered the tomb as we should have been. There were a couple of times when we received unsolicited hints because we weren't on the right track, which was really nice of them.All in all, I LOVED how this room was designed. Everything really fit well. If I were to change anything, it would be to minimize the Many pages of text in this one book. It's fun, but the book was filled with red herrings, which you don't realize are red herrings until you get to the end and the book explicitly explains which pages are important. I highly recommend this room!

room_title: Escape room "They're Coming" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We have now done all 3 rooms at this location, after just completing - and escaping from - They're Coming on Sunday. We have done rooms at 2 of the other Maze Room locations and this one is BY FAR the best!!! The rooms are creative, the puzzles are clever and the staff is fantastic. On Sunday, John made They're Coming a great experience. He gave us tips when we needed but held back when we thought we could figure it out. And when he wasn't sure, he asked! Great concept. (At times I feel like game masters give unwanted help - over-enthusiasm, which I understand, but can be a bit frustrating/annoying.) John was very friendly, positive and genuinely excited for us. He definitely added to the zombie escaping experience. I wish I could say we'd be back, but they need to make a new room first. Please do!

room_title: Escape room "They're Coming" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This is another great Maze Rooms location with quality escape rooms. We played all three games at this location back to back. My husband and I played them, just the 2 of us. We liked all of them. The set design and props are well done. Our favorite was They're Coming. I'm a fan of Evil Dead, so I loved all of nods to it. The puzzles were clever and fun. The set design and props were top notch. The story is clear.

room_title: Escape room "They're Coming" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I have done quite a few escape rooms and the "They're Coming" room has been one of my favorite ones to date. The production value was incredible and the room went through without a hitch. My inexperienced group and I got through the room with 5 minutes to spare using two hints. It had just the right amount of challenge to it, while still being creative, unique, and a little scary. Our game master was Joy and she made the experience immersive and was friendly and funny, making us want to come back to try the other rooms. 10/10

room_title: Escape room "The Secret of Dragon's Spire" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Aunt Edna's Condo" by Chico Escape Rooms in Chico
review: What a great time! If you haven't been here yet it's definitely a must!!! Aunt Edna's property managers were the best!!!

room_title: Escape room "Aunt Edna's Condo" by Chico Escape Rooms in Chico
review: We had a great time with Aunt Edna. Lots of laughs and fun. A must do again. Thank you for a unique experience.

room_title: Escape room "Aunt Edna's Condo" by Chico Escape Rooms in Chico
review: We tried both rooms back to back. These rooms are well planned out and executed. They are both challenging yet fair with the appropriate number of hints for both rooms. Our family loves escape rooms and these did not disappoint. Don't miss out, try both rooms! I would suggest starting with Aunt Edna first, then go on to the more challenging Baker Street. Wonderful owner and awesome lobby puzzles!

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: One of the most fun, most clever experiences ever! We took my husband here for his birthday and all 8 of us had a great time working together and trying to figure out the way out of the room! Thank you Golden Puzzle Rooms for a unique afternoon and we will definitely be back again!!

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: I took my husband for his birthday and he loved it. It was just the 2 of us in the room so there were just too many puzzles for us to complete. So definitely take more people. We had so much fun and will do this again!

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: Amazing and totally worth the money. Beat it with 5 mins to spare!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: This is the most amazing activity to engage in. You've got something good here, and I hope it continues to grow. My experience was so much fun, even though my group was soooooo frickin close but still soooo far away from completing the whole thing. I'll be back for new rooms & new puzzles. Thanks for this night of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: Diane is amazing! My daughter has not only loved learning to play immediately but has used it as her talent for school and pageant shows. We love the studio environment as well. Easy parking in quint downtown Roseville.

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: This is a a fun, challenging experience with numerous sophisticated puzzles to solve.

room_title: Escape room "The Vampire's Study" by Golden Puzzle Rooms in Sacramento
review: I won't give details; that would ruin the fun! And there was a tremendous amount of fun to be had. I will say that to get there, you need to go to the J St/K St alley on 10th St. The entrance is right next to Pre Flite bar. When it was time to get puzzling, Matthew the Butler came to fetch us and give us the lowdown. We didn't escape, but we were so close it made my heart hurt. Regardless, we had a spectacular time and it was well worth it! When they change it up, we absolutely will be back for more.

room_title: Escape room "The Smuggler" by Brainy Actz in Los Angeles
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Skeleton Key" by Game the Room in Rohnert Park
review: Our group of 6 (late teens and adults) had a great time with this game. Cleverly arranged, and just a few hints along the way helped us solve the puzzle with 20 seconds to spare.

room_title: Escape room "Skeleton Key" by Game the Room in Rohnert Park
review: Super fun and challenging. Operated by a husband and wife team. Wonderful people. Great addition to Rohnert Park. Definitely check them out!

room_title: Escape room "Skeleton Key" by Game the Room in Rohnert Park
review: Our group of 5 had an awesome time doing the Skeleton Key room today. Three of us had done escape rooms in the past, and two were rookies. All of us had a great time and can't wait to go back and do the other room. The owners were very kind and we enjoyed talking to them prior to doing the room. We are so glad we don't have to drive all the way to San Francisco to experience an escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We did the Spellbound room and it was really fun. No one will be bored at any point as there were a lot of puzzles. There are also a lot of locks but the puzzles to find the codes are varied. The best part was our game master. He was really nice and fun. Amazing energy. Definitely recommend checking it out.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Just did Spellbound tonight and had a great time. I have done 4 other ones, but for the rest of the group, it was their first. We were on the last clue when time ran out, but my friends had such a good time that we'll definitely be back. The clues were very thorough, interactive and seemed to be well thought out. This is a great family-friendly room as well.

room_title: Escape room "Spellbound" by Enchanted Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: We did the Spellbound room and liked a lot of things about it.  The decor/ambiance is really good and the puzzles are both fun and challenging.  It is different than other escape rooms that I've done in the past in that there are several objectives you are trying to complete, it's not the typical solving one puzzle leads to the next, leads to the next until you're free.  Because of the way it is structured, doing it with strangers is fine because they can be working on one puzzle while you work on another and if they find a clue for you or you find one of theirs you can share information, but multiple objectives can be getting done at the same time.  It was easy to get tickets and book through their online system and the guy who co-owns it was really nice and helpful. The building they chose for the location is great because it is on a rooftop and there is EASY parking in the back.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Time Machine 2" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: Our first experience in an escape room...and we loved it.  We really did feel as though we had stepped back in time.  A lot of fun puzzles/clues and the game/room master was very helpful with his hints.  There were four of us...we didn't escape, but we were soooo close!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Time Machine 2" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: The very first escape room my wife and I have ever done. Playing the "Time-Machine" room with just the two of us was challenging. The puzzles are easy enough to get you really going. Some puzzles within the game may seem to be overwhelming, but keep trying. Ask for help when you are really stuck. Their clues are not that vague to where it is confusing.A great place to have friends and family enjoy their time and co-workers to build teamwork! Definitely would return and play with friends and family!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Time Machine 2" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: This was my first escape room experience and it was super fun and really utilized our teamwork and collaboration skills! Definitely a brain exercise that makes you think outside the box and what was especially cool was the detail that made you feel like you stepped into a time machine! A must try!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Time Machine 2" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: This was my third escape room game, but I have to say it was a very good one! We were a group of five and had a blast during an hour. The different mysteries we had to solve were very well planned and new to everything I could have seen before. I would definitely recommend that to everyone (English speaking or not) who is ready for an hour of fun and excitement!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Time Machine 2" by Codebreakers in Oceanside
review: This was my and my boyfriend's first experience with an escape room -- and Codebreakers sets the bar high! Corrine, the owner, was extremely kind, genuine, personal, helpful, and reassuring, and her passion truly shined through in the conversations we had with her. The diner room's theming was super cute, the backstory was quite a bit of fun, and the technology associated within added a layer of fun interactivity. Each puzzle was exciting and fun, and it all seemed to flow together smoothy. Highly recommend for couples, families, business outings, team building, birthday parties, and any opportunity you're looking for to have some fun!

room_title: Escape room "Sweet Revenge" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Loved this escape room experience.  Kids were mostly 12 and it was a great level for them and super fun experience.

room_title: Escape room "Sweet Revenge" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: Went here for my first escape room experience and it was awesome! Sydney was our game master and she was incredible! We did the sweet revenge room. Would definitely recommend and would definitely go again

room_title: Escape room "Sweet Revenge" by Quandary Escape Rooms in Sacramento
review: This place is incredible!! Have done Locked In Dead and Sweet Revenge, and their rooms never cease to impress me. The staff is awesome, and the rooms are escape-able while being fun and challenging. Also, the tech inside both rooms blew me away. Highly recommend

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I came here with my family and we did the new room "The Seance". It was beyond amazing, production value was insane! There are some moments in the game that we really freaked out because it felt like the room is haunted.This room is on the scarier side. But we loved it! They have 4 other rooms that are not scary at all so we are also planning on trying them out in the next future.

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the Seance room and it was a great time. Barely made it out in time. Def worth a visit. Very well done and immersive.

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was a lot of fun! Definitely want to come back for the Crime Scene Room.

room_title: Escape room "The Seance" by Enigma Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience!!! Can't wait to go back and try another room!!

room_title: Escape room "The Villain's Lair" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: My wife and I as well as another couple had been referred to play here from owners of another escape room. We are so happy we went! The three games were all great. The Lab is a great intro room - tweens/teens would like it as would rookie escapers. We did AI and it was also fun. Villain’s Lair ended up being our favorite despite us not getting out (20 more seconds, so close!!). Sabrina was great as our game master and is definitely an asset to the company. Definitely check this place out if you like good and intuitive rooms with great scenery.

room_title: Escape room "The Villain's Lair" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: This is the 3rd escape room I've done, first two in LA. I thought this one was awesome! We did the villains lair (escaping a North Korean jail) that has a 23% pass rate. Our host was super nice in getting us set up and explaining things. Id recommend for sure and would be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Villain's Lair" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: Did both the newest Villain's Lair and the AI escape rooms here. I thought the AI room was more of a room that was rated 4, and the Villain's Lair a 4.5.Both rooms were extremely different, but very engaging. My group of six with varied levels of experience had a lot of fun trying to figure out the puzzles which required some thinking out of the box for both rooms and a lot of running around.I'd recommend at least a group of four for Villain's Lair and no less than four. I think we benefited from having six people because for both AI and Villain's Lair there were a couple puzzles that definitely helped having more people, not less, which is the opposite of what I find for most escape rooms. (I find 4 to be the perfect number). Having spent a lot of time surveying other escapers to find out what rooms would work for a larger group, we settled on Exit Game, and I'm glad we did! Escaping in time definitely relied on teamwork!For Villain's Lair there was a greater level of detail put into the room than in AI, and a lot less button pushing. However, there is one puzzle in Villain's Lair that requires a lot more abstract thinking and may or may not take your group longer to figure out. When we went, the "alarm" was speeding up which made a couple of us think we had lost and didn't escape when we still had 7 minutes left when we escaped! Since it was new to the San Diego space, we figured it was expected that they would still have issues and gave them feedback.For AI the details of the rooms were a lot less immersive than Villain's Lair, and I felt most of the puzzles required button pushing. I liked the use of technology and the use of a computer. A few of the puzzles really forced ourselves to think outside of the box. Once you have "escaped" you can choose to do hard mode, which our group chose to do.Villain's Lair we were told was a mix of traditional locks and technology (a mix of AI and The Lab basically), of which our group enjoyed more personally. AI is more technology and have no real locks that I can think of, and The Lab which we haven't done is more a traditional lock type room.I really liked our game master, who gave us appropriate clues without revealing too much, just the way we like it, via walkie talkies for both rooms.I'd definitely add Exit Games as one of the top Escape Room companies in San Diego. My group will be back to do their last room, The Lab.

room_title: Escape room "The Inheritance" by Vector Escape Games in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Magic Archive" by Excido Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Time Warp" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: My wife booked us and a few friends for 'The Time Warp' room. Can't think of a better way to spend a night out with friends or a date. Well worth it. We had a great time and hope to be back soon! Thanks!

room_title: Escape room "Time Warp" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: We had a lot of fun tonight! Escaped the time warp room with just a few minutes to spare! Awesome group night out!

room_title: Escape room "Time Warp" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: Great time tonight with family. We've done the Murder Mansion and tonight the Time Warp. Thank you Dylan!!! You did a great job and we are looking forward to the 13th Floor. This is a fantastic place to spend time together.

room_title: Escape room "Time Warp" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: Went to Escape Room for a friend's birthday, and we had so much fun! We did the 1974 Time Warp room, and we were quite close to solving it! Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Time Warp" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: This was the best birthday experience! Can't wait now to visit 13th Floor! Awesome staff! Clean! Safe and so fun!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard’s Redemption" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: I have now done two rooms here. Trespassed and Wizard's Redemption. Both experiences were awesome.The puzzles are fun and the designs of the rooms are well done - very detailed and immersive.  The game play is linear and so easy to follow what needs to be done next.Trespassed definitely has the creepy vibe going. Even the way you got hints was unique and fun. The Wizard's Redemption was even better! It is there newest room. The design was great. I love rooms that have automatic unlocking mechanisms once you solve a puzzle. Makes it more fun and "magical".The game masters are super nice and very helpful. Will definitely be planning more visits to their other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard’s Redemption" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: Shout out to California State Escapes!!! We escaped the wizards redemption room. 90 mins and no keypads or locks! It was amazing. Our game master was in character and very professional. We will definitely be back for more rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Wizard’s Redemption" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: This place is DOPE!!! Our first room we tried is Wizard's Redemption. I love Harry Potter so it's right up my alley. It is so immersive, and we loved that the puzzles were not just for combination locks. They varied and you use lots of different tools. We will definitely be coming back!!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Bomb Squad" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: We did it with friends and barely made it out alive. Dismantled the bomb with just 11 seconds left! Sooo much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Bomb Squad" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: This was so much fun! Something "different" to do!! It's so clever and intense trying to beat the clock on the ticking bomb. Will definitely be back!!!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Bomb Squad" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: I never thought I'd fall in love with a room.. But this room had me at poker table. Actually this was our first venture into an escape room and it was a blast. We didn't get out... missed it by () that much. Too fun though.

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Bomb Squad" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: This was awesome! Challenging but VERY fun! You'll see your friends in a whole new light after working to find clues and solve puzzles as a unit. Quite an exciting night out for not much money. We'll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Mafia Bomb Squad" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: Wow this was awesome!!! Definitely coming back to do the zombie room. We did the mafia bomb squad room and had a blast!!!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Russian Bomb Party" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Our family just left. This was our third room. We loved it! This time was difficult for us though. We tried the Russian Bomb Room. We escaped with less than a minute. We were thankful the staff gave us plenty of clues. If you get a chance to go, do! It's a great time for all. A little aggravating but fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Russian Bomb Party" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Went together with friends from work and did the Russian Bomb Party. It was insanely difficult but so much fun! We're already planning our next trip!

room_title: Escape room "The Russian Bomb Party" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Had a BLAST in the Russian Bomb room! Sorry people we failed to save the city but we gave it our best!

room_title: Escape room "The Russian Bomb Party" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Our family went and did the Russian Bomb room! We all had a great time. We did not finish in time so the city blew up and we killed millions... We can't wait to go back and do another one!

room_title: Escape room "The Russian Bomb Party" by Locked Away Escapes in Jonesboro
review: Oh my! We came here from Memphis and rocked the Russian Bomb Party! So close, but we didn't make it. We'll definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by The Great Escape Clovis in Fresno
review: Our family chose to do an escape room as part of our annual birthday celebration. All but one of us were 1st timers and we had a great time. The Heist room was challenging and our guide gave us excellent directions and some helpful hints.It was the only escape venue I could find that was open on a Wednesday and it a great first experience! We'll be back.

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Coming back for more👍🏻 staff was extremely helpful.

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: Great! Disappointed we didn’t get probed in Area 51 tho...

room_title: Escape room "Area 51" by Escape Room Salinas in Salinas
review: This was really fun my husband and I enjoyed it for our Anniversary. I highly recommend you start with couples then expend to groups. It was a great experience with us since we both love gaming and solving puzzles together. We almost made too . It's a small place but it was a great experience and good practice of team work.

room_title: Escape room "Wicked Witch's Castle" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Our group of 6 did the Wicked Witch (Oz) room. This was our first time at Eludesions and we had heard that in Arizona, they probably average the largest sized rooms. It didn't disappoint! The design, props, decoration, and interactive puzzles we're very fun, tricky, and unique. We were definitely helped by our game master, as we got stuck in a couple parts, which after receiving a clue, it all made sense. So if you're used to letter locks and combo locks, you'll be challenged in this room. I would definitely recommend this room! The staff were very laid back and fun. Also, I spoke with a female staff member over the phone regarding a question I had, and she was very helpful in helping me find an answer. Then to my surprise, Bob the owner, calls me back regarding this question, and clarified the answer. He's definitely someone who's business I would like to support. Very generous gentleman, and I appreciate his customer service and business acumen. Our group will definitely come back to try all of the rooms at Eludesions (we learned it's pronounced like "illusions").

room_title: Escape room "Wicked Witch's Castle" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Me and my wife had the pleasure of experiencing not one but two rooms here. We loved the first room so much (Wicked Witches Castle) that we wanted to do another one right after (Runestone). Both rooms had fantastic set designs and the puzzles were unique and definitely generation 3. Both of our game masters, Ahmed and Kyle were great as well. We will definitely be returning to do their other two rooms soon!

room_title: Escape room "Wicked Witch's Castle" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: Amazing rooms, interactive props and unique puzzles! Escape room enthusiasts, this is your Phoenix destination. Wonderland and Wicked Witch are my most recommended

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Magic School" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Whole family did the Merlin's Magic School Adventure and escaped without about 8 minutes to spare. We had SO MUCH FUN!!! This room was totally family friendly, though some of the others I would say are more adult themed(ie. Jack the Ripper)

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Magic School" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: This was my first time experience at the escape room. My game master was K2. I must say she was extremely helpful especially when we needed it the most. We did the Merlin’s room and we all loved and enjoyed every moment of it. The very best part is we solved the puzzle! Will definitely repeat! Thank you so much K2 you are the best!

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Magic School" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: We had a great time. The Merlin Magic and Vampire rooms are fantastic!  They were challenging and unique.  Loved the family time spent! Thank you Cody, KC, Queen, and Dominique!

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Magic School" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: We took my sister in law and 7-year-old son through the Merlin's Magic School escape room. Ema was a GREAT host!  She guided us through the story with ease and was patient. It was a first escape room experience for all of us, and it won't be the last!

room_title: Escape room "Merlin's Magic School" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Merlin's Magic School ranks as one of my top two favorite escape rooms of all time! We've done countless rooms all over the Denver area back home and in various cities where my family vacations. We were so impressed that we had to do a second room on our final night in town. Highly recommend this place because the puzzles are unique and challenging, and the rooms are wicked cool!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: I came here for my bachelor party and had a blast! The owner Jeff was great and made it very special for us. The escape room was a good balance of being clever, challenging, and fun. Thank you Jeff for making this special time even better! This escape room rocks!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: This place was truly a blast! The owners are really friendly and make it enjoyable. Mentally challenging and exhilarating! Definitely coming back!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Inland Empire Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: We’ve done a lot of escape rooms. And this Saturday night we did the Heist. It was definitely a good room, made you really think outside of the box.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: Me and my fiance had a blast! They were all so nice. We figured out some of the riddles on the stairs before starting the game. When we escaped at the end the pictures taken were the result.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: Funnest game room we have been in. Great theme and effects. Had a fantastic time with the family and met some new friends too.

room_title: Escape room "Sherlock's Study" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: We had so much fun in the Sherlock Holmes room here!! The rooms are beautifully and thoughtfully decorated and the games are perfectly designed to keep you engaged and having fun! Highly recommend signing up for a game or two or three...we can’t wait to return and try another room!!

room_title: Escape room "Flashback to the 80's!" by Down the Rabbit Hole in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Cell" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Super difficult room! We barely made it, but had a ton of fun. Chris was exceptional at explaining the rules and storyline. 10/10 would recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Cell" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Loved everything about our experience here. The staff was encouraging, friendly, and explained everything perfectly. The room was incredibly challenging and our team of 6 made it out with only 38 seconds left! You really feel immersed in the storyline. We'll definitely be coming back to try another room!

room_title: Escape room "The Cell" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: Ten highly intelligent people worked The Cell. It was incredibly challenging. We did not escape, however had a "blast" trying to. The studios are clean, staff was friendly. I would recommend for a work team, a birthday party, or just a great night out. Other rooms are smaller, we would have had to split up. Thanks to the Team and the staff at Dare to Escape. At least we dared!

room_title: Escape room "The Cell" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: This was our first trip to Dare to Escape. We chose The Cell because of the difficulty level. It was fun, well presented and challenging! Our group of 6 escaped!!! I am excited to go back and Dare to Escape the other 2 rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Cell" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: First time doing an escape room, and this was awesome! So many things to look for and determine which are clues, but it kept you busy and entertained. Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Cell" by Dare To Escape AZ in Phoenix
review: One of the best rooms I have ever done. Story, design, game flow all top notch. Staff was very friendly and show a passion for the industry. A+++ 5 Star.

room_title: Escape room "The Ruins of The Tukanii" by The Game Room Adventure Cafe in Sacramento
review: This was my birthday present from my daughters and grandson. It was the best Adventure ever. Loved the Indiana Jones theme, the puzzles and the craftsmanship of the designs. I highly recommend it for anyone!

room_title: Escape room "The Ruins of The Tukanii" by The Game Room Adventure Cafe in Sacramento
review: My coworkers and I came here, and we loved it. We successfully completed the ruins of the tukanii, and can't wait for more. The staff was super welcoming. I would definitely return to this place.

room_title: Escape room "Jester's Revenge" by No. 1 Escapes in Los Angeles
review: Jester's Revenge was AWESOME! I thought the room was very creative and a lot of the puzzles/challenges were well thought out. We had a group of 7 and that seemed like the perfect size for this escape particular escape room. We managed to finish but barely did it on time! The girl who helped us there was extremely nice as well and she made sure that all of us had a good time! Definitely going back to try the other room out next!

room_title: Escape room "Jester's Revenge" by No. 1 Escapes in Los Angeles
review: Had so much fun here! The staff was super friendly and helpful. Allison was super sweet and very patient with us since it was only our second time doing an escape room. We loved the first room so much (Jesters Revenge) that we decided to do the second room (Treasure of the Nation) that same night and what's great is that if you do a second ro that same day, they will give you 20% off!

room_title: Escape room "Jester's Revenge" by No. 1 Escapes in Los Angeles
review: The eight of us went here for the first time and Alison was our Jester. It was such a fun, challenging experience for a group.  Very hard to figure out but worth the time it takes.  Would do it again.

room_title: Escape room "Jester's Revenge" by No. 1 Escapes in Los Angeles
review: I have done both rooms, and this is one of my favorite escape room operations in the country! Creative, logical puzzles and high tech effects. We enjoyed it very much!

room_title: Escape room "Jester's Revenge" by No. 1 Escapes in Los Angeles
review: We did the Jester’s Revenge. This was probably the best escape room I’ve done. The people who designed it created fun, challenging, and unique puzzles. I thought the design was well laid out and you had to work together with your other teammates to figure out the solutions. All of the employees were so friendly and kind. We spoke to Brandon on the phone and he warmly explained everything to us in detail. Then we had a friendly woman who set us up acted as our jester. She made the experience even more fun. I was very impressed and I’m so looking forward to trying their other room!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Tomb" by Escape Westgate in Phoenix
review: It was a wonderful time for first timers to the Escape Room experience. Highly recommend. The staff was fantastic.

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Tomb" by Escape Westgate in Phoenix
review: I just completed their Lost Tomb escape room and it is easily one of the best escape rooms of the 30-40 I've ever done. It was almost like walking onto the set of Legends of the Hidden Temple. It really sold the atmosphere of being inside a temple, and aside from a bit of a very minor frustration with one specific searching puzzle I had no real issues of note. I will definitely be back for their Bill and Ted and Terminator rooms and will be recommending them to all my friends who like escape rooms. If you are looking for a really well done room I recommend Escape Westgate, you'll have a fantastic time. Plus one the owners look like Michael Douglas so that a bonus!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Tomb" by Escape Westgate in Phoenix
review: We went for a friends birthday party here and had a blast. We did the lost tomb theme and it was challenging and exciting. The rooms were really well done and the staff was great. Great experience for a great price ! Can't wait to do the terminator theme coming up!

room_title: Escape room "The Lost Tomb" by Escape Westgate in Phoenix
review: Went here on a field trip with daughter and class and we did the lost tomb escape room which was really cool , It has multiple rooms and definitely a lot of intricate clues you need to solve . It was a little difficult but with 10 of us we were able to get through it with 20 minutes left which was pretty quick. This is definitely good for kids and adults , great props and design put into this . Can't wait to try the terminator room next .

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Escape Room Long Beach in Los Angeles
review: Booked Prohibition for my birthday with two of my friends. It was our first time for all of us, so we had no idea what to expect. Little did I know the Prohibition room was the more difficult of the two - so we didn't make it out before the 60 mins. We had a great time though and felt very proud of ourselves for getting as far as we did. Our host was very generous with the hints, since we kept running around the room asking questions. Very fun, will do again but with a bigger group. Thanks!

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Escape Room Long Beach in Los Angeles
review: It was definitely a good work event.... It's not boring and was a good first time. I have no complaints. Very well managed and pleasant, fun, and professional staff. The location was clean and a safety briefing conducted.

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Escape Room Long Beach in Los Angeles
review: My friends and I had a really great time! I have done several escape rooms in the LA area and this by far was the most creative and challenging. You can tell they put alot of energy into creating a fun and exciting atmosphere. Great job guys!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Did the prison break. Very nicely set up. Mechanics are incredibly creative. Coming back next week to try the others.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: Our group of 8 did the Prison Break escape room and succeeded in escaping in their hardest room. Some of us consider ourselves useless in escape rooms but we had a good time. While there were a lot of puzzles and hidden objects to solve, the game is as hard as you want to make it because a lot of clues are given even if you don't ask for them. If you want to make the game harder, probably tell the game keeper that you do not want clues given unless you ask. Overall would recommend if you are wanting to be challenged but not so much so that you feel like you have no chance of escaping. Paris was our game keeper and she was definitely keeping an eye out for us and letting us know what illegal things we were doing (like climbing...) and giving us relevant clues. Wish there was more of a celebration after the game like having signs to hold up for pictures.

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: My boyfriend and I walked past the location in SF and we were greeted by a very friendly worker who explained everything to us! We booked the Prison Break room that same day, and it was a completely new experience. We had so much unexpected fun and would recommend this to anyone just looking for a fun thing to do!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: It was most amazing experience!! We did the Prison Break escape room as a family. We were joined by another family. Right from the get go the immersive experience began with a very well done setup. Teamwork and communication is very important and we were lucky to have a great dynamic going.The puzzles were fairly challenging but the thrill of cracking the clues was exhilarating. The solutions didn't cease to surprise.The team at the Escape Games is phenomenal! Very personable and super nice. Would especially like to mention Emily and Jackie who helped out tonight.Highly recommend this place to families - my daughter (7.5 years old) is hooked!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by The Escape Game San Francisco in San Francisco
review: This place is so nice and inviting that my friends and I will keep going till we finish all the rooms.  We just finished the prison break room and it was so amazing and immersive.  What was so great was that Jeff and gurion were so accommodating to one of our teammates being late.  It was great having the full time and for them to allow us to wait and do the room together.  We are definitely coming back to do every room and finish them all.  Best kind of service and such intuitive rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Gallery 3919" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Super fun place with very friendly staff... We had a blast... We'll definitely be back!!

room_title: Escape room "Gallery 3919" by Escapism in San Diego
review: We escaped from Gallery 3919! It was so much fun, I highly recommend it. My hubby and I used a terrific LivingSocial deal that made it very affordable. Best date night ever! We combined with two smaller groups to make one large team. We were all newbies but managed to escape with 7 minutes to spare. We loved it and will definitely be back when the next room opens.

room_title: Escape room "Gallery 3919" by Escapism in San Diego
review: This place is AMAZING!! The girls had a great time (as didthe adults)! We went with a younger group (ages 9-11) and the gentleman that worked there was awesome. When he saw the girls struggling he would give them a little hint to help them along. Definitely will be doing this again. It's a little pricey but definitely worth it, it's a unique, creative experience.Thanks for everything Escapism

room_title: Escape room "Gallery 3919" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Great escape room! It was our group's first room and we all had lots of fun. We had a group of five and were able to complete the room. Overall the room was tons of fun. I would recommend this room to everyone!

room_title: Escape room "Gallery 3919" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Well, how can I not give it 5 stars when we beat the room time record! This was not my first escape room, and I'd say it's right up there with my favorites. Good series of challenges that are thought-inducing and challenging, but not too impossibly hard that you just get frustrated. It's well organized and professionally run. The art gallery theme plays nicely into the challenges too. Definitely recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Gallery 3919" by Escapism in San Diego
review: I've done a few of these escape/puzzle rooms, and Escapism is by far the best one.  It is challenging and fun.  You do have the option to ask for clues, which we tried not to do.  This is a great activity for a group of close friends.  I DO NOT recommend this activity for couples who are just dating. This game can get rough and a bit physical since a lot of the clue will require you to get on your knees (not a clue).  A group of 8 might be too much energy and too confusing.  A group of 4-6 is good.

room_title: Escape room "Gallery 3919" by Escapism in San Diego
review: Awesome experience! Super friendly staff, all of whom were very helpful.  Our group of 8 decided to try out this escape room and were greatly pleased.  We did the Art Museum escape room, and there was a great number of puzzles for our group to solve.  There were a number of very innovative and unique puzzles, and it also had a good number of creepy, twists and turns (although nothing scary)!  I would love to explain more, but I don't want to give anything away.We had to use one hint, but we made it out with 15 minutes to spare.  Definitely looking forward to trying their next room.

room_title: Escape room "Abstrusus Museum" by The Experience Escape Rooms in Centerton
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Box" by Escape Enterprise in Daleville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Zombie" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: It was fun, pretty challenging at the medium level but it was my first time. Worth it. I did the zombie room.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: Let me just say from the point of walking in, you'll fall in love with the decor, absolutely beautiful. My friend and I did the Zombie themed room, and believe me when I tell you this room is not easy at all, but fun once you figure out the clues and you progress through the puzzles. Didn't make it out in time as we had 2 puzzles left, but it only makes us wanna come back and try another room. The teammate Rebecca was awesome! She was very friendly and you could tell she loves her job! We'll definitely come back because she insists that Daycare will give us an experience we won't forget. Thanks Escape Hotel and Rebecca!

room_title: Escape room "Zombie" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: We had a great time here!! The hotel itself is beautifully done and the staff were all so nice!! It was harder than we thought. Which is a good thing! We did the zombie room and it was a blast. Definitely need three people for it. We're looking forward to going back and trying a different room!! Have fun!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: It was a great time and you really had to be a super sleuth for the heist room!

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: We had such an amazing time. Didn't think that it would be this fun, and definitely didn't think it would be this challenging. We didn't make it out, but still tons of fun! Thank you for the experience. We will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "The Heist" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: Our team helped get $90 million in The Heist! The puzzles are fun to solve and really get you thinking about everything you're looking at.I highly recommend Escape Sacramento for a fun group activity, be it for a birthday, a team building exercise, or just an excuse to get together with friends for a fun series of challenges.Looking forward to going here more in the future!

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Hunters" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: This was my family's first time doing an escape room.  The host couldn't have been much nicer.  He was friendly and inviting.  The ambiance was warm.  They have lockers so you can store your personal belongings while you are in the escape room.  Puzzle are fun.  Even the easier riddles/puzzles can be challenging when out under pressure.  You are given an hour to escape the room.  Definitely coming back to try the other themed rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Hunters" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: I've been to all the rooms here! I've also been to many escape rooms but I think some of the escape rooms here have been my favorite. You definitely have to work fast and open minded. The only room we did not pass was a very new one, paranormal, which was too difficult. I would recommend them to have a beta testing period and have the prices of the room be even cheaper so they can figure out what works best for the room. Overall, my friend and I always have a blast here and feel accomplished after beating the rooms...which cannot be said for most other places! We are team #blackhat, remember it!

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Hunters" by PuzzleMazement in Los Angeles
review: I've been here twice for the Doll House and Ghost Hunters rooms. Both were challenging but very fair. The puzzles sometimes require thinking out of the box but nothing too complicated. The games were slightly spooky but as they state, they are family friendly and their purpose is not to scare you so no jump scares or anything. The workers are extremely friendly and helpful.I would totally recommend this to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "Double Agent General" by Great Escape Maricopa in Phoenix
review: great fun and challenging! My wife and I really enjoyed ourselves.

room_title: Escape room "Double Agent General" by Great Escape Maricopa in Phoenix
review: As someone who has never been in an escape room, this experience in the Double Agent General room was AMAZING! Our host, Carl helped make our escape one of a kind. He was incredibly accommodating and informative throughout the entire process. Alan gave us a helpful intro tutorial and answered all of the (many) questions we had. The facility was clean and the room & the props in it were realistic. The difficulty level was undoubtedly enough to keep us fully engaged and with Carl's monitoring, we never felt discouraged. We loved it so much we booked the other Professor Ransom PhD room for tomorrow. I would highly recommend checking out the Great Escape Maricopa!

room_title: Escape room "Double Agent General" by Great Escape Maricopa in Phoenix
review: We had an absolute blast!! It was very entertaining the whole time. We look forward to trying another room at the same location.

room_title: Escape room "The Elevator" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: "The truth will set you free, but first it will piss you off!"  --Gloria SteinemI love the Exodus has an escape room for smaller parties.  Our little group of four smarty-pants.... rather, three smarty-pants and one very short but enthusiastic cheerleader (that would be me by the way), had a blast in The Elevator scenario which was perfect for a group of four!  The puzzles were challenging and fun.  The environment was themed so well!  They even had elevator music playing as we worked our way around each dilemma.  We escaped in time, and made the leader board for about 5 minutes as I'm sure other teams have beaten that record by now.  Still, we were proud of it and it was such a fantastic experience for our friends visiting from Oregon!The service was wonderful and the young lady who helped us (she told us her name a few times but I have the memory of a goldfish) was utterly helpful and delightful to talk to.  A young man also game out to greet us, who very much seemed like he was very knowledgeable about the rooms.  Anyway, I digress.  Exodus is fantastic.  And it's located right by an In-N-Out if all that thinking got you hungry.

room_title: Escape room "The Elevator" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Have done all the rooms here. Last one we did was submarine which was a little bit frustrating but other than that it was good. Favorite room was elevator, make sure you try that out. Puzzles were good and for a room with not a lot of room to work with or tech they made it work. Shoutout to Beth who helped us both times we were there!

room_title: Escape room "The Elevator" by Exodus Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The 5 stars is for BETH & the escape rooms! It was my first time doing an escape room and Beth made my experience great. 10/10 would recommend going here! Beth was so funny & friendly. We did the Sherlock Study Holiday version & the Elevator one. Both were so much fun and challenging!

room_title: Escape room "Terminal" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: Unfortunately I can't give this escape room a good review. I've participated in 40+ escape rooms in the Phoenix area and this room was by far my worst experience out of all of them. On the plus side, the room was very well decorated and the experience was immersive, however the train car motion actually caused some pretty moderate nausea with no way to turn it off until the first puzzle was solved. The remaining portion of the room had a set of adequate puzzles, but then 2 longer puzzles that were simply annoyingly tedious, it never felt like we achieved anything when solving the puzzles.We didn't escape the room, however in similar situations in other rooms we have enjoyed laughing about where we made mistakes and how we could do better and appreciating the design of the puzzles - this room only left us frustrated and annoyed.These complaints are probably causes or magnified by the fact that, from our perspective, our GM was either ignoring our group, and the clues we did receive seemed to be lacking or were significantly delayed from when we did ask for help.Considering the premium cost of these rooms, we will unfortunately not be returning to finish their other rooms unlike the dozen or other companies that we have "cleared out". I really had such high expectations and never have been so disappointed with an escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Terminal" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: Place is great. We've done zombie, and terminal. Both were fun, and will be back for spell bound. Hope more rooms come soon!

room_title: Escape room "Terminal" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: Excellent sets, total immersion. The GM goes above and beyond to ensure customers have a great experience. Highly recommend trying Terminal. We had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Terminal" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: My husband and I visited MindSpark last night. I was nervous at first because we knew we'd be placed with a random group since there were only 2 of us. However, we actually had an amazing time and our group was great. We did the Terminal room which was very fun, interactive, and challenging. Both of us had a blast and would highly recommend. Hopefully we can go again soon and check out one of the other two challenges.

room_title: Escape room "Terminal" by Great Room Escape in Phoenix
review: I can't believe how awesome this place was! It was my first time, but my son has been to a few other places before and said this was by far the best! The Terminal room was well thought-out and addictive. The staff was helpful and seemed to really love their job! I am going back to do the zombie one for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Trespassed" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: Awesome Place! The host was very nice and friendly! The experience was amazing! Highly recommend the Trespassed escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Trespassed" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: We did the Trespassed room and it was so much fun and challenging but so much fun! Can’t wait to do the rest of them!

room_title: Escape room "Trespassed" by California State Escape in Sacramento
review: Did Tresspassed with the hubby. Difficult but so fun!! Can’t wait to go back! Totally worth the experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Pawn Shop" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: This experience is truly one of a kind, but not just because of the so many things to unveil and solve in the room, but to the owner and creator of this place! Jo is one of a kind!!! She is the one who will take you from having fun to having a blast! I can't say enough good things about her!MUST TRY!

room_title: Escape room "The Pawn Shop" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: This was our first escape room and although my 5 friends and I were a step away from completing the Pawn Shop room in time, the experience was as fulfilling as it was challenging. Casey was extremely friendly and gave thoughtful and clever hints without revealing too much. Definitely recommend for any parties/birthday celebrations!

room_title: Escape room "The Pawn Shop" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: I've never done an escape room before so I was excited to see what this would be like. We did the Pawn Shop setup. It was a lot of fun! We unfortunately did not complete it all in the hour but it was great! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who enjoys puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "The Pawn Shop" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: Did the Pawn Shop last night and it was epic. Kai is the man, he was great and incredibly enthusiastic. I've now done all the rooms and can't wait for them to have some more.

room_title: Escape room "The Principal's Office" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We were in the principal's office. There were six of us and we got out with 4 seconds to spare. It was great. Cannot wait to do Alcatraz and the Great Outdoors.

room_title: Escape room "The Principal's Office" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This time I did the Principal's Office at the moderate level. We only had 4 seconds left, so glad it wasn't the difficul level. I've done the Alcatraz and Great Outdoors. All three provide an awesome experience. I would recommend this venue over many other escape rooms in the valley.

room_title: Escape room "The Principal's Office" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: It's hard these days to find an activity for all ages to enjoy, but The Principal's Room, did just that. Forget bowling, movies, the water park, the local amusement park or the fair. Our family, from age 5-68, had a BLAST and everyone was able to participate in the puzzle solving! We left already planning our next escape activity.

room_title: Escape room "The Principal's Office" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We did the Principals Office and this was a challenging and fun experience. My husband and daughter had a blast solving the puzzles. Highly recommend! So much fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Principal's Office" by North Valley Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We've tried other escape rooms in the valley and this one is the best. Full of surprises and so much fun! We have had several birthday parties here. They even have a challenge for kids called The Principal's Office. All the kids loved it!

room_title: Escape room "Arizona Shootout" by Escapology Montgomery in Montgomery
review: This is so much fun for a family outing, a date night, or a girls night out. I've done Arizona Shootout and Antidote and they were both expertly decorated, uniquely challenging rooms. You really get lost in the experience!

room_title: Escape room "AgXscape" by Hilmar Cheese Company Visitor Center in Modesto
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Lair "Z"" by Breakout Escape Rooms in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Escape Yager’s Tap House" by Escape Folsom in Sacramento
review: This was a great time! We booked an entire room for 7 friends. The whole experience was perfect and we got out of the room in time for trivia night at the bar.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Yager’s Tap House" by Escape Folsom in Sacramento
review: My husband and I have done a ton of escape rooms, and the Yager's Tap House room was one of the first ones we've done that I wasn't sure we would make it out of! (For the record, we did make it out with 5 minutes to spare, but it was challenging!) Super fun. Our host was awesome, the room was the right balance of fun and challenging, and the building itself has a really neat history. I also appreciated that the room theme wasn't super dark or creepy--it was lighthearted and there was great 80's music playing throughout! We're excited to check out the Prison escape room next.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Yager’s Tap House" by Escape Folsom in Sacramento
review: Excellent escape room/bar/restaurant! I did the Yager's bar escape room with some friends and we were able to get out in 53 minutes. I highly recommend this place! I will be coming back to try the prison escape room!

room_title: Escape room "Classroom Lockdown" by The Excape Adventure in Modesto
review: I really enjoyed the escape room. It was exciting and fun. I honestly did not think I was going to have as much fun as I did mainly because I knew next to no one in my group but it was great! I recommend this activity to anyone looking for a fun hour adventure.

room_title: Escape room "Classroom Lockdown" by The Excape Adventure in Modesto
review: It was a fun experience. We all had fun. I think it will make a good team building activity too!

room_title: Escape room "The Disappearance at Fogmore Manor" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: Really fun and engaging. I had only been to one other escape room and it was not so great, so I was kind of skeptical about trying another one. My husband and I did this one by ourselves. I was impressed with the thought and attention to details that went into this one. The level of difficulty was good for us but we did not manage to escape because we got stuck on one or two of the puzzles. We will go back again soon to finish it. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Disappearance at Fogmore Manor" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: This was insanely fun. Interesting puzzles, great tech. 10/10. 6 person cap so you can do it privately easy.

room_title: Escape room "The Disappearance at Fogmore Manor" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: This was a really fun experience!! I would definitely recommend trying it out! It was really creative and was a good challenge!

room_title: Escape room "The Disappearance at Fogmore Manor" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: Fantastic experience at The Entrapment! Great story and great puzzles. Highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "The Disappearance at Fogmore Manor" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: Very well-thought out escape room with consistent and engaging theme throughout. Increasingly challenging puzzles that are fun and interesting to solve. Best escape room we played in SanDiego so far. A good time all around!

room_title: Escape room "The Disappearance at Fogmore Manor" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: Did this with a group of friends and was not disappointing. The room was challenging filled with high and low tech puzzles, superb decor and lots of attention to detail. Highly recommended.

room_title: Escape room "The Disappearance at Fogmore Manor" by The Entrapment in San Diego
review: I will start with a disclosure that I'm friends with the owner and have been doing puzzle races with him for more than ten years now. However, I didn't help plan or test The Entrapment. I was actually proud to be one of its first official customers. I've done a few escape rooms and always felt that the puzzles were disconnected and lacking in innovation or just so random that they weren't enjoyable...none of that applies to The Entrapment! This escape room consisted of a variety of incredibly clever puzzles (of just the right difficulty) woven together in a story that made the experience unique and challenging. I loved that that there was a theme and story for the whole experience. Each object in the room was relevant and purposeful and added ambience. This is unlike the other escape rooms I've done that seemed to be full of completely unrelated puzzles or random office supplies that were intended to be puzzles. The story helped make the puzzles solvable and kept you connected to what was going on. I LOVED all of it and I can't wait until Scott creates another room to escape from!! In the mean time, get your friends together and book a time now!!!

room_title: Escape room "Time Travel - Chapter 1 VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Such an immersive experience! Really tests your teamwork and communication!

room_title: Escape room "Time Travel - Chapter 1 VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Most likely the most impressive

room_title: Escape room "Time Travel - Chapter 1 VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: LOVE this place. If you want a a unique experience you are in for a treat. Great staff great place. I was impress

room_title: Escape room "Time Travel - Chapter 1 VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience! Must-do in LA! We absolutely loved it

room_title: Escape room "Time Travel - Chapter 1 VR" by Virtual Room Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience totally worth the price fun for the whole family.

room_title: Escape room "The Conquered Embassy" by The Escape Little Rock in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Hourglass 2.0" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: It was our son's 12th birthday, and our first time at an escape room. Isaac was so accommodating with our booking time and our host Joe was super friendly and nice. Hourglass 2.0 was not too easy or hard, but the room was really interesting. We are going back to do Harvest Motel very, very soon!

room_title: Escape room "Hourglass 2.0" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: A very nice escape room to do with the family and also the kids. We went with our little family and we had a great time solving the puzzles and having fun with the kids.The story is nice, not scary and the puzzles are very original. So you can come with your kids and see them have fun helping you finding the clues. Jo was a very nice host and made us feel comfortable.We did it ! And we had a 'bonus' room to do that was very nice too.3rd Day Escape are a great team, always very friendly and funny ! Thanks to Jo and Isaac for welcoming us to this Hourglass and to The Harvest Motel.For sure, highly recommended !!

room_title: Escape room "Hourglass 2.0" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: This was our first escape experience and it was a phenomenal first experience. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. They took care to reassure our 10 year old that it wasn't going to be too scary. The game itself is well laid out with a good balance of challenges. It was a great time and we look forward to trying other games from 3rd Day Escape.

room_title: Escape room "Hourglass 2.0" by 3rd Day Escape in San Diego
review: Joe was awesome! Had a great time and really enjoyed the hour glass room, had a group of 5 one of which was my 10-year-old son and it was perfect for us!

room_title: Escape room "Fresno Has Fallen" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: We had so much fun tonight in the Bunker Room! 1st time and all so excited! We all played a part to get us out!

room_title: Escape room "Fresno Has Fallen" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: We had so much fun tonight in the Bunker Room! 1st time and all so excited! We all played a part to get us out!

room_title: Escape room "Fresno Has Fallen" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: Bunker Room would be great for first timers, but is a bit easy for experienced folks. The locks malfunctioned on us on the Murder Scene, but that was still a great room. A lot of fun overall!

room_title: Escape room "Bloody Elbow" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: We did both rooms at the Quest Room. We were very close to getting out of the harder room (Da Vinci) and got out of the Bloody Elbow room. The theme of the second room was on point. Both rooms were very well done and came with wearable props. Our gamemaster was awesome and enthusiastic. Also loved the tea provided between rooms. Great puzzles, great themes, and private bookings. Would definitely do their next room.

room_title: Escape room "Bloody Elbow" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: We played Bloody Elbow and could not have had more fun if we tried. The quality of the room was unbelievable, and our game master Daniel was a super fun and helpful host. The room has puzzles that are super inventive and give a real sense of accomplishment when you solve them, making every puzzle you figure out feel like a well deserved victory. Can't wait to come back!

room_title: Escape room "Bloody Elbow" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: This is a must do escape room!! So unique compared to any other rooms I have done. I’ve been to rooms all over the country and world. Most games will focus on a multitude of locks/keys or numbers. “Bloody Elbow” only requires 1 key and no numbers. This made the game feel way more immersive and intuitive. It felt as if I was escaping like I would in real life. Physical activity required was such a good element! Highly recommend if your in the LA area.

room_title: Escape room "Bloody Elbow" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: I have done many escape rooms, and this one was by far the best. It wasn't even a contest. For starters, the guy who greeted us at the door was insanely nice, and helped set the mood for "The Bloody Elbow". The puzzles were all perfectly on theme and none of them felt "tacked on" at all. The set pieces were highly interactive, beautifully done, and larger than most rooms. Everything fit and gave a real sense of progression. I can't give enough praise to this experience. If you are thinking about trying it out, just do it. I give my word that you will have an absolute blast. Looking forward to their new experiences. I plan on trying them all.

room_title: Escape room "Bloody Elbow" by Quest Room in Los Angeles
review: Played the "Bloody Elbow" room this past week. It was really fun and well themed. The atmosphere was scary, but not terrifying and the props were of really high quality. This was my first time doing an escape room and it was definitely harder than I anticipated! Luckily, we had some tips from a fellow "prisoner" to help us through. You won't play with any strangers so make sure you bring a group of 3 to 5 people. I want to go back and try the DaVinci room now!

room_title: Escape room "Hospital of Horror VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: Took my sister here and we did the VR- Hospital of Horrors experience. It was AMAZING! Staff is so friendly, and was extremely helpful. Will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Global National" by Next-Gen Escape in Fresno
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Get a Clue in Orange Beach
review: Our family went to get a clue and escaped the Crime Scene. It was really fun and the owner really knew how to give the right amount of clues to keep the game going without giving too much away. If you're looking for a fun way to kill an hour I recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Get a Clue in Orange Beach
review: This was the first escape room we have ever done and had a great time. We had our 10 yo, 13 yo and 4 adults and we all had fun. We did the Crime Scene Room and definitely recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Get a Clue in Orange Beach
review: We have done a lot of escape rooms and Get A Clue is awesome! The Crime Scene Room has been my favorite of all the rooms I've done anywhere. It's so challenging, smart, and fun!

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Get a Clue in Orange Beach
review: What a fun time we had! The owners are great people and went out of their way to make it an exciting game/time for us. We escaped the Crime Scene and are looking forward to trying out the Mardi Gras room (and the newest room sometime soon.

room_title: Escape room "Crime Scene" by Get a Clue in Orange Beach
review: We played the Crime Scene room and it was well thought out and a great time! The owner is very kind & helpful. Will definitely be back when we are back in Foley!

room_title: Escape room "Atlantis" by Escape Room LA in Los Angeles
review: I went back to Escape Room LA and played their newest room -- The Atlantis. Like all of their rooms, it's beautiful. It features a variety of different types and levels of puzzles. It's the perfect room for experienced enthusiasts as well as newcomers because there is a lot to do in this room. It's absolutely beautiful!I really like their rooms and for someone who tends to not like public bookings, this company's public booking policy doesn't bother me. For this room, I usually end up playing with a lot of newcomers and they tend to be quite easy going and terrific at working together. It's fun meeting new people and seeing what they come up with and finding solutions together. Because I've played their rooms before, it's easy to navigate and know when the in room game master is providing subtle hints, which are very useful. Watch your in room game master. If she/he is looking at something, it's probably best if a couple of people in your group see what they are looking at because there is an order to solving the puzzles in the different rooms.In terms of parking, I've usually found metered parking or I've walked to the venue or even have taken the subway and walked a little bit. The area is not fancy, but what area is in downtown Los Angeles.I like Escape Room LA's rooms a lot. I think their set designs are phenomenal and a bar above what many others are doing.

room_title: Escape room "Down the Rabbit Hole" by Trapped! Escape Room Upland in Pomona
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Zylchov's Laboratory" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: My sisters and I did the Laboratory.Our host was completely in character, and even though we did not escape, we had such a great time. Would love to go back and try all of the offered rooms.I would highly recommend trying this experience!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Zylchov's Laboratory" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: Went to Escape Out in Folsom on mother's day as a group of 4 and played the lab room. The designers made great use of the space they had to work with. The room was definitely on the smaller side but it was very well done. All of us each had opportunities to solve our own puzzle and the payoff for winning was super entertaining! Definitely looking forward to going back, my only hope is that the other room(s) are bigger and/or multi room experiences.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Zylchov's Laboratory" by EscapeOut Folsom in Sacramento
review: First time doing an escape room so I thought it would be a great time with the wife and kids. Very easy to book our time/day via their website which was awesome. We chose the Laboratory room which was their easier of the 4 rooms with a 50/50 success rate. My kids, wife and myself all had an amazing time and really can't wait to experience the other rooms. The host that helped us is a real asset to this place. He was very personable and his acting the part of the laboratory staff was a great addition to the experience. I highly recommend EscapeOut in Folsom if you are looking for something fun to do with friends, family and/or coworkers. BTW, We Escaped with 3 mins left!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2: The Elevator Shaft" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: The Elevator Shaft is such a great room! I did it with one other person and it was perfect.  Clues were very well done and room effects were amazing.  Something that stands out above all other escape room places is the amazing staff, everyone is so nice!! Our hostess was Jazz and she is awesome, so friendly and really helped us get into the mindset for the room! Can't wait til they expand (hopefully!) or change some more rooms so I can keep coming!!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2: The Elevator Shaft" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: The elevator shaft was dope. I can't stop thinking about it. 5/5 for sure. You feel like the elevator shaft is going to fall on you if you don't solve the puzzle. Nicest most realistic escape room i've been in. High-quality design!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 2: The Elevator Shaft" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: I tried The Elevator Shaft and loved it. A warning to all those who enter, you really need to think outside the box!

room_title: Escape room "Senseless" by Immersion in Orange County
review: My group did the Senseless escape room and it was really fun! The puzzles were creative but not too crazy (we used two hints total). Would recommend to anyone looking for a fun challenge!

room_title: Escape room "Senseless" by Immersion in Orange County
review: Senseless was dope!! Very different other experiences. Put together really well, really cool theme!

room_title: Escape room "Senseless" by Immersion in Orange County
review: Came here with a group of 7 friends and we did the Senseless escape room. It was my first time trying out and an escape room and I had a lot of fun! There was enough room for all of us to go around and find clues without bumping into each other. I'd definitely come back to try out the other rooms they offer!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Botcher's Minute Medical School" by Two Bit Circus in Los Angeles
review: Super fun!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Botcher's Minute Medical School" by Two Bit Circus in Los Angeles
review: We went to celebrate a friends bday. We looked into doing something different and fun and found it. We hit the happy hour deals. They have a variety of drinks that satisfied everyone in our group. The food looked good. Didn't get a chance to try any.We tried a couple of their VR rooms. That was pretty cool. We opt to do the Raft. I believe it was the only one that was offered that night. But we had fun with that. I'm not too much into gaming but it was well worth the experience. We also did the one with the doctor. Now that one was pretty interesting. Since all of our group is involved in the medical field one way or another, it was pretty fun to try and keep the Patient alive. Took a lot of team work and felt like we were in the E.R. trying to keep the dummy alive!!! LOL!The arcade area was fun. Plenty of games to play. From famous arcades to tic tac toe Basketball to skiball. And don't forget to challenge your friends in a game of ice hockey made for 4.They seem to host private parties and have jumbo connect 4 and Jenga. Those are always fun.Will definitely be going back since we still have bits to spend in our cards.

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage - Black Ops" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: This is a great idea if your looking to have a good time with a small group. Staff is friendly. We did the Sabotage- Black Ops.Don't go in thinking you will breeze through it. It will be a challenge you will enjoy and remember

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage - Black Ops" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: I just got home from a night at Breakout and I can honestly say that I will be back! I went with a coworker and played Black Ops. Unfortunately we did not breakout but we still had a lot of fun! We were welcomed with smiles and great personalities and throughout the game enjoyed the interactions that we were given. It is a fun and mind churning experience that I can't wait to experience again!

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage - Black Ops" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: Had a blast with my girls here last night. We totally didn't expect it to be as difficult as it was but we made it out in just under 3 minutes. That 60 minutes goes by WAY too fast...hahahaha

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage - Black Ops" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: We failed to stop the nuclear launch. Can't wait to go back and try the other games. Much more entertaining than going to a movie.
