room_title: Escape room "Sabotage - Black Ops" by Method of Escape in Fresno
review: Sorry Fresno -- we failed to stop the bomb :( I've had some experience with escape rooms, and Breakout definitely stands out as one of my favorites. The room I played (Sabotage) was the right mixture of entertaining, clever, and challenging. There was definitely a lot of scrambling around and yelling, but that's part of the experience.  If not impressed by the room, you'll love the staff. It's owned by a lovely couple, who are very welcoming and fun to talk to. Our gamekeeper, Brian, seemed really easy-going and did his best to help us out whenever we needed, both before the game and during. I'm definitely coming back -- I'll try not to leave Fresno in a nuclear waste next time.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: Don't be fooled by all the 5 star reviews!!!Just finished the Zombie Lab tonight and let me begin by saying, the pervious reviews hyped the room so much, but when we got there it was a big dissapointment. I am an escape room enthusiast and this was my 19th room. I would rank it 18th out of 19 rooms.  (Spoiler Free Review)Parking/Lobby:First off parking is hard to find but I suggest trying to find it on the street or at the lot at 11th and Olive. If you pass by that it will take to about 10 minutes to circle back around due to the one way streets and traffic. When we got there the host was by the door which was very nice because we were slightly unsure where to go. We entered and were told that there were going to be 6 other people in the room with us (randoms). The lobby was nice; theres a bathroom, lockers, and a bunch of comic books that are for sale. After waiting a few minutes we were shown the safety video, told the backstory of the room and then walked  to the room. The Room:Our first impression for the room was that it was fairly bland and lacking in decor. We got through the room fairly quick but we escape with 8 min to spare because we got hung up on a puzzle and because one of our locks was being finicky (The Game Master(GM) had to come in and help us with it since we had the correct combination in it and it still wasn't working). This room is a Gen 1 room, meaning the there is no technology puzzles in the room, just combos, locks and keys. The Zombie aspect of the room was one of the most hyped in the reviews but when we experienced it was sub par. The whole "encounter" is probably about 3-5 minutes since the zombie ends up leaving through the door (which didn't make sense in the plot line). I had thought that the zombie would be super scary and be with us until the end of the game but I was wrong. The actor playing the zombie did a good job for the time that they were in the room, I just wish they would have stayed in the room instead of leaving. The Hint System: You get 3 hints in this room, if you so close to take them. The are offered at the 30min mark, 15 min mark and 10 minutes mark (if i'm remembering correctly). During these time checks the GM would open the door and say "The doctor will see you in ___ minutes." I did not like that form of hints/ time checks at all, it really takes you out of the zone and pulls you out of the game mode. I think it would be so much better if they either had a screen with the clues and timer on it or a simple walkie talkie system. The Staff: Our GM was very friendly and courteous. She helped us get settled in and described the rooms to us very well. I did not like however that when you call the companies number with a question to ask, that no one picks up and it goes straight to a recorded message. Overall:I give this room 3 out of 5 stars because I felt like they could do so much more. The decor in the room was lacking and I honestly feel as though most of the room was wasted space. There were such few actual puzzles to solve in the room and the atmosphere in the room could have been better. The actor should stay in there room for longer, even stay the until the group escapes as that would add a element of rush and fear to the game. The hint system needs to be improved. Honestly, a $30 pack of walkie talkies would be sufficient enough because without it, every time you need a hint you're taken away from the game and brought back into "reality". I would only recommend this place to people who have never done an escape room before. After doing so many I just wasn't very impressed with this one. I'm hoping that their other rooms will be better. For the price though (we used Groupon) I would like to try to come back and escape there hardest room (The Office).

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: This was so much fun! Did the Zombie Lab and loved it. Can't wait to try another. Thanks for the good scare.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: My co-workers and I booked the zombie lab room not knowing what to expect. After everything was said and done we have to say that we would definitely go again and recommend this location to our friends. We had a blast and it was a great team experience.

room_title: Escape room "Zombie Lab" by Horror Escapes LA in Los Angeles
review: Overall this has been one of the better escape rooms and my best friend and I have done over 30+ up and down the west coast. Storyline is great and the surprise guests add a nice touch to the experience! Looking forward to the next two chapters of Dr. X.

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: The only issue I have with Exit Game is that they pair you up with strangers. I went with a group of 3 and they paired us up with a group of 4. The whole time I felt like they didn't really contribute to anything as they had no clue what was going on. All I can say is that you really have to think outside the box in order to escape this room.

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Very pleased with the experience I had at The Exit Game. It's definitely innovative, fun, and going to be the latest trend for game centers. I definitely recommend visiting The Exit Game, make sure you book in advance!!

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Our group had so much fun that we played two different rooms in one day. Very impressed with the game design and puzzles. Can't wait to play the new rooms next time!

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: A great, well thought out venue. The staff is friendly and helpful. I can hardly wait to try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Went in March and did 2 puzzles with 9 friends and had an absolute blast for my birthday. Would definitely come back again and would recommend for a large group of friends to play. Must go for everyone!

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience! Clever puzzles! Friendly staff. I would fly back in from St Louis to do the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Went here on a Saturday for a friend's birthday and did the Lab. It was a lot of fun! The story was that we were marines on a mission to escape an alien lab. You have 60 minutes to go through a series of complex puzzles, locks, clues, many rooms, and it was a great exercise in teamwork! It cost about $30/head and we had 10 people, which was a pretty good size for the challenge. The lab has a physical element to it where you need to crawl and duck your head low. They have alternatives if you cannot crawl or have claustrophobia, but it does take away from the overall experience, so opt for another challenge if that's a limitation of yours.  Especially compared to the Escape Game in Anaheim, this place was much more complex and believable with all the props and game design. It's not cheap, but a fun thing to do with a group of friends if you are looking for something different. It's located on the basement level of the Atlantic Shopping plaza where Empress Harbor Seafood and Half & Half are. Parking is free and head down the escalators to find it.

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51" by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Had an AMAZING time!! Went and reserved to do The Lab which was absolutely amazing, from hidden corridors to amazing puzzles it DEFINITELY was best escape room I've been to. Had so much fun We immediately reregistered to do the Vault! This one was much more difficult but still had a blast!Staff was super friendly and helpful! Group there was Jen, Norris, and Brian, and they communicated the rules well and made sure everyone had an amazing time start to finish.

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by Unity Escape Rooms in Redlands
review: Absolutely awesome! Went for everyone's first time, in a group for my husband's b-day and had the best time. The staff is amazing and even though we didnt succeed in The Cabin we are determined to be successful in The Temple. The decorations are fantastic - we felt like we were in a cabin. Can't wait to go back!

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Went with a team of 7 and did the fortune teller room! This was my first escape the room and it exceeded my expectations! The puzzles were creative and challenging but totally possible. Everyone on the team got involved and it was a blast!

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Such a fun night solving the Fortune Teller mystery with friends & our guide Caitlyn was awesome at putting up with our craziness. Can't wait to go back for another

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: I took a team of ten, we split up to two teams and all had a blast! It was a great challenge and really highlighted each person's strengths. Bre was a great clue master! Her enthusiasm and energy made the whole experience that much better!

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: We had a group of 5 - we did the Fortune Teller first and had so much fun we moved up to blood thirst. They were well done and the staff was great to work with. It was a great interactive group activity for friends and I highly recommend it for anyone who enjoys puzzles and thinking.

room_title: Escape room "The Fortune Teller" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Great experience today! The Fortune Teller room was very well crafted, theme and game wise. Really good puzzles and some amazing unexpected surprises! My cluemaster, Dani, was also amazing. I'll definitely be heading back to play the rest of their rooms!! Looking forward to being the first solo player to beat their most difficult room, which is vampire hunter themed!

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This room is on the easy side so great for players new to escape rooms. The room was nicely themed and nice story progression. This is a traditional lock-style puzzle room. The staff was great and very flexible with the booking process. A bonus with this room is that they let you take a team photo inside the room with a special prop. Makes for a great photo.

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We have been wanting to do something like this for awhile and finally we did, we had a blast!

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This was my family's first Paniq Room Experience and we loved it! Our host was friendly and helpful. We all had so much fun! We would love to come back again.

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: We went to do one room and ended up doing all 3 the same day! Our favorite place so far to escape from!

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: Really had no idea how this worked or what to expect. It was the most fun. There were 4 of us and we all worked together to find the clues. Lots of laughs and fun! Cannot wait to try another room!!! Highly recommend this

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: First timer!!! What an amazing and fun experience!!! The neighborhood was a little more run down than I expected and the building looked very small but once inside, the fun began!! We can't wait to get back and try all of the other rooms!! The Alien room was amazing!

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: I've played a few of these rooms in different cities and PanIQ Room is right up there with the best. Challenging, yet achievable, with a flow that matches the puzzles with the scenario. There is a lot of thought put in to the play/stump balance.Our hosts, Chan and Jeff, are my kind of people. They're the right blend of helpful, friendly and smart-ass. The after action talk is as fun as the room. We'll be back soon.

room_title: Escape room "Aliens" by PanIQ Escape Room Phoenix in Phoenix
review: This was such a great experience. We did the alien room with our family, two adults and four kids. It was such a blast! My daughter was really nervous beforehand about being locked in a room and her ability to contribute. She had the best time! The clues are great and so varied that everyone will be able to add something. Loved loved loved it! We will be back soon to be kidnapped!

room_title: Escape room "Bomb" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The 13th Floor" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: Did 13th floor with several of my coworkers. It was a lot of fun and good team building. Would highly recommend and plan on going back soon to check out the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The 13th Floor" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: My boyfriend and I went here for a date night last weekend and we LOVED it! We did the 13th floor but were ultimately unable to escape. Ethan was the one working that night and was exceptionally kind and explained everything very thoroughly after we lost. We will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "The 13th Floor" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: Great family fun! My group did the 13th floor room and it was an exciting challenge! Our room advisor, Nick, did a great job explaining the idea of the room and was helpful all along the way. Would recommend it to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "The 13th Floor" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: So we went through the 13th floor. It is very challenging but lots of fun. Cannot wait to try the other room(s).

room_title: Escape room "The 13th Floor" by Escape Dothan in Dothan
review: My husband and I went in today to do the 13th Floor room. We loved it so much that we stayed and did Time Warp right after (there was an open slot). We have done multiple escape rooms in both Hawaii and Mississippi. Escape Dothan is by far the best one we have been to so far. The people that work the rooms allow you to struggle some before they give you hints. They don't make it too easy to get out! We plan on returning in the near future to do Murder at the Mansion and will continue to go as new rooms are opened. We highly recommend that everyone try Escape Dothan!

room_title: Escape room "Uncle Tick Tock's Circus" by Escape Room Napa in Rohnert Park
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Smugglers Tunnels" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: We have finally tried their newest room, Smugglers Tunnels! Still as fun as ever. This room has less of a storyline, but plenty of challenging puzzles. Instead of trying time to escape, you and your teammates have to get as much treasure as quickly as possible. This adds a different feel to the adventure and my friends and I had a fantastic time with our individual puzzles, as well as the puzzles we worked on together. Missed out on first place, but we smashed second place! Highly recommend Escape Chronicles to anyone looking for a good night of puzzle solving.

room_title: Escape room "Smugglers Tunnels" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: I've played around 80 other escape rooms before this review. Both of the games at Escape Chronicles are freaking fantastic. Some of the most unique and engaging puzzles out there. If you're a bunch of first-time players, the Smugglers game is the one I recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Smugglers Tunnels" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: Some friends and I went to the Smugglers Tunnels room and LOVED it! I've done a lot of escape rooms, and this was easily one of my favorites, with a solid set of inventive puzzles and a refreshing twist on the usual "escape the room" objective. Very impressive to have a room that can equally satisfy both novices and experienced players!

room_title: Escape room "Saving Christmas" by Great Escape Mystery Rooms in Fort Smith
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Story Room" by Escape Narrative in Phoenix
review: This escape room was much different then others. It required real life thinking and problem solving. It was super fun and interactive. Was definitely well thought out. Would highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Story Room" by Escape Narrative in Phoenix
review: First time to do a escape room. Six of us decided to try this for entertainment and it was great. Not just going around a room and finding keys. We had to think, use clues, use a computer, put puzzles together and search as a team. The owner was just great and very nice. Explained everything very well. Exciting and thought provoking.

room_title: Escape room "The Story Room" by Escape Narrative in Phoenix
review: I have done a bunch of escape rooms across the US but this was the best experience! I loved how we were part of the story and used modern technology to solve the mystery!!! Great time was had by all. My 18yr old nephew was a little freaked out but still had fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Nora's Nightmare" by Puzzling Escape in Phoenix
review: Great room and awesome owners! Looking forward to the next ones opening!

room_title: Escape room "Nora's Nightmare" by Puzzling Escape in Phoenix
review: The 4 of us did Nora's Nightmare.  Fun room, really enjoyed it. The room had a good combination of locks, puzzles and electronics. The room flowed really well.  Have done many rooms and this ranks at the top!  We will definitely be back for the Houdini room when it opens!

room_title: Escape room "Nora's Nightmare" by Puzzling Escape in Phoenix
review: Played Nora's Nightmare yesterday and, it turned out, we were the first group to play the room since it officially opened.  As enthusiasts (almost 200 rooms played), we're always hesitant to try a brand new game as we've quickly learned it's much better to give them some time (even after beta testing) to fine tune things and make sure it runs they way they intended. But since we were jonesing for a room, we decided to go for it. From the first point of contact, via FB messenger, their customer service was spot on. The owner (I'm so sorry I don't remember her name) was friendly, very accommodating and responded to my inquiries quickly. As for the room, we enjoyed it quite a bit! I loved the unique theme and really liked the thought and details that were put into the aesthetics of the room. The puzzles are a good mix of lock & key as well as some tech so it should easily appeal to a variety of players. They are not overly difficult but they do still provide a good challenge and make you slow down to think. We are a two-person team and we finished with time to spare.  Afterwards, we spent quite a bit of time talking shop with the owner. She was very personable and didn't make us feel rushed or like she had something better to do. I know I already said it, but the customer service was on point with Puzzling Escape. As much as we love playing rooms, we also love talking with the owners and staff about the experience as well as about escape rooms in general.  We really enjoy hearing about what went into the design and development of their rooms and just learning about how it all started for them. We can't wait for their other rooms to open. Nora's Nightmare is a fun time for anyone looking for something neat to do. Regardless of your level of experience, get out there and play this game.  You'll be glad you did.

room_title: Escape room "The Underground" by Nightmare at 3008 in Birmingham
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Spy Room" by Xcape Room Fresno in Fresno
review: This was intense.  5 of us tried and got close.  Lots of different challenges than you normally find which was good.  Some interesting stuff, but take the max people as you will need the help.

room_title: Escape room "The Curse of Pharaoh's Tomb" by Mystery Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sugar Rush" by Legacy Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Super fun for the whole family! We are always looking for family friendly escape rooms and this one is it! Sugar Rush was definitely challenging but super fun-not scary at all!  Our group ranged from a 60 year old to an 11 year old...and everyone loved it.  The room is decorated very nicely and the puzzles are challenging, but not too challenging to the point you get frustrated.  Our game master was Julie and she was very friendly and always ready with our hints (when needed).They have another room, Cabin 13, that we plan on trying next time.  Can't wait to go back!The only downside to doing this escape room is you'll want ice cream after!

room_title: Escape room "Sugar Rush" by Legacy Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was my first time going to an escape room! The Sugar Rush" room was really fun, cute, and just challenging enough for the 8 of us. We were happy to successfully escape in time without any hints! Julie is super sweet and helpful!

room_title: Escape room "Sugar Rush" by Legacy Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Amazing escape room! Very well designed with creative and unique puzzles. Great production quality with incredibly immersive rooms. Sugar Rush was a fun room with great whimsicality while still having challenging puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "The Skull Witch" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: This was our first time experiencing an escape room and it was really fun! The staff was really friendly and helpful (if you wanted help). We did the Skull Witch room which was awesome. Very fun and unique experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Skull Witch" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Amazing and super entertaining! It is evident that a lot of thought and passion went into each and every room. The intrigued details remind me of technology right from a Disney attraction. Definitely TOP NOTCH! The staff is also wonderful! The Skull Witch room is my favorite!

room_title: Escape room "The Skull Witch" by Enchambered: Sacramento Escape Room in Sacramento
review: My first escape room and wow! They outdid themselves! We were thrown into their hardest room Skull Witch... by choice and aaaaalmost finished. They said we only had like two more tiny things to solve, then we would have been out. We were a group of 6, and I'd say that was perfect for that particular room.

room_title: Escape room "The Cursed" by Immersion in Orange County
review: Came here on my birthday with a group of friends and it was such a fun time! It's in a weird area but don't be fooled by the surroundings. There was only one worker there who was a girl and had a nose piercing and I wish I remembered her name but she was very kind. Definitely recommend this place, especially for birthdays or other celebrations. We did the newest room called "Cursed" and it was very achievable to solve for a group who has never been to an escape room before (go sister squad!) Totally recommend

room_title: Escape room "The Cursed" by Immersion in Orange County
review: One of the best escape rooms in Orange! SO and I tried out "The Curse," and it was very entertaining. They do a wonderful job of making each puzzle unique and fresh, that way you don't go through the motion of just solving through the escape room with just one type of problem. I would definitely recommend! :)

room_title: Escape room "The Cursed" by Immersion in Orange County
review: Did the Cursed escape room at Immersion and this room was on a whole  nother level compared to the other rooms that they own. The room is their latest room and they use modern tech for their cursed room. If you are thinking booking a room at Immersion, might I suggest the Cursed room over their other out-dated rooms. But in case you haven't guessed it from the room's name,  Cursed, expect it to be scary.The room is pretty packed but not overly expansive. A group of 4 seems ideal. Couples will likely experience a difficult time at Cursed while large groups will bump into each a lot in the cramped spaces.I did think the theme and story of the room was by far, the most bizarre plot I've experienced. But hey, that doesn't affect the quality of the room.

room_title: Escape room "Maze Quiz" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The School of Sorcery" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: My friends and I have done almost every room here. Every room is consistently great, and the puzzles are challenging and varied. The staff is helpful and friendly and clearly love puzzles. I would say that the production values for this place are above average, and the puzzle flow and style is friendly to large groups. I can't say much more without spoiling something, go!

room_title: Escape room "The School of Sorcery" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: From the lobby, to the staff, to the game itself, everything was of the highest quality and beat my expectations. The story was smart and engaging. The puzzles kept us (our team of two) busy and challenged. The decor was immersive and made sense.I can't wait to play their new games coming on the next months. Exit Games is on my "highly recommended" list!

room_title: Escape room "The School of Sorcery" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: School of sorcery was an amazing experience. The technology in the escape room was up to date. Brian was very helpful

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: Had so much fun at the Alcatraz room for my daughter's birthday. Almost made it - so close! We had a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: Well done! First time in one of these, really enjoyed and recommend. Alcatraz!

room_title: Escape room "Alcatraz" by Hourglass Escape Rooms in Searcy
review: Escaped from Alcatraz with Lauren and Mike! Awesome!

room_title: Escape room "Cursed Kingdom of Exitia" by EXIT Escape Room Adventures in Modesto
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Not So Perfect Dinner Party" by MasterMind Escape the Room Game in Little Rock
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage - at home" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Cure" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: Amazing! I did The Cure with a group of 6, and it was challenging and fun! It can be done with kids, and adults will love it too!

room_title: Escape room "The Cure" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: Avalanche Escape Rooms is fantastic! I've played in both rooms (didn't beat Blitzkrieg but we did beat the Cure) and they're so much fun to try and figure out. The staff is lovely, the games are worth the price, and it's a great time. I highly recommend checking it out!

room_title: Escape room "The Cure" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: Great fun with family today. We cracked the codes and found the cure with 6:32 to spare. This was truly fantastic. I highly recommend this to everyone. It's a must. We will be back for sure.

room_title: Escape room "The Cure" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: Had so much fun playing The Cure! Very impressed with the puzzles and the production value of the game. The hosts were super professional and informative. I can't wait to go back. Get a group together and go!

room_title: Escape room "The Cure" by Avalanche Escape Rooms in Anchorage
review: We took our family (15 year old, 13 year old and parents) to do The Cure and it was fantastic! There are a variety of puzzles for all skill levels, but the most important part was being able to think creatively and work together. It was a blast! Can't wait to do Blitzkrieg!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Video Store" by Mission 57 in Salinas
review: First time escape room experience and we had a blast! There's a lot to do in an hour but figuring everything out was very entertaining. If you haven't been I give it a two thumbs up!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Video Store" by Mission 57 in Salinas
review: Looks like a very simple design, but don’t let that fool you! Had an awesome time with this challenge. Couldn’t stop talking about it for the rest of the day. If you ask for clues, they are a little hard to hear, but they are helpful without being super obvious. Good job!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Video Store" by Mission 57 in Salinas
review: awesome experience and excellent rooms here at mission 57!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Darkness" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: Had a great time escaping this room. Scary, but not so much you can't concentrate. Put together nicely.

room_title: Escape room "The Darkness" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: Great experience! We had lots of fun! We did the darkness, super challenging, lots of clues to find and whenever you figure one out it feels so rewarding! Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Darkness" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: My husband and I totally enjoyed the Darkness & the best part is we ESCAPED! We definitely recommend everyone to go try it out.

room_title: Escape room "The Darkness" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: We went into The Darkness for my daughter's 13th birthday. It was wonderful getting to do something that got us so involved. Great quality time with good interaction. The puzzles were hard and exciting. We came. We conquered. We can't wait to beat60 again!

room_title: Escape room "The Darkness" by beat60 in Gadsden
review: We had a great time "beating 60" in the serial killer room. The puzzles were challenging and setup very well. I hope to be back soon to do the other rooms you have! Thanks for a fun almost 60 mins!

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: My girlfriend and I did the Espionage room. We were blindfolded and put in separate rooms to work as a team to get out. We got far in our hour of time but unfortunately, we didn't get out. The whole experience was awesome. most definitely will recommend this place. Recommend to family and friends visiting California.

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: Fun! We were walking by and weren't planning on going but after the greeter explained it to us we decided to give it a try. We decided to do the Espionage one since it was the least scariest because we had children with us. We would love to come back and do another room!

room_title: Escape room "Espionage" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: We did the Espionage room and it was definitely a fun time. If you're a beginner, it's a great room to start with. We escaped with 15 min left! So fun!

room_title: Escape room "PROstate Farm" by Solve Who, LLC in San Diego
review: Absolutely fantastic! This is similar to an escape room game, but instead, you solve a murder. There are clues you have to find like blood, fingerprints, and a murder weapon. There are small details all over the place and it was actually funny as hell. The owners worked with actual detectives, forensic scientists, and the people who do autopsies! After you make your judgement and give your “verdict”, they go over how the murder transpired. It is split into 3 portions. First you investigate the crime scene, then you go over 3 interrogations with the 3 suspects, then you get all the evidence you found - back from the “lab” and an autopsy report. A really cool aspect, was that you report the evidence you find, so if you miss a clue, it won’t be turned back into you when you piece the mystery together with your group. I highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "PROstate Farm" by Solve Who, LLC in San Diego
review: Came here as a double date with a group of 4 of us. We had a blast! I was expecting another escape room which start to have the same repetitive puzzles to solve and was pleasantly surprised that this was different. You're solving a crime rather than trying to escape. We did the PROstate insurance room and there were three parts. First you spend about 20 minutes at the area of the crime scene and then you go to the interrogation room and then you debrief where you try to put together all the evidence to figure out who the murderer was. I really commend them on the way they have this laid out and everything was in great condition. They even gave us a camera to use to take pictures of the crime scene. There was a ton of humor throughout this and we got a lot of good laughs. This was an awesome time and I can't wait to go back and solve the other crime! We ended up solving the crime, but it was difficult and we missed a lot of clues along the way. If you're looking for a fun night out I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "PROstate Farm" by Solve Who, LLC in San Diego
review: I planned this activity for my husband and I, customer service was great and the game was fun. We did the Prostate insurance murder.  The only thing is I wish we would have gone with a bigger group but we still did it. Its very difficult to solve but still really fun. Next time I would recommend the coffee shop.  It looked really cool.

room_title: Escape room "PROstate Farm" by Solve Who, LLC in San Diego
review: I went here for a date night with my wife and it was fantastic.  Very well put together and surprisingly challenging.

room_title: Escape room "The Emoryville Carnival" by Bakersfield Breakout Zone in Bakersfield
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Mission's Breakout: the Ultimate Bank Heist" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: My first time doing an escape room and it was awesome! My friends and I did the Bank Heist, its a new room with clever and challenging puzzles. The staff was also great, Bri was our host and she helped to create a fun atmosphere. Would definitely come back here!

room_title: Escape room "Mission's Breakout: the Ultimate Bank Heist" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: We tried the Bank Heist room after a long anticipated wait and it did not disappoint!  We really enjoyed all the fun tech in the room, you really felt like your were in the front of a bank and then eventually in the back house of the bank.  Highly recommend Mission Escape games for al of their rooms, they are amazing!

room_title: Escape room "Mission's Breakout: the Ultimate Bank Heist" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: I had so much fun here! I wanted to do something different to celebrate my friends, and this was perfect.,the fun starts when the clock does and literally doesn't stop. Don't second guess this place, just go lol. We did the bank heist and we'll be going back to do the haunted one.

room_title: Escape room "Space Station Tiberia VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: This was a lot of fun to do virtual escape. The staff was a lot of help and the effects are great. Some people may be a little freaked out at looking down on the world from space, but I found it awesome.

room_title: Escape room "Space Station Tiberia VR" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: I went back and tried the VR room, the space room. Absolutely incredible. I have done VR before, oculus and Samsung vr, but not like this where you can walk around and see the other people in your group. If you have never tried it, you definitely need to. VR is so futuristic and needs to be supported.The space escape room itself want too hard... It honestly seemed like it was designed for kids. However it was just plain fun! You can pick things up and throw them around the space station, which just doesn't seem to get old. Escaping the room was almost secondary to the fun space elements.We got out pretty quick and they were nice enough to let us see the horror hospital VR walk through, which was... Interesting.Anyway, based on others reviews here for the physical escape rooms, try them at your own risk. But the VR rooms just seem plain fun.

room_title: Escape room "Bayou Mystery" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: Most amazing experience with my group of peers!! Great team building experience and sooooo much fun!!!!!!!! Highly recommend and will be coming again. Super fun! Great thinking puzzles! Love love love!!!!!!!

room_title: Escape room "Bayou Mystery" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: Just got done. Didn't finish but was a blast. Definitely coming back. Customer service on point

room_title: Escape room "Bayou Mystery" by Real Escape in Bakersfield
review: We had a great time at Real Escape! What possibly had the potential of being very disappointing got immediately handled by Eric. He came to the rescue. There was a hiccup with our online reservation. Eric made things happen and we were in! Then the experience itself was ton of fun! THANK YOU Eric and Pauly. You guys were awesome! :)

room_title: Escape room "Captain's Curse" by Extreme Escape Redding in Redding
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Bad Blood" by Escape Room Long Beach in Los Angeles
review: Super fun night. 3 newbies and 3 veterans and everyone enjoyed themselves!

room_title: Escape room "Bad Blood" by Escape Room Long Beach in Los Angeles
review: This was my first experience with escape rooms and I loved it! Our group was warmly greeted by the staff, given thorough instructions and sent on our way. We were given an hour to complete the challenge and we almost made it in time... After we were done the staff came in to congratulate us on finishing the challenge and we took pictures and chatted with the staff for a bit. I look forward to returning when there are new challenges and will be sharing this with all my friends! Thank you for a fun evening!

room_title: Escape room "Bad Blood" by Escape Room Long Beach in Los Angeles
review: We had a great time! The staff was very friendly and seemed to enjoy what they were doing. The theme of the room was hilarious and entertaining, and the puzzles all made sense. It's great to finally have a local escape room that's easy to get to.

room_title: Escape room "Inside Job" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: Thank you escape room Tucson for making our team building event a fun one! Everyone enjoyed themselves! Thanks to the awesome helper that was in Inside Job with us!

room_title: Escape room "Inside Job" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: I spent my 30th birthday here. We did "The Inside Job" and had the best time. We didn't make it out but, I know who not to take with me when I rob a bank.

room_title: Escape room "Inside Job" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: I've been to Escape Room Tucson on 4 different occasions. Every room is so different. It's such a great time with friends every time! Can't wait to try their new rooms!!!

room_title: Escape room "Inside Job" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: My husband and I had an awesome time at Escape Room Tucson. The room we booked was a great challenge. The owners have definitely put a lot of work into making these rooms difficult but fun.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: My girlfriends and I completed Bank Heist Escape Room in Palm Springs. It was an amazing experience. Dominique and Emily were great and help us giving  hints. We will be back again to experience other rooms. It's sooooo much fun. We highly recommend Palm Springs Escape Room.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Our first time doing an escape room. Took our 2 kids (age 10 and 13) and the entire family had a great time. We did the bank heist room which was quite challenging, but we received a lot of helpful hints form Eevee. She was very supportive and gave us just enough clues to “break the vault” with 4 minutes remaining.  We would definitely recommend the escape room here and hope to return in the near future.

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: The Bank Heist escape room was a lot of fun! Our game guide, Ty, kept us on track and was great with the family. We had a great time and will definitely be heading back. Thanks for the fun!

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Have already tried two rooms here. Merlin's room is tech-friendly while the Bank Heist is keys and locks. Both rooms were fun but we absolutely LOVED robbing a bank!The staff and owner are so friendly and helpful! Plus you can't beat the price. Highly recommend

room_title: Escape room "Bank Heist" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: My group and I had the best time ever here. We did the Bank heist and it truly tested our mental abilities. Dominique deserves our highest graces for getting us in so quickly. Your customer service made my group feel so welcomed. Thank you for a great time!

room_title: Escape room "Diplomat's Secret" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: Could not have better better! Perfect for a family with teenagers . We were three generations. The realm was one of the best that we have done so far.

room_title: Escape room "Diplomat's Secret" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: We celebrated our 1st annual Christmas party at the Escape Room. It was fantastic. Everyone had a great time and the staff went all out to make sure we had fun. Really appreciated the extra effort they took to accommodate our schedule. We look forward to going back to visit another room.

room_title: Escape room "Diplomat's Secret" by Escape Room 101 in Phoenix
review: My wife and I had a blast here! We did the diplomat secret room and it was fun to be spies for an hour and crack all the codes! Thank you for such a fun and entertaining time!!

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: It was really cool. The game was super fun and challenging. We bring our inters there and they loved it. They do have a great Italian restaurant on the first floor of the building, so we went there right after our game.

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Never seen a game like this before. It’s like an escape game but need to get into this suitcase. It looks like a high end movie prop, with keypad on top, and you get some gadgets to pick codes and such. Than it opens to more puzzles and another level and another level. Very clever. The military guy on TV gave some story about evil corporation and we worked on 8 cases at different tables. Ended up helping each other otherwise we probably wouldn’t have finished it in time. Their “secret safe house” was a bit hard to find. Check the address in the email. we went to their main office first but it’s just a block away. No big deal.

room_title: Escape room "Sabotage" by EscapeSF in San Francisco
review: Great game - intelligent one! We were 75 ppl, the game was one of our team-building activities. Recommend for HR/Community managers to consider!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: My 4 grandkids ages 9-14 and myself enjoyed our visit to Bolt NWA. This was our first time to do an escape room. It was so much fun watching all of us working together to solve the mysteries.We 1st booked Grandma's Attic. We had such a great time, we decided to do Locked also! I loved that each one of us solved clues. I highly recommend Bolt NWA for families. We made wonderful memories and all of us agree, we are going back soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Attic" by Bolt NWA in Bentonville
review: What a great time! Been there twice. Day Dream beat us by 3 locks but we beat Grandma's Attic with 4min to spare! Super fun for the whole family!

room_title: Escape room "Treasure Hunters: Station 13" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: We pulled off a daring rescue mission at the Casino Royale today. Despite 007 getting himself into a bad spot, we all escaped with our lives, armed with nothing but our wits and cunning (and a few key assists from GM Elijah). A great time was had by all.

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: We loved our experience at Breakout Orange Beach!! Our game master Jessica was simply superb. The game was extremely challenging and so much fun!! Our 8 ages ranged from 13-40 something and all of us had a blast. We did Casino Royale and hope to go back soon for the other games. Definitely worth the money and time! Thanks Jessica for showing us a fantastic night and helping us breakout with thirty seconds to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: We did Casino Royale yesterday at Breakout. The staff were fantastic from start to finish. Friendly, helpful and went out of their way to provide excellent customer service. The game was so fun and very challenging! We all had a blast. Our ages ranged from 13 to 42. We did not escape, but came close and now can hardly wait to come back. Mike, our game master was fantastic. Do yourself a favor and go play.

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: We did the Casino Royale with 5 people...2 adults and 3 children ages 9, 11, and 15. Everyone loved it!!! Everyone was involved and working together. We didn't breakout but in the end we didn't really care. Thanks for the experience!!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Orange - Beach in Orange Beach
review: You guys are awesome. Very professional staff. We really enjoyed casino royale. For having only two people we have currently made it the farthest two people have ever made it so far. That was per the game master for that room. We will definitely be back here the next time we are down here.

room_title: Escape room "RabaBank" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: When my family travels, we always try and find a good escape room.  We found Escape Room 831 and its one of the best, if not the best we've played.  Great fun for the family (2 boys!), and very well done with the design decor and escape scenarios.  Highly recommend this location if you're anywhere near the Bay Area or Monterey.

room_title: Escape room "RabaBank" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: Great place with high production value! Very friendly with a professional team running the place. Love Barrie!

room_title: Escape room "RabaBank" by Escape Room 831 in Salinas
review: This was my very first Escaperoom experience and it was truly outstanding! The owner was so accommodating and fun and the room was brilliant. I cannot wait to go back and try out their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Forgotten Pharaoh Escape" by Xscape Pods in Los Angeles
review: We had an excellent time here for my daughter's 12th birthday. The Egyptian adventure room was perfect for their age and ability and they had a blast.

room_title: Escape room "Forgotten Pharaoh Escape" by Xscape Pods in Los Angeles
review: I took my and daughter and her friend for escape room fun for her birthday. We both have experienced other escape rooms. This trip was a first experience for her friend.  The staff was very friendly. We tried The Pharaoh's Tomb. We had so much fun that we returned the next day to experience more; Defenders of the Galaxy. We are also looking forward to the next adventure being added later this year and can't wait to come back and try out our skills. ;) Highly recommend this adventure!

room_title: Escape room "Forgotten Pharaoh Escape" by Xscape Pods in Los Angeles
review: This is my first time in an Escape Room and it was SO MUCH FUN! You can tell just from entering the lobby area that there is so much attention to detail and design and it's shown in the rooms as well. We did the Pharoah room. It really felt like an immersive experience. I enjoyed all the puzzles and how they each required different types of thinking with which to solve them. We got out with 4 minutes left (mostly because of my team - I was not as clever) and I definitely want to come back with a bigger team to try out the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape Room Yuma in Yuma
review: Had the pleasure of doing the Bomb squad room today. Sooo much fun! Will definitely come back and do the rest of the room. It's 60 minutes of just laughs and nerves lol

room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape Room Yuma in Yuma
review: 10/10 I had some family from out of town come down to Yuma for the weekend and we decided to try out the escape room we did “the bomb squad” and it was a very fun/tricky hour... we had a blast and are already planning our next one when my family is back in town! If you haven’t went yet... oh boy are you missing out! To top off our wonderful experience the staff was very friendly and helpful!

room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape Room Yuma in Yuma
review: We tried the bomb squad room with a large group. We were all having a blast with the room master. Candace was awesome! The room isn't overly difficult but it does make your brain work quite a bit. We had teenagers and adults so our crowd was mixed. If you are looking for something to do we recommend that you check this place it. It's something that you normally wouldn't do but you'll enjoy it!

room_title: Escape room "Summer School Breakout" by Vector Escape Games in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Vampire's Lair" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: I've done over a dozen escape rooms and can honestly say that the team at Escape Room Palm Springs is the best!! The rooms are well thought out and just soo much fun. I am such a fan that we've come back 3 years in a row. This is a must ... must.. must do if you are in Palm Springs. My favorite room is Vampire's Lair. Also all the employees here are top notch and truly care. I love this place.

room_title: Escape room "Vampire's Lair" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: So much fun. Everyone is so nice. The vampire room was fun and perfect for us to try with my 11 year old son. I will definitely come back and try their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Vampire's Lair" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: We had the absolute pleasure of going through the Vampire escape room as a large group and Brandi was an awesome game master. It was such a well thought out escape room and super fun. I would recommend to anyone!

room_title: Escape room "Vampire's Lair" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Did two rooms today, the Titanic Room and the Vampire Room. Just the right balance of difficulty and fun...cleaver without being ridiculous...with a staff that was really top notch. Thanks to Emily and Evee for all your insight and guidance. Good time for all.

room_title: Escape room "Vampire's Lair" by Escape Room Palm Springs in Palm Springs
review: Had a blast. Went with our adult children and did Vampire's Lair. We are first timers except for my 22 yr old son, who has been to several places. He said it was one of thy he best ones he has been to. Kay and all the staff very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back to check out the other rooms. This is a must do!

room_title: Escape room "Noelle’s Nightmare" by Escape Room 104 in Pine Bluff
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Las Vegas" by Exit Artists in Los Angeles
review: this was a 90 minute las vegas themed room, which was appropriate for our group of 4 adults and 3 kids the way we divided it up. we finished with just under 4 minutes to spare. the room was chock full of super fun puzzles and had amazing props and clever tech. alan our gamemaster was very cool and gave us just the right amount of help. i forgot to give him a tip, i feel bad. anyway go here for a great time with friends. 5 stars!

room_title: Escape room "Las Vegas" by Exit Artists in Los Angeles
review: Just did the Vegas themed escape room it was so much fun, the puzzles were challenging and the game master was super cool and very fun to talk with. I highly recommend this if you're looking for a fun activity to do with friends.

room_title: Escape room "Las Vegas" by Exit Artists in Los Angeles
review: Johnny and Herm have done an amazing job with their escape room! The staff is extremely knowledgeable and social!Their Vegas themed room is both challenging and fun. It is very visually appealing and intellectually stimulating. My tip - look for patterns  Perfect experience for first timers. You will not be disappointed!

room_title: Escape room "The Clock Tower" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: My group had a fun time at the escape room, everyone participated and everyone took the room serious. We will return and try some of the other escape rooms real soon. Be prepared you will get into the game and have lots of fun!

room_title: Escape room "The Clock Tower" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: I walked into Escape the Room with my wife on a whim. Neither of us had done this before and thought we should take a look. We weren’t planning on signing up, but, after hearing a great sales pitch, we figured we’d go for it. We signed up for the Clock Tower room, and, as it happened, we were the only 2 in the room. It was a blast. The puzzles were hard, but the hints were very helpful. We made it all the way to the very last puzzle where, sadly, we ran out of time. The experience defintely whetted my appetite for another room escape. Hopefully we’ll get to do this again before long.

room_title: Escape room "The Clock Tower" by Escape The Room Chandler in Phoenix
review: What a fun experience we had there. Got a group of tattooed hooligans together to have a bit of fun Tuesday night and decided to give the new place a try. It was my first experience ever doing an escape room while some of the group do them all the time. Dj was our host for the clock tower room. It's brand new so they ran on to some technical difficulties while dj was left there alone and we could tell DJ was getting a little frazzled but she did an amazing job and made it to where we will for sure be back  she gave clues when we needed them and took charge like a natural leader when the room went down. All and all we had an amazing fun experience and we will be back. DJ keep your head up kid you did awesome and made our time there awesome. Someone give this kid a raise she deserves it.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Bay" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did Pirate Cove. The place was a bit confusing to find but it was great! Great theme, really well put together, Ivan was so nice and we really had a great time.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Bay" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I went to the pirate room on Thursday night with my boyfriend and some of our friends. Absolutely loved it! The theme was fantastic and well done. We love going to these rooms and this was my favorite theme by far. Great puzzles too! Really fun technology. It's a must go if you're ready to escape a (fictional) pirate gang who's going to murder you if you cannot escape their lair within the hour!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Bay" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Supper fun game, highly recommended. Ppl working there are so cool and they are trying to make it even better

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Bay" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We have done the FBI room and now the Pirate Bay, we escaped both with just minutes to spare. So much fun! We are already planning our next room! Keep the rooms coming guys!!!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Adventure" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: We visited Limitless Escapes on Saturday. We have done other escape rooms but this was by far the best experience we have had. We escaped The Pirates Adventure with just seconds to spare. It was challenging and so much fun! The staff was very helpful and enthusiastic. Can't wait to try the next room. Would highly recommend.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Adventure" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: First escape room. We did the Pirate Kraken room. It was 9 of us I believe. We didn't escape but that was lack of communication on the teams part. We only had one final puzzle and we failed. Forever sentenced to Davy Jones locker! The staff was totally patient and helpful, they had fun laughing at us all I am sure. We cannot wait to do it again. Thanks Nathan for putting up with us!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Adventure" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: Great place to hang out. The Pirate room is my favorite!

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Adventure" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: Loved this place! I've done over 70 escape rooms and I had an absolute blast here. The staff is incredibly friendly and nice. The puzzles are well thought out and fun. I especially loved the decor of the Pirate themed room and the unique puzzles in their Sherlock themed room. I highly recommend this escape room.

room_title: Escape room "Pirate Adventure" by Limitless Escape Games in Livermore
review: Great staff, fun experience, family and friends had a blast and managed to escape the Kraken! Will be back to try out the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Summer Vacation" by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: There were 6 of us and we had the room to ourselves. We did Summer Vacation. It was very close but we escaped! I thought it was well thought out and put together. I've only done a few of these so I'm not world worthy but we had a GREAT girls night out. The staff were very friendly (and funny!) and added to our night.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Summer Vacation" by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: This was given to me for my birthday and we had a blast! There were 4 of us who had never been in an escape room doing the Summer Vacation level 7 difficulty. Get your thinking caps on and think outside the box! The staff was accommodating with our time and very friendly! Would definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Summer Vacation" by School of Hard Locks in Oceanside
review: Fabulous time yesterday. Working as a team brings you closer together as friends and I admire the skills of all my friends and new friends. Definitely a positive experience. Owner and mastermind behind it all was so cordial and fun. You can tell this is her passion and her enthusiasm puts the icing on the cake! Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "Blackbeard's Lost Treasure" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I totally thought they were manually controlling the locks in the back while they laughed at our attempts, but the lady insisted that the locks are all player-controlled. Hm... if so, that's amazing because I was like...how did it know we got it right? I was with 3 other people that never did an escape room before so we had unlimited clues. w00t! I'd recommend this place. It's so much fun.

room_title: Escape room "Blackbeard's Lost Treasure" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Had a great time! Just want to thank Brandon and his whole team for their great customer service...great customer service means everything to me! Thanks for making this experience exceptional! They were very accommodating, helpful and friendly. My whole group had a great time can't wait to experience the other rooms they have to offer.

room_title: Escape room "Blackbeard's Lost Treasure" by Back in Time Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This place is SO great!! Booking is easy and quick to do online. Just pick a date, location, and which room you want to do. They tell you the size of the room and difficulty level. The staff is so friendly, welcoming, and entertaining!So far I've tried 2 of the rooms and they were both AWESOME! Great themes with a lot of creativity, detailed puzzles and sets/props, and a good level of difficulty to challenge you while keeping it fun! They allow you a certain number of hints during the game, too. (They were even very generous to offer a few extra ones for us - they want you to succeed!) Definitely recommend this place and can't wait to try escaping another room!

room_title: Escape room "Prof. Pittsburgs' National Treasure" by EXIT Escape Room Adventures in Modesto
review: Our family had so much fun solving the puzzles in Kingdom of Exitia! Can't wait to go back and try the other room!!

room_title: Escape room "Prof. Pittsburgs' National Treasure" by EXIT Escape Room Adventures in Modesto
review: The National Treasure Room is amazing! I can't wait to do the Saloon! Everyone needs to experience an escape room! Great team building.

room_title: Escape room "Prof. Pittsburgs' National Treasure" by EXIT Escape Room Adventures in Modesto
review: It was so much fun. Just did the National Treasure room and had my mind blown. I definitely want to go back and try my hand at the Saloon room. I will be a repeat visitor!

room_title: Escape room "Prof. Pittsburgs' National Treasure" by EXIT Escape Room Adventures in Modesto
review: Extremely fun. This game kept everyone on their toes. Played the National Treasure room which was very well made. A lot of thought was definitely put into making the puzzles. Managed to get out with just a little over a minute left! The owners are very nice and shared in our excitement. Definitely going to try the exit saloon next time.

room_title: Escape room "Mysterious Stranger" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: Wow! What a fun and challenging room! Denzel was extremely nice and helpful! He let us know about the other room option and will be back again very soon!

room_title: Escape room "Mysterious Stranger" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: Fantastic gameplay, well thought out theme, and immersive decor. The owner, Jason was encouraging and his fun demeanor was contagious. Anyone in the San Diego area must come try!

room_title: Escape room "Mysterious Stranger" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: Had a wonderful time with my escape room team! This was my 25th room and my teams 7th and it certainly didn’t disappoint. Loved the room, wonderful immersion, unique puzzles and passionate owners who love what they do. Couldn’t ask for anything more!

room_title: Escape room "Mysterious Stranger" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: This was definately the best way to spend a friday afternoon! Very challenging and rewarding! Owner is the nicest and you can tell he really enjoys his job! Makes the expierence that much better!

room_title: Escape room "Mysterious Stranger" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: Mysterious Stranger room - Played the escape room with 2 of my escape room partners in crime. The set and prop designs are beautiful, the flow of the game was smooth, and the transitions between the zones adhered and added to the story line. This has to be one of the top escape rooms in San Diego!

room_title: Escape room "Mysterious Stranger" by Steal and Escape in San Diego
review: This is a fabulous room well designed and great hospitality!!

room_title: Escape room "Deep Space" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: Had a blast doing Deep Space! Love the two new rooms! Great puzzles with a good variety. Everything in good shape and explanation of game/goal easy to understand. Huge plus...we made it out!! We did it with only four of us and loved doing it as a small group. Great fun!

room_title: Escape room "Deep Space" by Beat the Room in Sacramento
review: A friend and I came here to experience the Deep Space room and loved it! The room was very atmospheric, the puzzles were challenging but not impossible, and our "Mission Control" was very helpful! We didn't escape the room before the timer ran out but we did have a blast! This place is definitely recommended for a good time regardless of whether you win or not.

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Frankenstein's Laboratory" by Excido Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was a lot of fun. The staff was great. We are going back!

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Frankenstein's Laboratory" by Excido Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Best 45 minutes of fun! Died while trying to figure out the last clue...

room_title: Escape room "Dr. Frankenstein's Laboratory" by Excido Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This is our third time, we've taken different friends and family every time. Great team building experience. You really get what you put into it. We will go again!

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51 - Version 2" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: Incredible production value. Difficulty spikes require some really sideways thinking, but each room is unique with unique puzzles and real attention to detail. We've done every room here and they were all worth it, absolutely recommend it.

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51 - Version 2" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: My wife and I visited Exitgame last week and it did not disappoint whatsoever. Upon arriving we were treated by our game host Drew where he made us feel very welcome and was very easy to talk to. We did the Lab 51 room and it was a good mixture of difficulty with the challenges. The only thing I would say was a little frustrating was being tall lol. Without spoiling anything I would recommend my tall friends out there stretch before doing this room. We have done between 20-25 rooms and this was definitely in the top echelon. I look forward to doing the other rooms they have, and I am pretty sure they are going to rock as well. Great job Exitgame, you deliver a legit experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Lab 51 - Version 2" by Exit Game in San Diego
review: I've done about 20 escape rooms and I was really surprised how good their AI room is in terms of decor, theme-related puzzles and how high quality the tech was in this room. Then I came back to do the Lab 51 room and also had a blast doing it. You can count on me to be first in line whenever they open up a new room. Would recommend to intermediate or experienced players!

room_title: Escape room "Th3 C0d3" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: The Code was a lot of fun! We barely got out but we definitely wouldn't have gotten out without the help of Kris, Oscar, and Azhane!! Thanks so much for a great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Th3 C0d3" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: This was my first time and I'm sure I will come again!!! Kris and Miranda were great workers, introducing us to our room and all that! Definitely recommend doing TH3 COD3!

room_title: Escape room "Th3 C0d3" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: This was my first escape room! I had a great experience and it was totally challenging. Miranda and Kris were really good game hosts, teaching us how to play and pretty much everything we need to know. We finished our game (COD3) in just 40 minutes which was pretty impressive for us haha. This escape place makes me want to try out other escape places. Def coming back here in the near future!

room_title: Escape room "Th3 C0d3" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: We had a blast! Oscar and Augustus were the absolute BEST. They made the experience so fun and memorable. I highly recommend this to everyone! We did "Th3 C0d3" and got out in 50 minutes!

room_title: Escape room "Th3 C0d3" by Escapology San Diego in San Diego
review: We took the family for the C0d3 and had an absolute blast. Game master Augustus was the best. Great personality and made our visit very memorable. The props and decor totally immerse you into the puzzle. Suttle hints were nice touch without giving the solution away. Everyone came away excited we escaped with 2 minutes.... even the 7 and 10 yr olds had a blast and was able to contribute. We will definitely visit again should we make it back to San Diego or another of the franchise locations.

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: Breakout Mobile was our fifth escape room and one of my favorites. We did the Museum Heist, a very fun and brain-teasing room. The Breakout crew was super and the facilities were set-up very well. We made it out at 48:56 and will be back to do another room.

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: Took my daughter here for her 18th birthday did the Museum Heist and that was so fun! Me and my family will be back and do the other ones.

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: We played the museum heist game for one of my buddies birthdays recently and we had a blast! There were 9 of us in the room and there was still plenty for each person to do!! Also, we finished in the Top 10 times!! We were pretty proud!

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: We had 3 adults and 5 kids, ages 9-13. The 9 year old may have been a bit young and therefore, frustrated because he couldn't figure out clues, but the others (11, 12, 13) had a blast and really got into it. We had a great time working together on how to break out of the museum heist.

room_title: Escape room "Museum Heist" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: My family and friends had a friendly competition. The ladies did museum heist and the men did hostage. Of course the ladies broke out. We all had a blast. Great way to celebrate my birthday.

room_title: Escape room "Dragon's Belly" by Fort Smith Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Butcher" by Escape the Place in Orange County
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Casino Heist" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: This place is great! The puzzles were challenging, but not frustrating. The staff were super friendly which made it even more fun! We actually didn't finish the casino heist, but there were only two of us and we were so close! The end when we lost was almost the best part because it was so funny! Totally worth the money!

room_title: Escape room "Casino Heist" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Great group of people running this fun place! The casino theme was a lot of fun and am looking forward to trying out the other rooms. I would definitely come back again!

room_title: Escape room "Casino Heist" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: AMAZING fun! The owner was so much fun and really made the difference from other escape room companies! We did the casino heist and can't wait to go back and try the bunker. Thanks for a fun night out!

room_title: Escape room "Casino Heist" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: We had an awesome time together stealing the loot from the casino :) Ages 8-69 all worked together and everyone had a blast and had no trouble contributing in different ways. Highly recommend for all ages!

room_title: Escape room "Casino Heist" by Paradox Escape Room in Phoenix
review: Soooooooooo fun!!! We did the Casino Heist room and now I want to go back and do the Bunker. Highly recommended if you're looking for a group activity!

room_title: Escape room "The Armory" by Kingdom Keys NWA in Centerton
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Cabin 13" by Legacy Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Some escape rooms make you solve puzzles that mean you go like, "okaaay... I guess..." but the puzzles in this room were fun, clever, and very doable. Julie was very friendly and made it super accommodating for the 6 of us.

room_title: Escape room "Cabin 13" by Legacy Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This room was so fun! Just the right amount of spooky without me flinching at everything I unlock in case of a jumpscare. I don't want to give away any spoilers, but I will say I started in a mini room. The puzzles were challenging but not frustrating, and above all I they were fun. There were many puzzles where I thought "wow, that's clever!"--and i have probably done about 20 escape rooms at this point. Decorations were great, and our game master Julie was SO good at explaining clues. Go here!

room_title: Escape room "Cabin 13" by Legacy Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Cabin 13 was a great escape experience.  I love the format and puzzles of this room.  The staff and game masters do a great job with your group and creating an awesome experience.The experience is well crafted and we had a great time escaping!  I look forward to visiting again for a new experience.

room_title: Escape room "Beat the Clock" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: Our family was looking for something fun to do out of the heat that we hadn't done before. This fit the bill. We got to work as a team to solve puzzles and escape the room. The 15 year-old had as much fun as the 9 year-old, and everyone begged to go solve another room as soon as we'd finished. Highly recommended. They even opened just so we could fit them in our trip!

room_title: Escape room "Beat the Clock" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: The best date night ever! We did the clocks room which was very fun!We are going back for more this weekend and bring more people to join in on the good times.Can't wait

room_title: Escape room "Shadow Menagerie" by Hall Of Shadows Escape Games in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Vacation Vandals" by Key Quest in Los Angeles
review: Took my son and a few friends here. Had a Blast!!! The staff is friendly. Will definitely come back soon.

room_title: Escape room "Vacation Vandals" by Key Quest in Los Angeles
review: Giving 3 stars because I'm being a hater haha took my son and some friends here for his 14th birthday. I am being a hater because the vacation vandals is HARD. It was a lot of fun but disappointed we couldn't solve it. We got about 3/4 done and got stuck. We probably should have asked for help sooner. We wanted to solve it on our own so we didn't call for a help clue till we were down to 15 minutes and by then it was too late we didn't have enough time to finish. But all the workers were super nice and the boys had fun doing a few games of laser tag beforehand. I will check back here seeing if anyone has solved it though.

room_title: Escape room "Vacation Vandals" by Key Quest in Los Angeles
review: I had an excellent experience here last night with my grandkids, thanks!!

room_title: Escape room "The Rise of Excalibur" by Brainy Actz in Los Angeles
review: This is really cool place!!! Really save, really, interesting for any ages. My kids want to return more and more!

room_title: Escape room "The Rise of Excalibur" by Brainy Actz in Los Angeles
review: Challenging, fun...truly a great time, with teamwork and comarderie!

room_title: Escape room "The Rise of Excalibur" by Brainy Actz in Los Angeles
review: Had a blast and the host was wonderful. Bringing my kids with me next time.

room_title: Escape room "The Spaceship" by The Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Loved this place, went with friends and we had such a great time, just the place alone gives you a spaceship vibe and outstanding work!

room_title: Escape room "The Spaceship" by The Room LA in Los Angeles
review: WOW! Had the BEST time! Our first experience in an escape room and it was even more fun than we expected! We did the Spaceship experience and will be going back soon to do the Cabin.

room_title: Escape room "The Spaceship" by The Room LA in Los Angeles
review: We had one hour to get out of a space module. Had to decipher many clues and riddles manually and electronically. Our family plus 2 got out with about 40 seconds to spare. We found life on planet Zoe and lived to tell about it! Easier to open locks would improve rating.

room_title: Escape room "The Spaceship" by The Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Super fun, and the interior of the spaceship room was really cool - it looked and felt like we were in space! The storytelling was a little bit confusing though (hard to figure out what exactly the point of each puzzle was) and some of the props were really challenging to work with which cut into our time. But overall it was very fun, the woman who worked with us was so nice and professional and helpful, and we had a great time! And we escaped with 3 minutes to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Fortune's Favor" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: What a fun night! You must do this! Josh was our guide and he did an awesome job!! He explained what we needed to do and put us at ease. He was super positive and didn't make us feel"stupid".This was a change of pace from out every other month bookclub gather and we all had a blast! We solved many of the clues and unlocked the treasures. We really enjoyed this and I highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Fortune's Favor" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: Super fun times solving Fortunes Favor! This one is a cool cave/forest feel. Really beautifully constructed to transport you into another place. I have previously done The Seance, Gallery, and Heist here and each challenge presents new solutions and methods that I've never experienced before. They really go the extra mile here. We had a great time with five of us in the room. The premise was fun and played on cultural knowledge. It had a mild level of creepiness/darkness which I personally prefer to heighten the excitement. Caitlyn (sp?) was a great hostess. Having the 8pm time slot, I think she let us have an extra 15min because we were on a roll. We really appreciated that because it let us fully discover the room and succeed rather than cue the lights and open the door with remaining unsolved puzzles. We will definitely be back here for another challenge next month. Maybe The Space Station... Our team can't wait!

room_title: Escape room "Fortune's Favor" by Escape Sacramento in Sacramento
review: just tried their newest room fortunes favor and it absolutely rivals the best rooms I've played in sac!!! This room is most definitely fun, themed, and challenging. You will have a great time taking in the challenge of fortunes favor!

room_title: Escape room "Saloon 66" by Flagstaff Escape Space in Flagstaff
review: Went to the escape room on very little notice (we wanted to do something fun, yet none of us planned anything) after confirming they had availability. I'm so happy we went to this one. It was fun and detailed and different from any escape room I've been in before! We completed the Saloon Room, and I can say that it was difficult to make all of us think, but also just easy enough for us to get out with 7 minutes to spare. Please please go here! Book a room online or call ahead, the price is well worth the hour given to play and if I'm ever in Flagstaff again I'll be trying to hit this place up.

room_title: Escape room "Saloon 66" by Flagstaff Escape Space in Flagstaff
review: Our family LOVES Escape Rooms and we've done rooms in several different states and we really enjoyed this room! We booked last minute due to the weather changing our spring break plans and this was definitely a silver lining of that!!
