We did the Saloon 66 room it was challenging and fun we unfortunately didn't escape but we had a great time trying!! Would definitely recommend this company to anyone looking for Escape Rooms in Flagstaff!!

room_title: Escape room "Blood Thirst" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: Totally didn't know what to expect but ended up having great fun! 'Blood Thirst' is totally clever.. high recommendations for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Blood Thirst" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: The six of us failed the Dracula room. While we had a ton of fun and completed over 60%, we were constrained by the linear progressive design. It was well designed. Great times.

room_title: Escape room "Blood Thirst" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: While Dracula may have defeated us that evening, our spirits and adrenaline were high on into the night! Bloodthirst was definitely challenging (we probably should have started with an easier room) but the puzzles were well thought out and very satisfying when we were able to solve them.The staff was friendly and the experience was great overall even though we failed in our mission! We will definitely be back to attempt some of the other rooms. Thanks for a great time.

room_title: Escape room "Blood Thirst" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: This was definitely fun! Though we lost Blood Thirst, we had a great time. Kicking ourselves for not listening to our gut about asking for the 1st clue early on, but we did not have a whole group vote on it since our foursome was paired up with another foursome & they did not want it. We almost made it! Ugh! Definitely a return in the works for another room! Staff was super friendly and helpful! Go here, peeps!

room_title: Escape room "Blood Thirst" by Epic Escape Game in Phoenix
review: I played the Dracula game with 4 other people, I felt it was very well crafted. It really is very challenging because it is not intuitive, the game had far too many steps, which were hard to follow. More people do not help because the game stops completely at points while you figure out one particular step. Good luck to any who dare to try it!

room_title: Escape room "Mardi Gras" by Get a Clue in Orange Beach
review: We did both the crime scene and the Mardi Gras room and LOVED both of them! We have done 9 escape rooms and these are in the top for sure!! Definitely give them a try, you will not be disappointed!

room_title: Escape room "Mardi Gras" by Get a Clue in Orange Beach
review: My family and I had a great time working our way through the clues in the Mardi Gras room. We loved the way the room was set up with great decor and interactive props. It was challenging and exciting. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "Mardi Gras" by Get a Clue in Orange Beach
review: We had a great time trying to escape the Mardi Gras room! Definitely something everyone should try! Thank you Mark and Sharon for a great evening!

room_title: Escape room "Mardi Gras" by Get a Clue in Orange Beach
review: We loved it! I took my two children 8 and 11 years old. We did the Mardi Gras room. When we didn't know what to do next we were helped with clues. This was fun for my kids and me. We will be back to do the crime scene room next!

room_title: Escape room "Six Shooter Bunk House" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: Went with a group of 5, and we are all old hats at escape rooms. We've probably done about 20 so far in Vegas, St. Louis, Orlando, Phoenix, etc. This room was okay for a Tucson escape room. It was better than two other Tucson rooms we tried last weekend. The decor was very good - It did get you feeling like you were in the old west and there were some fun trinkets to look at. The downside for my group was that the puzzles/clues did not seem realistic - they were quite random and left us wondering things like, "Why on earth would a person write that bit of info on that item??" "Why would a person ever hide that thing in this way?" The puzzles and clues just weren't realistic at all. So if you are particular about authentic scenarios, you may be a bit underwhelmed here.If you don't care about practical story-lines and game play, then you will probably really enjoy this room!

room_title: Escape room "Six Shooter Bunk House" by Ace of Escape in Tucson
review: We have done a room at each location, and both were so much fun. The 6 shooter room was great! We were a group of four which was perfect for the difficulty level and size of the room. We made it out of this one with seconds to spare!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We decided to attempt this room because my boyfriend is a huge Fallout fan. I personally didn't think this room was too challenging, as everything was pretty linear and straightforward for the most part. High production value, and overall fun experience. Would recommend to anyone who likes Fallout or is looking to do an escape room with a smaller group since the max is 4 for this room.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: My sister and I did Outbreak, which was our first room. Neither of us knew what we were doing but with the help of Felicia, our host, we finished with 7.49 minutes to spare! Great fun can't wait to do another one. Fun for all ages.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I booked the Outbreak room for my husband's Father's Day gift and I am so glad I did! I love the player-friendly style (unlimited hints, delivered via loudspeaker), the incredible attention to detail in the room, and Special Agent Crystal was an awesome element to the story-telling!

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I organized a group event for my company here. It was a fun to try to work out way out of the rooms. Damien and the rest of the staff were incredibly helpful. Puzzles were challenging but worth the experience so I highly recommend 60 out. They were in the process of building two new rooms so it looks like we'lol probably be back soon for another round.

room_title: Escape room "Outbreak" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I have done 2 of 60out's escape rooms and they were both amazing! The puzzles were challenging but not impossible. I loved the sets in both the rooms. The game masters were fun, friendly, and helpful. A great way to spend an hour! I have already booked my third room with them. Thanks to 60out I'm completely hooked on escape rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Key to the Throne" by Game the Room in Rohnert Park
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Space Heroes VR" by ZScape Games in Livermore
review: None

room_title: Escape room "POD" by A Narrow Escape in Hot Springs
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Dracula: The Final Hour" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: My team and I came out here to try Dracula, after hearing it is an original game created by the owner of the location, and we couldn't be more impressed. The set design, puzzles, immersion was on point. Perfect game for a max of 4-6 people. I would definitely recommend it to everyone!

room_title: Escape room "Dracula: The Final Hour" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Wow. First time doing an escape room at this location and will def be back. The Dracula room is difficult, very well designed and beautiful. Not your average escape room. They do help you if you need it and even if you're a seasoned vet of escape rooms you're gonna have a great time. Thank you!!!

room_title: Escape room "Dracula: The Final Hour" by Room Escape Los Angeles in Los Angeles
review: Shout out to Teri!!! Dope GM for Dracula and Zombie lab! Loved the rooms especially Dracula! I loved the ending to it and the room itself wasn't super easy either. Will comeback to do Tesla at some point to collect my passport stamp!!!

room_title: Escape room "Mad Lab: Resurrection" by Great Room Escape San Diego in San Diego
review: This was SO scary!!! We arrived with a group of 10 and did the mad lab. It was everybody's first time so we didn't know what to expect. We all had to sign a waiver and listen to instructions beforehand. You are not allowed to bring phones and purses. You will have to put it in a bin that will be in the same room with you. For the actual escape room, most of the times, we were screaming and scrambling so it was very hard to think while a chained up radioactive professor was chasing you. My heart was pumping pretty fast and my adrenaline was rushing. The mad scientist who was supposed to be our helper and guide, scared us even more! This was definitely not an easy escape room. We didn't make it in the 1 hr limit but it was still so much fun + SCARY! Definitely  check in yelp for the free extra hint because you will need it! Kudos to you if you can solve this escape room with no hints!

room_title: Escape room "Mad Lab: Resurrection" by Great Room Escape San Diego in San Diego
review: A friend and I did the zombie lab with a few other groups and it was such a fun experience. I thought it might be kind of awkward doing it with strangers but once the timer started we easily got into the groove as a team. I definitely enjoyed my time and will be going back to try another one. Whether you're going for a date, girls night, or team building I highly recommend Great Room Escape!

room_title: Escape room "Mad Lab: Resurrection" by Great Room Escape San Diego in San Diego
review: I've been to several escape rooms and this one was one of the best! We had a great time. The level of difficulty was challenging but not impossible. We did the "Mad Lab" scenario. There is a zombie on a chain and as time ticks by, the chain gets longer. If he touches you they put you in a cell and you have to answer questions to get out. Having this element added to the game definitely made it interesting and kept us on our toes!The staff was nice and helpful. I would definitely recommend this one!

room_title: Escape room "Speakeasy Nouveau" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: We played the Speakeasy Nouveau as a family. It was my husband and I and our two 10 year old boys.We have played a couple of escape rooms in the past as a family, so we have a little experience. This rooms is by far our very favorite ever. The story, variety of clues and puzzles, and props were all very well done. We also love the fact that its more than one room, you are led into more rooms with more clues which adds so much to the excitement! We found the clues sufficiently challenging, as we had to ask for a couple of hints along the way. The number of puzzles was perfect as we escaped with literally no time to spare. We had such a great time we came back the next night, while we were still in town, and brought another family along with us. The eight of us solved the Diner room. Again, great fun, great puzzles, and a large enough space so we all fit very comfortably and had plenty of different puzzles to work on simultaneously. They are also very competitively priced. Less expensive than some rooms we have visited, yet so much better!We highly recommend Quicksand Escape Games.

room_title: Escape room "Speakeasy Nouveau" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: Me and my family booked a trip to the Quicksand escape room while on our family vacation in San Diego. I came recommended from a friend and did not disappoint. I had not been to an escape room before so did not know what to expect. It was engaging, challenging, and a lot of fun. Would highly recommend for anyone that likes a challenge and is looking for something different/fun to do.

room_title: Escape room "Speakeasy Nouveau" by Quicksand Escape Games in San Diego
review: The location is right in the middle of busy pacific beach. The hosts are amazing and extremely accommodating as we were running late. They were very professional and knowledgeable and absolutely made the experience so much better! We attacked the Speakeasy Nouveau and got out with minutes to spare. There were a few minor hiccups however the hint system and the quick response by Andy kept the game flowing! All in all, Quicksand Escape is one of my top favorite escape rooms! I've completed The Diner, the Speakeasy, and Chinatown to date!

room_title: Escape room "Turing Test" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Rooms are fun, challenging and very immersive. Fun for the family!

room_title: Escape room "Turing Test" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I had a great time here!! This experience taught me the value of teamwork. The staff is great! Rose is great and should get a raise!!

room_title: Escape room "Turing Test" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Great venue. Interesting rooms with great attention to detail and awesome effects. Had a great time getting two rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Mutiny: Skull Island" by Escape Games at The River in Rancho Mirage
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Curse on the Emerald Seas" by Puzzle Effect San Luis Obispo in Grover Beach
review: We had a blast! Went as a girls party to the curse of the emerald sea, and it was harder and even more clever then I thought! So much fun! Also Kristen was amazing and so helpful. Definitely going again!

room_title: Escape room "Curse on the Emerald Seas" by Puzzle Effect San Luis Obispo in Grover Beach
review: I did not realize that I had booked the most challenging room they offered. The Emerald Curse was pretty tough. Puzzles were very creative and fun. The room followed the theme very well. The staff member was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely go again, but would do an easier room. Lol

room_title: Escape room "Curse on the Emerald Seas" by Puzzle Effect San Luis Obispo in Grover Beach
review: We had a great time trying to escape the Curse of the Emerald Sea! Challenging, exciting, and well decorated. Left us guessing down to the last minutes! Will be back for other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The Morgue of Dr. G. Reaper" by Trapped In Decatur in Huntsville
review: Lots of fun! Definitely going back! We did the "Escape from Morgue" and had a great time. I would recommend this to everybody!

room_title: Escape room "The Den of the Occult" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: So much fun! Did the den of the occult with 4 people and got pretty far but didn't finish. No regrets it was still awesome. I'll definitely be going back!

room_title: Escape room "The Den of the Occult" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: Escaped the Den of the Occult on Monday, June 12th in 42+ minutes. Very good room with lots of clever puzzles and physical contraptions, all of which made for a fun game.

room_title: Escape room "The Den of the Occult" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: We tried the Den of the Occult. The staff was very cool. The clues were imaginative and there were some innovative effects. A great way to spend time with friends and get to know people.

room_title: Escape room "The Den of the Occult" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: Had a wonderful time visiting "Den of the Occult" from the UK. Great mix of traditional and technology, some very clever clues to figure out combinations. The climax had fun interactions which were a brilliant addition to the room and gave the wow moments that make escape rooms so enjoyable. We look forward to visiting you again in the future when we return to California. Thank you!

room_title: Escape room "The Den of the Occult" by Escapedom in Los Angeles
review: Difficult and challenging puzzles! Fun to do with a group of friends. Teamwork is key! Also at a great price!

room_title: Escape room "The Dig" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: What an annoying time, the whole room was tired to the ability to solve a freaking slide puzzle.  Every thing else you can piece it together, but if none in your team can do it good luck. Highly disappointed and would not recommend this room just based on the slide puzzle.  I would give the other rooms a try.

room_title: Escape room "The Dig" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: Had an amazing time solving the Dig with my family! Amazing puzzles and will definitely recommend and will do more again soon!

room_title: Escape room "The Dig" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: Very cool. Definitely a different way to spend a Saturday night! Our room was like an archeology, "Indiana Jones"-type room. We spent the hour trying to decipher hieroglyphics and codes to try and find our way out but came up a few minutes short. Our Clue master was great and guided us well. We will definitely go back and try the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Dig" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: Came here with my wife and 8 friends for "The Dig" and had an absolute blast! The escape is challenging in that you all have to work as a team while receiving clues. While one person may interpret a clue one way, another person may have a different approach to things. If you want to get out within the allotted 60 minutes, you need to work as a team. Luckily, we got out in 58:59!

room_title: Escape room "The Dig" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: I went with my team at work we all had a great time. It was super fun and we got out with 4 minutes to spare. It makes you "dig" deep (ha!), get creative and really look beyond the norm. I would definitely suggest it for a fun night!

room_title: Escape room "The Dig" by Escape The Room Scottsdale in Phoenix
review: I came here to celebrate my birthday with my co-workers and we had so much fun!!! Loved the Dig, I thought it was really kind of difficult and the whole thing was really intense. However, it was definitely a lot of fun and exciting every time we figured out a clue. We ended up getting out with two minutes to spare!! It's a bit pricey but I definitely want to come back to try the other rooms!!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
review: 5/5 stars for Escape:Chandler! We’ve done The Cabin and The Pawn Shop. Both rooms are immersive and have great designs. It’s clear the owners put much thought into their themes and room decoration. The owners also exude passion for what they do and make the experience even better. The puzzles flow well and are fun to solve. I would recommend this place to anyone. Thanks for the great time!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
review: Just spent a fun hour here. The Cabin is just the right amount of spooky and creepy suspense. The owner/gamemaster was so good at her job, so we felt the experience was amazing. We will be back!

room_title: Escape room "The Cabin" by ESCAPE:chandler in Phoenix
review: I booked this as a team building activity for myself and my management team. We did the cabin theme and had SO much fun! Zuzu was great, super friendly and explained everything really well. We escaped with 23 seconds left! We definitely want to come back and do the other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "High School Detention" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: Visited House of Hints as a work team building exercise. There were enough of us to split into two groups and compete in escaping high school detention. We had a blast. Will definitely visit in the future.

room_title: Escape room "High School Detention" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: House of Hints was so fun! The detention room was super challenging, but still very fun. Matt enhanced our overall experience with his humor and upbeat attitude. I would definitely recommend this place to others. I can't wait to go back and try the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "High School Detention" by House of Hints in San Diego
review: Pretty good room with some fun twists. I would recommend it to anyone and would give it a 7/10 based on the rooms I’ve completed. My main downside was that I thought the main story didn’t necessarily flow throughout the entire game but still fun and unique puzzles.

room_title: Escape room "Saloon No 10" by Escape Anchorage in Anchorage
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Summer School Scandal" by Extreme Escape Redding in Redding
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Ghost Chamber" by Wizards & Wires Studios in Redlands
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: it was awesome !!!!!!!!!!!! the codes were fun and the puzzles too! my team made it out with 7 minutes to spare!!

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: I did this room with a group of 3, and felt that it was a good number although the GM told us that it would be more tough attempting this room with such a smaller number of people. We felt that the room was okay overall, good for those who are new to escape rooms. It was literally just locks and keys, as we felt that room didn't have a high production value because some of the clues and props just looked out of place. On top of that, when we were inside the room we could hear people talking really loudly outside, which broke our concentration from the room. We had to ask for hints for certain puzzles because we literally had no clue how to solve them, but overall this is a learning experience that I will be taking with me to the next escape room I do. We escaped with about 3 minutes to spare.

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: Went with a small group of 4 to do the Pirate Den. It was our first trip to a room escape and we had a blast! The puzzles felt complicated yet beatable and there were many different types. The room was immersing and very well designed. Staff was friendly and helpful. I can't wait to go back and try out the Pharaoh room!

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: Loved it! We escaped but with less than a minute to spare! (From Pirate room). The lady working was really nice and very helpful both before and during our experience.

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: Challenging but a lot of fun. Made it out of the pirate room with seconds to go. Clever puzzles and great rooms. Can't wait to try other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: Our family had a great time and escaped the pirate room in the nick of time!

room_title: Escape room "The Pirate's Den" by MagIQ Room in Los Angeles
review: Birthday party perfection for adults and children alike!!!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: Introduced some newbies to the game and enjoyed my third round. Best time yet in the Casino room. Our game master [Jack] was AWESOME! Thanks for great night! Can’t wait to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: We did the Casino game and it was so fun!! We had to figure out many different logic games. The staff was very nice and offer hints if you get stuck. Definitely want to go back and try all of them!!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: My husband, myself and two other couples did the casino! Very challenging, but we were able to break out!! Can't wait to go back!!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: This was so soo much fun! We had a blast. We were a little surprised to be paired with strangers to reach capacity, but it turned out fine. It was such a challenge and we broke out of casino Royale in 58:54! I hear that this is the hardest one!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: Casino" by Breakout Games - Mobile in Mobile
review: A group of 7 of us played the casino room today & had a blast! We didn't break out but it was fun & our game master Ashton was fun to work with! Will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Houdini" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've been to three different 60out locations and each as been wonderful. The rooms are decorated to feel realistic and the clues are clever. Staff has been friendly and professional. We just keep going back. One of these days we will finish without assistance! No way.

room_title: Escape room "Houdini" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Fantastic staff. Easily the best production value in an escape room I've ever seen. Definitely worth your time and money!

room_title: Escape room "Houdini" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: best escape room out there! highly recommend to everyone!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 3: The Study" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: My group did The Basement & The Study and we left both rooms very disappointed.Let me begin by saying that we were extremely excited to do these rooms and we had heard so many good things about it. Long story short we don't think we will ever be coming back to this establishment. Study: The puzzles in the room were fairly basic but then they just became big leaps in logic. There is no direction to this room, and the hint system is at the discretion of the in-room actor, who only hinted 2 things in the room for us. Other than that she would just start yelling directly in our faces, talk about verbal abuse... We will admit that one of our players did break a rule by tossing a pillow in the room which ended up making contact with the actors arm. After which we were all reprimanded over the loud speaker which left a sour mood for all of us for the rest of the room. Do not put your actors in positions where there is no visibility and there is a possibly of them get hurt. An easy way to fix this would be to add a low red hue illuminating the space, that way both the actor and the customers have at least some visibility of what is happening. Frightened people will always have exaggerated reactions to elements unknown, so try to make those elements known. In the rules they are very clear about not climbing on any of the furniture however that is quickly thrown out the window as one of the puzzles requires interaction with some furniture. This had us all very confused as why we deliberately had to break a rule in order to solve the room. Also, throw all sense of safety out the window when you enter this room because you have to do some things that go completely against common sense and better judgement, again there is no direction telling you to do the task you just have to think of the unsafe action and do it yourself. The final puzzle that we got to was "off by a hair" as we were told by our game master at the end. This is always frustrating as literally a few millimeters can make the puzzle not work. This could be fixed by adding larger sensors or even making notches so that there are set amounts that triggers can hit. One of the most awkward parts about the end of the game was when the game master entered and asked us "So how did your lovely actor do in the room?". It's not an audition, she's already got the role you shouldn't need your customers to give feedback on them while they are in still in the room with you. Because to be honest who is really going to say something bad to the actor when they are right there in the room with you: like "Yeah well you see she could have done a lot more instead of just standing in the corner and yelling at us". Onto the pillow thing: Our player realized their mistake and apologized for their reactions but the way the Game Master handled it was unacceptable and unprofessional. She walked us out the lobby, sat us down while she reprimanded all of us about our actions for about 5 minutes saying that she needed a "verbal confirmation" from our player that they would "behave properly" in the room and that she could have just kicked us out without a refund. Honestly we probably would have been better off with that so that we didn't have to experience not only 1 but 2 terrible rooms. We all put that whole issue aside and we were now ready for the next room with hopes it would be so much better, spoiler alert, we were wrong, it was even worse. We were brought with our group & 4 other randoms into the waiting area where the game master yet again called us out for the pillow thing by saying "don't throw anything at the actors or anything crazy like that" while looking directly at us. Seriously?! You already spent time treating us like children and scolding us after the player apologized for their actions, be done with it and move on. The Basement: The entry style to the room was pointless & unnecessary, I guess it adds to the theming & immersion? Felt like a waste to me. The Basement has even less direction than the Study does. Be prepared to turn the whole room upside down in search for things. The flashlights were legitimately falling apart & were horrendously weak. The puzzles were a stretch, some of the visual clues were hard to differentiate: imagine 3 of the exact same locks with a 3 try limit on them. (For both rooms) When we feel like we are struggling we should be able to ask for a clue, it shouldn't be up to the actors to decide if we need it. Oh and in the room was an image of our player who tossed the pillow with the words "PILLOW THROWER" on it. Again, with the taunts & belittlement, are you kidding me. Not a way to make us feel comfortable or welcome anymore. Wish I could give this place 0 stars. Only reason I give 1 star is for the decor and windows in the Study but even then it was very sparse.Based on our experience I wouldn't be surprised if they try to not let you escape so that you come back and spend another $40 on it.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 3: The Study" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: Came back for The Study yesterday. It was such an amazing experience.Our group made it out 43 seconds before the game was over. In my opinion, it's not as difficult as the Basement, but still it's quite challenging.The Basement has gotten me addicted, so I'm coming back in 2 days for their new room The Elevator Shaft.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 3: The Study" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: Wow, this place is awesome. I was excited the entire time looking for clues, solving puzzles, getting everybody play as a team. Cool!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 3: The Study" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: I was a little worried that this might turn out to be cheesy but fortunately that was not the case. The atmosphere, acting and details made for a great experience. We did not escape but made it about 94% of the way. Another couple of minutes and we would have made it. Not bad for a bunch of rookies with no escape game experience. We would like to return for the other two chapters in the future.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 3: The Study" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: Lots of fun!!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter 3: The Study" by The Basement in Los Angeles
review: This is one of the best birthday parties I have ever had! The experience was awesome

room_title: Escape room "20,000 Leagues Under the Sea" by Mystery Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Golden Formula" by Escape Zone Oxford in Oxford (AL)
review: Great facility and location. Staff is excellent! All 5 teenagers loved it! Definitely going to go back!

room_title: Escape room "Prison Break" by Great Escape Mystery Rooms in Fort Smith
review: If you and a few friends are looking to have some fun, you should consider this place. Plan to spend up to an hour there, unless you're quick.Owner was very nice. Currently have 4 different rooms. My friends did the prison break. Very fun!

room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: Well organized and fun staff!! Bomb Squad was my first escape room and we loved it!! Daryl was great!

room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: I honestly feel like we just successfully defused a bomb hahahaha! I'd never done one of these before, and I'm ashamed to say I was not really expecting much. However, from the moment I set foot in the place, I knew it was going to be fun and challenging. The staff do a great job of teaching how to play, and really play their roles to make it feel "real". The owner puts a lot of TLC and expertise into her work building the rooms, and it shows. It's not at all cheesy like I kind of thought it might be. I was 10 minutes into my first puzzle and already wanted to do another one afterward. Go do it.

room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: We did the Bomb Squad escape and had a great time. Out of our group of 7, 5 people were first-timers so this room's intermediate difficulty was a good fit.The owner has a lot of passion and enthusiasm for escapes, and it showed in the room. Lots of well-designed puzzles and activities with an overall high production value.I've done quite a few escapes and this is the first one where there was a human monitor or guide in the room. I think this takes away from the experience, so that would be my one criticism. Our guide jumped in too often without us asking for help.Other than that, great experience and worth the money! We're planning to visit again.

room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: We had so much fun and will definitely go again once they move to their new place. We really enjoyed figuring out the puzzle and solving the clues. At first I think we were all totally confused, but we caught on quickly and in our group of all first-timers, we somehow managed to pull off the second fastest time in solving the room!

room_title: Escape room "Bomb Squad" by Escape Room Tucson in Tucson
review: My family and I did our first ever escape room, BOMB SQUAD, and it was a lot of fun. It is a great team building activity to test communication and working as a group. We started with the "easy" room, but it was still very challenging for us. Originally, we booked the cold war room, but quickly realized it wasn't a good fit for our first time. AJ, the owner, was polite and flexible and adjusted accordingly.

room_title: Escape room "Private Detective Agency: Knight & Rook Investigations" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: We went on Thursday night (family visiting from out of town) and did the Knight & Rook challenge. We didn't escape but had a great time. Can't wait to go back and try again.

room_title: Escape room "Private Detective Agency: Knight & Rook Investigations" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: I was skeptical at first...but I had a great time with my girlfriend. Fun date idea.  Keep an open mind and check everything! We tried the Knight & Rook. It's a blast, worth the $$$ and fun!

room_title: Escape room "Private Detective Agency: Knight & Rook Investigations" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: Went with my brother and parents for my 18th birthday today. It was so much fun while also being mentally challenging. We did Knight and Rook and can't wait to do Pipe Works next!

room_title: Escape room "Private Detective Agency: Knight & Rook Investigations" by Puzzle Effect Gilbert in Phoenix
review: I went here a few weeks ago with my wife and our friends from the East coast. We've done a few different types of escape the rooms in Tempe and Scottsdale but this was by far the best!Both the knight and rook/vegas rooms were tough and constantly had us moving around trying to get ourselves out. We were very happy the limit is 6 people, so our group of 4 was the only party booked when we went. I was impressed with the attention to detail and different types of obstacles we had to face in each room. We barely made it out of the second room it was intense!Awesome staff - looking forward to seeing the new rooms they open!

room_title: Escape room "The Starlight Lounge" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Played this one with my family, we got through the first few puzzles fairly quick. This is also a medium-tech room. I personally found this to be the most difficult room they have even though the site lists it as the easiest. There are a lot of red herrings in this room which threw us off for a good 10 minutes. Overall it was fun and we escaped with ~4 minutes left!

room_title: Escape room "The Starlight Lounge" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I have been to a few Escape Rooms before however this was the best one I've seen from the decor to game flow, staff and creativity. Well done!

room_title: Escape room "The Starlight Lounge" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Wow! Funner then what I expected. I went with a few friends and when we were finished we were all talking about when we would have time to go back and try the next room. Different and very fun way to spend time with your friends.

room_title: Escape room "The Starlight Lounge" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: I went there with a group of friends a few days ago and had a really fun experience. We had no problems with booking, even though we had to change the time the last minute. The staff is very friendly and very helpful. The room is well-designed with a bunch of interesting puzzles, even though there were a few times when we were kind of stuck, the game masters were there to help when we needed them. Over all, it was great, fun thing to do, and i would definitely be going back to check out other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "The Starlight Lounge" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had my daughters 16th Birthday party here .. They had such a great time we stayed and did a second room!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Starlight Lounge" by Amazing Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: The Starlight Lounge is a well laid out room with good challenges to be solved. We escaped with 3 minutes left.

room_title: Escape room "Case File: X" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: One the best escape rooms in Phoenix. Very high production value with a mix of unique and interesting concepts. We only tried case files X and definitely coming back for more rooms as they open up in the future!

room_title: Escape room "Case File: X" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: We had a group of 10 in the "Case File X" room. I can honesty say this is the best escape room facility we've ever been to! The level of intricacy and technologically advanced clues was outstanding. Our cluemaster was excellent in giving clues when we needed them. We were able to make it out and had an excellent time!! I highly recommend this place and we will definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Case File: X" by Eludesions Escape Rooms in Phoenix
review: This was sooo fun! My boyfriend and I went to the Case File X room. It was just the two of us and we made it out with a few minutes to spare (thanks to the hints). Pretty cool and intricate puzzles. The staff was amazing and very friendly even at 11:30PM when we left. Great set up and i highly recommend this place for groups or even just two people! We both enjoyed it very much and are planning our return to a different room.

room_title: Escape room "The Clock Tower" by Escape the Room LA in Los Angeles
review: Lots of fun! We came for opening weekend! Note: park level B5 for easiest access. These are some great themes and highly recommend Clock Tower as number 1!If you like easier do Bank HeistChallenging Clock TowerNear unbeatable Jurassic Escape

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by Trapped In Decatur in Huntsville
review: This was a lot of fun! We did the "Escape from Alcatraz" and got to the last two locks... so close! The "prison guard" who was running the room was terrific. Would definitely go back!

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by Trapped In Decatur in Huntsville
review: Great time! Ready to do it again! We were in the Alcatraz room and did not escape but enjoyed it anyway.

room_title: Escape room "Escape from Alcatraz" by Trapped In Decatur in Huntsville
review: We came from Fayetteville TN with a couple of our friends and did the Escape from Alcatraz room. It was awesome, great job! The “guard” was awesome too!

room_title: Escape room "Lunar Mission" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: High production value, and a perfect way to spend the night out. Our group escaped with no hints needed, and almost beat the record for best time, being off by about 1 minute. They give you space suits to wear in this room and you really feel like you are in space. This one was a little more challenging but nothing too difficult.

room_title: Escape room "Lunar Mission" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Lunar escape was very well designed and so much fun! Thank you for the awesome experience.

room_title: Escape room "Lunar Mission" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Lunar Mission has fantastic production value! The music and the environment were so fun. I loved every minute of it. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Lunar Mission" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Everything I expect from an escape room. I could tell a lot of time was put into the rooms. The Lunar room was incredible. I love the technology offered in both the Lunar and VR room. Well worth the money.

room_title: Escape room "Lunar Mission" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Loved it! So much fun. Challenging escape game, great team, parking, good location ! My overall experience was 10 out of 10 !!! Good job Maze Rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Lunar Mission" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Went with folks from my job and did the Lunar Base room. Great fun! Would highly recommend!!

room_title: Escape room "Agent" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: Such an amazing experience. We were in the Agent room which was so cool and dark. Trying to figure out the clues in the dim light made it even better. We all enjoyed it so much. Definitely need to check into the escape hotel. Can't wait to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Agent" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: Did the Agent room. It was so much fun. It was our first experience in an escape room. The printed passports & clues were great. Definitely going to go back.

room_title: Escape room "Agent" by Escape Hotel in Los Angeles
review: I visited with a group of 4 as a birthday celebration and it was all our first visit to any escape the room experience. We all loved it! When we arrived we were greeted by a hungry zombie, and the ghostly staff was fun and helpful. The Hotel was beautiful and well themed, and our hostess did a great job setting us up for our room. We played Agent, and although we did not win, we had a blast working out the clues and puzzles together. I will definitely be checking back in and plan on filling my passport to Escape Hotel!

room_title: Escape room "Skip Tracer" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: My wife and I are escape room addicts, and when we found ourselves with a day to kill in the central valley, we decided to find an escape room. We ended up playing Skip Tracer and Family Jewels here at Mind Games Clovis. Both games were well thought out, and we especially enjoyed Skip Tracer's clever hind-delivery system. With only two people, Skip Tracer was challenging, but we made it out with several minutes to spare. Family Jewels was easier, but there was still plenty to find and explore. Our hostess was very pleasant, and we could tell she really enjoys what she does.

room_title: Escape room "Skip Tracer" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: So much fun! A group of us friends got together and did the detective room. It was the right amount of challenging and such a great concept. We can't wait to try another room. Staff was very friendly. Definitely recommend!

room_title: Escape room "The Manor" by Immersion in Orange County
review: First time at this escape room location and the staff was so friendly! The room I escaped was The Manor and there are definitely lots of pieces to the clues and room which makes it fun. Overall such a good experience and I will be back to escape their other rooms :)

room_title: Escape room "The Manor" by Immersion in Orange County
review: My first escape room was "The Manor" and it was pretty sweet! A lot of clues to look for and fun to do with a group of people. I will definitely be back!

room_title: Escape room "Framed for Murder" by Immersion in Orange County
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Prohibition" by Escape Room Yuma in Yuma
review: This is absolutely the best! Family and I tried the Da Vinci room and the Prohibition room and the sets were so interactive and detailed! You got an awesome soundtrack to your experience that matches the theme of the room. The awesome part is that if you get stuck on a clue you can request hints. We can't wait to test the other rooms they have. Every day of Spring Break my kids were asking to go back, so this place is definitely doing something right! Amazing customer service and attention to details.

room_title: Escape room "Chapter One: Occam's Apartment" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Love this escape room! You have to do the back-to-back seamless experience for Chapter One and Two. So much fun!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter One: Occam's Apartment" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was my 56th room I've played nationwide.The whole experience started before you got into the room. It was so immersive, I felt like we were living in a suspense/action movie story plot. Patrick, the gamemaster/owner/creator is also a fantastic piece of it all!I've seen most of the puzzles and tasks we had to do in other rooms I've played, but even seasoned players would appreciate their unique delivery and how carefully thought out they were that kept them in line with the story progression. The delivery of hints also fits perfectly into the theme of the whole experience. Can't wait for Chapter 2 and Chapter 3!

room_title: Escape room "Chapter One: Occam's Apartment" by Evil Genius Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I've played about 20 escape rooms, and Evil Genius is one of the best I've done. Interesting puzzle, nice scenery, and immersive atmosphere. Not to mention a fully custom soundtrack for the room, which is awesome AND unique! The story is well done, and you become emotionally invested in it quickly. I'm excited to see what Episode 2 has in store.

room_title: Escape room "Casino Heist" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Had the opportunity to escape from the Casino Heist with a room full of 13 year old. Watched them as they solved each clue to escape just under 60 minutes. Came back to the WLA room of Senator Payne with the family. Had a load of fun. Even Grandma go into the mystery. Can't wait to try one of the new rooms in the Marina area. Also, Angelique was a great hostess as well as the other guy who works there..

room_title: Escape room "Casino Heist" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: This was my first time playing an escape room, and I had a great time with my boyfriend! He surprised me for my birthday, and it was a GREAT surprise. Casino Heist was awesome, and Taylor was such a great gamemaster! I'll definitely be back.

room_title: Escape room "Casino Heist" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Thanks Mac for a fun afternoon! Did the Casino room this time.....clever! Of course I can't say much, but you'll like. I brought my parents who are in their 80's for their first escape room experience. They totally got into it....and even when they were totally confused, I think they liked being there anyway ;). Luckily 60out has so many rooms..can't wait to try them all!!!

room_title: Escape room "Casino Heist" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I HIGHLY recommend their casino room (my 16th one ever)! It's tough, but the hi-tech aspects are impressive! The look and feel makes you feel totally immersed. You have 60 minutes & unlimited hints/clues, but if you want to make the leader board, try not to use one. There were 6 of us in the room. We got out with 5 minutes to spare!I also came back to conquer their Senator Payne room (my 18th one ever) and the puzzles were very unique, which made it so interesting and loads of fun. We had 5 people in that room and we got out in 40 minutes using 1 hint!Can't wait for their next rooms to open up!Street parking free after 8pm. Meter parking $1 per hour. Easy to find parking

room_title: Escape room "Casino Heist" by 60out Escape Rooms in Los Angeles
review: Mak is the friendliest host ever!! Asides from the well-planned escape room, her service really made our experience a great one. Upon arrival, she greeted us and showed us 2 videos just in case this was our first time and we didn't know what to do. Even when we entered the room, she reviewed the rules once again.My boyfriend and I did the Casino Heist with just 2 people. It was definitely doable! You are allowed an unlimited amount of clues, but we only used one. After we were done, she came in and went over some of the things we missed/had questions about.Initially, I was a little skeptical to try 60out Escape Room since I had a bad experience with a different company in the past and it left a sour taste in my mouth in regards to escape rooms. But Mak and 60out Escape Room really turned my experience around. I can't wait to try out the other ones!! 60out Escape Room is my new "go-to" for escape rooms and I highly recommend everyone to check it out.

room_title: Escape room "SuperNova" by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: Our Sunday School class had a blast doing Supernova room. The puzzles were challenging and fun. The staff was friendly and helpful. The house has some cool history too. I'd highly recommend this escape rooms for a fun and team-building group activity!

room_title: Escape room "SuperNova" by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: My co-workers and I visited and had an excellent time! I truly felt part of the group and was blown away by their personality and customer service! I didn't think I'd be very good but was super surprised. I highly recommend that anybody do this! So grab your friends and test your brain!

room_title: Escape room "SuperNova" by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: We did the Game Room the first time and loved it so much that we booked SuperNova! It was even better, the props are great and the room flows well. The owners are very cool and good at their job! We are ready for their new rooms.

room_title: Escape room "SuperNova" by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: This is the best escape room in Little Rock! The only thing better then the rooms are the people who run it. They are so nice and funny. Can't wait to come back again and try another room.

room_title: Escape room "SuperNova" by Mystery Mansion in Little Rock
review: The history of the house was an added bonus to a super fun evening. The staff was great and the challenge was just right - challenging but achievable. We had kids and they were engaged and had a great time. Thank you!! We can't wait to come back!!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Lost Pyramid VR" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: My friends and I played the new VR Escape The Lost Pyramid room that opened today. Originally we were supposed to do the first VR room, but Jay was very accommodating and let us try the new VR room instead. We had an amazing experience! Will definitely come back to try out the regular escape rooms!

room_title: Escape room "Escape The Lost Pyramid VR" by Red Door Escape Room in Sacramento
review: Love this place. The Escape rooms are one of the best designed. It's definitely challenging and fun.The staff is always so friendly and fun. They certainly make the experience better.I like their membership program, they have cool offers and gifts.My most recent visit was for their new VR game, which we played Escape the Pyramid. Although VR was not completely new for me, playing with a group was a different and unique experience. It had a similar style of challenge of their standard rooms, but it felt a bit easier. I'd still recommend it anyone.It's a bit disappointing that they're limited to only 2 games in VR. I wish they had more options. Since it's digital, it could be potentially unlimited. The employee made it sound like the games/rooms are expected to change every ~2 years. I wish they had more rooms  for more players (more than the 4 it's currently limited to). Until then, I suppose I have to go somewhere else for a new experience?! I

room_title: Escape room "Wizard Quest" by Brain Busters Escape Rooms in Daleville
review: None

room_title: Escape room "The Torture Chamber" by Exit Strategy in Sacramento
review: Just did "Torture Chamber" at Exit Strategy Games and it was awesome! One of the hardest rooms I have attempted. I highly recommend giving it a shot.

room_title: Escape room "The Torture Chamber" by Exit Strategy in Sacramento
review: First time here, second time overall doing an escape room and my experience here was amazing! I like how you can have just your own group whereas other places they combine groups. We did the Torture Chamber and you definitely have to communicate! The clues were difficult but not overwhelmingly so. Michael was super friendly and we did ask for help a few times and he would give us hints just enough for us to figure it out without just giving us the answer. It was a lot of fun and definitely would go back/recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "The Torture Chamber" by Exit Strategy in Sacramento
review: My mom and I attempted to escape the Torture Chamber. It was tons of fun and spooky. Michael was our game host and he was so awesome! He was super nice, funny and helped us when we got stuck. I do recommend playing with at least 4 people... two people just isn't enough to get through all the puzzles. I'll definitely be returning!

room_title: Escape room "The Torture Chamber" by Exit Strategy in Sacramento
review: First of all, thank you Michael for making our first experience a great one! We had a group of 11 people and did the Torture Chamber and escaped with 4 and a half minutes! It was so much fun. We will definitely be back to do it again.

room_title: Escape room "The Torture Chamber" by Exit Strategy in Sacramento
review: My friends had a great time getting out of the Torture Chamber. It was our first escape room and we can't wait to come back to try the conspiracy room! The guy at the front was enthusiastic, and did a great job getting us in the problem solving mindset. Can't wait to come back this summer!!!

room_title: Escape room "The Torture Chamber" by Exit Strategy in Sacramento
review: My siblings and I recently went to try out one of the escape rooms (The Torture Chamber) and it was a lot of fun! It was just the three of us and it took us a lot of time (we didn't make it) so I would recommend doing in a group of at least 4-5. The room was well done, required lots of communication, the puzzles were difficult but not extremely so, and I especially enjoyed the intro video :) Michael was genuinely good-natured and it was great interacting with him before and after the game.

room_title: Escape room "Wild Wild West" by Padlocked Inc. in Riverside
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Designer's Studio" by Not Another Escape Room in Pomona
review: Oh great...not another escape room.... but hey, I'm not complaining!There's plenty of parking since it's on the border of a neighborhood and business area.My team of 4 did their "Designer's Studio" room, but we really wanted to do their "Unicorn" room instead. Unfortunately, the room had some technical issues so we ended up doing the "Designer's Studio" instead.Luckily, we weren't disappointed at all. Though the puzzles are mostly gen 1 puzzles, made of locks and other gen 1 mechanics, there were actually gen 1 puzzles that were unique to that room that we had never seen before. I've done almost 150 rooms, and it's always fun to see new puzzles and there were plenty of new ones for me to see this time around too.Their games and wording are quite clever, so pay attention to those.Though the games are private games, I would recommend a team of 2 to 4 for more experience teams, and 4 or more for less experience teams.

room_title: Escape room "Operation: End of Days" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Awesome, great experience!

room_title: Escape room "Operation: End of Days" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Very fun and had a great game master with a lot of flair to his attitude which was enjoyable.

room_title: Escape room "Operation: End of Days" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: So much fun we needed a few hints but it was only my wife and I in the room thank you for the experience!

room_title: Escape room "The Last Winter" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: Had so much fun playing Chronos Escape room! The manager and owner here are stupid friendly. The games are high tech and immersive! Kid and fam friendly.

room_title: Escape room "The Last Winter" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This place is so much fun. They have different rooms that range from Easy to Expert. It is very well put together and exciting. Requires team work! I highly recommend this place!

room_title: Escape room "The Last Winter" by Chronos Escape Room in Los Angeles
review: This was my first time doing an escape room and it was so much fun! The staff is so friendly amazing!!

room_title: Escape room "Japanese Thriller" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: A bit of a difficult room, with a strange set of rules designed to make it a bit horror-themed, such as having to run to a central hallway when the lights flash. The room is certainly not scary.There are 3 rooms, each self-contained. This means that you'll know when you have finished a room. There is then a meta-puzzle to escape.The puzzles mostly had sufficient clues to figure out, but our party of 3 had to ask for a few hints to make sure we were doing the right thing. One puzzle took a long time to slog through, which wasn't particularly exciting. All 3 of us were kept busy figuring things out. The room probably wouldn't be good for large groups, even though they accept up to 9.Not a room for beginners.

room_title: Escape room "Japanese Thriller" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Fun escape room with a solid theme throughout. Some very creative puzzles and although it was a thriller wasn’t too scary. Would definitely recommend to everyone.

room_title: Escape room "Japanese Thriller" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: WE HAD A BLAST!!! My husband and I took four kids and fun was had by all. Brandon, our guide was entertaining,  professional,  and appropriately scary to set the mood. The puzzles were challenging. I would love to try another one. Groupon made it affordable. Bravo!

room_title: Escape room "Japanese Thriller" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: A good choice for first timers. Ignore the scary background story. Nothing scary in the escape room. We did the room with 8 people that had never done an escape room and finished in 17 minutes - second fastest time for that room. Zach was helpful and efficient.

room_title: Escape room "Japanese Thriller" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Just did Escape Game, it's a super fun activity to do with friends or family! I highly recommend it!

room_title: Escape room "Japanese Thriller" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: A must try! If you love a challenge you'll love this! We definitely be back to do both rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Japanese Thriller" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: FUN!!!! This was the best escape game I've been to so far. The puzzles were awesome, and the effects were cool. I like the storyline too. They obviously put lots of thoughts into the puzzles and clues because it was super well done.

room_title: Escape room "Japanese Thriller" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: This was so much fun. Didn't expect to have so much fun with a bunch of random people I don't know. The hosts are funny, energetic, and super welcome. They obviously love doing what they do and really into the games. They created some very cool and fun puzzles. I didn't feel like I was just unlocking one lock after another since the puzzles were so diverse. Great job!!! Can't wait for the next room. Highly highly recommend this place.

room_title: Escape room "Japanese Thriller" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: First time doing an escape room game and this place was absolutely amazing! Staff were super energetic and very helpful. The puzzles were definitely well thought out and very clever! My group made it out with about 9 minutes to spare, so for all you newbies, I'm sure youll be able to figure it out!

room_title: Escape room "Japanese Thriller" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: Finding the place and parking is part of the puzzle! :PWe did the Japanese Thriller room today with four people. The puzzles were fun and challenging but not too hard that we couldn't solve them after a bit of thinking. We did need one hint though. The company adds some different twists from other traditional escape rooms which we enjoyed. For example, you can earn extra points by finding gems in the room.Overall, we enjoyed the room but did not enjoy trying to find parking to get it.

room_title: Escape room "Japanese Thriller" by Escape Game SD in San Diego
review: We had so much fun solving the puzzle and figure our way out. Thanks for all the other yelp reviews that got me into trying this. It was way better and much more fun than i even expected. Our group work so well together and we came out as 4th place. We were so close to being second place overall.

room_title: Escape room "The Alchemy Lab" by ClueMasters Escape Room in Fort Smith
review: We enjoyed our evening at Cluemasters! It was fun for the whole family, teens and grandparents alike. The puzzles were challenging but solvable and the service was excellent. They were polite and helpful when we got stuck. The rooms, puzzles, and storylines were fleshed out and interesting. We are definitely coming back for a different puzzle!

room_title: Escape room "Cabin Heist" by Mission 57 in Salinas
review: Great place! The clues were very cleverly done and props were pretty good too. Highly recommend!

room_title: Escape room "Cabin Heist" by Mission 57 in Salinas
review: My husband and I tried an escape room for the first time. This was a great one to do. Enjoy!!🔍

room_title: Escape room "Cabin Heist" by Mission 57 in Salinas
review: Just finished Cabin Heist, what an amazing experience! 5 stars. I loved this room so much! We will be back for sure to check out Escape the Video Store. The owner is super nice, if you are in the area check out this hidden gem for sure!

room_title: Escape room "Detention" by Key Quest in Modesto
review: We had a great time hanging in the escape room and will totally be back to solve the mystery! We were so very close but needed a bit more time or a couple more heads to put it all together!

room_title: Escape room "The Warehouse" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: It was a lot of fun. We did the Warehouse. We didn't escape, though. We had one more clue to unlock to get there. Only complaint would be getting joined with people we didn't know. I understand that is part of the drawback when having a small group, but it does make the experience a little less enjoyable. Other than that, we had a great time and plan to play more in the future.

room_title: Escape room "The Warehouse" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: We loved it! The warehouse was so much fun. My 15-year-old son was under the impression he was not going to have fun. But he hated to admit he had a blast with his mom and dad here. Such an awesome place! We highly recommend coming here.

room_title: Escape room "The Warehouse" by Locked In in Birmingham
review: My husband and I had the pleasure of being Locked In. It was a wonderful experience. Although it was just the two of us that booked that time, we made it out with only 4 minutes left. I recommend everyone (all ages) go and experience being Locked In & ESCAPE!

room_title: Escape room "Sky Odyssey" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: I played Sky Odyssey today with my team. All I can say is WOW!!!I've done over 40 Escape Rooms and this is #1. From the game, to the effects, to the design, it was just incredible. I felt like I was literally in a fantasy world. I definitely recommend this place to everyone!

room_title: Escape room "Sky Odyssey" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did the Sky Odyssey escape room yesterday. It's the most beautiful and elaborate set I've ever done. There are a lot of puzzles and distractions in this room. A big group is needed.

room_title: Escape room "Sky Odyssey" by Maze Rooms in Los Angeles
review: We did 4 of the escape rooms over there (the abyss is the only one we didn't do)), we had a really great time, Sky Odyssey was our favorite (we got the record of 60 min for the B exit). Really good value!

room_title: Escape room "Escape Your Nightmare" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: This was a great experience! We did this as a couples date and had a blast. It got pretty intense at the end. The staff were very friendly and shared information on the facility. The room we escaped from is not for the faint of heart. If anyone suffers from anxiety, you may want to reconsider the room we did "Escape your nightmare". Still wondering how my picture ended up on the wall...

room_title: Escape room "Escape Your Nightmare" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: Very fun, well put together with great theming. We did the serial killer room with 3 people and it was a blast. With the looming threat of a serial killer barging into the room made for a very tense and exciting situation. I might not take people who are easily scared as the theme of the room is quite "obvious" (fake body parts etc.). Very much would recommend however. And looking forward to trying their other rooms.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Your Nightmare" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: First time going to an escape room. We tried the "Escape your nightmares" room. This was a multiple room challenge with an hour timer before the serial killer comes home and adds you to his collection. We had a great time looking for clues, finding the keys to unlock boxes and doors before time ran out.The staff was very friendly and helpful. We have to try their other rooms! We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Your Nightmare" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: Our group of 6 had so much fun tonight! The room was really well made and thought out. Definitely Challenging but we had an awesome time! Would totally go back to try another room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape Your Nightmare" by Mind Games Clovis in Fresno
review: Did the "Nightmare" room as my first one. Me and 3 friends. Very cool setup - subtle enough that 4 30 year old+ people probably overthought the clues but straightforward enough that anyone could figure them out. That's to say it was nicely done. Easy to use the website, check in was easy, and the props were simple, if subtle for a "Nightmare" scenario.Will try a couple more escape rooms, but also want to come back here and try another room at least. "Nightmare" is their easy one and we still needed a lot of hints (hence my comment about my group likely overthinking it a bit).

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Love the escape rooms at this location and AI does not disappoint.  Highest technology I have seen, the room was incredibly fun and exciting to play with nice decor and hidden secrets that unwrapped the story as we played.  We got lucky and got the harder ending (staff told us there were two endings possible).  Go try it if you havent already!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Had a great time in A.I. our team go through with a few minutes to spare!!. had a great time have a team effort. Going to come back & do the other rooms asap!! Well done!!!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Such an awesome and fun place! Waaay better than any other places i've been to...

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Had a blast trying to figure out some of the puzzles lol. Also great interaction in between people

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Our group had so much fun that we played two different rooms in one day. Very impressed with the game design and puzzles. Can't wait to play the new rooms next time!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Awesome experience! Clever puzzles! Friendly staff. I would fly back in from St Louis to do the other rooms!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Great senerios. Great employees. Great times. You'll keep going back for more.

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: Went in March and did 2 puzzles with 9 friends and had an absolute blast for my birthday. Would definitely come back again and would recommend for a large group of friends to play. Must go for everyone!

room_title: Escape room "The A.I." by Exit Game in Los Angeles
review: I went today for my birthday and had the best time. Completely worth the money and we didn't even finish the game. It was challenging, smart, thrilling, and a great all-around group experience. Thank you to the excellent staff that was so friendly and fun. We will come back soon and try the other rooms available!

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: Lot of fun and the employees were great. I would recommend this experience to anyone lookin for a good time.

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: First time here and had a great time! The lady who was our guide was top notch. Super helpful and explained everything perfectly. We manage to escape in just under 60 mins and only asked for help 4 times. The instructor said the average was 6 so we are the bomb.

room_title: Escape room "Wonderland" by Square Room Escape in Los Angeles
review: I got to participate in an Alice in the Wonderland themed escape room with 6 others and it was an awesome time! Firstly, big shout out to Ryan and the team who do a great job running the place and assisting as necessary. The rooms were well-decorated and the puzzles were lots of fun to figure out as they  were varying in complexity and required out-of-the-box thinking. The group I was a part of were a part of the beta testing for this particular escape room in Anaheim and I have to say it is worth the visit!I got to participate with people with and without experience and it was great fun. I highly recommend it to those who are new to escape rooms to the ones who have some experience to give it a go!

room_title: Escape room "Sleeper Cell" by Escape Game Alaska in Juneau
review: We had an amazing time! We have a large team and they accommodated our team and fit us into the two escape rooms perfectly! Great team building exercise. We loved being “special agents” and trying to figure out the clues to escape on time. The group in the Insanity room loved every moment too. We can’t wait to go again and try opposite rooms. Thank you Nicki!

room_title: Escape room "The Island" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: Really fun time. We did the island which is a large group room. Had a fun time laughing at each other.

room_title: Escape room "The Island" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: So much fun and easy, but yet so hard. Thanks for the great room!

room_title: Escape room "The Island" by Escape Zone in Phoenix
review: This room was the bomb. I went with my co-workers as a team event, so we were able to fit 16 of us comfortably in there. None of the teams made it out, but it was super close! I loved how my team was working on one clue for a hot minute and we had read the clue "upside down" and one of the employees told us to take a closer look to make sure we were right....they nudged us enough to understand we had read the clue wrong but never gave the answer away. I would absolutely come back- so fun and it felt exciting to be in volcano *-*

room_title: Escape room "Jack's Cabin" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Went in with some skepticism, but actually had a great time doing Jack's Cabin with my mom. We used only 2 clues, and finished with 5 seconds left!I prefer working in smaller groups so I will probably try one of the 4 person rooms next. Definately interested in going again.

room_title: Escape room "Jack's Cabin" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Have done several rooms and have enjoyed them all. Did Uncle Jack's Cabin today and my 9 year old was super excited because he guessed the last clue all by himself!

room_title: Escape room "Jack's Cabin" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Seriously so fun! We're already planning a trip back!! We did Uncle Jacks cabin and got out with 50 seconds left! Would recommend to anyone

room_title: Escape room "Jack's Cabin" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: Great experience as a family group of 4 on vacation! Jack's Cabin was a nice challenge for us and the team did a good job of helping us along the way.

room_title: Escape room "Jack's Cabin" by Escape Rooms Mesa in Phoenix
review: This place was tons of fun. Our family decided to go at the last minute and were able to make reservations for a room all by ourselves in "Uncle Jack's Cabin." This was our first escape the room experience and it has to be one of our favorite family night activities. We were happy to have made it out with 14 min to spare. We were impressed with how well they thought out each clue and left looking forward to going back again. Our daughter would love to do this for her birthday party. We would highly recommend this place. They have many rooms to choose from with different levels and themes. We will be back.

room_title: Escape room "Wizard School" by Limitless Escape Games in Modesto
review: None

room_title: Escape room "Testing Facility" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: This is a fun game! It is very immersive while still being puzzle heavy. We were paired with another couple that also happened to be escape room enthusiasts, so our team worked well together. The hint system keeps with the theme of the game and is very clever. There are puzzles in this game that I hadn't seen before. It's well done!

room_title: Escape room "Testing Facility" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: The Testing Facility was a perfect example of a quality challenging room. I find that most rooms labeled as "expert" are only difficult because they simply don't make sense. This is not the case with this room. The room is non-linear with mini-puzzles are leading to one meta-puzzle, so it's a perfect set-up for larger groups. My husband and I attempted with just the two of us and made it to the last puzzle but we needed a few more minutes. Overall, it a great, logical and just plain fun room and we can't wait to come back and try their other room.

room_title: Escape room "Testing Facility" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: The Testing Facility room is one of my favorite rooms ever! Entertaining theme and the puzzles were clever, logic-based, and needed all hands on deck in order to finish! The owners seem like they really love escape rooms and clearly put a lot of thought and care into creating the room. Awesome room and I recommend you book ASAP!

room_title: Escape room "Testing Facility" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: Great experience! It was my husbands birthday and they included clues about him. So cool! We did not escape in time. It's a difficult room. We've been to a few escape rooms before this and it's one of our favorites! Thanks for a fun time and for the cake! Can't wait for the next room.

room_title: Escape room "Testing Facility" by Escape Chronicles in Los Angeles
review: I love, LOVE the extremely strong narrative thread throughout the entire experience. Everything, including the hint system, ties into the story experience. The Testing Facility is a puzzle heavy room. There is minimal searching in this room. I really appreciated that we had to use our brains more than our eyes. Lots of unique puzzles in this room. Everything from number puzzles, riddles, and word puzzles. Very inventive use of props and not a whole lot of padlocks. Clever use of tech in this room.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Darkest Hour: Torture Chamber" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: This place is amazing! We did a team building night in both rooms (one scary, one not) by Mission Escape with 8 people per room. The storylines are fantastic and the mechanics they use are like magic. This goes beyond just hunting for codes to open locks (although plenty of those too!), but they use great technology to make the experience completely immersive. They really want you to succeed, so the progressive storyline is enhanced by the tech to guide you where you need to go so you don't feel completely lost and stuck. And even if you do get stuck they give you just enough hint to get you where you need to go.We screamed, we laughed, we loved every minute!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Darkest Hour: Torture Chamber" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: I have played a handful of escape rooms but this one was my wife's first time. And even though she was terrified of the Horror Theme for The Darkest Hour, she had an amazing experience. The game itself has a lot of unique and interesting puzzles. The whole game makes you think outside the box. It's a little difficult but if you bring a good sized group you all will have a lot of fun figuring out the clues for the escape.

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Darkest Hour: Torture Chamber" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: Mission Escape and Joe (Masterful Game Master) have done it again! Brought a mixed group of experienced and inexperienced escapers to try out the new Darkest Hour: Torture Chamber. We were wowed, spooked, tricked, and then escaped. Great take on this kind of horror theme. Very cohesive puzzles and clever guides. Looking forward to more rooms by these guys!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Darkest Hour: Torture Chamber" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: A friend, my sister, and I did The Darkest Hour escape room. It was very creepy. The puzzles were thematic and we were able to get out with 2:13 seconds left. A few jump scares happened. It was good that my friend was an expert in these types of games cause I honestly felt lost. The workers were definitely impressed at the speed of our puzzle solving. Definitely good times!

room_title: Escape room "Escape the Darkest Hour: Torture Chamber" by Mission Escape Games in Los Angeles
review: We have done both Hydeout and Darkest Hour by Mission Escapes and I can't say enough about the build quality, puzzle complexity, and amazing staff. Both stories are well thought out and immerse you from minute one. Darkest Hour was a little more simple (in my opinion) but the anticipation and thrilling nature force you to work a littlest more trepidatiously. The puzzles are innovative and unlike some of the puzzles I've seen before, the room is built to change music, lights, and mood of the room as you solve puzzles and progress. Joel was our puzzle master and he was amazing! Very engaging, a great conversationalist, and very supportive. Do yourself a favor and book this room, you'll have a blast!
